Name: The Mired Ruins of Guk
Description: Located on an island in the middle of the marsh, the Guk Ruins have been gradually sinking into the murky waters over the centuries. What was once a masterpiece of stonework is now a heap of mossy blocks eaten away by time.

Name: Hrux Residence
Description: Covered with colourful plants of all kinds, this little log house looks very welcoming. A strong but difficult to define smell escapes from the wooden window shutters. Two baby marmaruits are perched on the doorframe, curiously watching you.

Residents.Name: Hrux Doremus

Dialogs.Content:
There are several interesting plants for someone who really knows their botany. Unfortunately, for an adventurer like you, I imagine they wouldn't hold that much value.

Don't venture too far south, you're likely to encounter rather aggressive tortolions as well as the undead. If you're really unfortunate, a cross between the two.

Oh! And I can't remember exactly where it is, but there's an old abandoned tower that might excite you. It's towards the centre of the forest, I believe.

Hrux Doremus, herbalist, cartographer, musician, father of three...

* Hrux's face darkens.

... I'd rather not talk about the last of those.

Hello!

Which good winds brought you to my door?

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the forest?

Dialogs.Content:
* Hrux casts a discreet glance at the two winged rodents perched on his cabin's doorframe.

I've been taking care of these two marmaruitlings for over a month now. You know, these lovely creatures are very shy in nature. They usually perceive humans as threats.

I understand them.

Let's say that if I liked to talk about my personal life, I wouldn't live as an isolated hermit deep in a forest far from civilization.

* His gaze returns to the marmaruitlings, indicating to you that all your attempts to push the subject further will be in vain.

Residents.Greets: Move slowly, Fwit and Pwyl are nervous around strangers!

Name: Runes on the ground
Description: The floor of the room is lined with runes, they are engraved with impressive precision.

Dialogs.Content: Using her enigmatic language, Sylph tells you that you need to purify different creatures that you have already fought in the past. The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph tells you that you need to purify different creatures that you have already fought in the past. The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph tells you that you need to purify different creatures that you have already fought in the past. The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph tells you that you need to purify different creatures that you have already fought in the past. The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.
*You approach the crystal.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph tells you that you need to purify different creatures that you have already fought in the past. The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph tells you that you need to purify different creatures that you have already fought in the past. The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph tells you that you need to purify different creatures that you have already fought in the past. The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph tells you that you need to purify different creatures that you have already fought in the past. The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph tells you that you need to purify different creatures that you have already fought in the past. The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.
[GM]Fools, you followed me.

Replies.Content: Surrender! There is no other way out.

Dialogs.Content:
Ha ha, typically human.

So you don't understand, by following me here, you will lose even if you defeat me. Do you think Cragstein won't use you as a scapegoat for the lord's death?

He has nothing to do with the truth, he will take the most advantageous option for him.

Replies.Content: I will at least have your body as proof! Let's capture it!

Name: The Raging Oryctus
Description: This intimidating muddy farm is littered with caged oryctus, their eyes staring out at you from behind the metal bars. One spiked enclosure looks suspiciously like a combat arena.

Dialogs.Content: Too bad. I had a few cage secrets to share.

Sturdy? Sure. Sturdy enough? Surely not. Really I need stronger metal to forge new cages.

*Mily gives you a questioning look.

You'll find me some better metal, won't you?

Replies.Content: I have other things to do.

Dialogs.Content:
I knew I could count on you!

*You don't quite understand what Mily means.

Here is the list of drinking troughs that I'll need for my next batch of tenants. 

Don't tarry! If I start training after mating season, the oryctus only have one thing on their minds.

Replies.Content: Slow down, I didn't say I was interested!
Fine, I'll take care of it.

Dialogs.Content:
You are in the lair of the wildest animal trainer in all of Orval... the terrible... me!

*You stare at Mily's delicate stature and gentle face wondering whether or not you should laugh.

Replies.Content: Erm... can you tell me more?

Dialogs.Content:
Ha! I imagine it's not for an oryctus, eh?

I could indeed help with that. But as usual, I'm going to need you to help me in return.

Nothing too strenuous, just some materials for my next projects.
Don't go near the cages, you'll end up losing a finger.

Replies.Content: That drinking trough is mighty interesting!

Dialogs.Content: Oh no, really? Poor little oryctus. They'll be so thirsty after combat.

This is my farm! I live here, and I train combat oryctus.

Some animals cannot reproduce or be bred in captivity. A good trainer, however, can tame them.

It's a difficult art. Few people have the character and patience to practice it.
*This creature requires a building with the following characteristics:
*The oryctus looks at you without moving.*

Name: Bridge of the Unknown Bard
Description: For a decade, a masked bard wearing colourful clothes performed on the wooden bridge spanning Lake Zarata. One day, his performances ceased and no one ever saw him again.

Name: The cabin of the old madman
Description: An old cabin stands as best it can in the middle of a tiny clearing. Dozens of birds are perched on the surrounding trees and squirrels are running in all directions. The enchanting and colorful place is teeming with wildlife. A small campfire burns in the middle of the square, from which escapes a thick green smoke spreading a strong stench of rotten eggs and vinegar.

Dialogs.Content:
Oh yes! I'm so used to it that I forget it exists.

It's a special mixture of herbs and mushrooms that I burn to scare away the Scabonzis. These invasive vermin hate this smell, even more than humans.

Since they invaded this forest, it's the only way I've found to keep them away from my home.

That explains why you stink of dead rats. I just need one last thing to complete the ritual.

You know, I'm old and I don't have the vigor that I had when I was young. Such a ritual requires a lot of energy. I could really use a hand to accomplish this.

A helping hand that unfortunately you cannot provide me with. Don't take this the wrong way my friend, but you don't look like a seasoned ritualist at all.

I need the help of an experienced Ritualist Druid. Can you go ask Rakham at the Shrine of Eternity to send me one for the time of a single ritual? I will be greatly indebted to you for this service.

Replies.Content: This task seems quite simple to me. This shouldn't take too long.

Dialogs.Content:
Oh, I'm not used to having visitors, you see... my last bath was ages ago. My friends the animals of the forest do not complain too much about it.

Forgive me for my neglect. If I had known a visitor was coming, I would have gone to the lake first.

Replies.Content: No, I'm not talking about your personal hygiene, but rather the foul smoke coming from your campfire.

Dialogs.Content:
Here is finally some great news!

*Ralouf displays a huge semi-toothless smile and a look full of hope.

By traveling in the spirit world, I can manage to locate a specific living creature. I've never tried it on a ratman, but if it works on weasels, I don't see why it wouldn't on a rat.

Such a journey on the other side of the veil requires the accomplishment of a great ritual requiring preparations. My esoteric accessories are old and obsolete. Would you be able to go to Zarou, my old friend at the Cave of Knowledge, to get me some new ones?

Here is a list of the equipment in question.

*Ralouf scribbles a few notes on a dirty old piece of handkerchief with a feather and gives it to you.

Replies.Content: I can do this commission for you.

Dialogs.Content: Do you like squirrels?

Replies.Content: Do you need help with a specific task?
All those herbs and mushrooms are needed to make your mix?
If the Scabonzis are bothering you so much, maybe I can help you repel their invasion in your forest.
It is possible to stop the Scabonzi invasion by killing their warlord, but he remains untraceable despite Matis's efforts.
I have with me the equipment for the ritual. Zarou would like to have them back within two months maximum.
I have the ingredients needed for the ritual.
Are we finally ready for the ritual?
I am ready for the final confrontation.

Dialogs.Content:
Everything is in place! We are going to perform the ritual tonight so as not to waste any more time.

I will still need your presence to monitor the premises during the incantations.

Replies.Content: I will be present during the ritual.

Dialogs.Content:
He's hiding further in the woods, southeast of my cabin. Let me show you the exact location on the map.

*Having no feather to hand, he scratches the back of his ear and marks an X on your map using the wax on the tip of his finger.

Replies.Content: He will pay for his crimes!

Dialogs.Content:
I have already tried to assemble a small troop of fighting bears in order to scare them away, but the more we kill them, the more they come back in large numbers! I swore to myself never again to sacrifice the lives of my forest friends against those monsters.

*A tear runs down Ralouf's cheek and you can read the pain on his face.

There must be a way to get rid of them, but my knowledge of this enemy is too limited.

Replies.Content: I happen to know someone who knows a lot about the ratmen. I can go ask him for advice.

Dialogs.Content:
Maladiviennes and Antraciennes, when mixed together and burned, give off a strong odor that scares away ratmen and sometimes humans as well.

The Valariannes will allow me to heal my poor Potiron's broken leg, while the Russules are for my personal consumption.

They are delicious in soups and soothe my stomach aches.

On the contrary, they are very close friends! Moreover, they are right. Take a look at me...I'm clearly a little crazy in my own way.

I was once part of the circle of life as a druid and spirit guide. Unfortunately, by spending too much time in the company of animals, you end up becoming one yourself.

Not to mention the many astral journeys in the spirit world that also end up leaving their mark and affecting your sanity.

In short, all that to say that I live better and happier in the forest in the midst of animals singing and dancing and

*Ralouf suddenly stares blankly at you. A light trickle of saliva runs down his chin.

*You shake him slightly to bring him back to himself.

Oh yes sorry! What were we already talking about?

Who am I? To be or not to be? These are questions on which it is good to philosophize.

*Ralouf rubs his beard, staring thoughtfully at the clouds.

*You look at him puzzled.

Whoops! Forgive me, sometimes I get lost. My name is Raloufir Bourgrul, but the few people who know me call me Crazy Ralouf.

Replies.Content: Crazy? The people who named you like that shouldn't hold you in their hearts.

Dialogs.Content:
Ah finally! You took a long time for a simple order.

But yes, don't worry, I'm going to give him back his objects within two years, as you say.

Now that I have the right equipment, I need a large amount of blood and bones from Ratmen belonging to the Warlord's army in order to complete the ritual.

This will allow us to locate it. Would you be able to source its ingredients for me?

Yes of course! My cabin needs a little love. A good broom to remove the dust would do it a lot of good.

*You explain to him that you are rather looking for a task worthy of an adventurer.

Ah yes forgive me for my clumsiness. Two days ago, Potiron, my pet skunk and faithful companion, broke his leg trying to climb a tree.

I'm about to run out of mushrooms and herbs to burn in order to scare away the Ratmen. Usually, it's Potiron who takes care of this commission, but he's in a bit of a bad way, you see. I would do it myself, but I am old and confused. Here is the list of items I need.

Replies.Content: I can do that for you.

Name: Vault of Shadows
Description: {Guilde de talent darkness low-level}

Name: Black Horse Pavilion
Description: Concealed behind a high luxurious hedgerow, the Black Horse Pavilion has architecture worthy of the richest seigneurial palaces. Mounts, including a few bayards, roam freely in the courtyard. A close inspection reveals loopholes placed at strategic points around the main building.

Dialogs.Content: You believe that the Thorval Vigilance Camp, inhabited with those from Maliken, is worthy of suspicion. What's more, you have not yet found a slavery network in your adventures.
*The tree is listening to you, waiting to hear your deepest musings and secrets...*
You believe the fact that the two Duvergers, Charles and Cedric, have agreed to let the Barony of Kortombe fall into the hands of the Verdants is peculiar.
You believe the fact that a cousin of Sir Tarul Verdant is at Notroll Camp is of interest.
You believe the Camp of the Allies you discovered north of Gantras may be a cover for a group of thugs. This information is worth passing on to the Order.
You're puzzled by the peculiar and still unsolved outbreak of nightmares gripping Kortombe. Authorities have yet to find the culprit.
You inform the tree that a cult-like military camp is set up in Holdori. Even though their motives are unclear, they are clearly preparing for a significant event that may take place soon.
*The tree does not respond...*
You received word in Gantras that an organisation known as the Order of the Lotus has a growing presence there. You think it's a secret best shared.
The story Lydia told you about Iktar sounds interesting. Why did this beloved knight suddenly become an exile? Is there something going on behind this story?

I love the dagger, melee in its purest form! You can smell your opponent's rage and fear! Mmh, you almost touch them and feel the goose bumps on their skin when the ecstasy of combat reaches its peak!

*You are totally taken aback by Saraya's attitude, which is normally as cold as a block of lithosnow.

Care to practice with me?

Those are the kinds of questions that make me nervous. If you're here, you know very well who we are.

A Hippogriff is not a mercenary or a hitman. They are an agent of change or stability. We therefore do not accept contracts motivated by greed, jealousy or revenge.

We must honour any contract accepted by the guild, but we owe no loyalty to past employers. We do not obey the Crown or the so-called nobles.

We exist to solve problems that time has ignored.

In fact, yes. I'm going to need a new face for a few simple missions.

That will suffice until I can talk to Jahiri, he's yet to inform me why he sent you here. 

A merchant from Maliken is interested in our retirement services. We need to send him an answer.

Make sure he doesn't see you.

Then I must ensure you know what you're getting yourself into.

The Order of the Hippogriff is an organisation that operates in parallel to the law. We are not common highway robbers. Our primary purpose is to solve problems before they arise. However, it is not against our ethical codes to take other contracts to meet financial imperatives.

Replies.Content: What kind of contracts do you take?

Dialogs.Content: Ah! Okay, that changes everything. You have therefore just knowingly entered the territory of the Order of the Hippogriff. I hope you're aware that your chances of leaving alive have diminished considerably.

Replies.Content: I would like to become a member of your organisation.

Dialogs.Content:
If they're secret, they're secret for good reason.

*Saraya smirks at you.

If you like to fight, I have something for you. I need rare materials. In exchange, I can show you a special combat technique.

Obviously. The nature of our business arouses fear and anger in many other organisations, both official and otherwise.

Several nobles have tried to bring us down. We also have competitors who are doing everything in their power to weaken us.

We've also had many conflicts with the Protectors of the Rose and the Cult of Nephyria.

Replies.Content: This isn't the first time that I've heard of the Cult of Nephyria. Can you tell me more about them?

Dialogs.Content: Be on your way! Our warm welcome only extends to  adventurers and explorers nearing the end of their days. They wish to live out their last days in peace.

Replies.Content: Does the Order of the Hippogriff have enemies?
Do you have a job for me?
Do you have any secret techniques?

Dialogs.Content:
Ah, you have discovered the Tree of Secrets...

It is one of the most important tools of the Order. If you discover information that you consider of interest, insight or intrigue, come share it with the tree's listening leaves.

Know that this method protects you. For no one will know that it was you who revealed the secret.

And if you wish to uncover more secrets, why the best way to do so is by talking to every citizen you encounter.

Oh... right. You were the one who handled the message in Gantras, right?

*You're a little offended that you weren't immediately recognized.

Alright, I've got something a little more complex for you. Have you ever been to Enorwen?

The place is free territory, and that suits the Hippogriff well. A strange group has settled in the area, we believe they have a lair on Cybelfly Plateau.

Our goal is to prevent them from taking over the community. I'll leave it to you to decide how.

It pains me a bit to say it, but their mastery of the art of stealth is even more impressive than our own. So, I have very little solid information about them...

What I can tell you is that they are some kind of cult worshiping a... heroine... who is never mentioned in any storybooks. They don't have a headquarters, yet they have members everywhere.

I don't really know their motivations nor where their fortune originates. However, I have heard dark rumours of their connection to an immensely powerful ancient spirit.

I believe that on the occasions they've attacked us, it's because we disturbed them. Perhaps by unknowingly eliminating some of their members. There are some in my group who believe they are acting out of fear of us, but I don't buy it; I suspect that's an assumption made in hubris.

* Saraya looks visibly nervous.

My gut tells me they're far more dangerous than the Order believes.

If you're accepted into our order, we will share our knowledge with you.

We are masters in precision and finesse. We teach our members to always have a card hidden up their sleeve.

Name: Cyclotus's Glade
Description: Carcasses of catoblepas, wildlife, and even humans in various stages of decomposition are scattered throughout the clearing. The smell is sickening.

Name: Abandoned field
Description: This former grain field has been completely split in two by a shallow crevasse caused by a recent earthquake.

Name: Mine of Illusions
Description: The mine of Illusions is named after the mountain it is on. It is the greatest mining facility in the region. Borm and marapis are the main extractions done there, but a large vein of titanron has recently been discovered.

Residents.Name: Ulio Gavelio

Dialogs.Content:
You want work? I might in fact have a job for you.
Last week, a tunnel was discovered in the mine. Since then, tortolions haven't stopped coming out.
At first, we managed to repel them, but now there are too many of them. If you kill them, I'll give you a reward.
Me? Well, my name is Ulio Gavelio. It was my grandfather who founded this mine. Now I own it. Other than that, I'm just an ordinary man.
We don't often get visitors around here. What can I do for you?

Replies.Content: Do you have work for me?

Dialogs.Content: Well, even if you killed the tortolions, nothing is stopping more from coming. Find the tunnel et block it, or else the problem will never be solved.

Ah, it's you! I need your help again.
The tortolions have destroyed the wall you built and they are even more aggressive than last time. Plus, they came with giant spiders.
If it continues like this, I'll have to shut down the mining operation...

Replies.Content: Don't worry, I'll take care of it.

Dialogs.Content: You're at the mine of illusions, the greatest in the area! Usually, we mostly mine borm and marapis, but not long ago we found a superb vein of titanron.

Residents.Greets: I'm the boss here. What can I do for you?

Name: Grouchy merchant's house
Description: A pretty redbrick house has been built near the Dunedan Estuary. The array of products displayed in front of the house suggests the place is inhabited.

Residents.Name: Yolic Notoosoon

Dialogs.Content: Leave! You are not my type of clientele!

Replies.Content: What is your type of clientele?

Dialogs.Content: Perhaps it would be more lucrative if I didn't waste my time with people like you.
The type who don't come to a lost forest to do their shopping.

Replies.Content: Your enterprise doesn't seem very lucrative to me.

Residents.Greets: Hey there, friend! Better leave now before I shoot an arrow in your knee!

Name: Caninbane Lair
Description: As you enter the grotto-like cavern, the stench of pestilence becomes overwhelming. Hundreds of dead wolves, vargrs, and even dogs litter the ground. The scene reminds you of the moment you found little Ovie.

Dialogs.Content:
*Ovie nods towards the corpses, whimpering, with eyes full of sadness.

*You understand that the creature responsible for the massacre is most likely the same as the one that attacked Ovie's family's burrow.

*Compared to the corpses, the creature must be gigantic. You have to make a decision.

Replies.Content: It's best to leave this place for now.
The time for revenge is now! Let's prepare a trap!

Dialogs.Content: *Ovie is visibly disappointed with your decision.
*Ovie becomes especially aggressive as soon as you enter the den.

Name: Gismons' Farm
Description: The Gismons manage farmland of several hundred hectares on which grow cereals, vegetables and fruits. The farm also has an impressive herd of cattle.

Dialogs.Content: *To buy the animal, you must have a place in your domain to house it.
*Drea tells you that her Travel Horse is for sale.

Replies.Content: I'd like to buy your horse.

Dialogs.Content:
Ah, you know, Enorwen is quiet as usual. We take care of our farms, and we don't get involved in outsiders' business.

We even have a few new city dwellers who have come to settle in the area. I imagine they've had enough of the big city.

Good people, I assume...
Hello traveller! Welcome to the free lands of Enorwen, and welcome in particular to the familial farming estate of the Gismons!

Replies.Content: Hello Drea, what's been happening in Enorwen?

Dialogs.Content:
We're barely a dozen families. Three village elders advise families and make sure that harmony reigns.

We also have an ambassador in Maliken who ensures that the founding agreement is respected. Every two years, the Enorwenians elect a representative responsible for negotiating with the local lords. He also occupies the role of chief of security for the whole territory.

We have ten hunters who serve as militiamen to protect us from brigands and wild beasts. The rest of the defence is provided by the neighbouring seigneuries. That way they don't have to worry about hiring an army of mercenaries.

If you want to know more, I advise you to have a word with our alderman, he can answer your questions more officially.

Well, yes. 

In fact, the founders of the village were nobles from the Bran-Wojtek line. Following a family dispute, they wanted to have a seigneury in Ordval, but those who were already in power refused. 

Maliken, not being able to afford to lose the new money the Bran-Wojteks promised to invest, decided to give them a small territory with just enough freedom and wealth to keep them satisfied.

They quickly grew tired of this life of colonial rule and sold their rights to a group of wealthy local farmers. My grandfather was one of them. So here we are.

Replies.Content: But you don't have a leader or an army?

Dialogs.Content:
We are free as the air that fills the sky and the water that turns in the ocean's tides.

Well, in fact, that's not exactly true. We pay a huge amount of tax to sell our products outside the region and are forced into an agreement with Wellnear and Kortombe that provides us with minimal protection... but we don't belong to any of the Ordval seigneuries!

Replies.Content: But you still answer to the Crown of Pireiria, I guess?

Dialogs.Content:
Uh... yes, yes, why do you say that? Why really?

*You notice that Drea is getting more and more nervous.

Right. I have work to do, what did you want already?

Name: The Big Baddie's Burrow
Description: A pile of clothed skeletons, whose torn clothes identify them as unfortunate adventurers, indicates that you're standing in the home of a dangerous predator. A quick glance around reveals that there are a series of canine tracks in the vicinity.

Name: Fallen trees
Description: Following a major earthquake, most of the trees painstakingly planted in the Servants' Mansion woodlot have been at least partially uprooted. A keen-eyed observer would take more interest in the gigantic claw marks on the trunks of the fallen trees.

Name: Aranbourg Market
Description:
Most of the stalls in Aranbourg's central market seem to have reached the highest level of the famous historian Roch Pickhead's "scale of decrepitude". 

The few kiosks that are still active present a few uninspiring local products, the interest in which is far from obvious.

Dialogs.Content:
Think again! In high season there are thousands of people here! 

It's just that I was still a kid, the last time there was a high season...

*Leovia gives a long sigh

I would love to tell you that a strange curse has befallen Wellnear, but I think we just have to blame the poor crops, the taxes and... my predecessor.
Thank you! How nice! I've been waiting to hear from my cousin for a long time!

Wheat, potatoes, cheese, and sirumdarak...

*As Leovia said the last word, she watched your reaction carefully.

I bet you're wondering what sirumdarak is?

*Leovia does not give you time to answer

It's a reddish sweet syrup, I won't tell you the main ingredient. You can add it to your pancakes, cereal or bread to make them tastier. Be careful, don't mix it with corrimack... the consequences could be disastrous.

*Leovia's face becomes darker for a moment, then returns to colour.

I bet there is no sirumdarak where you come from!

Finally a visitor!

Uh... Fair weather and warm greetings to you, noble patron!

Better, but maybe a little too much...

*For a few seconds, Leovia continues to practice a few greetings without giving you any particular attention. Suddenly she seems to realize that you are not one of her regular customers, and her face becomes flushed.

...Oh! You really aren't someone from Wellnear!

Replies.Content: I guess you don't often see visitors around here.
Can you tell me what the specialties of the region are?

Dialogs.Content:
*Leovia's face suddenly becomes hard as a stone.

I should have kept quiet. Franz was a coward, a tyrant, and a... pig. He was found stabbed dead in an alleyway a few years ago. No one has ever known who to thank for that charitable gesture.

*Good humour seems to be slowly returning to the shopkeeper.

Honestly, he treated merchants, women, visitors really badly. 

Ever since I took over responsibility for Aranbourg Market, I've tried to rectify the situation, but a former lover told me that there was someone in Kortombe, a friend of Franz I believe, who is doing everything he can to hamper me.
Where did I put that box?

Name: House of Salamandese
Description:
Many of Larcen's rare species of tree grow on this poorly maintained stretch of land.  The house itself is in poor condition too. You would think it abandoned were it not for a few footprints in the earth and some clothes drying on tree branches.

[N] At night, the dilapidated little house is decidedly disturbing. The window shutters are all closed, but the flickering shadows of candles dance between through the cracks.

Dialogs.Content:
Go to the tavern, idiot! This is private property.

*Ector seems to be studying you carefully from head to toe.

Wait...

*Ector clearly wishes to speak to you about something important to him.

Replies.Content: Should I stay or should I go now?

Dialogs.Content:
I see that I am unmasked. You should be more careful when a sinister old fool asks you to do things.

Next time, you might fall for a real trap.

Replies.Content: Did the staff at the Setting Sun know all along?

Dialogs.Content:
I advise you don't ask me too many questions about that place. 

For your own good, there are some things you're not yet ready to know.

Let's just say that when I was younger, I worked for the Crown. And some of the residents of the house were people I "knew".

So, you wanna help me?

Replies.Content: If I said yes, what would be the risks?

Dialogs.Content:
*Ector looks furious.

Stop wasting my time then! Get out of here and leave me to my grief!
I also could have stabbed a spear straight through your skull. Maybe you should be thanking me for showing restraint.

Old fools have to keep themselves busy.

But no, in sincerity, it benefits me to have people around who can help me with certain discreet tasks. 

What better way to know if you're worthy than a little test.

The worst possible case is you get caught, then you can tell the militia that you were a nave jobseeker, screwed by an old fool with a grudge.

*You doubt that is the whole truth.

Come on, I'm not asking for much! Just some casual tracking in a house full of elderly folk.

Replies.Content: I'm not a spy, I'm not doing this.
Subterfuge is my middle name. Count me in!

Dialogs.Content: Oi! Get off my land!

Replies.Content: I didn't know the house was inhabited. I was just looking for a place to rest.

Dialogs.Content: Listen, if I'm in Quara, it's because I'm looking for my son's killer. I know the murderous scum is hiding out in the House of the Setting Sun. But if I go, someone will surely recognize me, and that son of a troll will have time to escape.

Name: Sirtura Outpost
Description: Banners bearing the crests of Kortombourg are flown above this small fortification. Guards in a small observation tower vigilantly survey the Brumedor Plain.

Name: Vorf Lundgrof's House
Description: Heads of several species of gruesome beasts have been attached to the inside walls of this small house of wood and stone. Stylized weapons, probably of little real value, are hung between them. A huge snoring vargr is lying near the fireplace.

Dialogs.Content:
It was truly the best of both worlds! You see, zigulans, that's the name for these insects, use pollen from hops to create zigul. And I use the zigul to attract and calm the sandvargrs.

Previously, I had to import the substance. But now, thanks to my imports, Thorval will become autonomous in its production of zigul! Everyone benefits! Huzzah!

Replies.Content: Who told you that? It's been a disaster for the hop growers!

Dialogs.Content:
What do you think the answer to that is!? Of course I do! 

They're one of the most powerful races of vargrs, but they're extremely rare. They are long-lived, so their biology means that they evolve less quickly than the sand vargrs I work with.

It's been a long time since I've encountered such a creature.

Replies.Content: I would like to introduce you to Ovie...

Dialogs.Content: Oh my! That was never my intention. But I'm in enough trouble as it is. I won't make another enemy...

Ha! You came to say thank you!

*Puzzled, you hold your tongue, hoping that Vorf will reveal more.*

So what!? Something not going like he said it would?

[!E:f8b81bbb-7973-4f57-937c-80188cff524b]I have nothing to tell you!
[E:f8b81bbb-7973-4f57-937c-80188cff524b]I hope Ovie is doing well!

Replies.Content: I'm here on behalf of the region's hop growers.
Do you know much about royal vargrs?

Dialogs.Content:
*Vorf's attitude changes completely when he sees Ovie. Your eyes may have played tricks on you, but you have the impression that the man bowed to the animal as if Ovie had really been from a royal family.

I... Me... You... Him... Wow!

*You explain to Vorf that you and Ovie have been fellow adventurers for a very long time, but you think you could use some help with Ovie's training.

It would be an honour to help you train such a majestic beast. Here was me thinking you were a bunch of idiots from the north...

You will need to be present too. If you've been together so long, he won't accept my training. He must believe it's you that we're training.

Name: The Red Tower
Description: [Todo]

Name: Multiforge
Description:
An imposing wooden building from the outside and a hub of creativity from the inside, the Multiforge welcomes Kortombourger artisans and visitors all hours of the day.

Inside it are workshops for jewellers, blacksmiths, tanners and dressmakers. There are also some free residences for craftspeople and creators with special needs.

Dialogs.Content:
Ahh the Multiforge! A truly enchanting place, first built by my ancestor Vincent Duverger 150 years ago.

Think of it as a crafting collective, a group of workshops belonging to and shared by different artisans and craftspeople. Many of whom are our local professionals, but some of whom are amateurs or freelancers from faraway lands. 

The magic of the place is that by working together in one central hub, all of the creators of the area can learn from one another.

Well, you've come to the right place, old bean! We have a bulletin board system that allows you to take orders and deliver them here to the Multiforge or directly to those who need them.

I must, however, first get you accepted as an artisan of Kortombe. A little test with the different tools of the trade should do the trick.

Oh! Long story short, I'm looking for a piece to decorate Baroness Relene Kortombe's room. I need something truly special, something which looks as if it's come from another world.

Do you know an artist who could make something like that?

That's me! Charles Duverger, husband of Baroness Relene of Kortombe. So I guess the proper way to introduce myself is by using terms like "sir", "lord" or "baron", but poppycock! None of that matters to me old chap!

Besides, in no more than five years, the seigneury will change hands. My wife and the knight, Tarul Verdant, have agreed on it. So it would be a bad time for me to start enjoying being called sir! Ho ho ho!
Greetings! You stand in front of the Multiforge of Kortombourg, a real pride for the whole barony. You can call me Charles.

Replies.Content: What's that plan in your hands?

Dialogs.Content: He currently occupies the role of Protector of Kortombe. He's a little uptight, if you ask me, but he is a good chap nonetheless. I just hope he will find a woman of his size to marry one day. Maybe Celeste? Maybe a grizzly bear? Ho ho ho!

My daughter in everything but blood. She was born during my wife's first marriage and occupies the post of burgomaster in Kortombourg.

She is a busy lady, but you should try to meet her anyway. Over there at the Great House.
Hammer Relay employees want four deer leather jackets with chinvre lining and laidor buckles.
To ensure the proper functioning of the Multiforge, a new tool order is displayed here every day. Late goods will not be accepted.
The militia needs blankets for their expeditions. Different materials are required for the different terrains of the region.
One of the old craft complex buildings is in dire need of new machinery. Craftsmen are needed to create more resistant machines.
One of the old artisanal craft buildings is in dire need of new machinery. Craftspeople are required to create these specialized machines.
The Rabouf family wishes to explore the Salamander Marshes. Chinvre and hare leather traveller's clothing is required for the expedition.
Celeste Kortombe would like to add two capes to her wardrobe. One made from ortas for visits to Bonarcane Forest and the other made from lan for visits to the Ridiculous Mountains.
*You approach the bulletin board, which is well used and splashed with paint and sawdust...

Replies.Content: Cape of the Mountains and Cape of the Forests

Dialogs.Content: Due to the increased presence of the gremfyrs in Caledorn, the region's landowners wish to arm themselves.

Name: Ambush site
Description: A few bushes have grown near the road. Some of them are big enough to hide a small band of brigands. It really would be the ideal spot for an ambush.

Residents.Name: Clumm Zee

Dialogs.Content: Hmfff! Don't move a muscle! I am much mightier than than you!

Replies.Content: What do you want from me?

Dialogs.Content: Uh... your purse? Or your money in your purse... or if you don't have a purse with money in it... jewellery! if you don't have a purse, or money, or jewellery... food? It would be nice to eat something...

Residents.Greets: *The bandit points his bow in your direction while trying unsuccessfully to hide his trembling hands.

Name: Kofo-Lun Camp
Description: Hundreds of warriors, wearing a style of armour you've never seen, have settled in a lightly wooded area of the plain.

Dialogs.Content: A group of pilgrims from the Kofo-Lun tribe ask to witness the ritual battle against the creature, Dar'hon. They offer you a sample of their craftsmanship in exchange.

Me? Well the mission that Lily gave me, of course!

She is a wonderful woman. A true pearl of the desert! I was so delighted by my brief exchanges with her that I've offered to be the spokesperson for her people in Ordval.
Welcome to the Kofo-Lun camp!

Replies.Content: Err... what are you doing here?

Dialogs.Content:
Yes, I feel the energy of your Lantern. Our people have dealt with yours many times in recent seasons.

And it didn't always end well... which is why I'm here.
What do you want, Walker?

Replies.Content: You could tell that I'm from Valsonge?
How are you finding life on these plains?
What are you really looking for?
Did you manage to do your ritual?

Dialogs.Content:
Finally, the heart of Dar'hon. May the spirit of the ancients be praised.

*Lily hands the object to one of her fighters and asks that her mount is prepared.

Our paths diverge here, for now anyway. I have to go back to my people in the desert and make sure everything is okay with them.

I have one last favour to ask of you. Groups from my people will come here for the Dar'hon ritual, but many of them will not be able to defeat the creature. For them, watching the fight should be enough. Perhaps you will be able to help.

I'll make sure they have a gift for you for your services.

*Lily takes the time to offer you a final training in a battle cry technique used by her people. She then leaves for her beloved desert sands.

*Lily doesn't seem happy that you asked her that.

There is indeed something on Mount Frokilkador that my people, like the gnolls, covet.

But my people are not adapted to life in the mountains, our clothes are designed for the desert climate and its great expanses of sand.

For the moment, we are stuck at the foot of the great mountain.

Replies.Content: I could equip you a little more appropriately...

Dialogs.Content:
We are nomads normally roaming the heart of the great Variguj Desert. Kofo-Lun means "Daughters of the Desert".

We are here, away from the sands of home, against our will. We have been driven here by our need for a solution to a great problem.

The great sea of sand is becoming more and more dangerous, even the gnolls are retreating to seek new lands.

And all because the Maelstorm of Mist seems to be slowing down. As it slows, it changes the entire ecology of our beloved desert.

Someone like you has already made me such an offer...

*You feel a wave of anger rising in Lily.

She called herself Shadowbringer. She came to us with beautiful words spun with all the delicate trickery of a spider's web. She convinced us that she knew how to calm the storm.

We held a terrible ritual with her on the precipice of the forbidden lands. Too late did we finally understand that she was not trying to calm the Maelstorm, but amplify it...

*Lily pauses, reliving the past.

I... I ordered the ritual to stop. The rest is unclear... a sword... a giant figure in the Maelstorm. Then I woke up, with half my people gone, surely swept away by the storm.

We never saw Shadowbringer again.

Contrary to first impressions, you did a good job. My scouts are already adapting to the mountains, though they're constantly being chased by giant ogres.

And my fighters are still not able to accompany them.

Replies.Content: I will help you fend off the ogres.

Dialogs.Content:
Thank you for these... clothes. I'm going to dress up my scout troop for their next outing.

As a reward for your help, allow me the honour of inviting you to one of our battle-dance trainings.

They are our natural enemies. We have shared the same lands and resources for as long as our history stretches. Some say since the dawn of time.

Never have we been at peace.

Replies.Content: Are you competing for something on the mountain?

Dialogs.Content:
I thought my people could manage alone on your green lands, but I think the gnolls are adapting faster than us.

A group has settled at the base of your great mountain of Frokilkador. If you could dislodge them, it would greatly help our progress towards the mountain.

I believe you have helped us enough for me to open up to you. If you were connected to Shadowbringer, I would have discovered it by now.

We seek the perch of Dar'hon, the great bone spirit. Legends say that to pay homage to the deity, one must defeat its bony reincarnation who lives upon the perch.

After the fight, my people must perform a ritual to commemorate the memory of those who died in the recent tragedy at the Maelstorm.

Replies.Content: I will look for information on this perch.

Dialogs.Content:
We saw. It was my troops that came around the mountain to take the gnolls from behind.

If we hadn't intervened, you could have had real problems.

Replies.Content: Are you at war with the gnolls?

Dialogs.Content:
Right. There is a place in the centre of the desert where a great storm of Mist has been raging since time immemorial. Our people have learned, like those of the green lands, to ignore the Mists rather than spend our nights fretting over them.

However, for the past few seasons, the storm has been moving, sweeping away everything in its path when it arrives and depositing hellish creatures when it retreats.

For my people, this chaos is devastating. We now must avoid the centre of the desert.

Replies.Content: I'm highly familiar with the Mists, could I help you?

Dialogs.Content:
My people now owe you a great debt. I can't even imagine Shadowbringer's malice.

I had already told her about the ritual of Dar'hon and the importance this tradition had for my people. Why did she want to hide the perch?

I have one last favour to ask of you. If you fight the Dar'hon, I need to take its heart back to the desert to calm the Maelstorm.

Not all of his incarnations can have one, and so far my warriors have been unlucky. If you happen to find one, know that it is an item of unparalleled value to us, for it will give us back our home.

Replies.Content: I will try to obtain one for you.

Dialogs.Content: No, I've already said too much.

*Lily and a troop of scouts have been following you for some time, they approach you after the wave of dissipation has passed.

Finally! Dar'hon's Perch! We can begin the rites of passage.

I don't know what magic was hiding it from us, but thank you for what you have accomplished this day!

Name: Mysterious Grotto
Description: This artificial cave appears to have been created long before the founding of Kortombe. Originally designed for the religious purposes of wealthy families, the only visitors these days are treasure seekers and adventurers.

Name: Great Throne Room
Description: This large chamber has been decorated in exceptionally bad taste. Large iron chandeliers crowd the ceiling. Paintings depicting barbaric scenes have been strewn chaotically along the walls. And judging by the pile of waste next to the imposing, ugly wooden throne, the person who lives here values hygiene as much as aesthetics.

Name: Ancient Ambush
Description: A dozen skeletons, male and female, wearing clothes of Gantras colours are splayed out on the ground. There are three arrows stuck in the ribcage of a warrior who must have been more than two meters tall.

Name: Enigma Pass
Description: Gigantic symbols have been engraved on the rock walls surrounding the pass which ends at the foot of Mount Cloporte. At the base of this mountain is an empty altar.

Name: Fort Ciloucan
Description: A fortified building is hidden near the Sleeping Forest. Banners of the Protectors of the Rose fly atop a tower allowing for the observation of the plains.

Dialogs.Content:
Yes, you see... my job here is to watch over the Mists in the centre of the plain. The lords, ladies and barons of Ordval are doing everything they can to ignore the recent changes in the Mists. They're too caught up in their political games.

But, the Protectors of the Rose, like owls in the dead of night, remain ever vigilant. We want to be ready for the day the people need us.

I, Reginold Wellstrong, Knight of the Rose, grant you your squirely quest today. In greatest honour, for the good of the people, you have been tasked to protect...

*Reginold chokes in the middle of his speech.

What was I saying?

Ah yeah, I have four old mates who need help with some adventures in Ordval. They're waiting for you to escort them.

This will be your first mission with me.

Indeed! Do you want an official ceremony?

I invite you to return to the fortress and follow our combat training.

We will soon talk about the next steps in your training.

Don't take me for a fool. Our scouts have seen you using the ancient portals of the realm. We know you're visiting the strange fort shielded by a Veil of Mists to the north of here.

You can keep your secrets, for now. But know that if you wish to progress with the followers of the Rose,  you will not be able to remain as opaque as those Mists.
Welcome to the fort.

Apparently so. I owe Florentina a favour, so I have little choice.

*Reginold awaits your reaction.

Don't make that face, I'm teasing. It's true that I don't normally take a squire these days, but Florentina tells me you're a special case.

*Rudugul looks at you, uncertain yet determined.

Okay, squire, let's cleanse this cave.

Replies.Content: I first must ready myself for the dangers within.

Dialogs.Content: Don't wait for long, the corruption grows with every moment we waste.
Are you the Knight of the Rose?

Replies.Content: I'm a squire, but fear not.
I'm a squire, but fear not.

Dialogs.Content: Don't wait for long, the corruption grows with every moment we waste.

*Rudugul looks at you, uncertain yet determined.

Okay, squire, let's cleanse this cave.

Replies.Content: I first must ready myself for the dangers within.

Name: Windy escarpment
Description: A strange creature seems to inhabit the escarpment.

Name: White Wolves Territory
Description: In this region of Gnikorbar there lives a pack of wolves known not to interfere in human affairs. As you pass through, these majestic animals observe you while keeping a safe distance from your group.

Dialogs.Content: *Ovie looks longingly towards the wolf pack.
*Ovie's head drops. He whimpers a little, seemingly disappointed with your attitude.

*Ovie wags his tail to display his excitement about the idea.

*You understand that Ovie needs a chance to explore his heritage, to answer his call to the wild.

*You can't be certain what will happen if you let him go.

Name: Flying Bridge of the Arcanists
Description: A peculiar bridge made of unusual stones crosses the river. Your knowledge in construction leads you to question how this bridge could ever stand, let alone support extra weight. Then you notice the glistening runes on each of the stones.

Name: Saroskor'nak Tower
Description: A dark and uninviting tower stands atop Mount Gracious.

Dialogs.Content: Rolonet explains to you, in his strange language, that he makes much more profit on poor quality poisons. He is willing to trade you minoris poisons for a better poison.
The! Magic! Potion!
Visitor! You! Search! The! Magic?

Name: Mirousana River
Description: A boat is attached to a long cable crossing the river. The boat operators charge a few coins to cross the river.

Name: Plindor Farm
Description: This farm looks more like a seigneurial estate than agricultural land. Half a dozen houses have been built here to house the workers, and a few heavily armed guards roam the grounds to watch the cattle and protect the Plindor family property.

Dialogs.Content:
He is a rich and powerful man who does not appreciate the curiosity of strangers. Do not waste your time with the gossip peddled by the jealous peons of Aranbourg.

* A mean smile appears on Trank's face. One day, the soldier might be more open to your questions about his boss.

Ah, uh, well... the boss asked me to find an artist-couturier to create a decorative tablecloth for his dining room.

But all the designers in town hate Plindor, especially Carl Sifer of the Scarlet Warehouse.

So here I am, wondering what to do.
You can visit the agricultural estate, but respect the privacy and property of the Plindors. If not, you'll have me to answer to.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about farmer Plindor?
What's that piece of paper for?

Name: Demalaise Manor
Description: Built from great stone slabs in the centre of an important forest park, the house of the Demalaise family casts its shadow over a full quarter of the city. Guards wearing uniforms in the family colours, orange and black, patrol the area around the estate.

Name: Island of the Legosus
Description: On a small island, a group of legosus is basking in the sun.

Dialogs.Content: *The moment seems favourable to train one of these creatures seeing as they seem much less aggressive than usual.
*This creature requires a building with the following characteristics:
*You approach the creatures.*

Name: Thorval Vigilance Camp
Description: Ten heavily armed soldiers train in a camp built of wood and stone. On a mast, the flags of Pireiria and Ordval fly side-by-side.

Dialogs.Content: Maybe one day, when we get to know each other better.
Yes indeed. Gosh he was an extraordinary animal. I suspected sometimes that he was smarter than the nobleman. And certainly cleaner.

Replies.Content: Could you tell me about your adventures?

Dialogs.Content: A special unit formed by Maliken, Gantras and the Crown to counter slavery and human trafficking.

Replies.Content: I thought the slave trade was illegal in Pireiria?

Dialogs.Content:
There was a nobleman who talked too much. He was more skilled with arms than with women. A lovely companion though he often gave me a headache.

A mysterious adventurer also accompanied us for a time. In the end, it was she who led the group. I do not know where she went after we separated.

Ah, yes, I was almost going to forget the boar.

Evidently. Why else would a special unit need to be created?

To counter the phenomenon, the governments I mentioned pay experienced mercenaries, retired soldiers, or simply adventurers who want to fight for a just cause.
Welcome. Leave your weapons at the entrance. They won't be of any use to you in the camp.

As I told you, I'm an archaeologist by trade. Yet over the years I've earned a solid reputation for resolving investigations, helping communities in distress, and eliminating terrifying monsters on my travels.

Though I have to admit that I wasn't alone on these adventures. Ahem.

Replies.Content: Can you tell me about your companions?

Dialogs.Content: I am Cerrydwen Cahern, formerly an archaeologist and now in the service of the Crown of Pireiria. I'm now what's called a vigil.

Replies.Content: Can you tell me about yourself?

Dialogs.Content:
For the moment, no. Network members and their family members must be proven to be above reproach. In a few years, it might be possible. Though I personally hope there will be no use for us by then.

However, you can help us dismantle the traffickers. I'll explain how once I'm sure I can trust you.

[dev] to have quests from the vigilante network, the hero must have a high reputation in at least two lordships

Name: Mirousana Mill
Description: A large wooden watermill has been constructed alongside the Mirousana River. The farmers of Enorwen bring their grain there to make various cereal products. Some old illegible graffiti remains visible on the exterior walls of the building.

Dialogs.Content: Well well! What a motley crew! Would you like me to make you some fine miroudor flour?

Replies.Content: Miroudor flour? Related to the valley, I guess.
Is there some sort of problem with the mill?

Dialogs.Content:
Yeah... it's really depressing. The mill had passed all of its latest inspections and everything, yet here I am, caught with a half-destroyed mill.

It's going to be a nightmare to repair too, the centre of the main wheel is made from korupto! 

*You notice that Jovien has a black eye, as if he had been hit.

Oh, hey, you're looking at my bruise. Well... yeah... one of the main wheel supports fell on me. I'll survive.
Yes and no. The traditional flour contains mirou, or mirousanienne, but miroudor is the favourite of travellers and adventurers. Probably because it's made from a different cereal than normal wheat.

Replies.Content: But some other kind of cereal, right?

Dialogs.Content: [dev] flour could be a special ingredient for a potion or enchantment x.

Korupto! Are you really offering us all this wood!? Those bastards better not...

*Jovien looks around nervously.

Listen, it's almost time to appoint a new alderman. Durong is trying to get elected to the post by threatening everyone in the village. Well, those he can't buy with coin. He's not even from the area! I don't understand why Lorne isn't doing anything to stop them from operating in town.

Alright, enough politics for today. Do you want to help me fix the mill?
That's right, it's called riordor around these parts. It's extremely rare! So if you find any, be sure to come back to me, and I'll pack you a bag.

Replies.Content: Do you know where we can find it?

Name: Hydromorphic Ladder
Description: You are in front of the ancestral Hydromorphic Ladder. Using the energy of the Mists, you carve a temporal scale into the flow of the river.

Name: Dayrien Mining Camp
Description: A few wooden houses and a large general store have been constructed adjacent to the Dayrien Mine. A few children take care of washing clothes and feeding animals while their parents work on the extraction of ore.

Name: The Giant's Leap
Description: A series of pillars could allow you to cross to the other side, provided you know how to jump.

Name: Marbleworks of the Elites
Description: Located in the shade of the Jonnidemattis Mountains, the marbleworks is a hub for the regions' finest stonecutters. Dozens of sculptors busy themselves amidst the white dust and tools.

Dialogs.Content: Yes and no. I'm an apprentice in the art of stonework. Learning how to deal with customers is part of my training.
The marbleworks is currently buying stone for a large project. The stone must be delivered in good condition, directly to the Marbleworks of the Elites.

Is my stress so palpable? It's because I have to redirect a request coming directly from Pirzendor Palace. I must admit, the prospect of that sets my nerves on fire.

They need a very particular sculpture representing an imaginary world in the Mists.

I doubt my local artists could manage such a job.
The marble factory is currently buying stones for a project. The stones must be delivered in good condition directly to the marble works.
Can I take your order?
The marbleworks is currently buying high-quality stone for a project. The stone must be delivered in good condition, directly to the Marbleworks of the Elites.

Name: Escomantis Tower
Description: A tall black-stone tower casts a menacing shadow over Tsarkalov Point. Dark clouds charged with energy surround its summit, rain or shine. Frightening howls emanate from inside the walls of the tower.

Name: Ruins of Kristo
Description: Covered by climbing plants, the ruins of the tower of the legendary hero Kristo remain visible. A strange scent reminiscent of a spicy stew rises from the small condemned well located near the rubble of a stable.

Name: Discussions with the steward
Description: You have returned to your home in the world of Mists. The sky is once-more veiled by the magical Mist of Valsonge. Your eye is drawn to the sun which, after your having crossed through the portal, now sits in a different place in the sky.

Dialogs.Content: Not really. I'm the final recruit available. All graduates have already been placed with other Walkers. The Valsonge authorities would never allow a domain outside of the city to be without a steward. Why, it's unthinkable!

At the end of your training, Valsonge constructed a small mansion and a Misthouse for you. They expect you to develop your lands and strengthen this Misthouse.

It is the responsibility of the Walker to successfully repel the Mist. That should give our people enough living space that they no longer feel imprisoned by its vapours.

Personally, I've never felt trapped by the Mists. They have in fact always given me a certain comfort. But we each have our unique quirks and tastes, right?
It's not fit for a master craftsman, but it will get the job done and allow you to create the first handicrafts you'll need. It's outside though so I hope you don't mind the cold!

The Misthouse has two vital uses: it repels the Mist and allows you to teleport yourself to other portals you know.

Only the council know how to build portals. It's a very well-kept secret as I'm sure you can imagine. Still, your training should be sufficient to keep it maintained.

Your ability to traverse the Mists. As far as I know, nobody from Valsonge will be able to follow you through them.

Although one day, when I was young, my grandfather Leonidas came to my parents house with a woman who claimed to be from a Mist-free world. He wanted her to meet the council. Perhaps that means you can bring people in through the portal?

Gone? Gone where? Maybe you had one too many ales at graduation yesterday.

*Scissana lays eyes on your Lantern and becomes as pale as the Mist.

Oh my! You... he... he told me about this Orb colour. He arranged for me to be your steward! I am humbled to be in your presence.

* Scissana takes a deep breath and waits for your reaction.

Replies.Content: This is what happened to me...

Dialogs.Content: About an hour, maybe less. The door of your mansion was still open and the chimney fire still well stoked.

Replies.Content: But I've been gone for at least half a day!

Dialogs.Content: Finally, there you are! We had an appointment earlier. Had you forgotten? Never mind, no need to apologise. We must speak of the post of steward.

Replies.Content: Did you say I was just gone for an hour?

Dialogs.Content: The mansion is your headquarters. It's really quite lovely inside. This is where we will work together to organize the labours of the land.

For the moment, yes, I'd recommend discretion. Though I know well that secrecy cannot last forever. If we succeed in exploiting the world without Mists, we can convince the council that your "power" is beneficial to the cause of the mother city. 

That's what I believe, anyway.

My name is Scissana, Scissana of Valsonge. 

I am... well... I am the granddaughter of Leonidas Valsonge. I carry with me his lineage and all of the problems that implies. I must inform you of this, given the... delicate nature of my grandfather's situation.

That's right. It is tradition, after all. Every Walker must have a steward, and every steward, a Walker. We stewards are rigorously trained in specialized schools. We keep the records of each domain and ensure that the work progresses as it should.

I finished my studies with distinction. In addition to operations, I'm a fine blacksmith, woodworker, sewer, and cabinet-maker. I will be happy to assist you in your early works. Though I imagine later you will want to hire specialised craftsmen whose skills exceed my own. When that happens, I shall return to my own specialty - organisation!

Ah I see you like to watch your coin. Fear not, Valsonge's board covers my salary for the early years of my employment. Your only responsibilities are to provide me with a room in your mansion and a place to work.
Okay, but I'm not letting you leave until the situation is crystal clear.

The two of us seem to have just become partners in adventure. I'm not sure if my grandfather is really behind this but it doesn't matter anymore.

There is an ancestral clause in the steward's code which states that we must inform the council of any teleportation to the outside world. It was never taken seriously by the students, but I knew, because of my grandfather, that it was probably the mission they deemed most important.
It doesn't concern you at all, but just to avoid misunderstandings, I'm exploring the ruins of the fortress. Now leave me!

Replies.Content: Your clothes seem surprisingly clean and rich to me for an adventurer or an archaeologist.

Dialogs.Content: Ha! Depending on the kind of trouble you are attracted to, I can probably help you, but I have to test your skills first.

Replies.Content: Testing my skills at night in the middle of ruins seems like a bad idea.

Dialogs.Content: I know what lurks in these ruins at night, and I'm not alone. What about you, do you think you're safe?

Replies.Content: I might be looking for trouble ...

Dialogs.Content: Your clothes seem surprisingly clean and rich to me for an adventurer or an archaeologist.
Oh? Are you sure you are in the right place?

Replies.Content: [D] What are you doing here, alone?
[N] The place seems to me a long way from Kortombourg for a richly dressed and lonely person. Moreover, it is night ...
DEV: There will be a few arena-style combat quests ... to be completed when the battles are done.

Dialogs.Content: My my, you make it an obsession with time and place. Then, if you lack courage, you can leave, I won't hold you back.
Dev: to review
Fordukura!

Huh what?

[GF]You are female

[GM]You are male

[D]It is day.
[N]It is night.
[S]It is sunset.
[T]It is sunrise.
Thou shall do something.
I do what I want.

Replies.Content: I'll get to the camp right now.
Did I understand there were other types of portals?
I'm afraid my knowledge in the forests here is too thin.
I'm ready to learn more about vortexes.
Do you have more information for me?

Dialogs.Content: It's not nice! Test

It is true that there is not much wilderness where you come from. Hmmm ...
Oh! There was another Walker who tried to climb a cliff near here. He never came back ...
Perhaps you could find some interesting equipment for your expeditions to his former camp.

Name: Silus Tribe
Description: Rudimentary huts have been constructed in this corner of the forest.

Name: Thorax Distillery
Description: Built in an old drydock ship hangar, the Thorax Distillery's wooden walls have been greyed through long-term exposure to wind and salt. The distillery employs more than a dozen workers, some of whom can be seen loading barrels into a small cart outside.

Residents.Name: Ardent Vorax

Dialogs.Content: Sure, I guess. Though I'd say if you're looking for non-alcoholic activities, then the distillery probably isn't the most sensible starting point. Just sayin'.

That depends on what you're looking for.

If you're hoping to improve your stabbing skills, I know some folks who could help. Likewise, if you're treasure-hunting, probably the most popular sport in the county, I could give you a few pointers.

Replies.Content: So you know some fencing masters?

Dialogs.Content:
That's part of the risk you take as a treasure hunter. I'm not forcing you to do anything. After all, if you'd rather conduct your own search, I won't stop you. But I'm pretty sure it will require more time and resources than I'm asking for.

[Dev] Ardent vorax will give small missions like fedex in exchange for the location of some chests. Some of his chests might not contain anything but they will lead to cool places like that.
I didn't drown when my ship sank, but I did drown my sorrows so deeply in alcohol that the old distillery owner named his first-born son in my honour... and left his establishment to me.

Replies.Content: Is it possible to have fun without alcohol in Thorval?
Do you flavour your alcohols with anything?
Do you need other substances for your alcohols?

Dialogs.Content:
* Ardent utters a howl that sounds a bit like laughter.

Of course not! My boat didn't really sink! I traded it for ten barrels!
Ardent works on a very special aromatic project for a new alcohol. He asks you for very particular products for his attempts to find the ultimate taste.
Eh... not exactly. I know people for whom wielding weapons is a way of life, not just a means of survival. Does that interest you?

Before I do, I'm going to have to make sure you have what it takes to join the group. It's not for the faint of heart nor weak of arm.

[dev] mission for Ardent that will lead to the front door of the Claws. Dorf Lundgrof is the one who will open the door for the hero to join the claws.

Yes, but they're not free.

* Ardent doesn't give you time to ask the price.

I won't ask you for any coins. However, you will need to complete a few tasks for me before I give you the possible location of a treasure chest.

Replies.Content: So you're saying it's possible there won't even be anything at the location you eventually reveal to me after I run your errands? That feels unfair.

Dialogs.Content:
It shouldn't be a surprise to you. Many boat captains, bandits and adventurers are said to have hidden treasures throughout the vast lands and coasts of Thorval.

Frankly, there can't be that many left. Though like my grandfather always used to say, the important thing is to seek, not to discover.

Replies.Content: Do you have any substantial leads for me?

Dialogs.Content: Ardent is constantly looking for specific flavours for his spirits. Return to him every day to see what he would like to test.
Ardent is keen to further advance his search for nuanced savoury flavours for his alcohols. Perhaps you would enjoy helping him with his tests?

Residents.Greets: Got problems? Fear not! We have over twelve types of spirits that can fix them.

Name: Exit from Saharanelle
Description: A staircase goes up to the Leviathan plateau.

Name: House of Laws
Description: Prominently placed at the entrance to Giltanbourg as if as a warning to ill-intentioned visitors, the House of Laws is the workplace of all the town's representatives in charge of its proper administration.

Dialogs.Content:
They are mainly stored here. Most of the time, they are written in the ducal palace.

However, the House of Laws is not just a library for legal documents, it also houses offices for most of the official bodies of Gantras as well as the official embassy of Ogvania in Myriaden.

Replies.Content: So you must be well-versed in local politics?

Dialogs.Content:
Do not touch our documents without first properly washing your hands! 

I'm sure that's a strange practice for people like you. But here in Giltanbourg, we are civilized.

Replies.Content: You don't need to be so rude.
I guess all the laws of Gantras are written here?
Can you tell me about Gantras?
Is there work for adventurers in Gantras?

Dialogs.Content:
Certainly. Though considering the lateness of the hour, I shall provide you with just a superficial account.

As I mentioned, there is my family, the Pirzendor - one of the first lines to be established in the region. Several of my cousins hold land and important positions in the administration of the Duchy. With a few exceptions, the dukes of Gantras usually come from our family.

The Demalaise family comes from a division in the line of Ysor Giltan. It is therefore, in a way, the first lineage of Gantras. Its influence is important, but no member has yet obtained the title of duke. Some, however, served as knights regent.

The Ecudors have historically had the role of forming the local militia, but the Duchess Pirella Pirzendor decided to withdraw that responsibility from the clan a few decades ago. That decision caused much scandal, but the cudors are happier today without the responsibility, I believe.

There aren't many Giltan representatives left. I prefer not to talk too much about it, given that it's a more delicate subject.

The Arcenciel, Corvus and Verdant also own estates here, but they're not very active in everyday life. The Corvus a little more than the other two.

There are a few representatives of the Cesseness, but their territory is found high in the mountains far from Giltanbourg, so I know very little of them.

There are also a few other wealthy families, but their political impact is relatively minor and their history is less linked to that of the duchy.

The people of Gantras show a remarkable openness!

*Ocelot's aged face scrunches up, indicating his disapproval of your question.

We have enacted laws to prevent slavery, we welcome all foreigners with open arms, and we try to help the less fortunate people of the duchy. If that's pretentious, then I welcome our pretentiousness. 

By comparison, Kortombe and Wellnear are disorganized and crime rules in Thorval and Larcen. Well, Larcen wouldn't be so bad if the lords of the place could concentrate instead of running tournaments and women with loose morals.

Replies.Content: Maybe you should be a little more open-minded?

Dialogs.Content:
You're right, sir. Good manners are as important a part of civility as cleanliness. Please accept my excuses. 

The truth is, I'm haunted by the nightmares of a particularly foul woman who fingered her way through our laws on marital inheritance, her hands still stained with blood.

*The old man's face turns a shade of pale yellow as he recalls the traumatic visit of the guest.

Do not worry. This uncouth girl now sleeps in the jail where she belongs.

*Ocelot shakes his head as if to wake up*

Are you the party of adventurers that brought warning of the invading nuertogolem army?

*You explain that the story is getting out of control and that only a few golems have been created.

I suspected as much. I'll have to prove it to the board. Though they'll want to see it with their own eyes otherwise they'll never believe me.

Since this whole story is your fault, would you agree to help me prove how exaggerated it has become?

Replies.Content: I'll help, although I'm not taking the blame...

Dialogs.Content:
It is the richest and most powerful seigneury west of Maliken. Our economy revolves primarily around mining, mineral processing, and trade.

We have one of the best military schools on the whole continent, and the ducal militia is undoubtedly made up of the most well-trained soldiers in the country.

Gantras has a dark past. But from the darkest dark, greatness can sometimes arise. Today, I believe without a shadow of a doubt, we live in the finest possible society.

Replies.Content: It's a bit pretentious here, isn't it?

Dialogs.Content:
Evidently, for a good part of our territory is made up of mountains and caves. And where dark places exist, evil always lurks.

The Protectors of the Rose are well established in the region, but they are not recognized for roaming the wild parts of the duchy. An experienced explorer will certainly be able to find several small quests to accomplish in less-developed regions. Especially for nobles, academics and business people.

There are also some citizens who have decided to establish communities outside of Giltanbourg. They are surely in need of help.

Moreover, tis not uncommon for local authorities to pay mercenaries to go and investigate parts of the territory or to monitor the borders with Ogvania.

Correct. You have been instructed to provide a gift to the Pirenzor family...

In Gantras, it is customary when an individual stands out in the community that he offers a gift of his creation to the ruling family.

You... have no choice. It's a legal decree.

Indeed. Though especially given that I am a distant relative of the duke, I cannot simply share my insights with the first travellers who ask me. You understand my position, I hope.

However, if you have any questions about the laws or the political history of Gantras, I can certainly be of service.

Replies.Content: Can you tell me anything about the important families of the region?

Dialogs.Content: The Blast Furnace has a constant need for wood for the creation of coal. The use of coal of rarer essence makes it possible to carry out difficult projects.
The blast furnace has a constant need for wood for the creation of coal. The use of rarer essence coals allows for the better finishing of weapons.
*You approach the bulletin board, which is kept in pristine condition with requests methodically alphabetized and colour-coded...
The weapons in the people's armoury wear out too quickly. Officials are looking for craftsmen to provide better practice weapons.
The blast furnace has a constant need for wood for the creation of coal.

Name: Statue of Cornea
Description:
Constructed in isipren stone imported from the marshes of Arangort, the statue represents Cornea at the end of her own life but still ready to help the dying. She is crouched near the body of an unknown peasant and she administers a healing potion to him. A plaque engraved on the base of the sculpture gives further explanation.

Born in the marshes of Arangort, Cornea traveled in several regions of Pireiria to finally settle in Kortombe where she ended her life. Following the great earthquakes that struck the continent, more than 200 Kortombourgers were directly saved thanks to her care.

Isipren is an extremely rare stone found mainly in the marshes of Arangfort. It is known to offer good protection against humidity.

Name: Muddy Road
Description: Long-known as "the muddy road" by villagers, a recent thunderstorm has really helped it live up to its reputation. The storm knocked down a tree creating potholes of deep mud all over - making the route as good as impassable.

Dialogs.Content: So, uh, what are you waiting for? Please, help him.

Replies.Content: I have to prepare my equipment to be sure that I don't disappear too.
I wait for nothing. I shall find him at once!

Dialogs.Content: I worry about Finn. He was supposed to be going to Kortombourg, but the fact that you are in front of me, and he is not, suggests the worst.

Replies.Content: I'm here to escort you to Kortombourg.
I could go looking for him.

Dialogs.Content: True. I'm sorry... I didn't mean to force your hand.
Prisoner of mud
I understand, but I will not leave without Finn. His mother is... one of my good friends. She would never forgive me.
Okay, but hurry. Finn could be in danger. And so could my cart!
Oh! What a relief to no longer be alone on this forsaken road.

Replies.Content: I get the feeling you might be in a spot of difficulty?
Finn may have been injured by vargrs, or he might have fallen into one of these awful mudholes.

Dialogs.Content:
I fear you may be right. My cart is stuck in the mud and my bodyguard is missing.

At the risk of appearing selfish, I think you should take care of my vehicle first.

Replies.Content: Let me assess the situation before deciding on the next step.

Name: Mystil's Marvels
Description: A majestic residence is perched on the cliff over the Chiona River. A strange energy emanates from the place, as if the building itself is watching you. In quiet moments, the distant rumbling of Heroes Fall can be heard.

Residents.Name: Mystil

Dialogs.Content: Welcome, dear visitor! Know that I do not accept crowns in exchange for my marvels. You'll have to prove your worth with something else...

Replies.Content: What is it that you want actually?
What can you tell me about the local area?

Dialogs.Content:
*Mystil inspects you.

I have a client who is looking for highly talented artisans. He made me prepare a little test for those who would like to work with him.

Would you be interested in participating?
I am not authorized to say more. The collector is a contact of mine, that's all you need to know.

You're at the beginning of the Mountain Chain of Heroes. The place is full of dungeons, plateaus and mountain peaks that are extremely difficult to navigate.

The names given to places in the region come from ancient Therianic folklore. We have the summit of Predatoris as well as the plateaus of Araknidras, Wyvernus and Royalgoat.

No one really knows if this folklore is based on fables or creatures from another world.

You'll have to go find out for yourself.
The Collector, a mysterious friend of Mystil, seeks a particular weapon forged to his specifications.
Bring me three copies of all achievement symbols, and I'll give you what you need.

Residents.Greets: Do you really have what it takes?

Dialogs.Content: The Collector's Armory is said to span a dungeon twenty stories high. Armor is even said to animate and attack you if you step into it.
The Collector exports jewelry across the continent. Some of his clients have very specific requests that require highly talented craftsmen. Like you?
You approach the bulletin board...
The Collector requires a well-stocked wardrobe. Today, he is looking for these clothes.
The collector owns a gigantic machine that often needs replacement parts. The machine is said to be hovering over Strata Obseka.

Name: Well of Odours
Description: It stinks...

Name: Flying Bridge of the Arcanists
