Description: A peculiar bridge made of unusual stones crosses the river. Your knowledge in construction leads you to question how this bridge could ever stand, let alone support extra weight. Then you notice the glistening runes on each of the stones.

Name: Camp of Tears
Description: A few tents abandoned by their owners and ravaged by time somehow remain standing. The smell of rot hangs in the air lending the place a sinister claustrophobic atmosphere. An unknown entity has painted red tears on trees surrounding the encampment. Some of the paint still looks fresh.

Name: Mount Faras Camp
Description: A few straw huts have been built at the foot of Mount Faras. Men and women are busy cutting up the carcasses of hunted animals and salting the meat for preservation.

Dialogs.Content: *You approach the bulletin board...
Our hunters have been attacked several times by tawny bears in the Watchman's Comb. If anyone could go over there and kill a few, that would be great. They will of course be rewarded.
The white vargr population in the area is too high. This could endanger our hunters and travelers. If anyone is willing to reduce their number, they will be rewarded.
Greetings! You can rest here, but you'll be far more comfortable at the World's End Relay.
Mainly green bears. There are few animals of that colour in Pireiria, which makes its pelt a rare product indeed. Oh, and their flesh is surprisingly excellent too.
It's an inn located in the Shield of the Chimera run by Cassiopee Felixvoris and her family.

Name: Bentro Cemetery
Description:
The graves, plants and walkways of the cemetery seem to be regularly maintained by the caretaker. Some offerings have been placed at the feet of statues representing important personalities from the history of Kortombe.

Since its founding over 250 years ago, the cemetery has been vandalized and renovated many times. Its caretaker and gardener, Rhys, is recognized as a sometimes rude man, but with a rather memorable sense of humour.

Dialogs.Content:
*The rotund man shakes his head in disapproval, then bursts out laughing.

I knew I shouldn't have trusted a mercenary for this kind of work. Next time, I'll go see the militiamen! They may not be the freshest hams from the butcher shop, but at least they are not complete morons! Walking dead! Ha! Ha! Ha!
It seems they're doing very well without me.
If I chose this profession, it is because I just love having visitors... especially the dead and the mourning! Ha! Ha! Ha!

Replies.Content: Do you really like people in mourning? Why?
Do you believe the living dead hypothesis?
So how are your dead these days?
Do you have a job for me?

Dialogs.Content:
The lineage owes its fame in part to Sorcha, a renown weaponmaster, and the first woman to have held the position of Protector of Kortombe. 

Many members of the Grandmoon family have had illustrious military careers. A few years ago, Matteus's father opened a training room at Korllights Academy, but his style was considered too complex for the peasants of Kortombourg.

*Sighs in exasperation

You were the one looking for work, I didn't ask you for anything! Well, if you change your mind, come back here to find me. 

I don't go to town very often. It's too... alive.

Look, I'm a caretaker not a historian, so don't expect a guided tour. There are commemorative plaques throughout the cemetery, you can read them if you want.

I can tell you that the place was named in tribute to the grandfather of Yves Bentro, the baroness's former husband.

My friend Matteus sent me a letter in which he claims to have been visited at night by the living dead. He is a descendant of the esteemed Grandmoon family, so I doubt that simple brigands or pranksters could have fooled him. 

If you ever have the time to visit him and see what's going on, I would consider it a personal favour. He lives in Maledorn Forest.

Yes. If you could please tell all strangers with weird accents to avoid the cemetery, that would make me happy. You can start by leading by example.

Seriously though. If you want to make yourself useful, for the past few weeks, graves have been vandalized, offerings stolen, and flowers plucked.

I suspect that there are dirty rascals intentionally playing tricks on me, but I never see them first-hand. 

I sleep in the cabin at the entrance to the cemetery, and my dog Baron Crocula patrols along the fences at night. I guarantee you that if he had seen a rascal set foot in here, that he would have barked and growled very loudly... I mean, he would then have run away with his tail between his legs because he's a little coward, but hey, he would have barked! 

Do you want to get to the bottom of things for me?

Replies.Content: Sounds a bit too spooky to me. I'm not interested.

Dialogs.Content:
Do you know how to prepare bodies for burial? Do you want to dig graves? No? No? That's what I thought...

*Rhys sighs heavily.

Wait! Actually I may have an appropriately simple job for you.

I need Grimkush oil for a personal project. The problem is that this liquid is only prepared once a year, under certain specific conditions, and it's only good for a few days.

I can tell you where to find it, but I don't think it will be ready immediately.

Replies.Content: I would prefer a more interesting mission.

Dialogs.Content:
They speak less than the others!

*Rhys gives you a heavy look of innuendo.
Perfect! Because I would prefer that my money doesn't end up in your purse!

Name: Vianney Ruins
Description: A few torn tents remain firmly planted in the ground around a deep pit. At the bottom of the pit, there are ruins of foundational walls that once supported an impressive watchtower.

Residents.Name: Pashega Varoui

Dialogs.Content:
There are several mining and archaeological camps in the area. Some soldiers and mercenaries also come to train in the region, it seems that the mountain air does wonders for the body and soul.

As for archaeologists, they're looking for information on towers that were built before the Cataclysm. Apparently no trace of them can be found in the history books.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the resources in the region?
What can you tell me about dangers in the region?

Dialogs.Content: [come back to talk about monsters]

Not particularly. Thorbourg is, however, the last organized port before the southern territories. So it's a good stopping point for adventurers, and over the years relationships have been forged between the trading companies of Jawana and those of Thorval. 

I arrived in the region a few years ago. The ship I was working on was in deep need of repairs, so to survive, I needed to find myself a few contracts. But over time, I developed an affinity for these mountains.
[come back to talk about resources]

* Pashega bursts out laughing.

Sorry, the people of Thorval are starting to get used to our presence due to commercial shipping. But generally, humans run away from us whenever they see us.

Replies.Content: Is there a lot of trade between your region and Thorval?

Dialogs.Content: Don't look at me like I'm some wild beast!

Replies.Content: And please don't talk to me like that. I'm not completely ignorant, I know how to recognize a shandori.
What can you tell me about the area?

Residents.Greets: Oshinara! May the sun watch over your travels!

Name: Mountain Gate
Description: On the side of Mount Gantdefer, there is a small golden lock. Evidently, only those with the key will be able to uncover the mysteries it surely hides.

Name: Nest of the Assembly
Description: A huge stone sculpture of a formidable manticore has been built in the centre of this small village. About twenty men and women, all wearing light armour, busy themselves with combat training and the daily management of the settlement.

Dialogs.Content: If you're worthy.
Do you think my time is so worthless that I would waste it on your infantile curiosity? Get lost.

Ah... yet more adventurers who celebrated with Emilio or played the role of explorer with Toride and now believe they're "of the Claw". Don't make me laugh!

Go kill the Rylenback. Maybe I'll have some time for you afterwards.

*Serocca looks you up and down before answering.

I need some rare resources that can only be acquired by defeating some pretty formidable creatures.

I'll offer you training in exchange, are you in?

*Serocca looks at you like you're a lowly gremfyr. A wry smile crosses her face.*

I'd be happy to show you just how unprepared you are.
You're in Claw Assembly territory now. We don't just let in simple visitors or the curious.

Replies.Content: What exactly is the Claw Assembly?
Can you teach me combat skills?
What can you tell me about the area?
I am a child of the Claw...
I'm looking for a challenge of brute force!
Would you train me in the use of polearms?

Dialogs.Content: Get out of my face. I've got better things to do.
There are trees. There are mountains. There's water. And there's bandits. Satisfied?
* Serocca growls at you.

Name: Hordulk'hos Tomb
Description: The thick stone door is made from the native lanferite of the mountain. Inscriptions, engravings and incantations have been etched into the door. Though you do not understand them, you feel a chill run through you as you look upon them.

Name: Silence Camp
Description: A few military tents are set up along the road. Two soldiers passively practice archery on a small improvised shooting range.

Dialogs.Content:
Theosos at Harmony Camp is very interested in scabonzis.

Given our recent prowess with the scouts, he might have a mission for you.

Tell him I sent you.

I don't know, did you?

* Lyma lets out a small laugh.

I know full well that if that was the case then you wouldn't tell me, and that's not the reason for my posting.

However, I must warn you of the presence of dangerous creatures which the people of Larcen call scabonzis.

People from the Lunar Caravan. They want to settle near Esquire Lake. They seem to have made all the necessary arrangements with the nobles of Larcen, so I'm not sure whether I should stop them or not.

They're looking for a guide for the region, do you have time?
Hello! Take a few minutes to rest here. We need to talk to you.

Replies.Content: Can I help you more against the scabonzi threat?

Dialogs.Content:
You may have already noticed the presence of scabonzi scouts in the Silent Plain to the north.

While not too dangerous, sometimes they tend to attack travellers weaker than themselves.

Go hunt scabonzi scouts on the plain. They're the weakest type of scabonzis you'll find.

Replies.Content: I'll take care of the scabonzi scouts!

Dialogs.Content:
A kind of goblinoid vaguely resembling gigantic bipedal rats. They rarely come near to this post, so I haven't seen one up close yet, but I do know that several Caravaneers have been attacked in the past few months.

So, do be careful in your journey.

Name: Tomb
Description: The tomb bears the mark of Eragoth.

Name: Sylvan Estate
Description: Someone has built simple huts up in the treetops, with wooden planks bridging the gaps between the trees. There are no visible stairs or ladders that would grant access to the structures.

Dialogs.Content: In the name of hungry tortolions! Can't you see that I'm busy?! If I wanted to be disturbed every twenty minutes, I would have built my house in the centre of Kortombourg.

Replies.Content: What are you doing isolated in this forest?
What can I do to help you prepare Grimkush Oil?
Do you need any other ingredients?

Dialogs.Content: I eagerly await the curious coming to disturb me. I sit here twiddling my thumbs all day, just waiting for people like you. Truly, I only exist to answer your questions.

Replies.Content: There is no need to be sarcastic.

Dialogs.Content: You could recover the ingredients I'm missing. The most important is the gossiping flower which is found in the Wood of Fables.

Obviously. Did you really think such a rare oil could be concocted out of a single species of flower? Some people! I need alcoholigron. It's a fluid that you can recover from certain types of undead. I imagine you can come up with some ideas of your own as to where to find it.

Replies.Content: Actually, I don't know. But I will go get it as soon as you have told me where to go.

Dialogs.Content: If my sarcasm stops you coming back and talking to me again, then there is absolutely a need for it.

Name: Ridge Path
Description: A tiny precipitous path follows the crest of the mountain.

Name: Edelweiss Fortress
Description: The cave's interior has been transformed into a large hall covered in luxurious marble. Heavily armed fighters train amongst themselves throughout this main hall, the echoes of their blades reverberating in a cacophony of metal-on-metal. Charts intended for the elaboration of complex military tactics adorn the walls.

Dialogs.Content:
Did you come here by accident?

* Cadfael looks at you in disbelief.

It doesn't matter. Yes, as I said, it's a place where our veterans come to perfect their skills.

Replies.Content: So if you agree to teach me, I can learn the techniques of the most experienced warriors?

Dialogs.Content:
We train the elite Protectors of the Rose. If you're not able to reach our centre, you're not worthy of being a part of it...

... though I can immediately tell that you have what it takes.

Replies.Content: Oh! Are you Protectors of the Rose?
So every warrior present has to climb the whole mountain whenever they want to train here? How does resupplying work? What about changing the toilet water?

Dialogs.Content:
You have a lot of questions. I'll simply respond that we have an efficient system in place for food, water... and waste.

As for the veterans who train here, they know the best passages to reach the fortress quickly. And they're not easily deterred by challenge.

Not necessarily. You'll certainly be able to find someone at your level. However, if you are really one of the best warriors of the order, then we'll be able to help you hone your skills to perfection.

Few things. You may have noticed by my accent that I'm not from Ordval... and I hear you're not either.

I know there are several ogres and summit wyverns around. For the past few weeks, there also seems to be an infestation of assassins, the spiders that is, throughout the mountain caves. It would be nice if I could get some men to deal with them.
Be careful not to distract the training fighters. You could get hit without warning.

Replies.Content: For a training centre, this place seems very difficult to access.
What can you tell me about the region?

Name: Kalamaran Ruins
Description: The remains of an old stone village remain visible despite the fact that the place seems to have been deserted more than two centuries ago. Only one building, an old forge, remains in good condition. Judging by the soot, the state of the place, and the traces in the mud, someone is still using it.

Dialogs.Content:
No. Yes. I do not know.

* Garim seems to have lost the thread of the conversation. You hear the sound of a gear slowly grinding.

A heart is the magic stone required to complete my masterpiece.

[Dev] a quest that gives a recipe for a cool item could start there.
Garim constantly needs parts for his automated forge projects. He is willing to trade you simple mechanics for more complex mechanics.

Yes.

* Garim seems satisfied with his answer.

* Once more, the creature seems to think long and hard before answering you.

I am Garim. A blacksmith. I do not know more. I feel... a connection with my brothers to the south.

* A deep vibrating moan comes from Garim's mouth.

I am missing a heart.

Replies.Content: I'm sure you are a sensitive being.

Dialogs.Content:
Yes. We... I am not alone. I do not wish any misfortune on you or the other sacks...

* Something in Garim's head seems to warn him to take his time before continuing to speak.

... to you or the other beings of flesh.

I only want to work with metal.

Replies.Content: What do you know about your brothers? Are there many of you?

Dialogs.Content:
Hello!

* A soft, deep, metallic voice comes out of what you first thought was a stone statue.

Do not be afraid. I mean you no harm.

* The statue appears to be searching for its words deep within its rocky skull.

I mean no harm to anyone.

I have been here for...

* You think you hear some mechanical gear noises whizzing and whirring. You'll probably never know if it was your imagination or a sound from Garim's clockwork brain trying to locate some deeply buried information.

... more than three days.

And all this time, I have been forging.

* A brief look inside the forge lets you know that it has been in ruins for months at least.

Now I cannot.

Name: Landslide location
Description: Part of the hill has collapsed, making the road normally used by local labourers impassable.

Name: The legendary X
Description: A gigantic, red, wooden "X" has been planted in this part of the territory. Graffiti indicates that you have arrived where you should be. About ten holes have been dug using shovels or pickaxes.

Dialogs.Content: Shovels, pickaxes, water bottles, in short, the perfect equipment for any self-respecting treasure hunter!

Baaah! There isn't much going on here. In the past, knights and their servants used to come here to train. Now there are only a few newbie adventurers passing through each day.

Oh, and there are earthquakes.

But of course! You're my hundredth customer of the day!

* Norill's exhausted expression is a clear indication that in fact you're his first customer in some time.
Well! Well! You took a long time!

Replies.Content: Can you tell me about the area?

Name: Hamlet of Brumedor
Description: A few residential buildings and a quay is all that makes up the tiny Hamlet of Brumedor. Though a good number of boats are moored at the wharf. Intriguingly, many of these boats are reinforced with spikes, as if they were designed to repel attacks.

Dialogs.Content: Are you here for work?

Replies.Content: I would like to go to Moulanasul.
I would like to go to Laematsu.

Dialogs.Content:
How about as the esteemed protector of ships? 

We're the fishermen of Titan Lake. And since the waters are infested with abominable creatures, we need fighters to protect our kin.

Really? So you have a death wish? That island is incredibly dangerous. Humans rarely venture there, and more rarely still do they return. 

The locals call it Snake Island because its teeming with aggressive species. 

If you really have your heart set on this foolishness, I do know a spot on the southern tip where I can dock. For the appropriate compensation, I would take you there.

Replies.Content: What do you want in return?

Dialogs.Content:
Really?

*A crooked smile appears on Rolaundur's face.

Then I hope you have a full purse to pay for the journey. There are many dangers in that area of the lake.

I'm not sure I want to send my sailors there.

Your best option for learning more about our kin and the chequered past of this place is to integrate with the community.

As is the custom in our lands, each day, you will need to bring gifts to the people if you wish to be accepted as an honorary member of our community.

Name: Alcharan Scientific Estate
Description: Several small stone buildings encircle a central structure that resembles a scientific academy. Men and women, humans and shandoris, walk from one building to another, dressed in metal breastplates covered in multi-coloured stains.

Dialogs.Content:
You mean the kind of creation that few of us are capable of conceiving.

*Wynael is watching you intently.

I imagine that mixing an andolvian and a sophalite is probably the most complex theoretical combination using the knowledge we have today. Someone who succeeded in doing so could certainly create legendary enchantments.

Some substances are more difficult to obtain than others. The reasons for this are multifold. In this instance, we seek the seed of a griffotulan. It's a species of rare plant-creature that is a formidable threat by night, but far worse by day. These carnivorous plants only live in temperatures colder than those of Thorval.

I can show you where on your map to find some if you agree to pick up a griffotulan seed for me. Alone, the substance you collect from them will not be of any use to you, but I'll give you components that you'll find much more interesting.

Replies.Content: I'll go there as soon as possible.

Dialogs.Content: Marvellous! I imagine that the substances I gave you will be of no use if you don't know how to transform them. It will be my pleasure to aid you on your journey of education!

Haha! I realise that most adventurers with an interest in practical alchemy do not take their research that far. After all, your main interest is in creating substances that can improve your chances of success on your journeys. This is why a certain work of dissemination of knowledge is essential.

The work of amateurs, do not feel insulted by the term, is also essential for us. You find hard to come by resources, and you experiment a lot more than we do. Unfortunately, you often don't live long enough to tell us about the results of your experiments.

Hmph. That could be an interesting test. Then again, since you're an adventurer, you'd just use the guide I gave you for building temporary labs. And what's more,  I can't leave Alcharan right now, so it would be too difficult for me to inspect your facilities.

I have no doubts about your ability to recover substances from creatures. However, being an alchemist is not the same as being a monster slayer. Indeed, most of us will never get out of the lab. 

So, I also have to test your other skills.

Years of dedication! Though I guess that's not the answer you were hoping for.

If you wanted to expedite your learning, you'd need the right tools and a quiet, solid place for you to experiment as you wish. It won't make you a master, but you should be able to take your research quite far.

Replies.Content: Tell me, is there an ultimate substance for an alchemist?

Dialogs.Content:
I guess you already have a grasp of the foundations. After all, many of us have written books, and alchemy is also taught in most academies. The Arcanists have written extensively on the subject as well.

To summarise, alchemy is the art of mixing two or more substances to form a new one. 

Obviously, the choice of substances used by alchemists in their experimentations are those supported by theories. For example, no contemporary alchemist would mix vulufang slime with wren scales. The two substances are well known to be in the same Ryonnian field. 

That said, if you wanted to do it in your home, no one would stop you. Well, I guess your neighbours might when they get a whiff of the smell.

Ryon was a remarkable alchemist who wrote endless books on alchemical nuances. Though very little is known about her as an individual. Her knowledge far exceeded that of all her contemporaries. Some say she made a pact with a dark entity to gain her talents, though this is clearly a myth.

So a Ryonnian field, named in honour of Ryon, is, if you will, a family of the elements contained in a substance.

For example, a substance containing fuergo, malkar and glaciule is classified in the Kragstein field. Merging two Kragsteinian substances won't give you an interesting result. However, if you take a Kragsteinian and a Rombaldian, you will produce a much stronger substance than the original two taken separately.

You have in hand the instruction manual to design your first alchemical scale. Their design and engineering requires a certain amount of thought and attention to detail. 

Also, an alchemist must know his tools well. Experiment by designing multiple versions of the scale and bring me your finished products. This will give me confidence that you have mastered this vital part of the job.

Replies.Content: I'll come back as soon as it's done.

Dialogs.Content:
First of all, thank you for your last service. I hope you've found your reward useful thus far.

You could indeed still be of use to me. A few students have gone to look for substances in the Woodlands of the Prankster. They're now several days late. I know that there's an egrom in that area. I don't trust them, but surely someone out there could tell you about the plight of the student researchers.

Replies.Content: I'll take care of it without delay.
I have to meet someone in Thorval first. I'll return to you when I'm ready.

Dialogs.Content: I don't mean to force your hand, but don't delay getting back to me. I worry for them.

I think the easiest task to start with is the collection of substances. It can be a dangerous job, but you've already demonstrated that you're capable of taking on the challenge.

Here is a list of substances that may be of use to me. I don't need them urgently. Just return here when you've finished with your, uh, groceries.

Replies.Content: Perfect! I'll come back when I have what you need.

Dialogs.Content:
Alcharan attracts the very best alchemists from all across Pireiria. It's not so much an academy, but a research centre, so you'd have to be a competent alchemist to stay here.

That said, if you're interested in the discipline, we're ready to teach you its basics. Perhaps even more than the basics if you have the right attitude and aptitude.

Replies.Content: Would you tell me more about alchemy?
What does it take to become a good alchemist?
I'm back. Do you need my services again?
I would like to become an alchemist.
Am I ready to learn now?
I imagine the next step is to prove that I'm capable of building my own lab?

Dialogs.Content:
Scouts claim to have found a laboratory belonging to Cadence Latortue, a revered alchemist and former ship captain.

I need you to go see it and bring back whatever you can find. Who knows, you might even find an old grimoire!

Name: Towers of Nabyla and Seroca
Description: Two small stone watchtowers were erected along Giltan Road to ensure the safety of travellers and to scare off bandits and goblinoids who dare to venture closer to civilised realms.

Name: Nosezandertal Cave
Description: The cave itself is not particularly large, and most of the space is taken up with laboratory equipment. Visitors' eyes are drawn to the walls where there are paintings of fantastical creatures, each more eccentric than the last.

Dialogs.Content: What you want with Vilocopiparadatanolor?

You think you's unique? Me have trade in aureate claws!!

Hail the Claw!

Me also have perfume shop, power baths, and magic weapons collections!
They is Claw power baths! Me knows secrets of things' power! Me gives you baths! Awakens special powers in young Claws and old Scales!
Vilo has no conception of the power of perfumes, only the size of the flake. This means that you can trade him a large amount of minoris perfume for a better perfume.

Yes.

*Vilocopiparadatanolor expresses no interest in sharing additional details.

Name: Saharanelle Tower
Description: A strange rock-built structure has been erected in the center of the plateau. You can sense the presence of the Mists everywhere around you.

Name: Thousandead Cavern
Description: A massive golden gateway has been built a few meters from the entrance. It does not appear to have a lock but still it's impossible to open or remove. Mysterious symbols have been engraved on the righthand gate.

Name: Camp of the Allies
Description: A stone palisade surrounds half a dozen wooden houses. In the adjacent paddock, some auburn horses take their rest. A few bearded men are flogging suspect goods of all kinds from the back of their cart.

Residents.Name: Jeanlien Zerooset

Dialogs.Content: Welcome to the Camp of the Allies! Everything that takes place here is perfectly legal. I swear it to you! Perfectly legal! Perfectly, perfectly legal.

* Jeanlien frowns and observes you closely.

If you say so. But you know if you work for the Giltanbourg authorities, you're obliged to answer truthfully when asked.

Replies.Content: I'd find it surprising if the capital guards were not allowed to lie. Either way, I can assure you that I'm not even from Gantras.

Dialogs.Content:
I'll give you the short version. Korkane traders rightfully complain about being overtaxed in Giltanbourg, so we take care of buying and reselling their goods. Everybody wins! 

If you're looking for better prices than the market, well I'm your man!
I believe you, for now. Your funny accent tells me that you're probably not from Ordval either.
Wait! You don't seem like you're from Giltanbourg. Who are you?
Exactly!

Residents.Greets: Come closer and gaze at our wonderful clogs! They're direct from Brysserad and come in all sizes and colours... almost.

Name: Purifying Crystal
Description: A large crystal has been cut so that its top can accommodate a rounded object.

Name: Jon Thorval Master's Office
Description: The Master's Office houses more than just the offices of Thorbourg's naval officers, it is also the administrative offices of the entire seigneurial capital. The curved roof, porthole windows, and thick wooden beams make it evident that the building's design was strongly inspired by naval architecture.

Dialogs.Content: I am. And you are the person I must honour today for your services. I don't have anymore time for you, so you best get to "the plank".

Replies.Content: Err... okay, I'll do that now.

Dialogs.Content: Be quick...

Name: Neoathernaris
Description: Half a dozen houses make up this small bourgeois hamlet built near Quara about fifty years ago. The Larcen family home is here and the place is protected by heavily armed mercenaries.

Dialogs.Content:
I can hardly choose between the thick layer of mud covering your clothes or the crude accent that betrays your abject lack of refinement.

*A subtle glow in the eyes of the young guard grabs your attention, as if she wanted to reveal important information to you. But she holds back and becomes phlegmatic once again.
Not at all, no. Meanwhile, the nobles celebrate until the early hours of the morning. If I get the opportunity, I'll flee for the hills of Ridand'hok so I'm not to here to deal with the party's end.

Neoathernaris is a direct link to the ancient name of the barony's capital. The father of the current baron built his second home here, but it's now occupied by the young baroness. 

The other houses belong to noble families like the Corvus, Tsarkalov and Verdant. Most of the residences are currently uninhabited, but that should change with the wedding.

More proof that you are not a noble. The baron's daughter has announced that she will marry Rand Thanasisson, a distant cousin of the Corvus.

There will soon be an important tournament and a few days of festivities before the spouses exchange sinerane leaves.

I have nothing against them personally, but it's my job to keep them from pestering the Blue Bloods.

*A mocking smile appears on Eleonara's pretty face.

Now get out.
Take another route! This is not a public village, but a private estate belonging to the richest of the barony. Commoners and beggars are not welcome there.

Replies.Content: What tells you that I am not a noble?
What can you tell me about this wealthy hamlet?

Dialogs.Content:
Okay so you're definitely not from here. It's an ancestral tradition. 

A malicious alchemist can easily turn sinerane leaves into deadly poison. The exchange therefore symbolizes the idea that each of the parties involved in a marriage gives their future partner the ingredients to poison them. 

You should ask a historian if you want to find out more.

Replies.Content: Thank you for taking the time to answer my questions. I thought you didn't like commoners?

Name: Diadem Quarry
Description:
The foreman of the quarry, a big beefy man with tanned skin, screams well-humoured insults to motivate the workers. He appears to have a nickname for each of them. 

A young red-haired woman runs a small canteen located near half a dozen tables. An elderly man takes care of draft animals and the infirmary.

The Diadem Quarry has certainly seen better days, but it has not yet ceased its activities. It once belonged to the seigniorial line, but was sold to Colmac Depurefalaise following a commercial dispute between Kortombe and Wellnear.

Dialogs.Content: I'll even give you mate's rates! And an even bigger discount if you'll marry my daughter, hahaha!
By all the sleeping troglodytes! We've just lost a client!

Replies.Content: I have an offer for you...

Dialogs.Content:
Baaah! You try repeating the same thing every day and doing it with a smile!

Personally, I don't care, my grandfather Cormac bequeathed us a real fortune, but the little guys and girls weren't so lucky.

Wait! You have an accent! Are you planning to settle in the area, outsider? Say, do you want to build your own stone house? It will be more beautiful and durable than wood, you have my word!

Name: Farm of the Excluded
Description: Cereals, vegetables and a few fruits grow on this small piece of agricultural land. The estate's main house is in poor condition, but the presence of a dozen workers suggests that the farm is enjoying something of a revival.

Dialogs.Content:
Oh, it's you. Well, uh, thanks for saving Sahranna. I'm just a poor farmer, I couldn't have done nothin'.

And don't start talking to me 'bout the authorities in Thorval, they're in cahoots with anyone who owns a boat. Be it pirates or corsairs!

From now on, I'll be tendin' my vegetables and that's it!
Are you still 'ere!? Get lost! And don't even think about coming back to disturb me!
That's it, one step in front of t'other. And don't look back!

*You notice the farmer hesitate for a moment.

I don't know nobody by that name... now get off my land!

Replies.Content: No way! Listen to me carefully...

Dialogs.Content:
You win! I'll talk!

You think I don't have plenty o' problems already? Look at my bloody house! I don't even have enough coin to keep the rains out!

Sahranna came to see me not long ago, I told 'er about my problems. She got it into 'er thick head to go and see the pirat... the merchants that I err... invested... in a new boat with.

I don't know anymore than that. I ain't seen 'er again since but they came by threatenin' to double my debt if I tried sendin' them another witch!

My cousin ain't no witch, and now I don't even know if she's alive.

This whole thing is a bleedin' nightmare!
Oi! This is private land! Get on yer way!

It's too late! There's no point chasing after problems. My cousin is probably already dead, and it was 'er choice to make...

*You glare at the farmer.

Yeah, yeah, that's it! I'm the callous, heartless farmer. What are you going to do about it? Torture me to find out? You probably just think the pirates are taking my coins, eh? Think again.

*Fabien pulls back his shirt, revealing a back covered in scars and welts.

I want to stay alive! Next time, who knows what they'll do to me...

Replies.Content: This is your last chance, tell me where to find them!

Name: Defected Mechanomine
Description:
A collapsed cave opening marks where the entrance to the mechanomine once stood. Many signs warn travellers not to approach the place.

The Mechanomine was an Arcanist project that turned into a disaster. The machines went haywire and a short mechanical war between the mechanominers resulted in many deaths and the mine's ultimate destruction.

Name: Port of Thorbourg
Description: At the port of Thorbourg, the majority of boats arriving and leaving are commercial, carrying goods of all kinds. Some ships bring explorers, traders, and students from afar. Occasionally, military ships come to  participate in special naval drills or to recruit locals for their ranks.

Name: [D]To delete
Description: You are in front of the magnificent Trolgobeth waterfall. You can see shards of glass on the other side.

Name: Crypt of Darkness
Description: Hippogriffs granted the right key can enter this crypt, which looks more like a luxury hotel than an ominously named place of corpse storing. A handful of men and women train in the main hall while others study, meditate, and receive assignments in related rooms.

Dialogs.Content:
It's more of a place of improvement, rest and... retreat.

Plus, if our headquarters in Ordval were attacked, we could also relocate all our members here.

May the night be with you!

* Krista bursts out laughing.

We may be professional assassins, but we have nothing in common with those cults worshiping death, evil, and cheesy broccoli...

* Krista pouted in disgust.

Especially not the cheese broccoli...

Replies.Content: So I'm really standing in a room belonging to the Order of the Hippogriff?

Dialogs.Content: That's the main reason for this place's existence. Our dorms can accommodate hundreds of people.

Replies.Content: For a group of killers, you're strangely far from the cities.

Dialogs.Content:
Ah! No! You're at Livalley Agricultural Equipment. How may I sacrifice you today?

*Once again Krista bursts into a belly laugh that contrasts with the serious atmosphere of the crypt.

If you've arrived here, it's because you know very well where you are.

Name: Poakerson Park
Description: Few people outside of the county know of the depth of Thorvallers' love of card and boardgames. In the park, several permanent tables have been erected for people of all ages and social classes to play and compete.

Residents.Name: Janus Tolkiesson

Dialogs.Content:
Aha! And I am sure, you are mistaken. You're a seasoned explorer, are you not?

Well, I'm certain there are a great number of people who would love to live your life without leaving the safety of their home. My game, Chariots & Mercenaries, will give them that possibility without the risk of giant spider bites or sword wounds. And I have faith in the creativity of players to take the game in innovative directions.

Who knows, someday a wizard may create a spell that allows players from all over the continent to experience these stories together across great distances.

Replies.Content: I'm amazed to hear you talk about magic this way!

Dialogs.Content:
You are? My friend you should dream a little bigger. I have several superstitious friends who would go as far as claiming that magic caused the Century of Catastrophes itself. 

All over Pireiria, there are now reputable schools of magic achieving unthinkable things. It's time for people to open their minds to the truths of our era. And while they're at it, they can open their minds to an innovative new type of boardgame.

* Janus's face lights up.

Besides, if you're interested in magic, I may have a quest for you.

[Dev] there could be a cool quest with magic, and recipes!
Yes, of course! However, if you wish to profit from your skill, this is not the place to do so.

Replies.Content: Oh? Is there a way to make money playing games?

Dialogs.Content:
It's inspired by more traditional strategy games, such as go and checkers, but the game plays out much faster. In fact, each player, of which there can be two or three, simultaneously moves pieces on a single board in an attempt to conquer their opponents. Participants are eliminated if they touch each other or can no longer move pieces.

It may seem childish, but if one day you face high level players, you will understand that the game is easy to play but extremely tough to master.
Don't be shy! Sit down at a table and face off against the best players of "Barbarians Yes! Barbarians No!" in the world!

Replies.Content: What's that game everyone is playing?
I like board games. Can I play with anyone?

Dialogs.Content:
I know! I know! A strange idea, isn't it? It's said that in Jawana, there are even players who are paid by the Crown to entertain the nobles during tournaments and parties of all kinds. Oh how I wish the Lords of Pireiria would adopt that idea.

However, should you wish to make some coins competing against players all over Ordval, I shall put out word to my friends that a new player is ready to compete. 

Though before I hand over all my contacts, I have a project with which I could benefit from some assistance.  

[Dev] a fedex quest to send Janus' documents to Wellnear. This quest will unlock the network of board game trippers.

You can call me J.T. I'm a lover of strategy games and drama!

I'm currently working on a new type of game that will combine the two. Each player will roleplay a different character of their choosing, and together will have to overcome many challenges chosen by the lord of the story.

Replies.Content: I don't foresee a great future for a game like that.

Residents.Greets: Come and play in large numbers!

Name: Territory of Mo'gul
Description: The Quiet Plateau is quiet because Mo'gul does not like to be disturbed.

Name: Trolgobeth Shore
Description: The lake is a little shallower here and a few rocks protrude above the surface.

Residents.Name: Sorka the adventurer

Dialogs.Content: Really? Okay, let me know if you need me. I'll be sitting back and watching the show.
Yeah, yeah. Keep your secrets to yourself then...

Your what!?

I imagine you're an Arcanist. I hope this isn't some spooky story of a cursed item. I really hate those types of stories.

*You're not used to someone not knowing what a Lantern is. In Valsonge, it is a day-to-day object.
What do we do now?

Precious... and magical? 

How mysterious. And thrilling! Actually not that much. But I'm glad I can help. I too am looking for something valuable. I guess you will have to help me in return.
Why do you need glass so much?

Replies.Content: I have to repair a precious object.

Residents.Greets: Do you really want to cross?

Name: Trogulnus' Lair
Description: At the bottom of the gorge stand ramparts of stakes bristling with sharpened pikes. Armed with rudimentary bows, the trogulnus lie in wait for potential victims.

Name: Tortolion Graveyard
Description: The skeleton of a huge tortolion that must easily have weighed half a ton is located in the centre of a natural open-air tortolion graveyard. The usually noisy forest wildlife is rather silent here. Oryctus and marmaruits probably prefer not to disturb tortolions which are known to come and pay a last tribute to their loved ones.

Name: Nest of Pygallus Nocturnis
Description: The largest branches from the woodlands of the Maranchons Valley have been repurposed for the construction of a great wooden nest. At its centre, there are a few broken eggshells. Surrounding these eggshells are dozens upon dozens of animal and adventurer skeletons, their bones picked free of flesh.

Name: Hydra Inn
Description:
Three gigantic serpent heads hang from the beams of the inn which itself appears to have been made from the hull of a shipwreck. Smells of the sea intermingle with customers' pipe smoke, a thick cloud of which hangs in the air at all times. The waitresses and waiters all seem to have been chosen for their unusual appearances.

[N] Installed on a stage located under the three gigantic serpent heads suspended from the ceiling of the inn, three minstrels clumsily play their instruments. Customers seem more fascinated by the waiters and waitresses than by the bards. A strong smell of smoke hangs in the air. A few men and women are playing dice in a dark corner of the room.

Dialogs.Content:
Because you need more than the physique of a princess to work here. You need to know how to count, talk to customers, and perform simple manual tasks. Sometimes at the same time. Do you think having beautiful employees is enough to keep my inn running?

*Simenon gives you an accusing look.

The answer is, of course, no. I do not operate a pleasure house. The unusual beauty of my staff attracts customers, but it's their wit and charm that keeps sailors, adventurers and academics coming back for more.

That would be the wise Escomantis. A man who mastered the fire magic and who had a penchant for the suffering of innocents.

*Simenon's face darkens as if a buried memory suddenly came to his mind.

Anyway, I've never been to the tower and no one has come back alive to tell me about it, so I don't know if the place is really haunted. If you go there, I'm confident you'll find some interesting treasures.

*An evil smile appears on his face.

And if you come back alive, pop into the Hydra to tell me about your exploits. I'll find a way to compensate you for your story.

No.

*Simenon does not seem to want to say more.

And to hear your accent, I guess you come from even further away than me.

* Simenon seems jubilant.

Ah! I knew this would interest you! As I said, you can find it at the very end of Tsarkatov Point, north of Quara. 

The former owner is rumoured to have been murdered by his own sister, and now his tormented soul has haunted the place for over 30 years.
Good evening! Everything is for sale here except my hydra heads and my girlfriend!

Replies.Content: So your inn is for sale?
I heard there will be a big wedding soon. Can you tell me more about it?
Have you heard any interesting rumours?

Dialogs.Content:
Yes.

*Simenon looks at you attentively from head to toe.

Guess you're some adventurer or mercenary?

*He is waiting for a sign from you that he could interpret as a response.

I know plenty of gossip, though I'm sure most of it wouldn't interest you. However, I have heard of an old, haunted tower located on Tsarkatov Point.
*Simenon glances at you but pretends not to hear. It's apparent that he's not willing to accept further questions on the subject. You will certainly have to gain his trust to find out more.
It's no secret. The count's daughter will be married soon. She's a woman with attractive curves, but I would never have hired her as a waitress here.
Haha! Only if you are able to pay its weight in gold.
Before accepting your offer, I must make sure that you can meet my requirements. Here they are:
Hey pal! I just finished the biggest contract of my life. They asked me to make fifty padlocks. Fifty! It means I've paid my debts and filled my purse, but now I need a new challenge.

Replies.Content: An admirable achievement! I have another for you.

Dialogs.Content:
The meat from the marsh's savage boars is even tastier. Naturally salty, rich, and flavoursome, with skin that crackles to perfection on a fireplace. Only a few meals of these savage marsh boar are served to our most distinguished visitors each day.

However, the savage boar is much more difficult to hunt. If you're able to provide us with it, the pay will be very attractive.
Hello! Welcome to the Hydra! Take a seat and I'll have someone come to serve you momentarily.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the serpent heads hanging from your ceiling?

Dialogs.Content: Nah, that honour belongs to my boyfriend, Simenon. I help him during the day and he takes care of the place in the evening.

Iktar Arcglowing! He's in charge of security for Neoathernaris. The rich people's hamlet not far out from the capital. 

*Lydia bites her lip, as if hesitating to say everything she knows about Iktar.

And... well... I have always been advised not to spread rumours about the powerful individuals of this world, but I have never been known to be cautious.

Iktar was one of Larcen's most famous knights, rumours even suggested that he was assigned as Captain of the Royal Guard of Maliken.

*She stops her story to see if you are still hanging on her words.

A few days before his departure for the royal capital, Iktar changed completely. He became paranoid and allegedly attacked the count's son. 

Someone high ranking must have interceded on behalf of the disgraced knight, and the count of Larcen appointed Iktar to occupy the post of Chief of Security for the Pot-bellied.

*A smile, mocking this time, appears on the lips of the young woman.

I don't know if the count hopes the knight will come to his senses with this appointment or if he simply wishes the worst for him.

If you want to know if they are real, I have no idea.

*A mysterious smile emerges on Lydia's pretty face.

I do know, however, that this kind of beast really existed, a very long time ago. I'm sure Iktar could talk to you about it at length. He always jokes that if we took one down from the roof, then two more would replace it.

The specialty of our inn is boar meat. There are some very tasty boars living in the plain surrounding the city. And best yet, living so close to the city has ridden them of much of their wildness. So they don't pose much of a threat to hunters.

Bring us their meat, and I'll pay you for the work.  

Mmm... I can almost taste the sausages.

Replies.Content: I'll take care of the boars

Name: Wellnear Castle
Description:
Unsurprisingly, Wellnear Castle appears to be in much better condition than the rest of the seigneury. 

A careful observer would notice, however, that the old wall could not withstand an attack from any tactical enemy for long.

Various animal carcasses are heaped near the walls.

Dialogs.Content: ... let alone have an audience with the lord without being summoned.
Don't hang around, stranger. You have no business here.
Get lost then!

Badouk! It's been an age!

Look, I don't want any trouble, so please don't insist. No one can enter the castle grounds...

You have, eh? Have you heard the one about the overly curious outsiders who find themselves in our rat-ridden jails? No? 

I can assure you it's based in reality.

Mind your own... actually, no... you have the right sort of profile... for a job.

The seigneury is offering a reward for the carcasses of creatures living in Manynotes Forest.

I have no idea why. And I don't need to know. Neither do you for that matter. Are you in?

Replies.Content: Slaughter animals for no reason? No.

Name: Superior court
Description:
The courtyard gives a breathtaking view of Kortombe and the fall of Sorcerer's River.

Many members of the Order of Kortomis train here.

Dialogs.Content: Dev.Perforant.999
Dev.Perforant.999
Dev.Contondant.999
Dev.Contondant.999
Dev.Tranchant.999
Dev.Tranchant.999

Name: Raven Mansion
Description:
Built of chomne and erilid wood, the luxurious Raven Mansion has been welcoming the hunting masters of Kortombe and their guests for several decades. Many animal and deer species have been imported from other seigneuries to facilitate learning and advance the sport. 

Amateur hunting is strictly prohibited on the estate.

Dialogs.Content:
While I do not recognize your accent, I am sufficiently astute as to identify that you are not of local birth. As is the custom of this place, I shall extend to you the hospitality of an introduction. 

My name is Cedric Duverger, the son of the Baroness of Kortombe. Some notables address me using the "honourable" title. Though I do not require such formalities. You may call me Cedric, so long as you do so with a respectful tone.

You don't know oryctus? And they say the aristocratic are the ones out of touch! 

Thanks to their, ahem, talents for copulation, they are everywhere throughout Pireiria. They are a small rodent-like creature with large ears. They attack crops or smaller animals if they feel threatened, but they are harmless to us. Which is useful, because their meat is particularly palatable. Especially with some woodland herbs.
I am the hunting master of the seigneury. Yes, I am very happy here. And no, I have no problem with my mother leaving the family titles to Tarul. He is a good man.

The knight, Sir Tarul Verdant, currently carries the title of Protector of Kortombe. He is responsible for the militia and all security in the lordship. 

Eventually, he will become the baron. He and mother have recently agreed on the matter.

Oh? Good chum, do you like hunting? There are a few wild deer and goats in the area, but mostly there's oryctus and lots of them. The most threatening beasts you will meet around here are the vargrs and the gremfyrs. 

As you can imagine, hunting is not the primary method of getting food in the barony. Alas, what fun that would be.
Most wolf attacks reported by travelling town folk are actually caused by vargrs - a much more daring cousin species of the wolf that does not share its kin's fear of man.

I took the name of my father, Charles Duverger, a wealthy landowner. Though Relene Kortombe, my mother, is the true heir to the line. 

My sister, Celeste, is the burgomaster of Kortombourg. If you have any questions about her father, please direct them towards her. I have not once met him.

Indeed, gremfyrs. Strange, aggressive little winged primates. They could never pose a real threat to the barony nor even to an experienced adventurer. Though I guess they can pose a bit of a threat when they contract rabies, or indeed if they get overly excited.

My predecessor, Flammerge, believed that despite all appearances the gremfyr were actually rather intelligent. And it's true, they can use weapons and armour. Though I have no idea where they get them from. Someone should probably look into that some day.

I am really disappointed with the loss of the pack installed on our territory. The royal vargrs are excellent neighbors, they help control other wilder creatures.

There must be caninbanes somewhere on the territory. I don't see what else could have happened.

I have something for Ovie, it's an enchanted protective collar my old dog used when he was younger.

May it protect the last of his pack...

Name: Pillars of Sighs
Description: Six pillars are stood upright in a circle.

Name: Park of the Golden Word
Description:
A pleasant variety of tree species grow in this small urban park. Their leaves provide shade for small groups of Giltanbourgers enjoying home-cooked snacks on public seating. 

Platforms and bandstands have been constructed, allowing actors, musicians, and rhetoricians to exercise their disciplines in front of audiences.

Dialogs.Content: It's not an official title, but I guess you could say I'm the person in charge of shows and parties and other fun events around here.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the events taking place here?
Could you tell me about Giltanbourg?

Dialogs.Content:
A better question would be "What can't I tell you?"

Every week, dozens of musicians come to perform shows. Lyres, lutes, harps, gitterns, fiddles, mandolins... you name it! I make sure that they're competent enough not to disturb the citizens and that they're civil enough to share the stage. 

From time to time, theatre groups run plays, and every week academics come to discuss different subjects on the stands. Sometimes brave politicians and nobles join them.

About once a month there are also public parties at the park. It could be the Carnival of the Mountains festivities, one of our many balls, or indeed a wedding. I love these events more than anything in the world!

In the name of all the Elders, this is going to be a disaster! It's chaos!

Two delegations have arrived on the same day, each of them firmly decided on presenting a performative showcase of their traditions.

I'll never be able to deal with both these groups of sava... I mean country folk.

Replies.Content: I'll take care of one of the groups.

Dialogs.Content:
I sure can! Though for me to give you a satisfactory answer, I'd need to know what specifically interests you about Giltanbourg. The queen of cities has many faces. 

At first glance, Giltanbourg is an extremely wealthy and diverse mining city. However, visitors and residents alike tend to forget that it's also a cultural and political hub. Several nobles could challenge the right to the seigneurial sceptre of the current duke.

By night, Giltanbourg is magnificent, though its darkest corners have their dangers. There is at least one thieves guild, and I wouldn't be surprised to learn that there's a chapter of the Order of the Lotus. In recent years, the city's notables have complained about the arrival of new drugs and crimes linked to human trafficking. You can visit Marketa or Marlin at The Mechanical Owl to find out more.

Giltanbourg certainly has one of the most imposing armies of Ordval, and the citizens of the duchy have basic military training, since it's compulsory.

The capital of Gantras is also one of the most culturally diverse cities in Pireiria, even more so than Maliken. About a quarter of the population comes from outside the province of Ordval and in this quarter there are many korkanes and shandoris. There are even a few hundred Arangforois.

Oh, hello to you.

One of our greatest directors is putting together a new play about the high dramas of the nuertogolem war.

*You struggle to believe the degree that people exaggerate the story of these creatures, especially in the far north.

As well as giving me a performing role, he instructed me to find an artisan capable of creating a nuertogolem costume.

Oh! By your accent, I could have sworn you were from that part of Pireiria.

*Arisha's face becomes redder and redder.

So you must come from Strata Obseka!

Arangfort is one of the three provinces of Pireiria. For the most part, it's a huge viscous swamp. There is obviously dry land, but that's not what attracts attention.

I believe that the Arangforois are more comfortable in Gantras than elsewhere in Ordval because, as in their province, the colonists of our duchy had to fight against unfavourable climates and terrains - unlike the majority of the seigneuries of the country. Well, of course, I know that living on the aerial islands of Strata Obseka probably isn't easy, but you don't need me to tell you about that.

*Arisha lets out a small nervous laugh. You believe that it's better not to contradict her about your origins.

Name: Walkrock's Lithobed
Description: A giant stone nest has been constructed in this area of the cave.

Name: Cove of the Drowned
Description: Small boats of all kinds have run aground along this cove. The skeletons of their hulls litter the sands alongside skeletons of unfortunate voyagers and animals. Scavengers gnaw at the little flesh that remains on their bones. Occasionally, mandibles emerge from the water as if their owner were looking for easy prey.

Name: Norgarr camp
Description: Within the clearing that splits the Chimera forest, multiple rudimentary hide tents are raised around a large fire.

Dialogs.Content: You not attack I! I nice. You kill trogulnus. You nice too.

Replies.Content: Why were you fighting alongside them?

Dialogs.Content:
Them arrvied from south. Them threatened us to destroy us if we not help them.
You killed them. Now, us free... thank you.
But them still in forests of here and over there. If you kill them too, I very happy.
You language complicated! I repeat if you want.

Name: Julien's tent
Description: An improvised camp has been quickly erected near a large, century-old tree. A ring of stones has been placed to allow the occupant to make a fire.

Dialogs.Content: Ouch! Ouch! Ouch! I've fallen and rolled my ankle. The only silver lining is that I've brought enough food with me that I can survive here until it's strong enough to support my weight.
I need help collecting firewood outside my camp. I don't think it's a good idea to push too hard with my sprain. Already, the return to Kortombourg won't be easy.

Name: Carpitors Den
Description: The incessant buzzing of giant flies is the first hint that this gory location is close by. Pushing one's way through the flies will reveal the corpses of dead animals and humans alike, each coated in a viscous sticky material.

Name: Relay of the Outsiders
Description: The Giltanbourg authorities prohibit entry to the city's interior for most mounts, stagecoaches and other means of transport. Some traders therefore prefer that their chests of wares, their horses, and some of their entourage remain at the Relay of the Outsiders to avoid attracting the attention of brigands at city gates.

Residents.Name: Tarine Doryctus

Dialogs.Content: Hmm. The authorities in the capital aren't particularly fond of armed civilians, but you shouldn't have too many problems. Above all, they want to prevent horses, oxen, or giant lizards from roaming the streets.
It's a mount frequently used by the inhabitants of the countries of the north. They very rarely pass through here, but I still must see four or five every year.
If you want to avoid being caught at the gates of Giltanbourg for days on end, keep the main body of your armed guards here, and certainly your mounts.

Replies.Content: They're not my guards, we're more a troop of adventurers. Is that going to cause problems?
Can you tell me about Giltanbourg?

Dialogs.Content: The Monster of Gargagoth is an inn that has developed into one of the most fashionable places in all Pireiria. Though apparently there are a couple of places that could rival its revelry in Ogvania.

Oh yeah? Well, unless you want to sweep or clean the dishes, I don't have any for you.

Actually... You see that man over there? He wants to go to the Bulgrof forest. Perhaps he would like an escort?

Thanks? I guess.

In Gantras, the holiday is traditionally more sober. Here it's said that nature weeps over the fleeting twinkle of lives too short.

It's the best town in all Pireiria. All the wealth of Maliken, but without the crime and poverty.

However, there are a lot of rules, so it's not exactly the best place to let loose in the evenings. Though, I admit that there are sometimes wild evenings at the Gargagoth.

Replies.Content: What is the Gargagoth? Can you tell me of any important places to visit in the duchy?

Dialogs.Content:
[d] Oh yes? Unless you want to sweep the floor or clean the dishes, I don't have one for you.
Although... Do you see that man over there? He wants to go to the Bulgrof forest. Maybe he would like an escort?

Residents.Greets: Welcome to the Relay of the Outsiders. Feel free to rest overnight or stay for a few days.

Name: Eirani Refuge
Description:
Twenty years ago, all the citizens of Gantras had heard the name Eirani. She had defeated the Beast of a Thousand Thorns and the Great Roc of Jonnidemattis. 

During a legendary battle against the nymph Irouna, Eirani was horribly disfigured. She went into exile to avoid the cruel gazes of others. According to rumours, the body of the heroine was laid to rest, by her daughter, in a sanctuary hidden behind a waterfall.

Name: Wreck of the Unsinkable
Description: A ship, which was probably built in Larcen, ran aground here a few years ago. Looters appear to have picked up everything of value over the years. On the walls of the captain's cabin, someone once drew a map that is now almost completely erased. Only the words "Mont Fauconniers" remain visible.

Name: Ogres' Mound
Description: The Ogres' Mound is used by the local militia to monitor the path to Wellnear. From the wind-blown top of the hill, you can see far south, right unto the crossroads.

Dialogs.Content:
Look, I'm not suggesting you have a wooden leg and parrot or anything. I was just wondering aloud about your accent and your provenance. There are a lot of foreigners these days. It's a bad sign if you ask me.

Unfortunately, I can do nothing to prevent wanderers from arriving in Kortombe.

I am responsible for patrolling Ogres Road and preventing invasions from Wellnear. Well, not alone, of course. I guess technically I'm responsible for gallantly hightailing it to the town to seek reinforcements if an army really is threatening Kortombe.

Tarul Verdant would surely speak more of looters, than invaders. But I don't care. If you come armed and eager to seize the goods of Kortombe and its citizens, then you, sir, are an invader.

And believe me, I'm not the only one to think that the brigands coming from our lousy neighbours are financed by someone powerful in their measly lordship.

Anyway, I don't think you came from here. Though your accent vaguely reminds me of that of my grandfather, who was born in Thorval. He was a pirate in his younger years.

Yeah, you can do my job for... nope... I shouldn't finish that sentence. My lieutenant isn't well known for his sense of humour. 

If you really want to help, go to the forest near here. I've heard rumours concerning the presence of brigands.

I suspect that it's a pack of these Wellnear dogs who call themselves "soldiers". Just because of that, I'm not allowed to intervene. It would cause a "diplomatic incident". Pah! 

In short, you don't have your hands tied by bureaucratic do-gooders like I have. Eliminate them or scare them away, just make them leave the barony.

Replies.Content: No thanks. It sounds to me like a job that that should go through the chain of militia command.
Sure. It sounds like a good opportunity to sharpen my reflexes.

Dialogs.Content: By continuing south-west you will reach the seigneury of Wellnear. Going north-east, you will cross the Quell Bridge before arriving at Kortombourg.

All I can tell you is that we often have to repel beggars and brigands from that seigneury.

The rest is not of my concern.
Or for a courageous person like my eight year old daughter, but obviously not for you. Pfft, outsiders.

Name: Valmari Camp
Description: [DEV:to come back to a luxurious hunting camp ... kind for tourists.]

Name: Geraldine's Camp
Description: A small camp has been set up here to allow field workers to rest and eat during their long working days.

Dialogs.Content: Oh, nothing complicated. You just have to venture a little further from the camp and collect the bales. You can find them all over Kortombe Plain. In fact, if you already have some with you, I could take those off your hands now. Thank you in advance for your help!
Did Mylena send you? Brilliant! I've had an urgent order for chinvre and I'm short of labourers.

Replies.Content: What do I need to do?

Name: The lair of docile spiders
Description: Strange spiders make their home in this part of the forest. They watch you, but don't seem to be aggressive.

Dialogs.Content: *The spiders don't seem aggressive, but you don't know how docile they truly are.*
*This creature requires a building with the following characteristics:
*You approach the creature.*

Name: Entrance to Rilandoss
Description: Tribal symbols are carved around the entrance to Rilandoss.

Residents.Name: Zorkaza the Adventurer

Dialogs.Content: You be believing that? Reginold be thinking this too!

Me be Zorkaza! Be adventurer, explorer extraordinaire! 

Me be shandori! Zorburrs be evil cousins! Me think be curse!

Replies.Content: Is there something I can do to help you, Zorkaza?

Dialogs.Content: You be having questions?

Replies.Content: Yes! Who or what are you?

Dialogs.Content:
Me be wanting to confront Shazazes Zorburrs. Shazazes be deciding everything. Me be trying get them back way of the shandoris.

They be wanting to meet me in Rilandoss. Me be optimistic but no be crazy. Me need team of protection.

This be job for you?

Residents.Greets: Don't squash me! I be Zorkaza!

Name: Chimera Footbridge
Description: A subterranean collapse necessitated the construction of a small footbridge to allow travellers to pass through. Some questionable graffiti has been painted on the wooden planks.

Name: Sotiris Camp
Description: Encircling a small clearing, there are fifteen wooden houses built in the architectural style of the Valsonge. It's safe to say that the camp's inhabitants, or their forebearers, came from the other side of the Mists.

Dialogs.Content:
For the moment, just not tell anyone about our camp. We're hidden in the mountains because we don't want to attract attention.

Otherwise, we still need the currency used by the people of Pireiria. Many people here are former adventurers, they could share their knowledge with you in exchange.

* Pisha's face darkens.

They're a group of vile extremists, mostly found in Giltanbourg, Maliken and Quara. They believe that the people of Tulsen, the island where all the humans of Myriaden supposedly originated, must take control of our entire continent. I've heard they've already infiltrated several important Pireirian families.

Honestly, I don't know if we Valsongeois are from Tulsen or not, but this group doesn't even see us as the same species as them.

They... they murdered my sister and her husband.

I would bet, then, that not many people have learned of your origins.

Yes? As I thought. That's normal. Most Pireirians must find your accent exotic, but not really question its true provenance. You must be careful, there are some groups that see us as enemies. My mind goes to the Tulsenvor, among others.

Replies.Content: I've heard of the Tulsenvor, but could you tell me more?

Dialogs.Content: You can, but I'm afraid we aren't particularly well set-up to accommodate visitors.

I suspect I've seen you before. Perhaps I met you when you were a child, or maybe I knew someone from your family.

* In response to your stunned expression, a kindly smile washes over Pisha's wrinkled but radiantly beautiful face.

Worry not, my child. For I am a Walker too. As are most people of Sotiris.

Replies.Content: I'm not worried. The people of Pireiria don't seem especially dangerous to me.

Dialogs.Content:
* Once more, a shadow passes over Pisha's face.

Let's just say that we're worried that we're not welcome there either. I'd prefer not to tell you more just yet.

Thank you. Though I'm far from the only one to have lost loved ones to the Tulsenvor and other such fanatics who see us Walkers as... monsters. It's not for nothing that we live far from any civilization.

Replies.Content: Why don't you return to Valsonge?

Name: Alderman's House
Description:
The house of the elected representative of Enorwen is more akin to the offices of a wealthy merchant than the administrative houses found in most seigneuries. The exterior walls have been painted in bright colours and the interior walls are lined with military banners. 

The alderman welcomes the villagers and visitors in the principal room on the ground floor, the other two closed rooms on the floor are reserved for the independent nation's diplomatic and commercial relations.

Residents.Name: Lorne Valiant

Dialogs.Content:
Look, I can't confront Talos's gang directly. There are more of them than just that group at the inn. I believe they have a hiding place in the mountains. 

I won't have the deaths of my fellow citizens on my conscience. If you want to help Enorwen, we need to work in the shadows. I'm quietly working to arm the clans so we can push the group back before the election.
Be quick!

Honestly, it's not a particularly remarkable area for those looking for thrills.

However, it does have a few interesting places to visit, such as the nearby woods or the plateaus to the north.

My official title is alderman. Normally, those who hold that office are assigned by a lord, but here I'm elected by the people. 

I'm the chief magistrate of Enorwen and the head of the militia. I also take care of negotiations with the neighbouring seigneuries and with the merchants who pass through the area. When I have time, I also welcome visitors...

Welcome!

Yes! The clans will meet soon to choose who will be the alderman for the next sacred cycle.

I hope to be able to stay in office for another cycle, I have great ideas to improve the lives of our fellow citizens.

Though the clans are a little tense, more than usual. And I don't see why.

No.

*Lorne watches your reaction carefully.

If you want the long answer, we are officially a free-state. That is to say, a territory that does not answer to the lords, following an agreement with the Crown. To learn more about the history of the agreement, I advise you to discuss it with the Enorwenians. For an adventurer like you, that will be more interesting than hearing a history lesson from me.

It's really rather peaceful. Enorwen is divided into a dozen families who independently handle most of their own concerns. Each of these clans must provide food and men, or women, to ensure the maintenance of the community.

*Lorne pauses as if waiting for a question too often asked by visitors.

I assure you, we're also doing what it takes to decrease the risks associated with inbreeding, if you know what I mean.

*Lorne doesn't give you time to comment.

In short, apart from the brigands, the mountain trolls, and the red vargrs, everyone gets along well here.

Now, we have peace at last. Though we cannot afford to grow complacent, for they will return. And perhaps in greater force now that we have shown them we will not be pushed around.

As I expected, they fled towards the Cybelfly Plateau. I'm convinced they have a headquarters hidden in the highlands. Durong, as vile as he was, is just a henchman. Someone else is running the show. 

I don't know why you helped us so much, stranger, but I'm truly glad of your aid. The clans of Enorwen owe you a great debt.

And now I must see to our injured. 

Farewell.
Lorne is attempting to secretly arm the clans of Enorwen so that they will be less intimidated by Durong Talos and his gang. You could discreetly provide him with some weapons.

Oh, it's you. Thank you, sincerely, for your help with the weapons. I believe the clans now feel confident enough to stand up to this band of thugs.

I myself now must find the courage to confront Durong directly and tell him that his candidacy does not conform to the laws of Enorwen. 

I believe things could go wrong. Would you care to escort me?

Replies.Content: I will accompany you. Let's do this.
I'll grab some weapons and come back soon.

Dialogs.Content: I take it you have questions about Enorwen?

Replies.Content: Is Enorwen part of a seigneury?
What are the main attractions of Enorwen?
They say you have an election soon, is that true?

Residents.Greets: Welcome! Take some lamden, and tell me about your life!

Name: Fortress of Kortomia
Description:
The fortress of Kortomia was built on the mountain before the foundation of the barony of Kortombe. According to legend, its builder, the knight Zartan Kortomis, brought stones from all over Pireiria to complete it.

Two generations of nobles resided in the fortress, but the Kortomis having opposed their cousins, the Kortombe, they left the place when the barony was officially founded.

A long palisade of stones, mountain stairs, a condemned tower, another half collapsed and a crowded inner courtyard form the bulk of the ruins still visible. Each year, many treasure hunters of all kinds invade the old fortress with the hope of discovering riches hidden in its underground passages.

Name: Troll Portal
Description: Amidst the crumbling ruins of an ancient temple stands a carved stone arch engulfed in climbing plants. A light fog emanating from no discernible source flows from the archway. Sporadically, flashes of crackling energy appear from the emptiness at its centre.

Name: Ruins of Albeit
Description: The skeleton of a gigantic bear is still half upright, as if it's protecting the ruins of the old stronghold. The foundations of three stone guard towers remain visible as well as the remnants of the protective wall. Half of the main building, which would have served as the officers' headquarters, is still accessible.

Name: Mirousana River
Description: A boat is attached to a long cable crossing the river. The boat operators charge a few coins to cross the river.

Name: Tower of the Chastised
Description: The standards of the five seigneuries of Ordval float at the top of a highly fortified tower. Its burly guards are armed with arquebuses pointing towards Maranchons Valley.

Dialogs.Content:
We are Ordval's first line of defence against the creatures from Maranchons Valley and the desert.

All the cities of the province are required to send us a number of recruits to guard the border. Sometimes we even receive soldiers from Maliken and other provinces.

Needless to say, we're not always sent the finest specimens. Fortunately, we have what it takes to build up anyone's character.

Are you looking to enlist?
Are you lost?

Replies.Content: Are the monsters of the region really so terrible?

Dialogs.Content:
Ha. That's the name of the desert tribe settled in Ritousan...

I guess that answers your question. We know they invaded the area, but that's the extent of our knowledge.

*You start to explain that they don't appear to be settled there of their own accord, but the captain cuts you off...

Enough! I don't need an intermediary to make my decisions. Still, if you're interested and you know the customs of these savages, I can grant you the contract to accompany our emissary to them.

Replies.Content: If that's how it's to be... I'll accompany your emissary.

Dialogs.Content: So be it.

Oh yes!

My troops, for the most part, are doing well. That is to say, deaths are kept to a minimum. Though the night now holds new dangers... do not go out after dark for a creature most foul has appeared in the valley.

Survivors tell me of a formless mass that would have engulfed an entire battalion.

We're looking for information on the creature, or better yet, someone to hunt it. That's if you have interest in mercenary work...

Name: Tagnard's Cabin
Description: A rustic log home built on the shores of Lake Tarazkon. Some dried fish lie on a low table next to an old wooden barrel. Cats scamper in all directions in search of prey without concern for the food left out by the cabin's owner.

Dialogs.Content:
Life is quiet and the lake is full of big fat fish. There's aren't many predators that are a threat to humans in there either. Apart from the odd swampshark and salanivore. 

Once or twice, I've found traces of a creature that I couldn't identify. Though I've never seen it first-hand. Nor heard it. I don't know what to think about it.

Very few people make it up here by chance. Then again, you've given me no reason to suspect you've been sent by my ex-wife to squeeze me dry of my final pennies.

* Tagnard opens a bottle of spirits and takes a hearty gulp.

I am Tagnard, formerly a soldier of Maliken, now retired. My only neighbours are these local cats, as well as the fish and other creatures of the lake.

I don't trust people who prefer the dark of shadow to the light of fire. If you're here to attack me, know this: I may be an old tomcat living his last days in quiet solitude, but I have no intention of giving up my final years of pleasure without a fight.

Replies.Content: Far be it from me to attack you. I don't even know who you are.
What can you tell me about the region?

Name: Altar of the Aquagremfyr
Description: You are at the location where the terrible Aquagremfyr can be summoned. The stone of offerings is ready to be activated.

Name: Sanctuary of Eternity
Description: Particularly disciplined loucantars guard a clearing, in the centre of which is a large, red, luminescent mushroom. More than a hundred trees of different species form an enclosure that protects the clearing. A dozen or so men and women take care of wild plants and animals.

Dialogs.Content: Shrine gardeners need rare plants for the Druid section of their garden.
*You approach the bulletin board. It's been lovingly crafted from natural materials such as woven doussoie...

Replies.Content: The Great Garden of the Circle

Dialogs.Content: The Grand Council of Druids is asking all combat-ready friends of the Circle to assist in the containment of corruption in ruins all across Ordval.
