The team responsible for the cleansing of the ruins of Nopeak requires a shipment of purification equipment for their ritual.
The gardeners of the sanctuary need plants from all over Ordval for their illustrious garden.
The purification team needs help in Lovers' Plain. Any guild member able to participate in combat is invited to join the struggle against the creatures of the region's haunted ruin.
The team responsible for the Ruins of the Cyclops have opened an ancient tomb. The druids need help to counter the onslaught of ghosts coming from within.

Indeed, these vermin are a threat and we must put an end to their conquests. I am happy to hear that good old Ralouf is still alive and I would be more than happy to do him this favor.

However, when he left the circle more than 20 years ago, he did not hesitate to dip into our reserves of elixirs and serums before going into exile in the forest. He has always loved the taste of those beverages.

Return to me with this list of serums to pay off Old Ralouf's debt, and I'll gladly send you one of my finest druids to assist you in casting the ritual.

Replies.Content: Classic Ralouf I'll get back to you shortly with the drinks.

Dialogs.Content:
In short, doctors believe that the human body is an entity separate from nature. With this idea in mind, they study and analyse anatomy and try to help it conquer its natural adversities.

For us, humans are connected to the whole universe by what we call the essence of life.

Our studies have led us to believe that by healing this bond, we can cure men and women of the ailments that afflict them.

There are several schools of thought among the vitalists. Some believe that human illnesses are caused by corruption of the essence. Others, that ailments arise from a spiritual connection between us and a part of the universe. And some even believe that ailments are caused by nature trying to get rid of its parasites.

I will not tell you my point of view on the subject.

So the lights are converging towards a specific point in the region? Fascinating. I invite you to visit the place and "study" the corrupted creatures there.

I must speak to my superiors and make an action plan, I'll come back to you soon with the next steps of this great adventure.

Yes, I need a messenger to go to Leviathan Sanctuary. As I don't think you've ever visited this place, perhaps this could be your chance.

If you don't have a boat, maybe the people of Brumedor could take you there.

Understanding all the principles of the Circle takes a lifetime of research and reading. I doubt you have the patience required.

However, when you have shown yourself worthy of our trust, we can teach you a discipline that is dear to us: vitalism.

Not at all. Firstly, we have no intention of forcing our ideology on anyone. Nor do we worship any man or entity.

The Great Tree represents the symbol of life, but we do not pray to it and we do not make any offering to it. In fact, our approach is more academic than you might imagine.

We observe the connections between the different elements of nature, we analyse them and we intervene when nature requires our help.

Interestingly, it looks like no major corrupted entity has taken possession of the Living Ruins. Perhaps the proximity to Kortombourg is the cause.

Thank you for this information, the Circle is grateful to you.
What kind of ritual?

Replies.Content: This would allow us to locate the Scabonzi warlord in order to eliminate him and greatly slow down their territorial expansion.

Dialogs.Content:
Well then! Ancient ruins have started to emerge all over Ordval. They all have one thing in common, the presence of beings who break the rules of the normal cycle of life.

I say "emerged" because we've inquired with the residents surrounding these places, and none of them noticed these ruins until a few years ago.

That obviously doesn't make sense.

I need someone who can search the Korllights Academy library for clues as to the history of the ruins of Hammery Plain.

Replies.Content: Do you have anything more violent?

Dialogs.Content:
It's a forest rich in flora and fauna. One of the most varied in all of Ordval.

You may have seen our loucantars, they are particularly intelligent.

* Rakham frowns.

Unfortunately, something has corrupted several of the forest animals. I fear this is a direct attack against us, but it's hard to say who's behind it. We are investigating at the moment, and I don't wish to discuss it further.
Only if you are an official member of the Circle of the Great Tree.

Replies.Content: How can I become a member?

Dialogs.Content: Then though you sit in its shade, the way of the Great Tree will remain hidden from you.

They are a more sensitive and intelligent variant of the common wolf.

Some researchers suggest that they even have the ability to speak our language, but I'm unconvinced. However, they are certainly more developed than trolls and even the majority of gremfyrs.

They are generally not hostile, but they will attack if they see you as a threat. Since they are more cunning than average animals, I also suspect that they take some pleasure in cruelty.

We are the Circle of the Great Tree. This is a place of unity with the world of wisdom and knowledge. 

We cherish life in all its forms.

We believe in harmony with the universe.

Replies.Content: Err okay... Sounds a lot like those weird little cults you find in storybooks.
I would like to know everything about your vision of the world.

Dialogs.Content:
I must say, you're already on the right track by being here. Ideally, we'd work together for a while, then I can personally grant you the rank of acolyte.

Would you be willing to help us in our study of the corrupted ruins of Ordval?
Welcome to the Sanctuary of Eternity.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the region?
The library didn't give us many leads...
I have found the spectral origin.
How does the Circle perceive alchemy?
Crazy Ralouf has sent me to beg you for the assistance of a Druid to perform a ritual.

Dialogs.Content:
Yes, five other ruins have been reported by the Grand Council.

Each is a place of deep corruption, according to them. And we do not yet know how to have these places purified.

We need a team of adventurers to explore the ruins and identify the creatures that haunt them.

The first ruin is to the north of Wellnear. Are you ready and willing to continue your investigation?

A number of our members practice the art of alchemy. As long as the conversions of matter made by the alchemists do not exceed the natural order of things, we have no problems with them.

In addition, we have to practice alchemy to create the sceptres we use to channel the energy of vitalism.

Would you like to know more?

I will try to go and see this fresco with my own eyes.

What amazes me the most is that no one in Enorwen nor the surrounding area has any recollection of the ruin. It doesn't make sense.

The Circle Council is a bit overwhelmed by these events, if I may say so. Something serious is interfering with the sacred balance of life.

Valdiss... that's really our only clue. I'll send two people to Thorval and Gantras, just in case.

Let's try the hard way, I'm going to ask you to visit the ruins in the night and study the corrupt creatures that inhabit them.

Study in the sense of... learning how they die...
I will not send you to bloodily exterminate those of the ruins until I have at least learned more about their past!

Name: Longuemire Trail
Description: Formerly the main access road used by stagecoaches and caravans moving to the neighbouring seigneury, Longuemire is now only used by hunters, brigands and other forest travellers.

Name: Deadly Sands Island
Description: The soil of this island is particularly marshy. Crossing it quickly shouldn't be a danger, but judging by the presence of skeletal legs sticking out of the mud, it's best not to stay still for too long.

Name: Forest clearing
Description: Judging by the stone rings, broken bottles and leftover food scraps on the ground, this place is often used by picnickers and revellers.

Name: Korllights Academy
Description:
Constructed primarily from chomne wood, Korllights Academy has three main buildings. A hospital, an alchemy laboratory, and a large library.

The building is maintained on a voluntary basis by citizens proud of this jewel of Kortombourg as well as by the handful of scientists and scribes who work there.

Without doubt, Korllights Academy is the most renowned private research centre in the province of Ordval. The academy frequently hosts scientists-in-residence in the special guest apartments in its basement.

Dialogs.Content:
You are here for engineering training. We will learn the basics of the physical, thermal, and dynamic principles that allow you to craft mechanisms.

Whether it is the rolling system of a simple peasant's cart or the directional sail of a prince's flying ship, all objects are subject to the same unwavering laws of physics.
Address me as Professor Goulie when you are in class.

Replies.Content: What are we going to learn?

Dialogs.Content: To register for engineering training, the academy asks students to take three different mallets with them that they will use to learn.
So be it. Come back when you are ready to devote time to knowledge.

Certainly, though as before, you will have to put in some work to get the information you seek.

I suggest that you go to the Kortombe Relay Station and speak with the travellers there. Once you have done so, return to me with the gossip... ahem... rumours of the other lordships and seigneuries.

Replies.Content: I don't really have time to chase gossip right now.
Absolutely! I asked you the question, so of course I'm interested.

Dialogs.Content: I don't know who you have already talked to, but I believe Rhys Pair at the cemetery and Celeste Kortombe at the Great House need help. However, they may not want to confide in a stranger. Especially one who is a little... rough around the edges.
Of course, by all means research the community in the library. My idea, however, was to have you talk to the citizens so that they tell you their own versions of local legends.

You are interested in learning more about our community! That is music to my ears! I believe that the best way to learn and remember the important parts of our past is to make you work to discover them. I'm sure a traveller like you will find it more fun to learn through experience.

Replies.Content: I don't really have time at the moment.

Dialogs.Content:
Any interesting books? Why our library is without doubt one of the best stocked in the entire province of Ordval. If you wish to venture there, well then, I have a challenge for you.

It may not be as exhilarating as hunting leprechaun in the forest of Malarcane, but here's what I suggest...

20 years ago, Professor Leonel Mache, started an important treatise on Roic the Incorruptible. But poor old Leonel died before its completion. I'm not asking you to finish it for him, obviously. But if you could help me find some documents, I'll endeavour to take care of the rest.

Replies.Content: Of course! Adventure is everywhere if you have the right mindset.

Dialogs.Content:
I see that you are not from Kortombe... and indeed that you may come from much further afield than the ordinary village folk might suspect. Would I be wrong?

Don't worry, your secret will remain between us.
Pity. Return to me when you are ready to enrich your knowledge.
Why hello there! Warmest welcome to the Korllights Academy. One of the most important research centres in the country.

Replies.Content: Do you have any interesting books in your library?
Can you tell me more about the neighbouring lordships?
I heard some interesting rumours at the relay station.
Do you know someone who could offer me a job?

Dialogs.Content:
*Despite his obvious disappointment, Oblir maintains his smile.

As you wish. Not everyone can heed the call of knowledge.

You are currently in Pireiria. A country inhabited mainly by humans, but korkanes and shandoris have also made their home here. Pireiria is made up of three provinces, Ordval, Arangfort, and Strata Obseka. Each of these is divided into seigneuries. Or as you might call them, lordships.

There are two other countries, Ogvania and Jawana. The three nations are linked by the Treaty of Maliken. This agreement also marks the start of our calendar.

Ha! You got me! I've told you the information you were looking for without you having to work for it.

Then again, it's an worthwhile talent to be able to get information out of somebody who doesn't necessarily want to give it to you.
Whispered rumours oft hide more truth within them than the bellowed words of official speeches. I'm glad you enjoyed the experience. I suspect I will have other missions for you soon.

Name: The Grand Barbu Tavern
Description: Some would say that the greatest rewards come at the end of the most difficult journeys. Very few adventurers attempt the ascent to the Grand Barbu, but the beer and the caramel tarabouillie prepared by Akmir are well worth the bruises and sprains suffered during the expedition.

Dialogs.Content: Who sends you?

Ah, I thought you were from my former employers. I am in ... forced retirement.

Ideally, I would have to disappear into the clouds for a while to make myself forgotten.

Replies.Content: I have a place for you.

Dialogs.Content:
It's not just to brag, but I'm one of the best foremen in the province.

My former employer was a little too bad tempered, he couldn't stand the fact that I was doing his job better than him.
If you are interested in my services, you will need a place to host me. With my skills, you will be able to better organize your crafts.

But of course! As in all taverns, where travellers tread, rumours are always close behind.

I imagine you want to hear some of them. I think the most important is Titov's Pass. Legend has it that the hero Pascarti left with a small team to take out Titov's ogre, but they never made it.

At first glance, the story seems banal, an adventurer who goes on a monster hunt and dies on the way, it's dj vu. What is less generic, however, is that at last the bodies of the team have all been found, and they weren't alone. Two additional corpses were found with the party, they belonged to adventurers unknown to anyone close to Pascarti.

Again, nothing completely out of the ordinary, right? They may have run into other travellers on the way? Except the corpses had books and maps written in a language no one recognized!

Obviously, there are a lot of rumours about the presence of treasures in the mountains, but we're in Thorval, so that's to be expected.
I'm sure you're in great need of rest. Take a seat, your first drink is on us!

Replies.Content: Have you heard any recent rumours?

Dialogs.Content:
We try to make our food and ale offerings unique. Though of course we're not immune to imitators.

That being said, most of our meals are inspired by korkane culture, so lots of salads, soups, stews, and pies. For desserts, we mainly offer dishes based around Thorbourg sugar and Ogvanian mint.

As for our alcohol, Akmir brews his canton beer in the kitchen, and we buy our stronger spirits from distilleries across the county.

*Dmitrya bursts out laughing.

As I'm sure you can imagine, you're not the first person to make that observation.

Honestly, when Akmir told me about his project, we were just twelve-years-old. Let me tell you, the kind of person who dreams of putting a tavern on top of a mountain doesn't change their mind easily...

*Dmitrya smiles for a long time, her eyes gaze out the window towards the alpine peaks.

Building the tavern here and attracting customers were real challenges, but after less than a year of operation, word spread, and we found profitability. Today, five years later, I can absolutely qualify the adventure as a success. A success which remains incomparable in Thorval and perhaps even Myriaden.

Name: Malvoisin Monolith
Description: A deep black crystalline rock stands tall on the mountain. You can see your reflection in the monolith, but not the sun or moon.

Name: Gontruk Quarry
Description:
Thick dust coats everything in the quarry, including the workers who do not seem to take much pride in their work. 

A constant screeching and rumbling gives the impression that the quarrying facilities could collapse at any moment.

Name: World's End Relay
Description: At first glance, the presence of an inn so far from major centres of commerce or residence may seem absurd. Upon reflection, however, the establishment appears to be frequented by a regular influx of fisherman, hunters, and travellers.

Dialogs.Content: Trogulnus, here? Usually, they don't venture into that region.

About a month ago, scouts went on an expedition to the Great Eastern Range. They still haven't come back.
Recently, hunters from Mount Faras Camp reported seeing several skeletons at the foot of Watchman mountain.
I want you to find out if these are our scouts and who or what attacked them.

Everything's good? You are awesome!
Anyway, you see that trogulnus with the spear over there? He is their leader.
My men and I will take care of the remaining trogulnus. You and your friends take care of him!

Great job! It was an honour to fight alongside you.
My men and I are going back to Giltanbourg, but maybe we'll meet again at World's End Relay.
Hello.

Replies.Content: So, what are we doing here?

Dialogs.Content:
Some miners said they have seen humanoid creatures in the Bulgrof forest. According to the description they gave, there is no doubt that these creatures are trogulnus.
Surely they are the ones who decimated our scouting party. I want you to go there and get rid of those monsters for us.
If you say so...

Residents.Name: Cassiopee Felixvoris

Dialogs.Content:
Sort of.

Here, we're a long way from everything. So you have to learn to do a bit of everything to survive.

Mainly white vargrs and tawny bears. The most dangerous, however, are the chimeric trolls. They are much faster and stealthier than your average dim-witted troll, and that makes them much more of a threat.

Some fishermen have recently claimed to have seen ghouls in the area, but I suspect that these are rumours rather than reality.

Haha! That is surely one of the two most frequent questions I receive.

The vast majority of our clients are fishermen, prospectors, and hunters. Occasionally, adventurers like yourself stop by. As do academics.

Now, obviously, my clientele is not as large as it would be in town. But what they lack in frequency, my guests make up for in generosity. Our patrons are willing to pay top prices for a cosy bed, hot meals, and clean beer. And they tip. No pressure though...

Replies.Content: It can't always be easy living alone here, right?
Do you offer any training programs?

Dialogs.Content:
Officially, you're in East Gantras. But between us locals, we call this part of the country the Shield of the Chimera, in honour of the mountain range located nearby.

Around the relay's vicinity, you'll find a few hunting and mining camps. Fishermen and academics prefer to stick to our comforts rather than build temporary dwellings of their own.

There aren't a lot of robbers around, but there are plenty of dangerous and ferocious creatures. So I advise you to be careful while exploring the surroundings.

Legend says that Strombulos Cave is near here somewhere. Though personally, I doubt it even exists.

It's a long story, and one that I don't share with strangers.

* Cassiopee's face softens.

I'll tell you, at least, that I served for a few years as a Protectress of the Rose. Though I've now retired from the lifestyle.

If you want to know more about the Protectors, I advise you ask around Giltanbourg. There'll be plenty of folk who'll relish the opportunity to talk to you.
Sit back and relax. And don't worry about the quality of the food and beer, we get frequent shipments in from afar.

Replies.Content: Do you get many visitors out here these days?
What can you tell me about this part of Gantras?

Dialogs.Content:
Aha! There it is! The other question I hear a lot!

For starters, I have to accommodate or serve over a thousand different visitors every year. That includes at least a hundred living in the camps near here. Most of them visit two to three times each week.

Moreover, I'm not alone in taking care of the relay. My sister cooks and her husband hunts and maintains the buildings. My girlfriend brews beer and takes care of farming. 

Frankly, I've all the company I'll ever need.

Residents.Greets: Welcome to the end of the world!

Name: Portal Ruins
Description: Amidst the crumbling ruins of an ancient temple stands a carved stone arch engulfed in climbing plants. A light fog emanating from no discernible source flows from the archway. Sporadically, flashes of crackling energy appear from the emptiness at its centre.

Dialogs.Content: I've been waiting for you.

Replies.Content: How did you manage to get here so quickly?

Dialogs.Content:
I cheated. But I won't tell you how.

* Leonidas gives you a knowing wink.

You will understand soon enough.

Name: Path of Mud
Description: According to local legend, a solid mud path crosses the swampland all the way to the Isle of Tortaumort. The problem is that if you set just one foot outside the path, the entire path will sink into the thick dark swamp.

Name: Game Master
Description: This is a test site. And in addition, this text allows me to test the site description UI. Win win!

Dialogs.Content: Hair. 10. Front. 8. Turn of [...]

Replies.Content: Hey, we're not in Star Wars!

Dialogs.Content: Nose. 2. Beard. 10. Feet. 2 [...]

Name: Place of Marvels
Description:
Dozens of shops, agricultural stalls and kiosks form the central shopping centre of Giltanbourg. 

Shandoris, korkanes, and humans barter with each other in relative harmony. A dozen soldiers are strategically positioned to reduce criminal temptations and to intervene if necessary.

Dialogs.Content: Mainly clothes, tools and jewellery from Ogvania. Most are from Brysserad, but I have a few trinkets crafted in the townships too.
No need to look so surprised. Yes, I'm a korkane... but I don't bite.

* Saskia frowns at you, struggling to understand your primitive questioning.

I can't tell if you're serious. But as you can surely tell, I'm not from here, so I'm not adept at telling what far-flung corner of Pireiria you might be from.

* Saskia's gaunt face softens, then you see a series of small, sharper-than-average teeth in her mouth.

I'm going to give you the benefit of the doubt and assume that you're not ill-intentioned. Maybe you come from a place like Kortombe or Wellnear, which would explain why you've never heard of my people. 

In short, we're the inhabitants of Ogvania, the country north of Gantras. As you can see, we're almost the same as Tulsenians like you.

* Saskia winks mockingly at you, then drops the hood that was covering her head, revealing two hairy, pointy ears.
The capital of my homeland, Ogvania. And before you ask, yes, we do class the remote and sparsely populated areas of the countryside as townships.

* Once again, Saskia is in disbelief, questioning whether you can really be this ill-informed.

Okay, I never thought I'd have to explain this to a human, but alright... I'm going for it.

According to the legends of your own people, your kind originates in the Island of Tulsen, a place thought to be somewhere east of the mainland. The exact location is somewhat irrelevant as the place no longer exists, if it ever did. 

Your people are said to have fled the island for reasons unknown, before becoming stranded on the shores of Myriaden. The natives, that is the korkanes, shandoris and indigenous humans welcomed the newcomers with open arms. Then, over time, the Tulsenians became the dominant race. 

If you're looking for more of an education than that, I suggest you head to an academy, not a market stall.

Can I return to my explanation of the korkanes?

* Saskia lets her guard down as she bursts into genuine laughter. As she does so, she lets her tail fall free from its hiding place under her cape. She uses it to give you a subtle wave before concealing it once more.

We're not ashamed of our characteristic traits. But we understand all too well that your race has difficulty realizing that that which makes us different does not make us evil.

It can be difficult and insulting for us to always play the villainous role in your folktales, to always be portrayed as uglier than you humans. An accusation I believe to be far from reality. 

And so, I wear a cape. Mostly to avoid scaring away my customers, though also to escape the small-minded bigoted wrath of the Tulsenvor.
So what sets us apart from you, besides our ears, teeth and tails is our slimmer physiques...

Thankfully I've never met one first-hand, but they're a group of scoundrels and criminals who believe that you Tulsenians are Myriaden's superior race. 

It's absurd. In our culture, a child who cannot find his home would be the subject of ridicule.

*Saskia's last words were spoken with some contempt.

Oh! Of all kinds. We have great miners and even greater artisans in the area.

Some are natural mines, like the now-abandoned Dematis. In these natural mines, the ores tend to be shallow beneath the surface so they take minimal investment and effort in order to be exploited. 

Duke Branic also operates mines, with the help of the Crown, though he is mainly concerned with extracting minerals most useful to the citizens of Maliken or Gantras.

Finally, there are mines owned by private financiers, often conglomerates of merchants and nobles. These are often the most profitable endeavours, though also the riskiest.

I thought that might grab your interest. 

A few months ago, an important stagecoach was attacked in the dead of night. The authorities initially assumed it was wyverns, but the trackers who investigated rejected this theory. According to them, the beast has at least eight legs and spits some kind of corrosive acid. What's more, based on fur that they found nearby, she's as hairy as a bear.

Since that first attack, several other commercial convoys have been targeted. There is surely a hefty reward for anyone who can take the beast down or at least help the authorities to do the same.
I sell the best tools in the whole duchy! Heck, what am I saying? I sell the best tools in the whole of western Ordval! In fact, I'm sure that even in Maliken there's nothing better!

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about Giltanbourg and the surrounding region?

Dialogs.Content:
Surely you've heard that this is the richest seigneury after Maliken, so I won't dwell on it.

You stand in the hub of a a mining frontier where you can trade safely. Well almost...

Replies.Content: Is your uncertainty about the security of trade because Gantras is a border region?

Dialogs.Content:
Not at all. The Ogvanians are charming neighbours, certainly more so than the people of Larcen.

There are, however, a great deal of brigands outside Giltanbourg and above all, there is "the Beast"...

Name: Lair of the Leprechaun
Description: Human and animal bones line the floor of the forest glade encompassing the cave mentioned by Calista. A rotten odour hangs in the air. It takes a minute to notice that the fauna has become much quieter.

Name: Forest clearing
Description: Judging by the stone rings, broken bottles and leftover food scraps on the ground, this place is often used by picnickers and revellers.

Residents.Name: Anna Rotrou-Vay
Residents.Greets: Move on quietly! I know very well how to use this... err... this dagger.

Name: Servres House
Description: Who knows what mad architect would decide to build a stone house in a gigantic "W" shape. Judging by the number of chimneys, three families probably reside inside.

Dialogs.Content:
Our house was not designed to attract the curious, but if you remain respectful you can visit it. We are open people. 

Besides, do you want a glass of rumbular or tartigou?

Replies.Content: You seem very welcoming to me.

Dialogs.Content:
Thank you. My family does not come from Wellnear, and it has always been a bit difficult to integrate with the locals. 

I get on well with Aryn and Heriza, the two innkeepers. But apart from perhaps Leovia, I find the people a little boring here.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the people from Wellnear?

Dialogs.Content:
It is a very particular art form and exercise based on stretching the body. It allows your body to become flexible and strong. If you do it well, it will do the same for your mind.

You will need comfortable clothes, preferably tight on the body so as not to interfere with your movements.

I met Cragstein a few years ago in an inn in Larcen. He was a skinny little runt who had to take a dagger in both hands to stand a chance in a fist-fight. 

Today, he leads a troop of monster hunters.

Such transformations can occur, but for him? I certainly didn't expect that little chick to turn into a hawk.

In short, since Cragstein and his hunters' arrival in Wellnear, the lord seems to have fallen into addiction... alcohol, women, gambling... you name it. I suspect it's Cragstein pulling the strings.

Look, I don't want to alienate the Aranbourgers, but let's say they prefer to believe that the poverty of the seigneury is linked to some sort of curse rather than to the high seigneurial taxes. That being said...

* Daelle frowns

I would be lying if I told you that there isn't a smidgen of truth behind the rumours of a curse.

Don't get me wrong, I'm not a big believer in powerful ancient curses. Though as anyone who has travelled or studied a little knows, magic is very much real. 

The lord of Wellnear is a descendant of Lorie Coeurdor. The majority of the heroine's descendants have always been recognized more for their charitable souls than for their greed...

Yet everything seems to have changed since the arrival of Cragstein and his troll hunters.

Aryn Dool is the owner of the Tavern of Tales. He's a former soldier with a troubled past and an adoration for oddities. He's usually in a good mood, but after four or five pints of beer, his memories begin to haunt him.

Heriza Podka-Vekash takes care of the Inn of the Pitiful. Her family is originally from Aranbourg, which is why a woman of her calibre remains here. There are rumours that she's a spy for Maliken, but I don't believe them for a second.

Leovia Zepalla takes care of the central market. She's a good person, but I don't think she's the savviest trader.

Name: Fearpiercing Camp
Description: Located at the base of Fear Peaks, a tribal camp is under construction. A group of warriors busy themselves building trenches and installing barricades. The only installation that appears completed is a training arena delimited by huge tree trunks.

Dialogs.Content: The first test is just a little bear, it's nothing at all to a warrior.

Of course not! The Prettybard Plains are free lands! Free! Free from the harassment of stiff-backed guards from Wellnear or Kortombe coming to tell me that I can't set up my basecamp here!

The Assembly has nothing to do with their shabby little towns!

And you, are you from Kortombe?

Replies.Content: Kind of. I'm travelling from that direction, at least.

Dialogs.Content:
Not yet, but our war efforts are progressing.

Rumours say the troll miner chief has arrived in his lair.

If we get rid of him, we'll send a clear message to the trolls that the Claw wants the cave. And what the Claw wants, the Claw gets.
I'd love to, but the last thing I want to have to do is climb the cliff again. So, I want to be sure that the entrance to the mine won't be condemned forever by the trolls if we attack.

Taste your words before you spit them out. Our arena also serves to force apologies for those who feel offended.

Besides, he's not my real father.

*Toride Flameborn proudly displays the scar on her right cheek. You also notice that she is limping slightly, perhaps trying to hide another injury.

Trolls!

I think I discovered it! The lost mine of mining trolls! The stories of the ancients told of a mine with a passage all the way up to Fear Peaks!

The problem... temporarily... is that the trolls are still there!

We collapsed part of the cliff to open a passage to the mine! Ha! You should have seen it!

But then those scumbags barricaded the mine. I need a scout to find out what they've prepared for us.

Replies.Content: Can't we just go for it?

Dialogs.Content:
Emilio? Actually, I must let him know that our camp is now well established. Pass me your map, I'll show you where his marquee is located. In return, you can deliver my message to him. 

You will have to arm yourself heavily, Irlandun Canyon is very dangerous.

Replies.Content: I'll never be able to get there.
Easy! I'll make the canyon my holiday home!

Dialogs.Content:
No.

But, you fought well and I have no way of knowing whether or not you're a descendant of our warrior tribe.

I think you should meet our all-father who lives in Irlandun Canyon. Only he can decide whether you should continue your progress in the Guild.

Replies.Content: I was more interested in you than your father.

Dialogs.Content: Well, too bad for you. That is the comment of a weakling. Maybe I was wrong about you.

And not just beautiful. The place is wild! Powerful! Dangerous!

One day I'll climb it, and I'll conquer everything that's there! I'll climb the Stairway of the Hydra, swim through Despair Lake, and finally make it to the top of Nightmare Mountain, just to watch the sun set over the horizon.

*You are not sure if Toride was really talking to you or if she was thinking out loud*
Well, if they sent you here to tell us that we're not allowed to set up camp here, you'd better go get yourself a bigger army!

* Toride sighs

Well done, but you still have a lot to prove...

Perfect!

Now we have to take possession of the mine! The trolls are too dangerous for the young Claws of the clan. I'm going to need volunteers for the first waves of combat.

It's for Claw Assembly fighters!

Each initiate must pass a series of tests in order to demonstrate their fighting skills.

Want to try your luck?

Replies.Content: Can I know what will I have to fight?

Dialogs.Content:
The bear was nothing...

I present to you now:

The big bad vargr!

Val-what now? Never heard of it! Is that one of the districts of Maliken? In fact, I couldn't give a damn where you come from. I just wanted to know if you were here to deliver a message from the townspeople.
Look at that mountain!

Replies.Content: The entrance will not be closed. The trolls await us.
What's up with the angry face?

Dialogs.Content:
Those scumbag trolls came into the camp and stole our sacred totems.

I need a shock team to get them back.

Are you in?

Hrm... yes... you hit a bit too hard! Normally, we use the vargr a few times before the rite of passage.

Where are your good manners?

You're a good fighter, no doubt about it. But I believe you'd benefit from learning more about our ancestral customs.

Replies.Content: Do you want to teach me?

Name: Great House of Quara
Description:
The primary administrative building of Quara, the Great House is built from sturdy logs decorated with carvings of boats and industry.

The flags of Pireiria, Orval, Larcen and even Ogvania are hoisted on poles located in front of the main gate. A statue of a sailor wielding a sabre stands tall in a guard-like stance by the entrance.

Dialogs.Content: Enchanfruits is looking for a transporter for a delivery of berries. The destination is the Dancing Cybelfly Inn in Enorwen.
The number of nobles having their mounts at the hippodrome increases enormously during these festive times. Grooms are looking for these facilities to ensure the satisfaction of their boarders.
The Thanasisson family still requires the assistance of local herbalists to help create powerful serums to speed up wedding preparations.
The Thanasisson family asks all the herbalists of the seigneury to kindly provide some serums to speed up the preparations. Your cooperation is appreciated by people of the upper class.
Guloft, at Quarawood Furniture, needs a specific material for a piece of furniture intended for the nobility of Quara. Can you help him?
Issaya's engineers are looking for high quality materials for the construction of a ship with the cooperation of the universities of Strata Obska.
A citizen of Quara is looking for seashells for her collection. Particularly those found to the south along the beach.
Authorities in Larcen are asking for help to reduce the danger posed by the Zorburrs and Razburrs in the Ridand'hok hills.
Pick some apples in the fields of Quara.
The Issaya Shipyard is looking for materials to build their next ship.

To celebrate the centenary of the shipyard's inauguration, the authorities of Larcen have chosen to finance the construction of a gigantic galleon. The materials will be purchased at premium prices so as not to delay the work.
* You approach the bulletin board. A seagull squawks at you belligerently before flapping off...

Quara is not the richest of Ordval's towns, but it's certainly one of the cleanest and most hospitable.

The town's population has grown tremendously in recent years. I believe we've doubled in size in less than a decade.

The main commercial activities are shipbuilding, fishing, forestry and trade. We also have a small academy and several agricultural farms.

It's really a delightful place.

I actually hate my town, but I get paid to talk it up to idiot tourists like you.

* Nefertiti's face remains emotionless for a few seconds, then she laughs a hearty cackle.

I'm sorry. I love seeing visitors' expressions when I say that. Sincerely, I love Quara, and I hope you learn to love it as much as I do.

Ah, one of the esteemed guests! 

But nope! Our city, the most beautiful in the realm, is organizing a tournament to pay tribute to the ordinary locals and foreigners who have participated in the smooth running of life in our beautiful region.
Welcome to Quara! The most beautiful capital in the world!

Replies.Content: You seem proud of your town.
What can you tell me about your town?
Are these flags for the wedding?

Name: The Stricken Tree
Description: Presumably killed in the instant it was struck for the first time, this huge tree and the ground around it has been scorched jet black by at least five distinct lightning strikes.

Dialogs.Content: I know the old adage that lightning never strikes twice has as much value as oryctus feed, but I'm still lost for words that this tree has been hit half a dozen times.

You can't be serious? Ah wait, you're clearly not a Kortombourger. I should have known from your cute accent. 

The people here call him Roic the Incorruptible. There are few, if any, more famous than Roic in these parts. My ancestor was the first Protector of Kortombe. Though frankly if you are after details, I'm not the best person to talk to. I have my own legacy to establish...

... Fiola the Inquisitive! Hmm maybe Fiola the Irrefutable! Time will tell...
Fiola... Cesseness... yes... yep... yeah I know... from the same family as the famous Roic.

I study strange phenomena all over Pireiria. I observe and take notes, and one day I will write a book that will make me world-famous.

And... I sell pendants to pay for my projects.

Name: Abandoned lair
Description: A den that could have been large enough for a wolf family appears deserted.

Dialogs.Content: *To tame the cub, you must set up a straw mattress on the front porch of your Mist Manor. This will allow you to host him.
*The Cub doesn't appear to have any fear of you. It is as if he was counting on you to help him.
You look at the abandoned burrow and wonder what path the caninbanes might have taken for their attack on Ovie's pack.
*You remember Ovie when he was just a little lost pup...

Name: Zhyxhu's Rift
Description: The infamous lair of Zhyxhu, a terrifying biting mosquito of giant proportions.

Name: Den of the Amphibious Assassins
Description: Dozens upon dozens of peculiar transparent assassins, each the size of a small oryctus, emerge from the water. From there, they squeeze their limpid flesh through a small crevasse on the woodland shore. Corpses, of wild beasts and the occasional human, litter the banks.

Name: Arena of the Prankster
Description: Tree stumps have been placed in a circle to delimit a small combat arena. Some primitive stands have been assembled to allow spectators a place to watch the fights. A small tent housing two beds as well as a marquee housing stretchers also furnish the clearing.

Dialogs.Content:
Don't know the password? Then clear off!

[Dev] This is one of the organized arenas where the player can fight to earn money. A bit like in TS. With a big recipe linked to combat at the end. To discover the arena will surely have to have a beginning of reputation in the assembly of claws

Name: Quarawood Furniture
Description: The workshop is very well maintained other than a thin layer of sawdust covering most surfaces. An impressive collection of saws hang on the walls, some are made of metals that you don't recognize.

Name: Camp Attreyu
Description:
Two large marquees have been temporarily constructed near Corinna Forest. The larger of the two serves as a dormitory, while the other is used as a research centre. 

A few shabby looking guards keep watch over the area, but they seem ill-equipped and unprepared to properly defend the expedition's sponsors.

Dialogs.Content: Yes, you! You can help us!

Replies.Content: And how could I do that?

Dialogs.Content:
* Jalena nods in agreement with your point.

We're funded by the Crown, our university, and a few other nobles. In addition, Milan works daily to make our expedition profitable.

* A stroke of genius seems to cross Jalena's mind.

You!

* Jalena doesn't seem to have noticed the irritation in your voice, anyone else would have heard it from miles away. 

Well, there are wisps in Corinna Forest!

Replies.Content: I'd love to hit the road to give you more time to think this through, but you'll only forget who I am when I return.

Dialogs.Content:
Have we seen each other before?

* Jalena frowns and thinks for a few seconds, then seems to be completely lost in thought. A minute later, she realizes that you are still there.

Ah... uh... well in that case, hello again, friend?  Old friend? Cousin? Brother? Uh... sister?

Ah! Yes! I remember now.

We're here to study all the forest of Ordval, it is truly the project of a lifetime!

Replies.Content: That sounds captivating, but it must be extremely expensive.

Dialogs.Content: Well then I'm reassured. Thank you!

* Jalena's cheeks quickly turn red.

Oops! I'm very sorry.

* Jalena tries to adjust a double-paned magnifying glass placed on her nose. She pauses, having noticed much to her annoyance that her screams failed to attract the attention of the guards.

I hope that my unfounded accusations will not cause you prejudice against me.

* A pout appears on her face.

They were quite unfounded, weren't they?

Replies.Content: You mean your accusations? I am neither brigand nor bandit!

Dialogs.Content:
Sorry?

* Genuine confusion seems to have invaded Jalena's face.

Here, I'll explain my idea to you. Milan believes that it's possible to extract spiritual puree from the wisps. If you could bring some back to us, we would be grateful.

(to be continued)
Agh! Brigands! Brigands!

Replies.Content: I'm still not a bandit. What are you doing here?

Dialogs.Content: * Jalena breathes a sigh of relief.

Name: The Warlord's Hideout
Description: A war camp that reeks of ratman excrement. A larger tent than the others stands in the center of the camp. It is undoubtedly that of the warlord.

Name: Entrance to the Lithofortress
Description: Many creatures have made their homes in the dark caves of the Tarzakon Hills. However, this cave looks different from the others. Stone columns have been installed to support the entrance, and a brief look inside reveals a cave floor paved with stone slabs.

Dialogs.Content: It's awful...
Well, I would have thought that after our adventure with your uncle Sir Horald Coeudor that you would be quicker to recognize me!
He will pay for Baloin!
One again! We won't get rich if they buy them by weight... ah ah ah.

Yes, this creature will pay me dearly.

*You explain to Badouk that you must first try to find out who the creature is working for.

Yeah, I'll make it talk, don't worry about it.
About the possibility of meeting an old friend there? Baloin, thank you for offering me this meeting with Cragstein, I did not expect you to make me wait here so long!

I... I recognize those clothes and that scar on the right hand...

It is the body of my friend Balouin, Lord of Wellnear!

But what happened to his face???
The creature is meant to be primarily a spy. However, it's fairly certain that he can use ancient magic.

It is a strange coincidence, it is only very recently that a scribe-copyist of the order came to talk to me about these creatures. He told me he had found a manuscript that no one had touched for hundreds of years that mentioned it.

Now... copyists never forget to copy books and... no one in our library, even the venerable elders, had no memory of this book.

It is also in this volume that the mentions of the ruin that I am looking for are cited.

*You draw a parallel with the ruins you studied for the Great Circle.

Replies.Content: Any ideas who he works for?

Dialogs.Content:
One thing is certain, he is not acting for another noble.

The only memory I have of the book is that doppelgangers were employed by the enemy of humans.

It's vague, the cult of Nephiria perhaps?
We need a strategy...

Name: Top of the Hydromorphic Ladder
Description: From the top of the ladder, the view of the region is majestic.

Name: The Lost Wharf
Description: An old stone pier strangely resembles a quay. The capstans are carved from the cliff itself, confirming the true function of this place.

Dialogs.Content:
* Sorka gives him a big smile and winks at you.

So, ready for a holiday in Dunedan?

Replies.Content: A holiday!? Weren't you chasing someone?

Dialogs.Content:
Haha! As charming as ever, Finn!

Let's get down to business. Turn around and let me get changed.

*Without waiting for you to turn, Sorka changes her clothes to combat gear.

Wow! Charles really did send me my stuff! He's going to want a reward when I get back to the Caravanserai.

Oh! I recognize you! Welcome to the Lost Wharf, gorgeous!
*Sorka makes a face and turns back to the cargo you previously delivered to her.

Me? What about you?! The first time I met you, you didn't even have any shoes on! Ha!

I'm coming back from Viperin Point, to the west. It's extremely dangerous there, I advise you wait a little before venturing out that way.
At last! I'm really clumsy when I'm underground. That's why I don't hunt dragons. They're always lurking at the bottom of caves.

Uh... no. I'm actually trying to get to Dunedan Valley. I'm chasing someone down who stole a precious possession from us.

If only Finn were here. He knew of a passage in the cliff somewhere between here and Dunedan. 

Hey! Aren't you working with him now? Could you go and get him for me?

Ho ho! So you do remember. You're brighter than Finn, I see. 

I need your help with that too. While you're in Dunedan, why not profit from the opportunity, eh?

I could probably manage without you, but I best not. The last time I visited Viperin, I almost stayed there. The person I'm looking for is really dangerous.

Anyway, would you like to help me?

* Sorka gives you her best smile. You suspect she's using you, but you don't mind.
... no need to tell the whole story, big boy. We just want to know where the trail is.
* Sorka turns to Finn.
Ready for a new adventure with your favourite explorer?
Oh! Hello Finny-boy! I remembered you as taller.

*Sorka suddenly loses her usual cool and easy smile.

Have... have I told you that I'm scared to death of caves and caverns?

I'll admit it, that's why I asked you to go to find Finn...

Replies.Content: You'll be okay. Let's do this!

Name: Tarzakon Cavern
Description: Weathered stone forms a staircase to the bottom of the lake and the entrance to an underwater cave. An amateur spelunker who wanted to explore it would first have to find a way to breathe down there.

Name: Staircase of the Messengers
Description: At one time, it seems the residents of Ordval found it a worthwhile project to build a stone staircase to reach the heavens. Unfortunately for the architect responsible for the project, the funds were seemingly cut after a few dozen steps. Unless, of course, the staircase did once reach beyond the clouds and was destroyed by bad weather after the work was completed. In that case, somewhere beyond the celestial cotton wool there is likely a small community desperately looking for a way to get their feet back on the ground. Be that as it may, the mystery of the structure will no doubt remain forever unsolved.

Name: Falgorn Crevasse
Description: Obscure signs painted on the walls of the crevasse by one Falgorn apparently indicate the presence of imminent danger. This is probably a myth since no one alive has ever been able to confirm the presence of this mysterious threat.

Name: Argistant Suspension Bridge
Description:
The Argistant Suspension Bridge is a very impressive old structure. The bridge is a suspended path that runs all along the cliff where the river enters the mountain.

Historians disagree on who the original engineer behind the structure was.

Name: House of the Setting Sun
Description: Built several decades ago by a wealthy Larcen family, the House of the Setting Sun is one of Pireiria's rare homes for retired or sick adventurers. About ten men and women work there as helpers and guides.

Dialogs.Content:
Seeing as our last cooperation was a success, yes I do. 

I know well that you understand who we're working for here. I have a little game for you. I asked my employees never to divulge a certain piece of information to you. Now I challenge you to discover what it is.

Replies.Content: Sounds like a job for a nosey gardener!

Dialogs.Content: Don't expect us to tell you any secrets. We're paid handsomely to respect the lives of our lodgers.

Exactly. Sometimes they are injured and come for treatment, but most of our clientele have chosen Quara and our esteemed residence as a place to spend their last years in tranquillity.

We provide them with many services to ensure that they experience perfect happiness. Too many people, especially commoners, underestimate the importance of independent adventurers and mercenaries.

Replies.Content: And you take care of them out of charity?

Dialogs.Content:
Ha! Of course, a freelancer!

Actually, I might have something for you. We need to ensure the safety of our wards and sometimes that involves investigating the old relationships of our residents.

Does that kind of work interest you?
That's unfortunate...

Ah, so you work for Enchanfruits now? I'd assumed your style was a little more boisterous than botany... a little more gallant than gardening.

I understand times are tough and we all need to look for something to do to help us... live longer.

*You decide that it would be better not to go into the subject any further.
Oh, you no longer work for Enchanfruit?

You might not know this, but the people of Brumedor and those of the Grandwind Caravanserai hated each other some 40 years ago.

Tis a tragic tale indeed. The son of the chief of Brumedor was in love with the daughter of the chief of the Caravaneers. At the end of the story, they both died in a most dramatic scene.

Well, at least that's what they made everyone believe in order to have peace.

Replies.Content:
That sounds like a real tragedy. 

I imagine I already know too much to say no. So, let's go.

Dialogs.Content: I have very special customers. To provide them with optimal comfort, each bed is made to measure. Well, we have recently had a new resident, and that means we need a new bed.
You end up understanding that the beds requested by Jahiri are used for controlling or spying on the residents. He therefore has no choice but to have them made by a craftsman of the Order.
You would be surprised. Many adventurers make arrangements years before the end of their careers to ensure that they have a place here when the time to rest arrives.

Replies.Content: So adventurers come to your residence to end their days in peace?

Dialogs.Content: Welcome to the House of the Setting Sun! Guess you're here to plan for your retirement?

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about your residents?
Are the flowers to your liking?
Things are settled with the Klotoss.
Do you have another investigation for me to undertake?
Do you have something for me to do?
Do you still need my services?
Your beds are... special... aren't they?

Dialogs.Content:
You really went to study the tribe in person?! You are special! The majority of my "investigators" would have simply wiped out traces of our resident's old reports.

Well, you are a gardener after all.

Speaking of gardening, I need some rare plants for medicine for our residents. Could you find them for me?

Well played. I invite you to visit the Black Horse Pavilion. Tell Saraya Corvus that I sent you.

You are not a member of the Order yet, but you'll be granted access to more important missions as well as some of our training.

Good luck, and always be...

... vigilant.
Jahiri needs a very special bed for a new high-class client. He asks for your help creating this luxury piece of furniture.

Don't worry, no gardening is necessary. Our first investigation concerns a former Kortombe guard who was stationed at the Sirtura Outpost.

He told us he was friends with the Klotoss tribe further south. He was protecting them from Kortombe by falsifying reports of their presence.

With all of problems of scabonzis in Larcen, he is afraid of being accused of treason. For the comfort of our residents, we would like to know more about this story.

Why, of course!

*Jahiri gives you an elegant wink.

Though we are also heavily compensated, I can assure you.

You're not? I... will forgive that refusal this time. But in the future, you need to understand that once you know about an investigation, you become a danger to...

*Jahiri pauses, looking you straight in the eyes.

... us. And that would end badly for you.

Name: Vault
Description: A dark vault.

Name: Top of the ledge
Description: The ledge gets very narrow here. The view of the falls and the lake below is magnificent. Looking closely, you can see hundreds of ominous black shapes swimming through the waters.

Residents.Name: Sorka the adventurer

Dialogs.Content:
Ha! Ha! So cute.

Don't worry, I'll keep you safe. Now, take your staff - I'm going to demonstrate an old trick of the trade.

Oh! You progress from theory to practice very quickly! I'm impressed.

This technique will be very useful if you pursue a life of adventures. After all of your precious glass fragments have been found, of course.
I guess you never received combat training?

Replies.Content: Let's say, more theory than practice...

Residents.Greets: I need to talk to you...

Dialogs.Content: Dev.CraftGather.3
Dev.CraftGather.3
Dev.CraftGather.2
Dev.CraftGather.2
Dev.CraftGather.1
Dev.CraftGather.1

Name: Sanctuary of Roic
Description: A statue representing Roic, the first Protector of Kortombe, was long-ago erected in front of an altar dedicated to his feats. Benches are placed in front of the statue to allow the faithful a space to meditate.

Dialogs.Content: One of the creature's young cubs clambers on top of the statue of Roic. It would be best to get it off before a fanatic of the former hero arrives to pay their respects.
* You recognize the mother gremfyr, and her cubs, whom you rescued in Caledorn.

Name: Mirousana Cave
Description: Although shallow, the cave system behind Mirousana Falls has several galleries and tunnels that are easy to get lost in. From one of these distant passages, emanates the pleasing smell of saffron.

Name: Barefoot Camp
Description: A small backpack full of clothes lies on the ground near an old cauldron. Traces of human and animal activity litter the ground.

Name: Tombstones
Description: On the far side of the ruin are two tombstones with the inscriptions "Arriel" and "Ela".

Name: Ruins of Fortsonge
Description: Nature has reclaimed its rights over the old stronghold erected here, probably during the Century of Catastrophes. Walls greened by living plants give a good idea of the size of the fortress. Seasoned explorers might, by searching for several days, find an entrance to the abandoned vaults, but it's unlikely anything of significance remains inside.

Name: Circle of Fireflies
Description:
Glass bottles containing honey and other sweet products have been placed on poles in a circle in this section of the plateau.

[N] Fireflies have found their way into glass bottles placed on poles in a circle on the plateau. The light produced by these small beetles gives the area a magical atmosphere which is intensified by the wisps of mauve smoke escaping from censers dotted around.

Dialogs.Content: Quantity only has use where quality is absent.

Everything and nothing.

* Vitalys seems to take a few seconds to study you.

I know that trees can answer the questions of those who master their language.

I hear the whispers of assassins in the mountains.

I saw the giants destroy the world.

Replies.Content: Have you really seen giants destroy the world though?

Dialogs.Content: No land belongs to me.
Let's just say I am one who has the world as my canvas.

Replies.Content: You can't have many spectators, connoisseurs, or art critics around here.

Dialogs.Content:
No. That of your ancestors.

I tire. Let me take care of the stars that have come down to earth.

* Vytalis ceases to acknowledge your presence and begins to chant in an ancient language.
Be at peace, traveller!

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the area?

Dialogs.Content: Oh yes! But their spell didn't work on me. I was, I am, and I will be.

Replies.Content: The giant's spell didn't work on you?

Name: Corvus Camp
Description: A military camp containing hundreds of tents is set up outside Kortombe. The coat of arms of the Corvus family can be seen on gigantic banners encircling it.

Name: Greensea Relay
Description: The relay is one of the most dull places on the continent. The owner of the place hates music and imposes a consumption quota on his customers.

Dialogs.Content: Just what am I doing here...

Replies.Content: I have a job for you!

Dialogs.Content:
That's what I'm wondering, I thought I'd find employers in Enorwen...

But nothing!

All I want is to work.
If you can host me too, I'll happily escape this place and work for you for a while...

Name: The Sticky Crevasse
Description: A viscous greenish glue-like substance leaks out of the walls in this crevasse. It's most bizarre.

Dialogs.Content: *You approach the creature.*
*It's evident from the peculiar substance's movements that it is in fact a living creature endowed with some form of intelligence. With a little practice, you might be able to control it.
*This creature requires a building with the following characteristics:

Name: Poisoned Shore
Description: A pestilent odour spreads more than 50 meters from the riverbank. Dozens of floating corpses of fish and small animals lap up against the shore. Ravens feed on the carcasses of two maggot-infested vargr corpses.

Name: Plateau Bridge
Description: Five workers betting on the hour of the collapse of an old bridge wave to you. Their foreman seems discouraged, but still motivated to undertake the repair work.

Residents.Name: Ulrick Goodarms

Dialogs.Content:
I don't think so. Well, actually, do you know how to fell a tree? There is supon wood in the forest southwest of here. If you provide me with enough of it, we can solidify the structure and you can pass.

I'll even let you keep the tool as a token of my thanks!

Replies.Content: Sounds like a good plan to me.
Lets just wait for your shipment.

Dialogs.Content:
If you want my opinion, the Baroness has more pressing things to do that take care of this old bridge. If people need to cross it desperately enough, then they should learn to swim or build a raft. 

Still, Sir Tarul Verdant insists that it be maintained to allow his troops to make observation missions. Seeing as he may well be the new lord soon, it's probably wise to listen to him.
Wait, are you arriving from the plateau? Now that's odd, no one has been able to travel that way on this bridge for weeks.

Replies.Content: I crossed the river using a raft. How is the work progressing?
It's true, the old bridge looks like its barely staying upright.

Dialogs.Content:
A raft you say? Really. That's a peculiar story, and you have an even more peculiar accent. But hey, none of my business! 

To answer your question, we're in desperate shortage of labour and wood. Especially wood.
As you wish... but I'm starting to suspect that my delivery guy never left the tavern last night!

Residents.Greets: Don't get too close to the bridge! The old girl could collapse at any second without warning.

Name: Boar Territory
Description: The stamping grounds of an especially muscular wild boar.

Dialogs.Content: *You approach the creature.*
*The boar seems naturally docile to you. You think he might be a good candidate for taming.*
*This creature requires a building with the following characteristics:

Name: Portable portal
Description: Your portable portal has materialized in front of you. What always amazes you most about this magic is that the portal looks uncannily like an ancient ruin has always been here.

Dialogs.Content:
I'm not a walker if that's your question. My magic allowed me to escape, but I am able to create an object that allows you to enter.

That's all you need to know.
Mistwalker... I've allowed you to come to me because I need people with your abilities.

Replies.Content: Can you give me more details?

Dialogs.Content: Greetings, human.

Replies.Content: What can I do for you?

Dialogs.Content:
*The Collector remains frozen for a few moments.

Yes...

I provide you with the metabrumic key, which allows you to enter Saharanelle. It's your reward received in advance, because you can keep everything you find in the places except the three items I'm looking for.

Each time you do the adventure, I will be able to provide you with a key with a different telluric calibration. I have to study the result of each attempt.

The rest is none of your business.

Firbolgs.

Don't make the mistake of thinking I'm a Shandoris hybrid or an impure Korkane.

Well enough yes, I was a prisoner there for a very long time. Do you think Valsonge is unique?

I was in Saharanelle Tower when I... woke up. This location was in the Mists not so long ago, in fact it still seems to be a bit, as only a walker can enter it with a Metabrum Key.

I thought someone from Valsonge would know. I'm having trouble understanding the fabric of the worlds in this case...

We are the people living... or rather who lived, in the Far North of the continent. Our lands have been completely overrun by the Mists, causing the very existence of our civilization to seem to have been lost from human memory.

The tower belonged to my people. Imagine this is an embassy from ancient times. Only the undergrounds still seem to be in good condition.

The Mists have corrupted everything there and monsters have invaded the place.

*The Collector doesn't seem to want to talk more about it.

Name: Near the base of the well
Description: You are at the base of what appears to be a well. You notice what appears to be a ladder across the river.

Dialogs.Content:
You have finished?

I'm not sure yet if this contamination is an indication that the ruin I'm looking for is in this cave...

...but it's an increasingly likely scenario.

Surely there is another way through, I suggest we search the rest of the cave.

Doppelganger...

*Badouk turns to Palenne without understanding.

A thief of appearance, a mythical creature found in the old tomes. The Order has not recorded any encounters with these creatures for hundreds of years.

He took the place of the Lord of Wellnear, I see no other explanation.

Look at the fish, they also have a purple hue...

*Palenne touches the surface of the water with a rock. You notice that a crystalline powder is deposited there.
I hope they don't drink that upstairs...

Name: Foreign Trees
Description: Trees of a rare species have been planted near the mountain wall. A large bird of prey has built a nest atop one.

Dialogs.Content: Oh, okay... Thanks for bringing me here.
Thank you for escorting me here.

Replies.Content: Why did you want to come here?

Dialogs.Content:
I am originally from Kortombourg. At the Korllights Academy library, I read the diary of a man who supposedly settled in the Bulgrof Forest and planted exotic trees in order to study them.
Being a big fan of herbalism, I went looking for these trees in order to bring a sample home and continue this man's work.

If you want it, I wouldn't say no to help.
First, we need to harvest some nuts produced by these trees.
I also need a soil sample to know exactly what type of soil is suitable for their growth.
Finally, I would like to have a piece of bark and leaves from each tree to analyze.

Name: Brigand Daerth Cave
Description: Until recently, the legendary Brigand Daerth reigned unrivalled as king and master of the Great Central Chain. That was until soldiers, led by a group of Protectors of the Rose, finally got the better of the notorious outlaw. After which, he fled to this cave where rumour has it he was slaughtered by a gigantic green bear who had taken up residence inside.

Name: Doctor Rymard's strange boat
Description: A boat, designed to navigate on the high seas, ran aground in this rather marshy land halfway between Irroudanadouls and the ocean. The explanations for its arrival there seem rather difficult to ascertain. A keen observer might also notice that the boat is in much better condition than it should be.

Name: Johnvorace Fort
Description: [Todo]

Name: Lower door
Description: You are in the inner courtyard of the fortress. Access to the large staircase that leads to the upper court is reserved for the full member of the order.

Dialogs.Content: Can I help you?

Replies.Content: Why are you looking at me like that?

Dialogs.Content: Kortomia Fortress is the headquarters of the Order of the Knights of Kortomis. Visitors have access to the lower courtyard, but the upper one is reserved for members of the Order.

Replies.Content: How do you get into the Order?

Dialogs.Content:
So that's it! I will notify the council.

Oh! Wait...

Want a quest where you have to bring back ten Gremfyr Heads to prove your worth?

I'm kidding, but Mily will probably have some quests like this for you.

One enters the Order when invited to do so.

To be clear, we are working with the nobles of Kortombe and surrounding areas to uncover potential candidates.

Who knows, if you get big enough, maybe the College will be interested in your services.

Even though the term is borrowed from the knights of the nobility, you are not in the service of a knight. Your squire rank gives you access to certain training which is paid for with your Kortomis Stars.

To have Stars, one must render services to the Order.
Very well, the Order of Kortomis will await your decision.

Sorry, I made sure you were the right person ...

The Order of Kortomis would like to offer you the chance to become the Squire of the Order. This title does not make you a full member, but it is a good first stable.

Our Head of Squires, Mily, will surely have some work for you if you agree.

Replies.Content: It would be a great honour for me.
I don't feel ready for this honour.

Name: The Mechanical Owl
Description: The tables of The Mechanical Owl have been designed to look like famous book covers from the continent. The establishment itself is neither strictly a tavern nor a library. Hundreds upon hundreds of books are placed along the sturdy stone shelves lining the walls of the hybrid business.

Dialogs.Content:
First, you should know that there are at least a few representatives of the Order of the Lotus here. Don't worry too much about them. They're hired killers but unless someone holds a grudge against you, they shouldn't bother you much.

Second, as in all major cities, there are pickpockets, con-artists and drug dealers on the streets. They can be a nuisance, but they won't be foolish enough to get in the way of a heavily armed adventurer like you.

Third, probably the most dangerous, those involved in human trafficking. I'm not just talking about prostitution, but slavery too. They're paranoid and aggressive. They might decide to attack you before they even know if you pose a danger to them.

Finally, there's a few less scrupulous nobles and merchants who also use arms to gain power and influence over other residents of Giltanbourg. I suspect the Olizadek family are particularly fond of these heavy-handed tactics.

People always ask me where the name of our establishment comes from.

There's an old legend concerning the construction of a clockwork owl companion for a hero who defeated a herd of gorgonians. And when I say gorgonians, I'm talking about evil bull-headed monstrosities who delight in turning people to stone, not pretty women with serpentine hair.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about Giltanbourg?

Dialogs.Content:
Co-owner, actually. My lover Marlin owns half of the building and the business. I take care of the business side, and he takes care of supplying the place with books and alcohol. Before you ask, we don't serve meals here... fewer sticky fingers on the pages.

The Mechanical Owl is open to everyone, but we're mostly looking to chat with the free-thinkers of Gantras.

*Marketa lets out a laugh.

I'm obviously not talking about those idiots who believe the planet is sitting on a giant turtle or that creatures imitating humans are trying to take power. However, if you want to talk about democracy, revolution, or the links between organized crime and the nobility, then you're more than welcome at our tables. We're also open to all sensitive subjects which may offend the morals of "good society".

*Marketa bursts into laughter.

I won't give you the sales pitch of our golden city of the duchy, but it's certainly an interesting place. 

It's a rich city, as you must have noticed. Yet wealth attracts criminals faster than it does normal, well-meaning folk. In short, I can talk to you about the underworld if you're interested. 

If you're looking for a more official take, visit the Park of the Golden Word or the House of Laws.

They're a minor family from Giltanbourg. Frankly, I'm not even sure their nobility has been officially confirmed. I'd advise against investigating them though. They are more powerful than they appear.
You could say that, but we're pacifists. A strong society cannot write its origins in blood.

Replies.Content: Taking up arms is sometimes necessary.

Dialogs.Content:
* Marketa smiles sincerely.

You're an interesting person. I hope to see you again at The Mechanical Owl!

Residents.Name: Marlin Waringer

Dialogs.Content:
I'm more familiar with the players who act outside the city walls. For example, I know the Protectors of the Rose have a stronghold in the Shield of Astrid which is located near here to the east.

I also know that the Luxoras family owns several mines and a few hunting camps in the area. They're not overly influential in the capital, but they control a good proportion of the mercenaries and supply operations of the duchy. Naturally, they're extremely wealthy. Rumours have it that they wouldn't hesitate to hire known criminals to hunt the monsters inhabiting the less-civilized territories of Gantras.

There are a lot of bandits in the mountains. The duchy may be rich, but it's difficult to control such a large border area. You may also come across paramilitary troops from Jawana and Ogvania who have come to take a look at the country.

A few men and women attempted to take control of areas further away from Giltanbourg, but no attempt lasted long.

Hmm... what else? Somewhere to the west, near the ocean, is a small village inhabited by people who don't seem to want to mingle with others. I don't know why.

I know it might sound hard to believe, but I'm not actually a two-legged wolf. I am a...

*Marlin seems to be searching for the correct pronunciation for the word he has in mind.

Replies.Content: You're the co-owner of the inn. So I assume that you're a citizen of the duchy.
What can you tell me about Giltanbourg?

Dialogs.Content:
No. The inn belongs to my shinorya...

*Marlin gives a slight growl of frustration.

My better half...

*Marlin smiles in Marketa's direction.

... is the only real owner. Though we both put in the coin to start The Mechanical Owl. That's why she considers me to be part-owner. But in truth, I have no legal rights.

*Marlin's face betrays his surprise.

I'm amazed. There are few of my people, and few outsiders that have met us also. Perhaps there are just a hundred of us in all Gantras. 

*Marlin frowns.

And surely a few more tens of hundreds... hmm a few thousand, I mean, roaming around the rest of the country. Unfortunately, several of my... fellows live a life of brigandage... brigandism?

*Marlin groans showing that despite his fine Pireirian accent, he still has difficulty with some words.

Residents.Greets: Don't be afraid of my presence. I don't bite... much.

Name: Tavern of Tales
Description:
With its white and pink frontage, the Tavern of Tales looks like something imagined in a  children's story. 

This fantastical impression is accentuated by the interior design. A unicorn head, presumably faked, is fixed to the wall across from the main bar. 

Smells of candy and melted chocolate linger in the air.

Dialogs.Content:
Yes, right...

The tortolions found on the Algent Plateau have teeth that I can use as a hook. I don't think you should have any trouble identifying the tortolions, the secret is their shell.

Replies.Content: I am tortolly up for this!

Dialogs.Content:
Before assigning you with another task, you will need to find a lost passage that leads to the Algent Plateau to the west.

This passage should allow you to get to the region without having to make a grand tour. It will no doubt be useful for you later too. 

Rumour has it that the passage is near a river...

Replies.Content: It's time to rediscover the passage!

Dialogs.Content:
I have an idea for a creative new piece. In the Donpa Woodlands, there is a large breed of spider with thick sturdy legs. Now I'm thinking that I could use them as supports for tables, desks, and chairs. 

Creepy? Maybe. Conversation starters? Absolutely.
Not at all, actually. Fairy tales are my passion. His are theatre and interior design.

Replies.Content: You don't really strike me as the fairy tale type.

Dialogs.Content:
Don't be shy about eating the chocolate walls of the tavern, my son would take that as a compliment.

*Aeryn bursts into a loud laugh

Seriously, don't eat the decorations. You'll poison yourself.

Replies.Content: Your son must really love fairy tales.
Do you need help with your tavern?
Do you need anything else for your tavern?
Anything else? I like hunting for these oddities.

Dialogs.Content:
Always! I'm looking to make this place as fascinating as possible. And that means I need weird materials. Odd substances. And just about anything peculiar.

I currently have a project with very specific needs.

To the west of here is the Woodland of the Dryads. There are spiders who have paralyzing poison in their fangs. 

It just so happens that the green tint of that poisonous fluid is ideal for a dye I need. I'll need a lot of it though, 10 vials should do the trick.

Be warned. At night, rumours abound of flying women. It would be wiser to visit in the sunlit hours.

Replies.Content: Avoid the flying women and the dark. Got it. See you soon!

Dialogs.Content:
During my time as a mercenary, I had to fight a vargr with my bare hands. The vicious beast was going after my pregnant sister.

*Aeryn's gaze dissuades you from questioning his story.

I'm not sure I ever recovered from it. So, yes, I now prefer fairies and pink, to vargrs and crimson.

And I like your attitude! 

There are small creatures living in Raven Marsh, north of here, that have tongues I could use for rubber bands. It'd be helpful to tie things together, you know?

Replies.Content: That sounds disgusting, but I accept.

Name: Ottravi Egrom
Description: A few wooden houses have recently been abandoned. The smell of rotting flesh hangs in the air. The fresh claw prints of a huge bipedal beast have been partially filled by the day's rain.

Name: Rylenback's Nest
Description: At the top of the mountain, there is the lair of a gigantic creature. The corpse of a freshly killed cow lies in the centre of a huge straw nest. Surrounding it are the gnawed bones of creatures of all sizes.

Name: The Barbarous Barbers
Description: Contrary to the name, the place is comfortable and rather inspiring. Everywhere on the walls you can see paintings of nobles from the great families of Ordval with the most extravagant hairstyles imaginable.

Dialogs.Content: Which cut would you like?

Yes. I cut, I transform, and I colour. I can even remodel your eyes, the shape of your face, and even the pigment of the skin.

Besides, everything is free, making the world more beautiful is the only pay I need.

*You are no longer feeling particularly confident after hearing this.

Name: Sylvan Chasm
Description: Centuries ago, the ground of this clearing crumbled into the earth creating an almost vertical tunnel several miles deep. On the walls of the chasm, trees have grown out horizontally. Some nights, particularly aggressive albino birds flood out of the depths.

Name: Hippodrome of the Halcyon
Description:
Numerous wooden stands have been built beside a sizeable oblong track designed for tournaments and horseraces. 

Empty stalls are positioned along the base of the stands for merchants to set-up in during major events.

Dialogs.Content: Are you here to help me?
Beautiful construction, don't you think? There's not much happening here right now, but boy is it something special when there's an event...
*To buy the animal, you must have a place in your domain to house it.
*Balin tells you that the owner of this bulky horse wants to get rid of it.

Replies.Content: I'm interested in acquiring the war horse.

Name: Ladder of Roots
Description: A strange ladder made of writhing woven roots descends to the main level of Garrun'gol.

Name: Lair of the Joktos
