Description: What was once an underground lair of bearman-like creatures is now rubble and pestilence.

Dialogs.Content:
*The Joktos opens his eyes for a few seconds. You're sure to have seen a mauve glow in those before he closed them.

*You notice that Badouk is looking at you as if he had noticed too.

Secret Joktos... sacred fountain... thieving demons...

*The creature points to a waterfall further into the cave.
*You approach one of the creatures that seems to still be alive.

Name: Traveller Relay
Description: This relay has been designed to meet the needs of travellers, explorers, and isolated workers of Kortombe as well as the neighbouring seigneuries. They can rest, feed and cool off. Obviously, the mounts also take the opportunity to imitate their masters.

Dialogs.Content: Take the time to rest and refresh yourself. The road is beautiful, but it can be hard if you don't take the necessary precautions.

Replies.Content: I would like to know more about accommodation.

Name: Old Rabouf's House
Description:
Two enormous red vargrs guard a small wooden house. Animal skins are drying on a wooden frame nearby. 

[N]Two red vargrs are resting near a campfire. On the fire sits a large iron pot from which escapes a slight aroma of stew. The wooden house, located a few meters from the canines, seems inhabited.

Dialogs.Content: The majority of the teams I guide are looking for aciel, marapis or gurdismo. I also sometimes have hunters looking for varan and other lizards.
Good evening! The stew will be ready soon. Not much meat in it today, but the broth will be alright. Come, join me, I'll only ask for a story or two as payment.

Replies.Content: You would find my stories strange.
What do you think of Somberseason?
What do you think of the current situation in Aranbourg?

Dialogs.Content:
*You explain to Marco that Palenne believes there is a ruin somewhere under Mount Siho.

I have always found this mountain in the center of the village a bit strange. It is forbidden to climb it, because I believe that the lord uses it as an observation post.

But I understand that you are looking for a place under the mountain, which means that we should first inspect every stream of water that comes out of the mountain, it is the best way to find the entrance to a cave.

Take a drink. I have a tale that will send shivers down your spine.

It was a misty morning. I was in Malvoisin with Marco Filsderabouf guiding a group of wealthy visitors from Maliken. I guess my guide skills are a little rusty, because I manage to get us lost. 

The rest is, frankly, a blur. It all happened so fast. I remember only flashes of hooded figures, gruesome monsters, and a black rock. And the screams, oh lord the screams...
Marco is discreetly working to arm part of the population in case the situation degenerates at the castle. He is looking for weapons that could be forged in a secret location.

Without doubt. There are few more experienced than I in mountains and swamps. An evening spent talking with me will teach you more than a month trying to work it out yourself.

I can even teach you things you might not have imagined possible in mountains and swamps. 

But, for that, it will be necessary to provide more than stories in payment. This old house is in need of renovation, and there are some things that can only be exchanged for coin.

You clearly didn't know my father! Ahaha!

Like him, I am the guide of the region. I specialize in Raven Swamp and Pandolfo Hills. I've seen plenty of strange in my time too.

Replies.Content: What do people look for when they're exploring these parts of the county?

Dialogs.Content: I have a deep appreciation of the celebration. At night, I walk near the cliffs of Pandolfo reflecting on the meaning of life.

Name: The Queen's Fianc
Description:
[D] The owner, the cook and the waitress are more than enough to serve the clients who come to the hostel during the daytime. Most of them are regulars, though a few passers-by are lured in by the smells of cooked meat and spiced broth floating out its doors.

[N] In the evening, around fifty customers, mostly Kortombourgers, enter and leave the inn. In the later hours, the fragrances of cooking are a little tainted with the smell of pipe smoke and spilled mead. 

The inn's interior has undergone a number of transformations over the years. The furniture is built from a variety of wood, and the attentive observer will notice that the bar counter is from a completely different period than the doorframes. 

Sculptures and framed paintings decorate the walls, each depicting the owners of the inn through the generations.

The Queen was the nickname given to the first commoner of the seigneury to become rich enough to own several plots of land. According to local stories, this "Queen" enjoyed drinking at the small local tavern so much that she had it transformed into a full inn. 

She said that since she had no husband or children to turn her life into a misery, that she may as well invest in the things that brought her joy. And so The Queen's Fianc came to be. Or so they say.

Dialogs.Content:
Ah! Then I have just the task. It will help you to obtain clothing adapted to the climate of the seigneury and do me a service at the same time.

You see that case of dried meat? Bring it to Kortombourg Market, just down the street. Go ahead, and one of my men will pay you for your troubles. Once there, visit the shops and you will find all you need to go on an adventure.

Replies.Content: I don't really want to play deliveryman.
Perfect! I'm ready to shop 'til I drop.

Dialogs.Content:
I also heard someone rabbiting on about a demonic oryctus in the forest of Malarcane. But I don't believe it for a second, they're too cute and tasty to be evil.

Go find the master of hunting and he can tell you more. You'll find him at the Raven Manor.

* Raul approaches you and Thume Atuvu.

While Thume may not always be truthful, I can vouch for him this time. I was there when the stranger told that suspicious tale, and I told this fool not to spread the word.

By the spine of a boneless goat! You're not from around here, are you? Cor! I can barely understand your accent.

Rhumbular is a strong alcohol, classified as three "x"s by the Pireinian Alcohol Commission. Tartigou is a beer brewed by a local farmer.

Maybe you've had enough tartigou and rhumbular already, mate! 

Have you just escaped from a hospital? Have you been living in a cave? How can you not know about the capital of all Pireiria?
What?! You heard the rumour about me serving spoiled meat. Pure slander and lies. I only use the highest quality cuts of fresh meat in the seigneury. Honest! Heh heh.

Welcome, welcome, one and all! Take a seat and call me Raul! 

Would you care for a bowl of our oryctus stew with kortomboise sauce? Wash it down with a mug of Tartigou? A glass of rhumbular, perhaps?

Replies.Content: I would like to explore the seigneury, but I am not sure I have all the necessary equipment. Can you help me?

Dialogs.Content:
As in all taverns, many rumours not only arise here but are transformed and elevated here. 

Don't assume I'll be revealing all my patrons' secrets to you though. You are just a stranger after all.

The village was founded by the Kortombe family a few years after the creation of the barony. 

I advise you to meet Celeste Kortombe to find out more. She is the burgomaster and the daughter of the baroness. You will find her at the Great House. Oblir Lightmind, from the Korllights Academy, is also very well informed on these matters.
Ahaha! Well, you got me, stranger! For a second, I really didn't think you had heard of the capital of the country that we live in.
Caroline Jussifrus, who works at Golden Gin, told me that she has been having problems with particularly reckless vargrs. Maybe you have what it takes to bring her a little peace.

If you want my opinion, they are a sneaky invention of the great thinkers of Maliken to come and steal gold coins from us hardworking folk!

Though if you want a bias-free answer. The PLC is a group of retirees from the royal seigneury who judge the strength and quality of the spirits. Nice job, eh? Producers must pay a few coins annually to ensure that their products are approved. If they refuse, they could receive a sale ban.
Don't listen to his nonsense! Thume is naught but a local drunk. While it's true his purse seems bottomless, I do not believe a crumb of its history.
As you wish, but it's about as easy coin as you'll ever get!
And misinformation...
I should have listened to you, old friend.

I heard that a young woman has been imprisoned by an old hermit in the woods nearby. I'm not too sure of the details, but from what I know, she has been held by him for over a week. I think she's probably a noble from the Lordship of Larcen. She could even be the baron's daughter. I bet there will be a big old reward if you save her from her captors.

They say both captor and hostage are in a cabin in the Caledorn Forest.

Replies.Content: A damsel in distress? I'm already out the door!

Dialogs.Content:
I have nothing for you unfortunately... unless you care to resolve a dispute between Raul and I?

The other evening, I gave a generous tip to Gustavienne, one of the part-time waitresses. It seems that since that time she harasses Raul to work more and she demands more from her clients. 

So my mate Raul, here, asks that I resolve the situation with her. But I don't think I can be held responsible for my generosity. Not one bit! 

Then again, since we don't want our little quarrel to escalate, we decided to accept the judgment of a third party. Though clearly we're not bringing a matter like this Baroness Kortombe just yet. Some things are best resolved within the walls of an inn.

So, as a foreigner with no bias towards either of us, you seem the perfect person to resolve the situation.

Replies.Content: I expected a more physically demanding job.

Dialogs.Content:
No. I swear it on all the ale in this place, I did not know. 

It was a gabridge player who told me about her. I do hope you were not seriously injured.
Hello traveller! If you feel like company, come join me for a beer or to share my bottle of gin.

Replies.Content: Have you heard any interesting rumours?
Did you know that the story of the kidnapped noblewoman was a trap?
I just arrived in town and I'm looking for work.

Dialogs.Content: And I didn't expect a stranger looking for work to be so choosy.
*Thume laughs so warmly and loudly, that nearby patrons look over.

Replies.Content: So you spend all of your days here?

Dialogs.Content: *Thume roars with laughter once more.
Shame. You would have enjoyed it.
It's much more interesting than you'd think. I chat with the pretty waitresses and the weary travellers. I am a veritable goldmine of information.

Up until a few years ago, I was just a humble street trader. Then I rendered some services to a knight in the duchy of Gantras. You could say that I went beyond the call of duty.

Since he had no children, he left me his fortune when he died. So since that time, I've been quietly squandering my inheritance in establishments such as this one.
Always. And if you are in need of adventure, I've heard a particularly intriguing story.

Replies.Content: I'll keep that in mind, but I best not right now.
This is exactly what I was looking for.

Name: Quara Market
Description: Quara Market is a typical market of the realm. There are assorted merchants, crowds of hustling children, a toddler crying for a new toy, and town guards casually brutalising the elderly.

Dialogs.Content:
Everything's going great here!

*Bolondinus beckons you to approach and whispers:

Psst. I don't give quests, I'm here to sell items.
What are you looking for in our beautiful market?

Replies.Content: Just browsing. Is everything going well here?

Name: Marquee of the Claw
Description: A permanent structure, this marquee of leather and wood could comfortably accommodate a hundred people. A dozen scantily clad warriors train in an arena bounded by a stone wall. The whole place smells of sweat and old blood. An additional smaller tent houses a dormitory.

Dialogs.Content: Children of the Claw will not always have their friends at their side. Surviving on one's own is an essential element of a warrior's education.

Members of the Claw Assembly decorate everything they can with trophies from creatures that they have defeated. A good way to gain acceptance in the community is to provide some for the decoration of public spaces.

To understand the strength of numbers in battle, Warriors of the Claw will have to learn how to counter small foes that attack en masse. The amphibious assassins of Thousandshirts will show you the way.
A creature named Tortolus resides in the Ridiculous Mountains. A Warrior of the Claw must learn how to pierce armoured carapaces.
Children of the Claw must be able to fight against the creatures that prowl around them. The dice of destiny will decide who is the enemy of the day.
* You approach the bulletin board, its notices display brutal challenges and initiation rites for would-be Warriors of the Claw...

Replies.Content: Initiation of the Claw: The Assassins
Initiation of the Claw: The Fauna of Irlandun
The Challenge of the Little Ones

Dialogs.Content: The Marquee is quite decorated for the moment. Claw Assembly members hold all kinds of parties and recipes that use substances. You could barter with them for aureate claws.
The child of the Claw must be able to fight against the creatures that roam around them. The dice of destiny will choose who is the enemy of the day.
Around the Marquee, solitary creatures change with the cycle of the sun. Learn how to live by day and how to survive by night.
The Marquee requires rarer substances for decorating around the seats of the esteemed Gorathan family.
This little one will accomplish great things for the Claw, it is written in the smoke of the sacred fires of the howling night.

Only cowards have no enemies.

These tortolion Arcanists believe we are stupid brutes. We are not, but we don't care for what those pretentious philosophisers think of us nor for how they think. They play with occult forces, and one day those forces will knock them from their ivory towers. We will be waiting at the bottom, amidst the dirt and mud to welcome them.

* Emilio bursts into a cruel laugh.

We also hate those cowards of the Order of the Hippogriff. They see themselves as creators of kings, but one cannot wield real power while being afraid of the light.

The founding families of the Assembly populated southern Myriaden and part of Ordval before Maliken became strong enough to protect its colonies.

To avoid being crushed, these families gathered under the protection of the Claw - the most powerful manticore ever to have existed. Under the Claw's orders, the tribes of our ancestors resisted the invaders for a long time. Though eventually, they did succeed in slaying our sovereign. Grieving and at the end of their tether, our ancestors decided to surrender rather than be eliminated.

However, the more determined warriors of the Claw clans continued to impart certain skills to their descendants. Eventually, the great-grandchildren of the brave came together and formed the Assembly.

Replies.Content: As I suspected, I'm not likely to be descended from your ancestors. Still, I'd like to know more about you.

Dialogs.Content: Only those who have learned to love their inner rage can join us. Unless, that is, you can prove that you're a descendant of the ancients.

Replies.Content: I'd be surprised. Can you tell me more about these ancients?

Dialogs.Content:
Our main role today is to defend the descendants of the ancient southern tribes no matter where they are on the continent. We are proud warriors and we never shy away from challenge. For us, there is no such thing as a bad fight.

Fury drives our every move and we celebrate it each day.

Hmm...

I guess we don't use that name often. You are in the principal estate of the Claw Assembly.

We come from a long line of warriors who have learned to master our fury in order to become better warriors.

Replies.Content: Can you teach me your techniques?

Dialogs.Content:
I would say the biggest threats are the mountain loucantars and the ogres of the Keskat Clan.

There are also a few robbers and smugglers, but they shouldn't pose a meaningful threat to those skilled in blade and bow.

What else? Ah, yes, at the foot of the waterfall near here, you can catch some great fish.

Every year we tried organising a feast for the season, and every year our preparations were ravaged by heavy rains. 

So, no. We don't celebrate it. Not anymore.
Are you a lost traveller or are you looking for the Children of the Claw?

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the region?
Does the Claw Assembly celebrate the Somberseason?

Name: The Incendiary Tower
Description: {guild, talent, fire, high-level}

Name: Ruby Woods
Description: A few decades ago, the rumoured existence of a ruby tree attracted many scholars and travellers to this part of the territory. Unfortunately, the curiosity of these people was their downfall. They were the targets of the famous pirates of Thorval. Even today, some people claim they have seen gems growing on the branches of certain trees, though no one believes them.

Name: The Monster of Gargagoth
Description:
Formerly an aristocratic mansion, the Gargagoth has over forty rooms. Without a shadow of a doubt, it is the largest inn in Ordval. By day, the place welcomes more than a dozen travellers and workers at any one time.

[N]The hostel appears to be in thriving business nonstop. After supper time, hundreds of customers enter and leave the establishment. The diverse staff and musicians seem to have been chosen to appeal to all types of visitor.

Dialogs.Content: Once there is space, someone will quickly come to take you to a table. In the meantime, I advise you go to our living room and chat with the other visitors.

Replies.Content: The tavern seems to be doing well.

Dialogs.Content:
My apologies. I hear so many accents here that sometimes I fail to notice that someone is not local.

Paladin is the highest title in the Protectors of the Rose. They are a guild of knights and warriors who have taken it upon themselves to defend needy commoners rather than the comfortable nobles. I'm not the most well-versed in their organisation, but Arnaud Croixdefer will surely be able to inform you. He takes care of the weapons room.

A oneye is a sort of gigantic ogre which, as you might expect, only has one eye. I know, it's not very original, but not every creature deserves to be named by a poet.

You won't be surprised to hear that we get that question a lot. 

A mine near Gargagoth Lake was overrun by a giant oneye, rendering it unusable for the many workers in the area who relied on it for income. Arabella Dematis, a Paladin of the Rose, and her troop attacked the giant and liberated the mine. 

After receiving his share of the sizeable reward, one of her team quit and founded the inn. If you ever see him, you should ask him for the details. He tells the story much better than I, sparing no detail no matter how dramatic nor gory!

Replies.Content: Paladin of the Rose? Giant oneye??

Dialogs.Content:
It's more than just a tavern!

* Armand's smile lights up his face, making it even more beautiful than it already was.

Why I'd go as far as saying that we're the foremost entertainment establishment in the whole of Ordval. And so we shall remain! We welcome over one hundred minstrels and artists every year. In winter times, we open our rooms to the painters and sculptors of the continent who display their works for the public. 

Many private and official ceremonies also take place here. There are rumours that King Gallant himself was one of our clients.

Don't worry, everything here is most legal. I'm an importer, and I've an agreement with Armand to conduct my trades here with his rich and refined clientele.

Many of the items I import come directly from Maliken. But on occasion I have objects coming from much further afield!
Interested in rare items?

Replies.Content: Erm... what do you have to offer?

Name: Crossroads
Description:
A series of signposts have been installed on the side of the path to direct wayward travellers:

South-east towards Wellnear

North-east towards Kortombe

West towards Enorwen and Thorval

Name: The Observed
Description: Over the years, the forces of nature have carved a small valley out of local plateau. At the centre of the valley is a leather tent by an artificial pond. The sound of snoring draws your eye to a red bear sleeping on an uprooted tree.

Dialogs.Content: Much like you, I guess. I hunt and I explore.

Replies.Content: Are there any interesting sites to visit in the area?

Dialogs.Content: Please, do not insist. Oh, I discovered a nest of assassin spiders while I was exploring the river to the north. Don't go there unless you're well equipped.

* A young woman with surprisingly well-groomed hair and clothes watches you approach, her silky hair blowing lightly in the breeze

Were you sent by my... admirer?

Replies.Content: Do you have a secret lover?
What are you doing out here?

Dialogs.Content:
* Brita smiles sweetly.

The truth is that I'm looking for a specific place. And as I do not know you, I'd prefer not to give you any clues as to the nature of my search.

Replies.Content: That clears things up a little.

Dialogs.Content:
* Brita bursts out laughing.

Well I don't think he's' in love, and I'm certain he's no secret.

* Brita gestures in the direction of the plateau, near the wooded area.

He's been watching me for weeks, as if I were some kind of actress performing for his pleasure. I tried talking to him but all I got in response were the growls of his pet vargrs. I would have asked Rroar to intervene...

* She smiles affectionately in the direction of the sleeping bear.

... but if I think about it carefully, I don't see the point of killing domesticated vargrs. Nor of making myself an enemy. After all, the idiot is only looking at me.

* Her tone suggests that she may be a little flattered by the attention.

* Brita responds, imitating the tone of a museum guide.

Ah! Why of course! If you turn to your right, the eagle-eyed amongst you will be able to spot a fallen tree. No one really knows who is responsible, but local legends say that it was the wind and inclement weather. Sadly, we may never know the answer to this age-old mystery.

* Brita picks up a stone from the ground.

This stone was created by Gulbak, the almighty lord of pebbles! In fact, it's a nail from his toe. Do you want to buy it from me? I'll give you an exceptional price!

Replies.Content: Okay. I see. You don't want to share your findings with a fellow explorer.

Name: Heart of Tarasquan
Description:
In the middle of the otherwise murky swamp, there grows a majestic bush covered in yellow and gold flowers. The smell of these flowers has attracted butterflies and small birds that have built their nests in its branches. 

By stark contrast, you notice human bones floating on the waters of the Tarasquan.

Name: Statue of Kortomis
Description:
Atop a base drenched in thick moss, an old stone statue of a noble warrior watches over this part of the plain. 

Zortan Kortomis was an important warlord who controlled the region before the foundation of the Lordship of Kortombe. The links between his family and that of the Kortombe family have been little studied by historians.

Dialogs.Content: I am the protector of Zortan Kortomis. You are asked to address him with respect.

Replies.Content: You want me to respectfully address a statue?

Dialogs.Content: Insolence!! Lord Kortomis is a good and generous man who watches over his whole kingdom.

I'm back!

Are you one of the new recruits? Very well. Come find me later if you'd like to practice under Kortomis's gaze.

Name: The Face of the Ancients
Description: You are in front of a large rock known as the Face of the Ancients. A venerable humanoid face has been carved into the rock. According to legend, an adventurer could be invested with the knowledge of the ancients here, with the right ritual.

Dialogs.Content: You feel ready to perform the woodcutters' ritual
*You approach the ancient face, its deep-set eyes look as if they hold the wisdom of a hundred generations.*
You feel ready to perform the ritual of extraction.
You feel ready to perform the botanical ritual.
You feel ready to perform the ritual of the hunt.

Name: Fountain of crystals
Description: A magnificent fountain has been built around a crystalline rock. The water has been flowing over the stone for so long that you can discern a cavity in the faces of the crystal.

Dialogs.Content: Using her enigmatic language, Sylph explains that you must create a mixture from the very specific ingredients she tells you.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph explains that you must create a mixture from the very specific ingredients she tells you.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph explains that you must create a mixture from the very specific ingredients she tells you.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph explains that you must create a mixture from the very specific ingredients she tells you.
*You approach the crystal.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph explains that you must create a mixture from the very specific ingredients she tells you.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph explains that you must create a mixture from the very specific ingredients she tells you.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph explains that you must create a mixture from the very specific ingredients she tells you.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph explains that you must create a mixture from the very specific ingredients she tells you.
Using her enigmatic language, Sylph explains that you must create a mixture from the very specific ingredients she tells you.

Name: Scratched Rock
Description: According to legend, a giant feline created the deep claw-shaped marks in the cliff. The assumption feels unlikely, though alternative explanations for the scratched out cavities are slim.

Dialogs.Content: Ha! Ha! Come on, now. I know they're probably just legends. But the idea is fascinating, don't you think?
Fascinating! Wonderful! Enchanting! Everything is so fabulous when you take the time to observe and listen.

Replies.Content: What is it that fascinates you so much?
I'm ready to operate a vortex.

Dialogs.Content:
Wonderful! The nearest vortex is on Sorcerer's Mound. I will show you the location on the map as soon as you understand the channels.

I'm going to ask you to bring some materials so that I can explain how to resonate them to make rods that will pass through the Mists when activated with your Lantern. It will make sense soon, I promise.

Replies.Content: I don't understand all this mumbo jumbo, don't you have any monsters I can kill?

Dialogs.Content: Pardon?

You can see the vortex as a rift in the Veil of Mists.

At first, we didn't really know what to do with them, but Leonidas ended up finding a use for them.

The vortex allows us to channel resources present in the surroundings directly into your home.

We believe that the channelizers force the creatures of Mist to work for you.

Do you not believe in the existence of mythical monsters? 

I'm sure you have friends who would openly make fun of you for admitting the possibility that they're real. But you're in safe company with me. I'm a free thinker!

Yes, it looks like a wizard's staff like in fairy tales.

To maximize the drama, you have to arrive at the vortex scene and plant your pole saying "You shall not pass!"

Hurmm ... well I was saying that the rod is a miniature version of the pillar, it is ideal for learning to use the vortices, because it is possible to move them without a cart.

They are however much less powerful, you will not be able to extract a lot of resources with this type of channel.

Leonidas will explain the pillars to you later if he thinks you can use them.
This marks in this cliff! They must have been left by a giant cat, some sort of  fantastic feline! Or perhaps one of these legendary manticores? Who knows? The mystery is tantalising!

Replies.Content: From what I know, manticores are not that big...

Dialogs.Content:
Ahhh, a Mistwalker. Is it Leonidas who sent you?

Yes, I worked with him for many years inventing the vortex channels.

These are usually vertical structures, such as a pillar, a totem pole, or even a monolith which are installed inside the vortices.

Once activated, the channelizers go through the mists, and their links to your Misthouse ensure that resources end up in your domain.

Looking at your gear, I don't think you're yet ready to install pillars, but I have an option for you... our pipe prototypes were poles.

Name: Burrow's Edge
Description: A burrow that might have been big enough for a family of wolves now seems deserted. The stench of a rotting corpse emanates from within.

Dialogs.Content:
It's a burrow of royal vargrs. The hyenas are just here to chew on bones that have been left behind or to find cubs that might be hiding. They could never have carried out such a massacre.

But what worries me most is the possibility of a caninbane in the vicinity. And I couldn't protect you from one of those foul beasts.

It's best we finish our quest soon, you can come back here later if you want.
It wasn't hyenas that did this...

Name: Surizor Camp
Description: Around a central fire on which meat is cooking, white, green and yellow tents are arranged in a circle. Hunters and lumberjacks come and go between them.

Dialogs.Content: In that case, you could in fact help me. We need better quality axes. Do you think you can get us that?

Here is the Surizor camp. There is good wood around here and hunters come to hunt hyenas.
By habit, this place has become the gathering point for hunters and lumberjacks in the region.
Welcome to Surizor Camp. How can I help you?

Replies.Content: I was about to ask the same question.

Name: Azrason Egrom
Description: Several huts have been built around a totem representing mythical creatures from various folklores and legends. Men and women with long, braided hair and tattooed limbs complete small chores around the hamlet.

Dialogs.Content: Naovic, this is serious! I need those infusions to think.
Aren't you the strange ones who came to save me?

Replies.Content: Naovic was telling me about the nightmare epidemic. That some people say it's related to the Mists...
What are these infusions, some kind of narcotic?

Dialogs.Content: Sahranna explains to you that she mixes narcotics to make a substance which allows her to enter a trance. Though on many occasions, she lacks the requisite ingredients. And this is one of those times.

Heh, true. Well, I have more to do than just remembering the faces of random adventurers. I thought "strange" would be a nice term for people like you.

Well, uh... thanks.

*Sahranna isn't much more cordial than her cousin...

Ah... yes indeed. I seem to remember having promised to reflect on the question.

I'm going to need my reflection infusions if I'm going to get there.
She's not far away. The poor girl is taking a meditation treatment with the fairies to help her recover from her emotions. I hope she'll be back with us soon.
Ohhhh. So you think you're better than me? Eh? Do you? The fairies didn't tell me anything but you think they're going to talk to you?? Aha!

Replies.Content: Actually I was thinking of asking the locals...

Dialogs.Content:
Like I just told you, they have no respect for our way of life and...

* An idea seems to cross Naovic's mind.

If you really want to know more, you can talk to our sage, Sahranna. Besides, she hasn't been back here for a few days. That worries me.

Replies.Content: Do you want me to investigate?

Dialogs.Content:
The golden mushroom? Do you think the students you mentioned are looking for it?

If that's the case, I have some unfortunate news. They're likely dead. The mushroom isn't far from here... it's in Fenrigan's Lair.
Well, you're useless.
*Naovic lets out a small chuckle.

Hmm, I have to be careful with my words... brutes, let's say, come here to force us out of our woods. They don't respect our way of looking at life. They think the fairies won't return!

Some even think that the nightmares experienced by citizens originate from beyond the Mists, as if there is something beyond that damned fog!

Replies.Content: That's strange. Do you have any idea of their motivations?

Dialogs.Content:
Fenrigan is a giant wolf that has been preying in Woodlands of the Prankster for centuries. Many hunters have fallen trying to bring him down. 

Whilst he's not normally aggressive towards humans, he's extremely protective of his territory. If your students tried to enter his den while he was there, there will be nothing left of them but gnawed bone and memories.

Replies.Content: Wynael hired me to find his students.

Dialogs.Content: I hope you're here to talk and not to attack.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the golden mushroom?

Dialogs.Content: I'll show you the way to the lair, if you want. Though I warn you that you will not find your students alive.

Replies.Content: I must carry out my mission, until the end.

Name: Scabonzis' Fortified Castle
Description: The castle is surprisingly well built, at least for the very low standards of ratmen.

Name: Argistant Herd
Description: It is here that the famous horses of Argistant live, a breed of horses adapted to work in the mountains. To your amazement, a small luxurious stable is located near the large waterfall.

Dialogs.Content: *You approach the horse*

Replies.Content: Would you like to come with us?

Dialogs.Content: *To recruit the Argistant horse, you must have suitable lodgings for it.*
Welcome, traveller.
*The horse takes a few steps towards you as if to test you.*

The horses do not belong to me. I'm here to protect them, with the help of the nobility of Gantras, because this fine breed is edging closer to extinction.

Argistant horses do not have the temperament to live their whole life in a herd. They must do what we call their pilgrimage. Then they will return to us when they're ready for herd life.

As breeders, we prepare them to make their pilgrimage in the company of humans.

If you prove to me that you have a worthy place to receive him, I will let this one go with you.

This is my humble stable!

*You look at the luxurious stable which seems anything but humble to you.*

I am the one and only Argistant horse trainer on the continent. It is a noble breed which deserves a most comfortable place if it decides to make leave of its native land.

Name: Leviathan Sanctuary
Description: Tents have been set up around a totem pole representing a tree reaching for the clouds. On the shore near the sanctuary, men and women take care of aquaculture. A few unusually large salamanders roam the island, seemingly free from all concern.

Dialogs.Content: We can. Though to put an end to the phenomenon, we'll have to perform counter-rituals.

*Heault's face darkens as you tell your story about the creatures.*

One of our druids was investigating Darkblade Marsh, but they deserted after coming into contact with a mercenary stationed in Viperin.

I suspect this ex-druid of ours is responsible for the rituals creating these abominations.

Replies.Content: Could he move them to Wellnear?
Can we prevent the creation of these golems?

Dialogs.Content:
Our ancient art is called vitalism. Tis an approach that some refer to as magical medicine.

It would be our pleasure to teach you our art, but we must be sure that we can trust you before beginning your education.
Hello, and welcome to Leviathan Sanctuary!

Replies.Content: Do you know anything about the nuertogolems?

Dialogs.Content:
Oh! You came here by chance. I assumed you knew we were the second largest gathering of the Circle of the Great Tree of Ordval.

We're healers and lovers of harmony and nature. Some call us druids. If you wish to learn more about our way of life, I advise you to go visit my good friend, Rakham, at the Sanctuary of Eternity.

Replies.Content: Can you teach me any new recipes or techniques?

Dialogs.Content: In search of the following ingredients: Three funeral candles, two human bones and three vials of strange water. We also need the incantation book. Rumour has it that these items could be found in the Lithofortress. This place is very dangerous.
That's it! He'd previously sent us an emissary offering his services at a time when the Claw Assembly was destroying an ecosystem that we try to protect.

I imagine so, but why would he do that?

*Heault remains thoughtful for a few moments...

It's probably related to the actions of the mercenary he's working for now. His name escapes me...

Name: Tomb of Ilmagoth
Description: An old tomb caked in dust still glistens where it catches the light.

Name: Meeting point
Description: A good meeting point must be easy to find by those who seek it, but almost impossible to discover by those who are unaware of its existence. In this case, a huge orange nest sits amongst the branches of an old chanderene tree.

Dialogs.Content: Thank you very much for your help. If one day you visit the University of Gantras, come and greet me.

Name: Fontainsnail Relay
Description: A few tents have been set up in front of a small stone inn. About a dozen men and women train, rest, and bathe in the river. Most of them appear to be mine workers or adventurers.

Dialogs.Content: There are many folk more skilled in the wilderness than in the towns and cities. Many of them aren't dangerous. Though there's no denying that amongst them there are those who are deranged and eager to satisfy their lowest instincts.

Indeed. We have a few rooms for travellers, but most are reserved for those coming to supply our family's worker camps. 

Let me tell you, we buy a lot of alcohol. We also sell leather and some precious stones found by chance by the miners.

Replies.Content: How are the minerals transported from the region's mines to Giltanbourg?

Dialogs.Content:
Oh the usual Gantras fauna. There's a few ogres, some abnormally aggressive bears, and a few other rarer creatures. I'm not really an expert.

My family, the Luxuras, pays out a fortune to train certain family members so that they can protect our workers themselves. And before you ask, no, I don't think they're looking to hire for the role.

However, if you are interested in scouting contracts, I might have some of the work for you in a few days.

Mainly by caravans pulled by Argistant horses. You might have come across them in your travels. They're small, but extremely muscular. They usually have silvery coats with darker manes. Beautiful beasts!

Everyone is welcome here! Though I should warn you that the prices are lower for members of the Luxuras family and their workers. Since I've never seen you at Uncle Samvee's place, I'm guessing you're not related to me. But hey, nobody is perfect!

Replies.Content: I take it that you've settled here principally to support your family's workers.
Tell me Yassine, what are the dangers of the region?
Are there a lot of bandits in the area?

Name: Buralin Point
Description: Partially concealed by shrubs and rocks, there is a small wooden dock. On the beach near the wharf, there are the wrecks of small boats. A stone ring from a campfire between a few tents suggests that people slept here just days ago.

Name: Camp of the Wild Boar
Description: Once used as a hunting and logging camp, the place now appears to service researchers and wildlife enthusiasts. A few young men and women study stones, bones and plants precisely arranged on a central table surrounding by leather tents.

Dialogs.Content: For the time being, our studies are focused on the behaviour of the local wildlife. Several village folk have reported rather unpleasant encounters with aggressive animals. That would not be out of the realm of normal animal behaviour were we experiencing a period of famine. But that is not the case.

Replies.Content: Any ideas as to what event caused their change in behaviour?

Dialogs.Content: I hope you're not here to cause trouble. We are scientists and pacifists whose only adversaries are ignorance and barbarism.

Replies.Content: Do you have a problem with foreigners?
What can you tell me about your research?

Dialogs.Content: Not at all, only with those who live by the sword. You may not realise if you always move from seigneury to seigneury, but your actions have real consequences. Perhaps you do not see the spectre of chaos following you as your own shadow.

Replies.Content: I sense you have a story to tell.

Dialogs.Content:
*Thinsac takes his time to answer, seemingly choosing his words carefully.

I don't want to accuse the count of anything, but there seems to be a connection between the work done to prepare for his daughter's wedding and the origins of the animal attacks in the area.

Perhaps the count's workers killed more beasts than they should have to prepare for the festivities. This could have catalysed an imbalance in the ecological system of the seigneury. Though, it seems unlikely to me.

My feeling is that someone or something has introduced an animal species that has disturbed the natural balance of the food chain. However, I have no evidence to support my theory... yet.

* Thinsac seems to hesitate.

I might have a job for you, but I don't know if I can trust you. Come back to me when you have gained the confidence of more people in the area.

Maybe someday I'll tell you it. But if you've listened to my words, then I've taught you enough for one day.

* Thinsac frowns.

Here is a simple warning. The folks at Larcen are not as defenceless as they may appear and you may end up with a dagger stuck in your back for refusing to pay a fair price at the hostel.

Name: Fortress of the Rose
Description: Built into the natural walls of the mountain, this vast fortified domain watches over the entire region. Dozens of men and women can be seen entering and exiting the stronghold at all times. On flag poles stretching high above the principal manor, fly the banners of Gantras as well as those of the illustrious Protectors of the Rose.

Dialogs.Content: Being well-armoured is a priority for the Protectors of the Rose. The armoury always needs new gear for recruits.
Protectors of the Rose use temporary encampments to provide refuge and aid for citizens in need.
*You approach the bulletin board, which displays requests for help from citizens of the realm...
Fortress renovations require more materials than was originally planned for.

The authorities in Gantras are looking for an escort for young Bilina. The girl's parents, Hobil and Forana, died while on patrol in the Grnkorbar Mountains. Bilina must be escorted to Thorval where her aunt can take care of her.
Being well equipped in armor is a priority for the people of the Rose. The armory always needs new parts for its paladins.
Being well equipped in armour is a priority for the people of the Rose. The armoury constantly needs new gear for its knights.
A botanist needs an escort to protect her from the dangers of the Arkzoun Mountains.
Scouts have reported a pack of vargr worgens that have moved a little too close to the Fortress of the Rose. A reward is promised to any adventurer who scares them away.

Residents.Name: Florentina Goldcoin

Dialogs.Content: This is the principal fortress of the Protectors of the Rose. We are an order dedicated to protecting commoners and less fortunate citizens. We occasionally help the wealthy too, though they are far from our priority.

Replies.Content: You obey the duchy or the Crown, I suppose?
What can you tell me about the region?
Can you teach me new fighting techniques?

Dialogs.Content: Absolutely not. We're a paramilitary organisation. We don't give out strategic information to civilians or random adventurers. It could put us in danger.

To be completely honest, the majority of our donations are received after we've done a service to an individual or community.  Though you'd be surprised, some wealthy people do know how to be generous without expecting anything in return.

Replies.Content: How do you get along with the local authorities? Do your services cover the entire country?

Dialogs.Content:
So much the better, these damned cylmos are causing a lot of trouble to the people of Gantras. I'm amazed that the rulers of the duchy are not more effective at neutralizing their threat.

Even if you're not officially a Protector of the Rose, I'll grant you access to our bulletin board, displaying requests for help from citizens of the realm. You aren't authorized to operate on behalf of the guild, of course, but it's to be expected that we cannot send a titled knight to deal with every request from the populace.

I have good news. An old friend of mine, a former Knight of the Rose, has agreed to take on your mentorship.

I invite you to visit him. You will find him in the Fort Ciloucan in the great Thousandshirts Plain.

May the sun shine upon on your journey. Good luck!

I've always been a hard-hitter, and I have a particular penchant for hammers and maces.

In case you're looking for someone to teach you more about those weapons, I'd really like to share my knowledge with you.

I feel safer knowing that Protectors are properly trained before their missions.

Replies.Content: That would be an honour, thank you.

Dialogs.Content:
Protection is our speciality. So, we're often sought after to escort people through the lordships. As long as their cause is noble, we accept.

In answer to your question, there are indeed times when we're unable to send a guild member out on a mission. It just so happens that I have one such escort mission that would be fitting for a "mercenary" like you.

In Gantras, our work is generally well accepted, although some militiamen are hesitant to share information with us. We try to keep our interventions outside Giltanbourg.

People can communicate with us all across the country using birds that we've trained. We also have a secondary fortress somewhere in Ordval, as well as other camps dotted around. We're better able to respond to long-standing problems than to emergencies.

Replies.Content: Don't you want to tell me where your secondary fortress is?

Dialogs.Content:
Very good.

Should you have time to participate in other such work, I have a rather special "client".

The people of Korllights Academy are asking us to release oryctorans in the mountains of Arwen. Seems that doing so may help to control the population of cylmos.

Replies.Content: A little odd, but let's do it.

Dialogs.Content:
The fortress surroundings are completely free of threats. It's safe to say that our presence frightens robbers and any creatures with the intelligence to know the danger that awaits them.

If you venture a little further into the mountains, you may come across some mountain vargrs and large rocs.

We're a completely independent organisation. We've been around for more than three centuries, financed largely by citizens' donations and gifts. Though donors are strictly prohibited from asking for favours in return.

Replies.Content: That sounds nave to me. Donors will expect to receive some benefit in exchange for their donations.

Dialogs.Content: We welcome all travellers to the inner courtyard, but it is forbidden to enter the mansion's interior and the guard towers.

Replies.Content: The oryctoran seems to be effective.
What is your weapon of choice?

Dialogs.Content:
Only if you're worthy of it.

We teach our members myriad techniques to help them protect themselves from their opponents' attacks. A Protector's mission is to defend the weakest, therefore they must be able to hold their own and hold strong 'til combat's end.

Ah, one of our veterans is retiring. The problem is that given his rank, we have to provide him with a coat of arms made of elorinal, a rare metal of which there is no longer an operating mine.

If you find some in your adventures, we'd offer a very special training course in exchange.

Replies.Content: It will be an honour to help you.

Dialogs.Content:
I'm afraid we still haven't found a mentor for you.

Still, we have a lot of work here in which we would benefit from your aid.

Replies.Content: It would be an honour to help you.

Dialogs.Content:
Ah yes, I received the report! You are now considered a Squire of the Order. Which means that you're a prospect to become a Protector of the Rose. 

Your last missions have allowed you to forge a bond of trust with us. Congratulations!

The next step will be to become a Companion, a full member of the order. We'll contact you as soon as we find a volunteer to take care of your education. In the meantime, you should follow our trainings.

Evidently. All those who pose a threat to the common people are our enemies.

I guess your question was more about our relationship with other factions of Pireiria. In that case, I would say without hesitation that the Order of the Hippogriff is our most constant source of trouble.

I understand that many of their assassins believe they're acting for the greater good, but in reality they're nothing more than over-trained hit men. Vermin!

My superiors are also investigating the activities of the Cult of Nephyria. I only know the group by name, but it seems their goal is to bring back a legendary demon trapped in the Mists.

Residents.Greets: All benevolent travellers can rest here!

Name: Scarlet Creek
Description: A substance you don't recognize has dyed the creek's water and rocks a deep red. The absence of oxidised dust in the vicinity leaves the curious flummoxed.

Name: Miblosa Sheepfold
Description: The sheepfold wouldn't normally strike you as an affluent location, yet you notice that the buildings are state-of-the-art. Outside, there are large fenced pastures protecting the animals from weather, poachers, and local predators.

Dialogs.Content: *The donkey is for sale.

Replies.Content: I would like to buy this donkey.

Dialogs.Content: *To buy the animal, you must have a place in your domain to house it.

Bah, if you continue on the path, you'll arrive at the Manynotes Relay. Then to the south, there are strange old ruins where dew clings to the stones.

We never go inside Manynotes Forest, it seems very dangerous.

I've just told you, it's the perfect place to raise sheep!

* Zally pauses.

Hehehe. I joke. Frankly, the region is often bypassed. It's not particularly dangerous, though at night you have to watch out for oryctus. Fortunately, they don't have much interest in sheep!

For some time now, we've had new visitors. They're a group of warriors who have set up camp at the base of Fear Peaks. If their goal is to climb them, well, I can only wish them luck!

They're perhaps a little primitive, and a touch rustic, but they've never threatened us or anything. They don't appear to be from a band of bandits.

When the fiery-haired lady is with them, I always add a little more meat to their order to stay in their good graces.
That's how I'd describe it. I think she's their boss. I wish I had as much energy as her.
Zally's family uses many types of shoe in their work with sheep. A situation which isn't aided by the sheep's tendency to chew through leather. Can you provide them with the right shoes today?
Welcome to Prettybard Plain! The perfect place to raise sheep!

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the surroundings?

Dialogs.Content: Yes indeed! When the sun is shining, I like to walk around the edge of Manynotes and gaze upon the small animals of the forest.

Name: Grandwind Caravanserai
Description: Located in the heart of the Brumedor Plains, an eclectic group of colourful caravans forms a semi-permanent camp.

Dialogs.Content:
Why of course! You couldn't keep me away from those magnificent views! I tend to visit a few times per year. 

We have strong relations with Charles Eouwettu. In fact, his cousin is one of our local Caravaneers. If you're headed up that way again, would you bring a package to Charles from his cousin? 

You'll need some kind of transport animal, it's not exactly a small parcel.
Welcome, fellow traveller!

Replies.Content: Are you from the Lunar Caravan?
I've come to work with you.
Do you have any jobs for me?
Have you ever been to the top of the Ridiculous Mountains?

Dialogs.Content:
Since you ask...

Do you know Jill? Bill's Jill? That is to say, Jill daughter of Bill? No? Well she sprained her ankle while fleeing from a troll roaming the plains.

She'll be fine, but she's the main breadwinner for her family. Could you cover her hunting and gathering while she recovers?

This is a competition between our teenagers. They build land boats that move forward with large sails.

The children of the Dolmono family are building a particularly imposing machine this year.

I think they're going to run out of fabric!
Visit the Elder Council to learn about the history and ways of the group. The Caravaneers do not write their stories, but as they make their clothes, they spin their tales as well as their yarn.
That's right. Please, excuse us for this welcome. Things haven't been pretty of late, we've had a lot of trouble with the people of Larcen.

Name: Issaya Shipyard
Description: Many craftsmen and engineers work valiantly on ship frames of various sizes. Amidst the cacophony of labourers' shouts, wood sanding, and seabirds, workers try with great effort to haul a recently sunken boat from the water under the panicked gaze of their foreman.

Dialogs.Content:
Haha! Indeed! Nor do I have time to teach you. It doesn't take more than one look at those weapons to see they're not fit for carving wood, and I don't think that armour would give you much protection against splinters either.

I need someone I trust, or at least someone who is not from here, to investigate the site. I'm sure that these events cannot simply be down to chance.

Come see me again later, for now I have to refloat this sunken ship...

* Olivieri seems visibly surprised by your presence.

Oh! Sorry, I didn't notice you. I thought... baah... forget it! Who are you?

Replies.Content: Just a simple traveller. If I understand correctly, then this is not the first ship to sink after being launched?

Dialogs.Content:
Hmff! Yes, you understand alright! It's the third in two months, even though they're always inspected a few hours before being put into operation.

*Oliveri is watching you closely. He visibly hesitates before asking you a few questions.

You're not from here, are you? Are you looking for work?

Replies.Content: I'm not sure I have time to build you a new ship.

Dialogs.Content: Mother of pearl! Another ship becomes fish food!

Replies.Content: That boat looks a little dull, no?

Dialogs.Content:
I say! Well, I do need a good idea for a figurehead to give it a bit of character. I need something really... legendary.

Hopefully, that will keep it from sinking when launched.

Replies.Content: I can take care of that.

Name: Dar'hon's Perch
Description: A gigantic perch constructed from thousands of bones taken from Dar'hon's victims. From the top of the perch, you have a breath-taking view of the mountains of Frokilkador and Sigolnorka. But, you're not here to admire the scenery, are you?

Name: Banks of Laematsu
Description: You have arrived on Laematsu Island. A powerful sense of tranquillity reigns over the place.

Name: Watchman's Armoury
Description: Hidden at the end of an alley, the boutique workshop is simply built. A few craftsmen work in a line constructing some solid looking armour.

Residents.Name: Corralia Sikol

Dialogs.Content:
Our armoury supplies all the major towns in the region. We make a model and a mould for a suit of armour and then all the guards on the continent use it.

If you're not coming to pick up a city's order, you probably don't need to be here.

Replies.Content: I would like to learn how to craft armour like that.

Dialogs.Content: Oh certainly! Let me just reveal all my production secrets to you! Funny, stranger... get out of here!
Which seigneury have you come from?

Residents.Greets:
Two and three, left a bit... right! Okay then, here...

... Oh hello! Welcome to the Watchman's Armoury!

Name: Manynotes Relay
Description: The relay is built between two giant melizes. The interior of the building is particularly warm, and a good number of travellers rest here.

Dialogs.Content: Interesting. I'm going to need a comfortable place to study and practice my art. What can you offer me?
I came back empty handed from my last adventure, how about you?

Replies.Content: I'm preparing a team for a special adventure. Would you like to join us?

Name: Fortress of the Deserters
Description: Twenty years ago, West-Gantras fought a war of independence with the rest of the duchy. Refugees, mostly hunters and loggers, fled south of the Slow River to avoid the conflict. Determined to protect themselves, they restored a stone fortress at the summit of the mountain.

Dialogs.Content:
We're at the Fortress of the Deserters. In fact, the name is rather poorly chosen. A few years ago Emelia Piercegold tried to assemble all the brigands of the western part of Gantras.

Since they were no match for Gantras's forces, their warlords attempted to force the hunters and farmers to fight for them. To avoid being drafted into a conflict that they had no stake in, several groups crossed the Slow River.

When they arrived here, they discovered the ruins of a tower which they restored and inhabited for a few years until peace was restored. My grandfather was one of these so-called "deserters".

What interests me most is who built the tower originally and for what purpose.
[Dev] Small quest to help Yank do research. Could be relatively high level and give a cool loot. It might also unlock a small dungeon.
What irony! I paid a handful of mercenaries to protect me during my research at the fortress, and instead they deserted me, leaving me in peril!

Replies.Content: Unfortunate! Perhaps I can replace them.

Name: Larfungel
Description:
Nobody expects to find a crashed boat in the middle of a forest, far from the sea. Judging by its design and propellers, it is almost certainly an airship prototype from Strata Obseka.

Composed primarily of three floating islands, Strata Obseka is one of the three provinces of Pireiria.

Dialogs.Content:
I first visited Larfungel a few years ago, and always knew I'd like to come back here. I am an archaeologist, archivist and explorer driven by curiosity. I listen to the rumours and gossip of peasants wherever I go. Then I investigate to discern if there is some truth behind the tales. 

The rumours that currently lead me towards Kortombe are much darker and much stranger than this ship. I don't want to talk about them until I know more lest I become a propagator of gossip myself.
The work of Strata Obseka engineers is simply fascinating!

Indeed, people too often struggle to distinguish the false from the true.

I remember meeting people who believe in the existence of a secret cult whose vision was to control the world. Ha! Ha! Ludicrous!

Besides, everyone knows that one day the whole continent will be controlled by witch kittens conducting spells of manipulation from beyond the stars. It's obvious.

You probably know that Strata Obseka is one of the three provinces of Pireiria. But you may not know that it is also where the best engineers in the country are trained, perhaps even the best on the continent!
Antonine does more than defend me against brigands and wild beasts, she also takes part in research.

For several generations, the Strata Obsekiens have been trying to create the perfect aerial boat. They have managed to design one that allows them to commute between the three islands and descend to the mainland, but they have not yet succeeded in making vessels that can travel long distances. The Larfungel is their attempt that has travelled furthest from the islands.

As you can see, its first flight was neither complete failure nor complete success. Certainly not the landing.
From memory, it crashed in the year 185, so it's been here exactly 13 years. It was built by the talented architect-engineer Nicolas Vendor, in case you were interested.

I am Antonine Bentro, niece of the baroness. Normally, I do not live in the seigneury, but sometimes I return to visit my family.

By profession, I am a bodyguard, explorer and archaeologist. The rest does not concern you, stranger.
It is a prototype flying boat built in the Strata Obseka archipelago. I don't know when it crashed here, but it must have been at least 10 years ago.
Participating, yes, you could say that. I have some knowledge of ancient languages.
What he means to say is that he cannot stand falsehoods and fakeries.
I accompany Aloysius on his expeditions. He has essentially been my employer for more than two years. There are a great many dangers on the roads, especially for a man who will not handle weapons.
Thanks for the clarification. I'll rest easily tonight knowing that I'm a little bit smarter.
If you have come here in the hopes of recovering valuables from the ship's wreckage, you are far too late. Scavengers first passed through here several years ago.

Name: Banks of the Thaumaturge
Description: The earth forming the banks of the Thaumaturge River has a pretty purple colour due to its rich mineral composition.

Name: Path of Mud
Description: According to local legend, a solid mud path crosses the swampland all the way to the Isle of Tortaumort. The problem is that if you set just one foot outside the path, the entire path will sink into the thick dark swamp.

Name: Entrance to Trolgobeth
Description: You are in front of the entrance to a dark and mysterious cave. You can hear the rumble of a waterfall in the darkness.

Dialogs.Content:
Yes, yes. It is only a small cave of no real significance. Go ahead, I'm following you.

*Sorka appears hesitant to share more details with you.
*Sorka seems very nervous.
Hi it's me!
I request this item!
*Grrrrr
Ma specs!

Name: Woodland traps
Description: As Cedric had foreseen, poachers have lain traps here and there to catch oryctus and partridges despite the barony's formal ban.

Name: Golden Mound
Description: A fine dust the colour of gold covers almost the entirety of this mound. The nature of the mineral residue is difficult to identify, but someone who could exploit the vein would surely make a fortune... should they survive the dangers of the region.

Name: South Gate of Giltanbourg
Description: The gate is closed. Well-armed guards prevent some people from passing.

Dialogs.Content: No, I don't recognize your face.

Replies.Content: It's impossible for you to recognize every single visitor!

Dialogs.Content: I believe so, yes, we have a description of you in the files. Follow me to the barracks.
Show me your face!

Hey! Who do you think you are? We undergo several years of tutelage to train our minds to recognize the thousands of people with right-of-access to the city.

Now, get lost!

Name: Heroes Fort
Description: {Guilde-Guerrier, haut-niveau}

Name: Snake Mine
Description: Snake Mine is not open to explorers and adventurers. Heavily armed Gantras guards protect the entrance. A small building nearby deals with visitors.

Dialogs.Content: By decree of the duchy and on the recommendation of the supreme wisdom of the Duke of Gantras, the authorities authorize the following exchange for the needs of the mine and the betterment of the realm.
By decree of the duchy and the whole shebang, the team on the twenty-third level of the mine could really do with some new tools. Please endeavour to deliver within three days.

By decree of the duchy and on the recommendation of the supreme wisdom of the Duke of Gantras, the authorities authorize the following exchange for the needs of the mine and the betterment of the realm. The team on the thirty-second floor of the mine require a full load of gurdismo in order to construct a supportive pillar in a waterlogged cavern.
* You approach the bulletin board, which amidst its protracted ducal decrees contains bulletins on ore and orders...

Name: Shaunessie Tower
Description: A small wooden tower has been erected on the highest hill overlooking Janrek Creek. A huge lantern has been installed at the top of the structure. Someone is definitely using the tower as a private lighthouse.

Residents.Name: Breezie Moon

Dialogs.Content: Kind of you to keep me company on this rather chilly night.

Replies.Content: You don't look like one of the hop workers.

Dialogs.Content:
The compliment is mutual.

*Breezie bursts into a lovely laugh which harmonizes with the sounds of the waves and sea winds.

Fear not, I'm neither pirate nor smuggler. However, I have no desire to tell you more just now. Perhaps another night under another moon.

Residents.Greets: May the night smile upon you!

Name: Ladder of Roots
Description: A strange ladder made of writhing woven roots leads up into another cave.

Name: Pillar of the Prophetess
Description:
According to legend, it was on this pillar that a woman of resplendent beauty met explorers skilled enough to reach her. Today, next to a female skeleton, there is a symbol traced onto a rock. It is difficult to read by daylight.

[N] On the rocks, alchemical symbols glow with a faint light. A decaying woman sits on a ghostly throne, her expression peaceful as she reads from an invisible tome.

[Dev] important quest giver for magic

Dialogs.Content: The ignorant are not welcome here!

Replies.Content: How can I prove that I am not an ignoramus?

Dialogs.Content:
* Ignassa loses interest in you then returns to her invisible book.

[DEv] there could be a quest to decipher the message that goes from there and then it gives other quests allowing players to get high level cool stuff
* Ignassa points her long spindly fingers towards the illuminated symbols engraved on the rock.

Name: Farm of the Honourable
Description: Located on the shores of Lake Gargagoth, the farm is one of the best kept you have ever seen. The plants are pruned and arranged with meticulous symmetry.

Name: Sorka's Camp
Description: A simple, temporary camp has been set up on the side of the cliff. A campfire crackles and pops as its flames flicker in the breeze.

Residents.Name: Sorka Simik

Dialogs.Content: What brings you here?

Replies.Content: I've already completed a few quests.

Dialogs.Content:
Calm down, you...

*Sorka bursts into hearty laughter

Ah, I'm disappointed...

* Sorka bursts into one of her classic laughs.

Ah yes. You know, I've heard what they've been saying about you in town. It's safe to say you even have a few admirers.

But it takes a little more than that to impress me.

Anyway, I have good friends who are interested in you, they asked me to give you some challenges and check if you are up to the task.

Join me on my mattress.

*Sorka awaits your reaction with a big smile.

Replies.Content: This is my sort of challenge.
That is not the kind of adventure I had in mind.

Dialogs.Content:
Yes, let me check my journal for the quests that have been around for too long.

*Sorka appears to have a gigantic quest log.

Ah yes, here is a task that I would do without. Do you like night walks?

Ah really?! Wow! I hope I didn't miss out on something spectacular. I'll have to go and see for myself sometime.

You know, I'm starting to find you to my liking. How about a night time mountain getaway together?

Replies.Content: I would like that very much.

Dialogs.Content:
Great, I've always had a soft spot for that guy's nose.

Finn has always loved fairy tales. So I have something for you both. There is a magic fountain in the Salamander Marshes. It is said that if you bring the remains of the swampshark there, the spirit of the swamp will show you great power.

In my opinion, that's all a load of rubbish. But you've got a vigour for adventure, the quest is yours if you want it.

I'll stop the teasing.

This story of friends is more or less true, it's my initiative. But when I have enough confidence in you, I could invite you to meet a special group to which I belong.

Nah, I like you but I like working alone better.

I have a friend named Finn who likes adventure but doesn't like the pressure of leadership. If you see him, he might be interested in your offer.

Once you meet him, come and pay me a visit.

Residents.Greets: I recognize your face... or your butt, hard to say.

Dialogs.Content:
The mask! Keep it on you until we know if it's cursed...

...uh...

...I mean I have to be able to fight without being encumbered. You will give it back to me later at my camp.
Well, that was easy. Do you need more or are we done?

This area is called the Troll Plateau. I imagine you know why?

No, there are no trolls under the bridge! Besides, the bridge is broken. Someone will have to help poor Ulrick with that, but that's another story.

As I was saying, the place is called that because there once was a troll king living here. This king was defeated by an ancient hero of Kortombe. But, the cave where he lived has survived the tests of time.

I know many adventurers visit this cave to find ancient artefacts. Would you like to visit it with me?

Wouldn't be such a bad first date, would it?

Replies.Content: I would be honoured to go with you.

Dialogs.Content:
Ha! Ha! Ha!

That's the adventurous spirit that I love! Come back to me when you've seen the cave entrance.

Wow! Can you imagine if there had been a hundred like that!

*Sorka looks nervously towards the lake for a few moments.

Our plan worked! The others won't come. Everyone to the chest!
Ha! You survived your big dangerous trip to the forest.

Replies.Content: Very funny. Hey, I'm looking for shards of glass...

Dialogs.Content:
Such a grand quest! I understand, I'm glad someone is picking up all this debris that so-called adventurers leave everywhere.

*You explain that you need the glass to repair something.

Oh I see, not just a selfless deed then? I take it that means you're with the old fool who stays endless hours at the Throne of the Troll waiting for god knows what?

Well, I like you anyway. And I have a proposal that might interest you.

What a thrilling adventure! I apologize for the smell, but I really needed someone to be the bait.

*Sorka gives you a cheeky wink.

Rest assured that I had everything planned out! I bought a very powerful soap from the druid Maratatinus so you can remove the smell of water snakes.

Well, I'd love to help you wash, really, but I promised to return this mask as soon as possible. I need to leave for Larcen right now.

Good luck on all your future adventures!

*You watch Sorka leave and begin to wash off the lingering stench.

Residents.Name: Sorka Simik

Dialogs.Content: Bah! Don't listen to me then, it'll be even more entertainment for me.

Sure, but it's much less entertaining.

Okay, if you want the right gear, I believe there is a camp of a missing adventurer near here, where you could find clothes, weapons or other tools to use. Go ahead and I will give you one of my quarterstaves to reward your efforts.

Replies.Content: I'm not sure I trust you.
Thank you. I'm leaving as we speak.

Dialogs.Content:
*A rabbit cooks quietly on a fire near a small leather tent. A woman of undetermined age plays the zither while waiting for the meal to be ready.

Well, well! Dressed as you are, you must be on your way to a ball. No self-respecting adventurer would dare to explore a forest without being well prepared.

Replies.Content: Where I come from, there are no such dense forests.

Dialogs.Content: Oh! I guess there is no rain, sun, wind, or bandits either? Because frankly, unless you plan to live among the blades of grass, you seem very ill-prepared for... anything!

Replies.Content: Can you help me instead of making fun of me?

Dialogs.Content:
Okay, you're entertaining but I have an adventure to complete. If you need to rest, you are free to use my camp.

But don't touch my mattress!

Residents.Greets: Do not hide, I only bite if asked.

Name: Fenrigan's Lair
Description: Corpses of antelopes and warthogs lie in front of the entrance to a huge burrow made from stones and branches. No bird sings in the vicinity for fear of aggravating the master of that deadly burrow. The smell of fresh blood hangs in the air.

Dialogs.Content:
We thank you, from the depths of our hearts!

*Orea glances in the direction of the corpse of the fourth alchemist. A dark cloud crosses her face.

I'll take care of telling Edgar's parents of his passing... trying to become a better alchemist.

*Orea looks towards her companions, though, exhausted, they do not meet her gaze.

Replies.Content: It's probably time to return to Alcheran.

Dialogs.Content: Awesome! We're ready when you are!

Replies.Content: I have to check my gear before I go.

Dialogs.Content: Okay. I'll tend to my comrades' injuries in the meantime.

*Orea nods absently.

We will need your help. I'm sure Wynael will reward you amply.

Name: Cave of the Gatherers
Description: A foul, green gas constantly escapes from this horrifying cave. The corpses of humans and animals hang from a dozen spikes stuck in the stone near the entrance. A huge, evil-looking troll guards the cave while petting a very large lizard.

Name: Mistwalkers' Fort
Description: You can feel the presence of the Mist in the surroundings. The fortress is built on ancient ruins with architecture strangely reminiscent of that of Valsonge. In the centre of the fort stands a Misthouse that looks just like the one in your domain.

Dialogs.Content:
Indeed. It's a family as large as it is old. Their main bloodline holds influence throughout Pireiria.

That said, many who carry their name no longer have the slightest connection with the noble families.

It is said that many family names such as Corneil, Colvum, and Covrus are also descendants of the same line.

Some branches of their sprawling family tree have changed their name intentionally, to avoid association with the Corvus line.

Blimey, you make me thirsty with all your questions.
Oi oi, Ryks, mate! I need to meet Sir Baloin on some urgent business.

*Badouk throws a shocked look at the man-at-arms.

Ryks, who's the new guy? Looks like you forgot to provide him with a tabard.

*Badouk does not wait for an answer.

Well, so be it! Thanks a lot, Ryks! We'll wait for your official letter of summons.

Don't take this the wrong way, but it's a little less gloomy here than in your domain.

I don't suppose you're thinking of moving your domain out of the Mists anytime soon?

Hurmm, interesting. I'd bet a few beers though that they came at the request of Tarul or Celeste.

I don't see the Corvus leading such a direct attack on Kortombe. But their help will cost Tarul dearly, I wouldn't have made that choice.

...

Well, what do I know, I'm just a drunken adventurer. Hahaha!

Replies.Content: Are there several Corvus families? I've met some on my adventures.
Might the Corvuses be playing a double game?

Dialogs.Content:
*Badouk shrugs his shoulders.

Aren't nobles always double crossing? It seems entirely possible.

Tarul has been having trouble with fake witch hunters arriving in his lordship in large numbers. They are in fact mercenaries, or rather, marauders.

I know those kinds of people all too well. They're paid by someone to destabilize an area before a delicate military or political operation occurs.

But... I've never seen an operation of this magnitude. We're not talking about a petty lordly quarrel here, Kortombe itself is the target.
It sure is nice here.

Replies.Content: Tarul Verdant wanted to talk to you?

Dialogs.Content:
Ha! Ha! Ha!

Right, so what were we talking about?

Ah yes! So am I right in thinking that the story interests you because you need to know if those of Valsonge are involved?

I have a great contact in Wellnear who could shed some light on the matter.
The old git is right... uh... my apologies! I meant Leonidas is right! I had one ale too many. Sorry!

* You approach the bulletin board. *

* A note explains that Leonidas and his team are being retained by the team of developers at Mist Legacy. Check back later... *

At the moment I already have someone with the Protectors of the Rose in the Duchy of Gantras. While the Order of the Hippogriff seems a little too dangerous to approach right now.

If you attempt to join either of those guilds, it will be on your own behalf, not as a Mistwalker.

And finally...

... there's the Cult of Nephyria. Now isn't the time to go into detail on them, but know that you will want to take great care to hide your Mist Lantern from their members.

If you're looking for some big bad villains in your life, you may have found your ideal candidates.
I don't have unlimited time in this world, hurry up.

Your best bet is to participate in important events with other Mistwalkers.

That's especially true with rifts. If there are multiple Walkers repelling a creature from the Mists, the veil tends to crystallize more actively.
Actually, that's what I've been thinking...

No, you're one of the few who walk this far. Many do not survive the passage. Some return to Valsonge where they're asked to keep their experience secret.

Others give up their Lanterns and try to become citizens of the world without Mist. A small group of such people have settled south of the Algent Plateau. They're harmless, but it's always disappointing to lose future Walkers.

This name, or rather this title, means something to me, but I can't remember.

Could you try to find out more?

Curse these old bones! I'm too late! 

As soon as I heard the fighting, I rushed to your aid. I could see the second group moving to steal the artefact once the fight began but you couldn't hear my warning calls over the clashing of blades. 

I have a bad feeling about all of this.
I'm listening.

Replies.Content: The Circle of the Great Tree?

Dialogs.Content:
*You recount your adventure to Leonidas.

I see. I believe the victims were neither Walkers nor inhabitants of Valsonge. I believe they were... prisoners of the Mists.

Instinctively, I draw a parallel with the investigation you conducted with the Circle of the Great Tree.

We will have to investigate further. I shall dwell on the matter, then we shall talk of it again.

As strange as it may sound, there exists a theory which claims the world of Mists and Valsonge should not exist at all. That all of this is the result of a natural cataclysm or a cataclysmic error.

This is why it is so necessary to learn more about the rifts, portals and creatures of the Mists... to be able to make the right choice.

One of my Mistwalkers told me he saw Corvus family troops heading towards Kortombe.

They arrived by boat from Maliken, as far as we know.

I suspect you've already dealt with them without realising it. The young Sorka likes to camp near the Throne of the Troll where I meet new Mistwalkers.
