For Caravaneers, life is an adventure! They preach the nomadic life and the joys of seizing upon our free will. By rubbing shoulders with them, you will learn plenty about survival in the world outside the Mists.

At the top of the Ridiculous Mountains, you'll discover the ideal spot to make your introduction.

Ah, I see you looked at my training list!

Basically, these are expansions to your Misthouse that allow you to harvest resources in Myriaden. Depending on the quality of the materials you use, you will be able to harvest better resources.

Don't be fooled by the rustic appearance of these constructions, they are high-tech buildings of the Mists. The majority of materials are used in the directoflux pipe that goes to your Misthouse. So, prepare to invest thousands of resources if you want to use these devices.
Welcome to my home.

Replies.Content: What do the Mistwalkers actually do?
How can I help the Mistwalkers?
Tarul Verdant told me you know a certain Badouk Brank.
I have information on the Rufgarr victims.
The Collector, does that mean anything to you?

Dialogs.Content:
I haven't been able to find out who the author of the missive is...

It would be very irresponsible not to alert the people of Kortombe.

But, I must confess that I have no idea who... or if, a doppelganger has infiltrated the barony as well. It may just be a classic spy.

You have worked a lot with the people of Kortombe, I would like you to take care of this file.

*You recount the story of the Kofo-Lun to Leonidas.

Interesting...

Replies.Content: What do you think of my news of the Maelstorm?

Dialogs.Content:
I find the Circle especially interesting. They practice vitalism, a magic linked to all that is alive. One could be forgiven for supposing their objective is the protection of the forest. In fact, their objective is to protect all natural life, us included, from corruption. Though as a result, their choices are not always appreciated by societies looking to capitalise on nature's riches.

I know that they are currently investigating the corruption of certain places in Ordval. We should ensure that isn't related to the Veil of Mists.

You may have already met a certain Mana... Nara... no... Maratatinus? Well, one of their members is at the Ancestor. That's the giant tree located in Kortombe. No doubt he could introduce you to the guild.

You are in my old domain, the one that the authorities of Valsonge assigned to me many moons ago. Unlike the other domains, I was designated a ruin lost amid the Mists. My task was to explore it and secure its surroundings by repelling the Mists as much as possible.

I had also undertaken to explore the ruin's subterranean passages. That's where the accident happened.

Finally, you should probably know that my domain is now halfway between the two worlds. Though as of yet, we do not know exactly why or how that has come to be.

Replies.Content: Do all the Mistwalkers follow you?

Dialogs.Content: *Leonidas frowns at Badouk, more shocked than offended, but says nothing.

Your question is, at least, direct.

The picture I painted for you at the Throne of the Troll was a cute one. The wise old wizard helping the greenhorn adventurer will always be an irresistible introduction.

But in truth, the reality is quite grave.

Valsonge may be about to be destroyed in its entirety. And there is something in the Mists that, for the good of us all, should remain there. 

All of this is linked to our ancestors, the mysterious founders of Valsonge. I struggle to believe their goal was just to found a city in the Mists.

Replies.Content: You didn't really answer my question.
What do you do with the Mist shards?

Dialogs.Content:
This information is by far the most important that you have brought to me so far.

It would be easy to believe that a Whirlwind of Mist like this could be where Valsonge is hidden, but the desert environment does not match Valsonge's climate. My observations of the climate have always led me to believe that Valsonge was located in the north of the continent.

One thing is certain, we will soon have to visit the desert to discover the background of this story.
That's not a tale I'll tell you today. Sharing knowledge about what one finds in the Mists is strangely dangerous, as if the very purpose of the veil's existence is to censor ancient knowledge.

I do have a plan for you. You seem to have a special gift for being accepted by the people of the region.

I need someone who can gain the trust of the primary guilds of Ordval. I'm not asking you to enter the great sacred councils of each guild, just to forge a bond of trust with them.

In addition, the guilds will be able to teach you certain secret techniques which will be most useful for repelling monsters trying to get through the rifts.

Hilla Shadowbringer is a direct descendant of Arianna Skalda, so she may have inherited her powers.

Perhaps I am jumping to conclusions, and yet if a giant huge perch with a gigantic creature atop it has been discovered by neither you nor a full tribe of scouts... well it stands to reason that it's been hidden.

You will use your Lantern to peer into the Mists. If you find something, I will show you how to perform a wave of dissipation spell. You will need some shards.

In my opinion, you will have to be discreet if you visit Kortombe. We, along with all other Walkers, are new to Ordval's political landscape.

It's certain that if they need a scapegoat, we newcomers will be first in line.

You should have told me about her before. If you've met her in your adventures, she still lives!

Shadowbringer is a former council member of Valsonge. When I gave my presentations on the weakening of the Veil of the Mist, she seemed much more interested than the rest of the council.

All I managed to discover was that she ended up going to war with the other council members, which ended in her banishment.

I can't decide if she could now be part of the Cult of Nephyria or if she is trying to take advantage of her powers in this world.

Regardless, there are few people alive more dangerous than she. Should your path cross with hers again, be very, very wary.

I use them as currency. The reason is quite simple: I require them for my studies.

Shards crystallize when an event disrupts the Veil of Mists.

You have surely noticed that other Mistwalkers tell you of completing deeds which you have already completed? This is because our influence on the real world is limited and sometimes even erased by the Veil of Mists.

There are even important events, seemingly unrelated to the Mists, that still cause shards to appear. Such is the complexity of our reality.

Give me details!

*You explain to Leonidas that a creature had taken on the appearance of Sir Baloin de Wellnear and that in his clothes you found a coded message that he seems to have received from Kortombe.*

Unbelievable... so there could be other such creatures infiltrated into the nobility of the whole kingdom!?!?

Do you still have this letter???

Yes, the monsters from the rifts. I already told you about them. The border between the Mists and Myriaden is slowly crumbling. Rifts are the first holes in this boundary. The monsters that inhabit the Mists seize upon them as a chance to escape.

Alas, they have the same powers as the Mistwalkers. So even upon defeat, they can return to plague us again and again.

Yes, the Lucides, led by the magician Arianna Skalda. It's not yet known exactly what they did nor why they did it. But there are no traces of them in Myriaden, which seems most strange to me.

I still cannot connect all the dots in this constellation of conflicting stories about our ancestors. One of the primary objectives of the Walkers is to clarify the history of Valsonge and, above all, to know why it does not align at all with that of the rest of Myriaden.

The Arcanists practice a magic very close to what we learn in order to become Walkers. Because of this, you should be able to harness their magic in little time at all.

Their powers focus on the elements, like fire, water, and wind, rather than the Mists.

Still, they are a group that places an admirable value on knowledge and curiosity. My long-term goal would be to have them join with us on our quest to understand what is happening with the Veil of Mists. 

In the short term, however, you should visit the Haularken Hills to find Yolasula's home. She will instruct you on how to become a member of the Arcanists.

I'm afraid I have little information on them. I'd always thought they were a bunch of macho fools relishing in the opportunity to fight those who stood in their way.

That was until I met one of their captains who set up camp near our fort. It turns out that their roots stretch far back into our history. Perhaps you could learn more of their past? Some clues as to Valsonge's origins could be hidden in their ancient rituals.

But be prepared to fight to earn their respect.

Hmmm....

A story most interesting. Disturbing, even.

* Leonidas' face darkens.

I'll try to explain. This runic sealing is a rare procedure in our day and age. Whoever designed this lock either has highly advanced ancient knowledge... or they are toying with powerful magic that they do not comprehend. 

* Leonidas shrugs and his face becomes brighter again.

Actually, it doesn't really matter. And I know someone who can help you. Rhavina Delisle is a master runist. She lives in a small house near Raven Marsh.

Go see her and greet her for me. She owes me at least a few favours, so I'm sure she'll help you.

Sadly, they did not survive. Only my domain and Misthouse are still standing.

Speaking of my Misthouse, I'm currently working on recalibrating my portal. I wonder if ultimately it could bring the people of Valsonge here for a glimpse of the "outside" world.
The simple version is that we fend off the monsters of the Mists while seeking to discover why, or if, we should continue to do so.

Oh? Sir Verdant is looking for Badouk Brank?

I know Badouk well. He's no Walker, but he has worked for me a few times. He is knowledgeable, but sometimes lacks a little... common sense.

Badouk is currently carrying out a mission for me. It's one that concerns the Mists, so that should interest you. I don't know exactly where he is. Though knowing him, he will have stopped off for a beer or seven at the Biggoat Relay.

I've seen or heard that name before somewhere. By any chance is it the dumping ground for broken parts from the factory of Karal Ouloubek?

I would have assumed the place was lost to the Mists. Are you telling me you've found it? 

That's troubling. What I understand is that the Mists keep those kinds of places hidden. And yet you go and find it outside of the Mists... why?

I shall get back to you soon with a plan of action.

If the people of Kofo-Lun know of the existence of the perch, it is because it's not related to the Mists.

You must have noticed, places related to the Mists are always erased from memory. And when the Mists dissipate, places reappear from memories.

Unless...

Name: Scorpion Plateau
Description:
Hundreds of scorpions scamper in all directions on the small plateau at the cave's exit. Some of them fall into the water where they drown or transform into lobsters and hunt sea creatures. A few large arthropods have taken up residence in armour that once belonged to ancient adventurers.

[DEv] there might be some kind of invisible bridge there (need a spell, item etc) to see it. The bridge would make it possible to cross the fall. The principle of the object making the bridge appear could be reused a bit like the flute in certain zelda games.

Name: Edge of Norkantas
Description: The majestic Norkantas Forest stands in front of you. It is beautiful and terrifying in equal measure.

Name: Summoning Crystal
Description: In the center of a majestic room, you can see a crystal larger than the others. It is certain that at this size, it has a unique function.

Name: Mountainfoot Relay
Description: The relay is located at the beginning of Snake Valley. The place is clean,  organized, and, thanks to the protection of Gantras guards, secure.

Dialogs.Content:
In the name of a badly aged whiskey! You're back!

If I understand what you're saying correctly, the people who came out of the Mists were undead? This is all getting a bit complicated for little old me, I think you should talk to Leonidas about it again.

Ho, and well done for dealing with Gularzob. Without him, the Rufgarrs will have to hide in the squalor of the Lithofortress. A leader could have led their threat into the outside world. That could have ended badly for both Kortombe and Larcen alike.

Ah yes, I have an idea why. I'll get a message to him and then pay him a visit as soon as possible.

The mercenaries don't care about witches; their target is clearly someone more important.

I don't know what to expect from the next few weeks, but it will surely involve beer and fighting.

Probably at the same time.

Replies.Content: The knight, Tarul Verdant is looking for you.

Dialogs.Content: Sounds like a good idea for me. After all, it's important to squeeze in a little exercise between all the chicken thighs, beers, chocolate cake... and the other beers. I'll warn you though, my days of sleeping on floors are behind me. So I hope you have a respectable place where I can lay my head.
We still have work to do at the Lithofortress! One last quest demands our attention.

Replies.Content: What's going on at the Lithofortress?

Dialogs.Content:
It may not be of critical urgency, but the creatures of the Lithofortress have a new warchief who seems more cunning than the last. He even has a name, a clear improvement over his predecessors.

*Badouk thinks for a few seconds.

Gularzob, in case you were curious. And no, it wasn't my first time in the Lithofortress, but I've never faced so much... adversity. I think we must get rid of this little warlord before he gets too ambitious.

*A shadow crosses Badouk's worried face.

Oh yes! Come to think of it, Leonidas sent me into the tower to find some information about...

*Badouk inspects you from head to toe, then shakes his head nonchalantly.

... the cracks in the Mists. There have been rumours about... people coming out of the Mists in the fortress. It's sounds weird put like that, but if you could find any pertinent information, it would surely help Leonidas.

Replies.Content: That works for me. The world doesn't need another tyrant.

Dialogs.Content:
I'll be frank with you, I can barely walk right now. And no, it's not because of the alcohol. It pains me to say it, but go without me, I'll only slow you down.

If I were you, I'd find other Mistwalkers to help.

*With a tired look, the traveller signals you to sit down at his table.

You seem to be looking for someone. Judging by your attire, I'm guessing it's more likely someone of my ilk than someone in the employ of a relay.

*Irax gives you time to explain your story.

I know Badouk well... we've had a couple of trips to the inn together if you know what I mean... though those are probably not the adventures you're interested in.

Badouk wanted to know more about the Lithofortress. It appears he got wind that my team and I explored the place...

*Irax interrupts his speech to cough then runs his hand gently over his ribs.

Anyway, I showed him on my map where the fortress was. He thanked me through ale and an escort up here.

If you decide to follow in his footsteps, I advise you be well-accompanied and well-armed. The place is a death trap for inexperienced adventurers.
You'll need good contacts in the city to be able to enter. The laws of Gantras don't make life easy for traders. We're forced to run a lot of our operations out of town.

* Athuso points to a large crate reinforced with domane. He explains to you that the crate must be delivered to the Algent Plateau where it must be left in a specific location and that no questions should be asked.

For the most part, just bog-standard deliveries. Although our first cooperation has more of a... violent nature.

I rent a building here at the relay where I receive food to redistribute to my customers. 

Between the scratch marks and the growling, I'm confident a creature has made its home in the attic. It must be removed before it hurts an employee.

Replies.Content: I'll grab my weapons and take a look.

Dialogs.Content: Hmm. We could work together for a while. And if our cooperation works out, I'd be happy to recommend you as a potential guest of the city.
Sorry, stranger. I have no idea what that is. I'm not from the area, I'm a merchant from Gantras.
What do you want?

Replies.Content: I'm looking for a sanctuary belonging to the Circle.
I would like to enter Giltanbourg.
Do you have another job for me?
Do you have any courier work?

Dialogs.Content: I sure do. One of my convoys is attempting to pass through Knight Hills. We should go and give them a hand.

Replies.Content: I'll go, it's not far from here.

Dialogs.Content:
Stop! Don't say another word!

Those festivities gives me nightmares!

Name: Kortombe Market
Description:
[D]A dozen farmers, artisans and itinerant traders have positioned their goods in permanent stalls or temporary kiosks. The clientele are mainly retirees and women with their children. A few days a year, travelling buskers stop by Kortombe in the hope of collecting a few coins.

[N]After dark, the marketplace is almost deserted. Only a handful of militiamen making their rounds stop in the square.

Richer than its neighbours, the barony of Kortombe frequently welcomes merchants and curious wanderers from the seigneuries of Larcen and Wellnear. The market has therefore become a hub for fascinating encounters, as well as a source of interesting gossip for all those who know how to listen well.

Dialogs.Content:
I think I'll stay in Kortombourg. I always dreamed of knowing another seigneury and living a life of adventure. 

Umphric Podor has assured me that he will provide an armed escort to Varko for his return home.

Replies.Content: Do you have any more specific plans or projects?

Dialogs.Content: Brilliant! Just let me know when you need my services.
Not really. I don't want to be a simple sword-for-hire. I guess I could ask the neighbourhood notables if they need me... but I would rather join your party, if you need me, that is.

Replies.Content: Now that is an idea that interests me, Finn.

Dialogs.Content: Oh so that's the reason you don't hunt dragons! Right...
The Golden Gin herbalist is in need of local plants.
Authorities in Kortombe wish to reduce the mountain goat population in the hills, as some travellers report having their persons attacked and their campsites trampled.
I, Fiola the Explorer, offer free training in the creation of esoteric pendants! Come and meet me at the Stricken Tree and bring some gems for your training.
The authorities of Kortombe ask for the help of adventurers and hunters to reduce the population of wild animals in Ordval.
*You approach the bulletin board. Amidst the posters for lost pets, and a few bits and bobs for sale, there are notices pinned up for local quests and tasks...
The Dufanni family offers a reward to any adventurers able to scare away the gremfyr who have installed themselves in their barn.
Raul Despommiers is looking for fibers and leather for his work to expand his establishment.

Ready to meet a legend? Come and join the magnificent Maratatinus at the tree known only as the Ancestor. You will be able to participate in a secret ritual of the Circle of the Great Tree. Find out if you have the Gift in you!
Duelling and paid tournaments are prohibited throughout the territory of the barony...

Replies.Content: I hadn't even thought of that! Do I sense a "However..." coming?

Dialogs.Content: Whatever. You literally just told me you had time for me.
Okay, but hurry. I fear they are in danger.
If you're looking for good fresh products, you've come to the right place. Never buy them in Wellnear, their maggot-ridden vegetables rot after a couple of days.

Replies.Content: Do you have work for me?
I have time for you if you need help.
I'm looking for a place to train with my weapons, but also to make some money. Can you help me kill two birds with one blow?

Dialogs.Content: Ideal. The foreman of the Forsec Mine has been waiting days for a shipment of cargo. Are you interested?

Replies.Content: I don't have time to make deliveries.
That sounds like a great excuse for me to see more of the country.

Dialogs.Content:
Personally, yes, but that does not mean that I'm free from concern. Since yesterday, I have been awaiting a shipment from the Duchy of Gantras. And I begin to fear the worst.

The last update I received suggested that it should arrive no later than yesterday morning. 

Normally, the caravan transporting it would be on the road to the west. If you could follow that route up to the neighbouring seigneury to see if the carriers are safe, it would bring me great relief.

Though please, do not cross the border. That would cause me endless headaches with neighbouring traders.

Replies.Content: I have some business to settle, but I'll get back to you as soon as possible.
Danger calls, and I will answer without delay.

Dialogs.Content:
There's always work for citizens who aren't afraid to earn an honest living. But I imagine the jobs you're after have little to do with agricultural fields and house repairs. 

Ah yes! I may have a more attractive mission for you. We have a problem with one of our wood suppliers, Berthier Granfore. 

In short, the lumberjack no longer wants to deal with us because he prefers to negotiate with travellers and merchants from neighbouring seigneuries.

According to him, it's better to exchange logs for goods than for coins. He does not understand that the Kortombe Merchants Guild cannot trade apple pies for logs.

Can you make him see sense, please?

Replies.Content: Come to think of it, I don't really have time right now.
Sure. That's exactly the sort of thing that I'm looking for.

Dialogs.Content:
*An expression of disgust appears on Umphric's face.

Well I won't waste my time with you any longer.

However... I may know people who organize games that allow ordinary citizens to let off steam or settle scores. If you know what I mean...

If this kind of tourna... uhh due... uhh entertainment interests you, then visit the Kortomia Fortress at night. I'll leave it to you to find your way there.

... is aggression with good reason! The head of their merchant guild is a first class incompetent.

Oh, and also my parents-in-law live there.

Most artisans and agricultural producers come here two or three times a week to sell their wares. Come back often and you will always find fresh vegetables, tasty pies, or handcrafted jewellery to buy.

In addition, sometimes foremen from the Forsec Mine come to sell nuggets that they cannot use.

It's one of the largest mines in the region. It mainly extracts feros, but occasionally they will find a vein of odiemel.

What is odiemel? It's a rare and extremely resistant mineral. Keep an eye out for it, it's burnt orange, almost red, in colour.

Don't get me started on that place! It's a lovely name for the most mediocre seigneury in the country. They should have called it Wellcrap or Hellnear.

You've really never heard of it? You must come from the Larcen side. Wellnear is the poorest civilized territory in Pireiria. It's a seigneury full of sleeping pigs administered by drunken boar.

Name: The Ice Barrier
Description: Before you stands a wall of living ice. As soon as you approach, the ice closes in and sharp crystals form threateningly close to you.

Name: Orycvorax Burrow
Description: According to legend, there are gigantic carnivorous oryctus capable of combating entire human armies. No one has ever been able to prove this story true, but it is certain that the leporidae that have built their burrows in this part of the forest are not of the usual size.

Name: Camp Tormul
Description: Camp Tormul is very well maintained. You see many tools and machines used to exploit the resources of the region. Everything here is meticulously tidy.

Dialogs.Content:
*Ameliana smiles proudly at you.

I'm glad you recognize talent. You know, I even offer training for people looking for adventure. A camp can be a simple blanket, a tent, or even a portable house.

The concept is simple, you can set up a camp as a place to rest before resuming your adventure.

*Ameliana continues giving you camping advice for a good fifteen minutes, expounding on topics ranging from sanitary latrines to insect deterrence.

Anyhow, in the jot-filled surroundings it's plenty hot enough, though up in the Ridiculous Mountains be prepared to use jutug. And also...

*You no longer have a choice - you patiently listen to Ameliana finish her story, and try to take in at least a couple of valuable details.

It would be faster for me to explain the little that I don't like about it. 

But seeing as you asked. My camp is clean and it's tidy. Each building is designed to maximise efficiency and the workspaces are kept clear of clutter.

A good camp should offer you a place to safely store machinery that will be used to mine the surrounding resources. And our machines have been specially ordered for our needs from the Korllights Academy.

Plus, take a look at those salandrin frames. It's tough enough to withstand any avalanche that might crash down from the cliffs of the Ridiculous Mountains.

Our workers! Hahaha! My dad loved that joke! At least, I think he was joking. 

We have a workshop at the Multiforge in Kortombourg. We come here because there's branzos in the hill, pan and ortas in the forest, and wild boar to hunt for leather.

It's essential to set up a camp in a place in close proximity to plentiful resources.
Greetings, visitor. Keep your hands out of the reach of our tools and you'll be just fine.

Replies.Content: I'm looking for help to build a camp.

Dialogs.Content: We are an exploitation camp, we spend the summer here exploiting the surrounding resources. This camp is the pride of my family, and it shall remain so as long as I am responsible for it.

Replies.Content: What do you like so much about your camp?

Dialogs.Content:
*Ameliana gives you a giant smile

No one knows this area better than my family. Our camp is the best in the seigneury and I am its mistress.

If you follow my instructions well, you'd be able to build your camp atop the Mount of Flame if you so desired.

Name: Heavenly Oak
Description: This magnificent ancient oak rises over a hundred meters from the ground. Believed to have been growing for more than a millennium, local tribes believe its highest leaves touch the heavens themselves. Offerings, tributes, and other tribal objects adorn its branches and leaves, left there by ancient people as tribute to its divine splendour.

Name: Dilapidated house
Description: Hidden in a small forest clearing, this old house looks to have been abandoned for years. However, steam from someone's cooking has clouded the windows, betraying the recent presence of one or more individuals.

Name: Renaissance Encampment
Description: Hidden in a small valley, this camp, or rather, this hamlet, is made up of ten stone houses. A few cauldrons are placed in a central clearing. The architecture of the place is strangely reminiscent of that of Valsonge.

Dialogs.Content: I can tell by the look in your eyes that you see a familiarity in our little hamlet...

Replies.Content: Have you ever heard of the Somberseason?

Dialogs.Content:
* Corrick sighs in relief.

So, we are from the same place.

For a moment, I feared you were one of them.

I have. A druid visited and told us of the season's story. 
We performed a sunset ritual together a little higher up the mountain.

Or was a sunrise ritual? Heck, I don't remember.

Either way, those druids are weird if you ask me.
I can no longer remember their name but there is a kind of cult that views us as enemies to be wiped from the lands. It's not for nothing that we live in hiding from Pireirian society.

Replies.Content: Why don't you return to Valsonge?

Dialogs.Content:
Because we're not convinced that we'll be welcomed with open arms. Our doctor also believes that we could transmit diseases to the Valsongeois.

Though, above all, the air is cooler here, and the hunting grounds more fertile...

And what about the colours! Have you stopped to appreciate them? Marvellous!
No particular reason. This is private and licensed property. Please let us live in peace.

Name: Collapsed cliff
Description: A significant part of the cliff has collapsed recently. Uprooted trees and even animal corpses can be seen sticking out of the rocks that have tumbled into the ocean.

Name: Anvil Relay
Description: Built of metal and stone, the appearance of the Anvil Relay leaves no doubt as to the origin of its name. It is very likely that sleeping in this place will be a memorable experience.

Dialogs.Content:
We have meal parcels prepared for Bolondinus at Quara Market.

The courier who was supposed to deliver them is sick in his room and can no longer do the job on time.

We reckon he was poisoned by one of the bugs in the swamp not far from here. So watch out!

Replies.Content: I was planning to head to Quara, I'll deliver the food.

Dialogs.Content:
Since my clientele is mostly constituted of soldiers and adventurers, I don't really hear local rumours very often, but I guess you aren't really interested about who saw who kissing who behind the barn anyway.

I know that a research camp has recently been set up near Corinna Forest. They're looking for some rare ingredient, but that's all I know.

Hello to you! 

Sit back and take some time to relax. Be that with a good pint of beer or with a bag o' nails and a hammer. Ha!

Replies.Content: What a strange place to build an inn! Especially with so much... style.
What can you tell me about the region?

Dialogs.Content:
Baaah! My grandfather built this place to attract adventurers and soldiers almost 35 years ago. He was a blacksmith and so was my father. 

I know all about smithing too, but I much prefer brewing beer than smelting steel.

Well yes, I have a message for Sally. Didn't she travel with you?

One of the members of her order, a certain Palenne, came by and left her a message.

Replies.Content: Yes, she travels with my party.

Dialogs.Content:
I would be happy to spread Roic's legacy with you, assuming that you can accommodate me properly. 

The experience gained with you will prepare me to once again face Bobu. One day I shall vanquish him, I swear it!

If you don't believe me, then I don't have time to waste on you. 

Come back to me when you're ready to fight for Roic's legacy!

Yes, if you want to spread the spirit of Roic with me, there is a quest we could embark on together.

An evil creature named Bobu resides in Hordulk'hos Tomb. The creature must be destroyed!

I know how to open the door to the tomb. We could face the darkness together!

Replies.Content: My team is ready to vanquish the darkness!

Dialogs.Content: May Roic guide you.

Replies.Content: What are you doing in the area?
I would like you to join my team of adventurers.

Dialogs.Content: I believe I've figured out how to summon Bobu at the well. Let's gear up and go visit Hordulk'hos Tomb.

Roic's followers are everywhere.

More seriously, I'm currently studying an ancient tomb on the Golden Plateau.

Name: Ruins of the Temple of Paolis
Description: Several statues bearing the effigy of the heroic travelling doctor Paolis still stand, but the building which was to be the meeting place of his followers has completely collapsed. It is however possible that by excavating the rubble, an explorer might discover the famous underground passages of Life.

Dialogs.Content: Ah, I recognize you, yes.
Certainly. He's one of the special members of the Order of Roc. He has the talent to become a member of the Grand Council, but he prefers fieldwork.

The students who built the temple certainly believe so. From what I've been told, he even had magical powers that allowed him to heal his companions. Though as I said, I don't really know much more about him.

According to some rumours, his logbook containing his most powerful secrets is buried in the catacombs under the temple. No one has ever discovered the entrance.

Very little is known about Paolis himself. We know he died more than 500 years ago, and his followers built a substantial temple as an homage to his deeds. But all the splendour of the temple was lost in the series of catastrophes and disasters that turned it into the ruin you see before you.

We do know that Paolis was a travelling healer and a renowned cartographer. His travels would have educated the nobles about Ordval and the County of Larcen in particular.

Somewhere around here, there should be some flowers which owe their name to him.

Replies.Content: Was he really a doctor? What you're describing sounds more like a simple explorer.

Dialogs.Content:
*Tara looks desperate.*

No, they are innocuous little plants that are surely hidden somewhere in this forest undergrowth... that is, unless they're not really here, a bit like our undead. Ha!

*Tara describes a plant that you suggest is more likely to grow in the environments a little further south.

In the south, I don't believe you! The ancient books were very clear!

Replies.Content: I'll go get you some, I'll be right back.

Dialogs.Content: I'm looking for a plant that should grow near here, but I can't find it. I'm starting to think it's not really worth the risk with all the living dead around.
I don't believe you, I was sent here to study the undead of the forest. There must be such creatures here.

That's right. The undead. Brain munchers. Living dead. Flesh-eating freaks. Zombies!

If you hadn't realised, we're exploring the ancient ruins of the Temple of Paolis. Plenty of people died here during the Century of Catastrophes. 

That means the spirits lurking in these woods are not pretty youths drinking and playing zither on tree branches but the walking dead. Though as I was saying, it can be difficult to tell the difference.

Replies.Content: Can you tell me more about Paolis?

Dialogs.Content: Don't tempt me! I don't miss!
Hurry up and say something before I shoot an arrow straight through your skull.

Replies.Content: What a welcome! Be my guest. You may, however, find that my head is too thick and hard to pierce with a single arrow.

Dialogs.Content: Well, I believe so... there are evil creatures in these woods, I'm sure of it.
That's right. Now let me see to my plants... and my zombies.
My apologies, but caution is a necessity in places such as this. It can be difficult to tell adventurers from the living dead. Especially when the former hasn't bathed for weeks.

Name: Arcane Tower
Description: Thousands of books have been painted on a large wooden tower. Outside, men and women meditate or take care of a luxuriant garden. A few teenagers bathe in the waters of Lake Holdori.

Dialogs.Content:
Truly? Marvellous! What did you discover?

*Clara gazes at you in fascination as you summarise your discovery.

A feather? Down there? Intriguing. We should study it! I know an alchemy specialist who would be a great aid with this task. If you're able to provide me with more of these feathers, that would be most beneficial.

As a reward, I might even offer you training in certain spells normally limited to students above your level.

Replies.Content: Sounds like I should go back to study the reflections, then.

Dialogs.Content: "Welcome to the Arcane Tower, home and great library of the Arcanists!"

Replies.Content: Can you tell me more about the speciality knowledge of the Arcanists?
Can you tell me about the area?
Are you studying anything of interest in the local area?
I managed to activate the monolith.

Dialogs.Content:
This tower pre-dated our arrival by some time. Sadly, there isn't a single trace of its original occupants. There are surely artefacts or remnants of them somewhere in the vicinity, but we've never found them. Nonetheless, the isolation of this place made it the perfect location for our principal library. 

As for the surrounding area, there are several formidable predators in the area. The most dangerous of which is the royal chimera, I counsel extreme caution should you see signs of one.

Bah, the Protectors would like us to use our knowledge to help them complete their own mission. We consider them essential, but we have always refused to link our knowledge to a cause. As a result, they have repeatedly tried to subjugate us. Though it must be said, the current commander seems more open to a partnership of equals.

As for the Assembly, you only need to understand one thing: they are ignorant brutes whose machismo only serves to disguise their fear! They would flee from their own shadows if they could.

Treatises on the art  I mean, the science  of staff combat are available in the 29th row of the 3rd floor of the 2nd library.

Happy reading!

Replies.Content: I'll be going then, thank you.

Dialogs.Content:
Most people call us "magicians", but members of our community use the term "thinkers". We ponder the nature of the universe and its most captivating mysteries.

Some imagine us in an ivory tower reading occultic books...

... well, I guess that's not completely wrong...

... but we don't live in complete isolation from society and prefer to see... magic, for lack of a better word, as a science.

In short, we study sciences unknown to the majority, and we try to perfect them. Deep down, the forces we use are real and manifest in everyday life. It seems a waste to live in fear or ignorance of them.

An unsung part of our job is also to track down and control untrained or disturbed magicians. After all, we are the best prepared for that kind of work.

* Clara bursts out laughing, pausing only to wipe the tears from her eyes. 

Do... we... have... enemies? What a hoot! Pretty much everyone. The peasants see us as the evil witches of fairy tales, the academics view us as madmen playing with forces beyond our understanding, and the nobles treat us as weapons.

Historically, we've also had several run-ins with the Protectors of the Rose and the Claw Assembly.

Magic, as the common man understands it, is a vast field requiring an entire life of devotion simply to understand its foundations.

In brief, we have developed teachable implementations of it that you might call spells. Learning a few gestures and words of power can be enough to allow you to establish contact with magical energies. Once called upon, this magical essence will allow you to influence reality itself.

Before you say it, I'm well aware that my choice of vocabulary only serves to feed comparisons between us and the pointy hatted wizards of the old tales. Yet when your studies are as pioneering and ineffable as ours, the common tongue is more useful than volumes of technical gibberish.
Oh. I'll leave you to explore the mountains east of Holdori some more then. We should talk again when you're more familiar with the area.

Have you been to Sombrazur?

There's a very mysterious monolith in that cavern. It possesses a magic that we don't quite understand.

Maybe you could investigate the monolith? You seem to have a different... method from the other members of our order.

Replies.Content: I don't know where Sombrazur is...

Name: The territory of the tortolion
Description: A solitary tortolion lives in this part of the forest.

Dialogs.Content: *You suspect that the solitary tortolion, unlike those living in groups, could be tamed.*
*You approach the creature.*
*This creature requires a building with the following characteristics:

Name: Flowering Island
Description: Huge flowers of varied and vivid colours grow everywhere. An enormous tree of more than fifty meters stands in the centre of the field. At the end of its tallest branches are fruits that seem to be made of glass.

Name: Servants' Mansion
Description: Still in great shape, this large and gorgeous manor house was built to honour Albertus LeVaillant. Fortunately, it has been spared by the recent earthquakes. The smoke rising from the chimney seems to indicate an inhabitant.

Dialogs.Content:
* Rubika bursts into a sinister laugh.

That tells me more about you than you think.

No.

* Rubika looks at you uncertainly.

Is it yours? Or rather that of an ancestor?

Replies.Content: It's not. My family isn't from this part of the country.

Dialogs.Content:
* Robika nods.

With your accent, I would've been very surprised if you were local.

* Rubika hesitates before continuing.

So, where are you from?

Oh! You're not the person I was expecting to see here.

* Rubika frowns, then smiles at you.

I'm sorry. I've been waiting for a friend for several days and I'm starting to worry.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the area?

Dialogs.Content:
Very little. I often come to the Servants' Mansion for my work, but I don't stay here long and I don't explore.

All I can tell you is that there are some really strange creatures around.

* Rubika shrugs her shoulders.

Pfft! No idea! Maybe mole-men digging a tunnel?
A few weeks ago, yeah. Though it was nothing major. What worries me is that it was the fifth in the last year alone.

* Rubika briefly observes you .

Hmm. No thanks, I'll wait a little longer, although...

* Rubika hesitates for a moment.

... I can certainly help you.

As I told you, I'm awaiting my partner.

If you need my services, you know where to find me.

You see...

* Rubika coughs, clearing her throat.

Let's just say that I'm a professional who offers... specialized services.

Replies.Content: Oh? You mean you, uh, sharing your body...

Dialogs.Content:
* Rubika looks at you with uncertainty.

As true as there are people who reside on the other side of the Mists. Hahaha!

* Rubika doubles over with laughter.

* Rubika blushes before bursting into laughter.

Of course! The most profitable place for a pleasure maid is in a lost forest several miles from all civilization!

* Rubika regains her composure.

I'm a bounty hunter.

Replies.Content: Well it doesn't seem like that great a location for a bounty hunter either.

Name: Inn of the Pitiful
Description:
Seen from the outside, the tavern appears to be on the verge of collapse. Inside, the owner has taken great care to camouflage the building's faults with humour and passion. Such as a mural parodying the Conflict of the Great Rift drawn around a crack in the wall. 

In fact, the entire tavern is packed with oddities and peculiarities. So much so that some consider it more museum than drinking establishment.

A faded wooden sign is placed near the main counter. Perhaps it once held an extensive menu, but now only one dish remains: 

"Exquisite Sirumdarak of the Brave, only served on airless days."

Dialogs.Content:
Yes, a lot, though I cannot say the same about the coins I'd use to pay you...

*Heriza mumbles something about taxes.

I don't normally hire strangers, but my delivery guy is well... he's there...

*Heriza points towards a burly patron who has clearly had too much to drink. He's having a heated argument with himself in the mirror.

Replies.Content: I haven't drunk anything yet, let's go!

Dialogs.Content: Noted. Want a beer in the meantime?
Hello traveller! Much like my clientele, my tavern has difficulty standing. One more rum at the end of the night, and it could all come tumbling down!

Replies.Content: Rum at the end of the night?
Do you have a lot of visitors?
Why is this seigneury struggling so much?
Do you have any work for me?

Dialogs.Content:
Oh yes, we get loads of customers. I just don't invest my profits back into the business when the real money is to be made in rat racing. 

I always choose the most obese rodent. If he's meatier than his buddies, he's bound to have more energy, right?

* Heriza gives you a mocking wink.

Just bad luck, I guess... and too much taxation.

*Heriza looks in all directions, then seems in a hurry to change the subject.
Strange colour for a frog...

You're right, I need to calm down. I'm going to stop drinking... for a while.

Earlier, I ran into Marco Filsderabouf. He told me that he was visited by a certain Palenne, who was looking for some ruins under Siho - that's the mountain in the centre of the city.

I wonder if this ruin, if it exists, could provide an unwatched route into the castle.

Unless you have any better ideas, we should find this Palenne.
I have a feeling these creatures have a thing for old plank bridges.

This type of well is used mainly in times of siege, allowing armies to hold out longer without running out of water.

Usually anyway. I will still mentally prepare myself to fight Wellnear's purple guard.

*Badouk bursts into a forced laugh.

Well, yes. In short, my parents were in the service of his father. So in my youth, I was often at the castle. That meant we spent a good part of our childhood getting up to mischief together.

You have no idea how much the cook hated us both. Hahaha!

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about Baloin?

Dialogs.Content: Pour yourself a drink...

Frankly, I don't understand what's going on and it depresses me greatly. I'm afraid Cragstein is trying to take control of Wellnear.

I fear for the lord's safety... he may have the odd tendency to tyranny, but he's still an old pal.

Yes. He's the leader of an elite armed troop of mercenaries.

His stronghold is said to be in the Viperin Mountains in the west of the continent. He usually stays away from politics, but the nobles hire him and his sell-swords when wars break out. His fighters are formidable on the battlefield.

But guards these mercenaries are not. I fear things will quickly descend into chaos for the inhabitants of Wellnear.

Replies.Content: Is there a link to the Kortombe mercenaries?

Dialogs.Content:
Baloin has always been a long way from perfect. The people of Wellnear are poor, but to keep the seigneury out of total chaos, it was necessary to have the means to maintain many guards.

And so a vicious circle was created. More guards, meant more tax, and that meant more hatred. In turn, more hatred caused the need for more guards. Over the years, the people came to see him as a tyrant.

But in the way one always knows the heart of a childhood friend, I know that, deep down, he was always just trying to keep order in a town rife with bandits and brigands.
Very unlikely. I guess someone could have paid Cragstein to trouble an ally of Kortombe. However, Wellnear is probably the last place Tarul Verdant would ask for help.

*Badouk glances around to make sure no one is listening.*

The new guy, at the castle. He's one of Cragstein's men, I'm sure of it. Among mercenary circles, he's the scummiest of the scummiest.
I was trained to be an independent craftswoman, but I need experience before setting up my own workshop. So I'm looking for work with an awesome employer or someone to take me on as an apprentice.

Replies.Content: You seem to have some interesting qualities. And I am pretty awesome. I could certainly use your services!

Dialogs.Content: Before working for you, I need to make sure that you can meet my requirements. Here they are:

Name: Mercenary Camp
Description: A small palisade has been quickly erected around a temporary encampment. Guard dogs are placed at the only entrance. Inside the enclosure, four people rest and prepare their equipment.

Dialogs.Content: I can tell from your accent that you're not from anywhere near here. So don't worry about matters that don't concern you.
Be on your way! We're looking for the witch, we have nothing against you.

Replies.Content: Why are you looking for her?

Name: Kortombe Castle
Description: A dozen guards and servants work at the castle at all times. Visitors wishing to meet the baroness must first contact the office of the steward to express their requests. For municipal affairs, they must contact the Great House of Kortombe.

Dialogs.Content:
I can handle that, though it may take a while. In the meantime, I have another mission for you.

My daughter, Celeste, confirmed to me that the peasants believe more and more in the theory of the family curse. She also told me that the locals had been made aware of your discoveries. There must have been a leak from one of my staff.

I ask of you, please, take care of calming the situation, and I'll take care of authenticating the documents you brought me.

Replies.Content: I'll come back to see you when I have time to handle it.
As you command, Baroness Relene. It would be my honour.

Dialogs.Content:
Sir Tarul Verdant is the Protector of Kortombe. He's in charge of security and militia. He can also answer some of your questions if necessary.

You can find him in the barracks, though the official knight's house is located a little away from the village and is known as Roic's Manor.
The peasants are naturally drawn towards superstition and will continue to assume that the troubles that affect them arise from the history of my family. That is, unless they are proven otherwise.

Replies.Content: I pray it does not displease you too much, but I ask that you could give me some time to complete some other pressing duties first.
I am at your service, my lady. Point the way.

Dialogs.Content: Yes, the place where all of the municipal administration takes place. It also houses the militia barracks. I really suspect these questions could be answered by someone less busy.

From what my daughter tells me, you have done a lot for the barony already. She believes that you are trustworthy, but she trusts too easily. The poor girl, she was never very good at politics... at least not on any scale larger than a dining room table.

Anyway, I'm ready to employ you to deal with a sensitive matter. You will no doubt know that several of my citizens have been affected by strange effects in recent weeks. A rumour, which appeared a few weeks ago, suggests that all of the problems are related to one of my ancestors.

Like all nonsense of this kind, the details vary from person to person. However, I would be unwise to ignore these murmurings and whispers. It would be prudent for you to learn more about the rumours. And, ideally, to discover their origin.

Replies.Content: I have to fulfil some obligations before I can be entirely at your disposal.
You do me a great honour.

Dialogs.Content:
While there is no immediate rush, a baroness waits for no man.

I shall not waste weeks waiting for you. Should you not return within the coming days, I shall appoint my knight, Sir Verdant to the task. I am confident he will chase leads incessantly on my behalf.
Hmm. You must have some pretty important errands to run. Your fear of commitment leaves me pensive.

Unfortunately for you, as Baroness of Kortombe, I cannot take the time to talk with strangers unless it is absolutely necessary. Contact Sir Verdant or the burgomaster, my daughter, if you have questions about the seigneury.

The village folk seem to have calmed down, though the ultimate reassurance can only come from discerning the truth behind the death of my ancestor, Annabelle Kortombe.

I trust you enjoy solving mysteries?

Replies.Content: Mysteries take time to solve. And time is a resource I'm short on right now. Let's do this later.
The investigation has more than piqued my curiosity. I am both available and willing.

Dialogs.Content:
You don't have burgomasters where you are from? It is an administrative role, like a mayor. 

Here, the role is performed admirably by my daughter, Celeste. She takes care of Kotormbourg's administration and the reception of new arrivals. 

You will find her at the Great House of Kortombe.
Peace and Courage in Kortombe.

Replies.Content: It's an honour to meet you.
I understand that you are looking for someone you trust to carry out a delicate mission.
May I help you once more, baroness?
Do you need my help to authenticate the documents I brought back to you?
Is there anything more I can do to help you?
Might I be granted a full audience with you? I have some questions.

Dialogs.Content: Perhaps my daughter really is wrong about you.

*Rlne Kortombe gives you a smile that seems to mean "they all tell me that...". However, midway through her polite smile, a noble you've seen before in the Great House of Kortombe whispers something in the baroness's ear. Something that causes her eyebrow to rise.

Oh, tis an honour for me as well. For I have just been informed that you are the individual my whole family has been discussing for some time.

As Baroness of Kortombe, I would like to personally invite you to our next castle ball.

Replies.Content: Attending would be my great pleasure. I will be there.

Dialogs.Content:
I need you to be focused on the task at hand, so go, fix your petty problems and return to me afterwards.

We need to find the source of the trouble, but I fear it will be extremely complicated. For now, we must demystify the death of my ancestor Annabelle. 

Obviously, it will be difficult to investigate a death that occurred almost 200 years ago. I shall give you access to the family crypt, perhaps you will find clues in the possessions of Reinfort or Annabelle.

Name: Sanctuary of Valdiss
Description: You stand in what must have been a garden in ancient times. The place has a strange energy which gives you feelings of both calm and sorrow.

Name: Biggoat Relay
Description: Part of the goat farm has been transformed into a dormitory to accommodate travellers. A large goat, likely the namesake of the relay, trots and struts through the agricultural estate.

Dialogs.Content: *To buy the animal, you must have a place in your domain to house it.
*A young goat from the farm is for sale.

Replies.Content: I would like to buy this goat.

Residents.Name: Amanda Gilos

Dialogs.Content:
Yes...

I was in the Silent Plain, to the south.

I was enjoying the magnificent lake view when a huge oryctus, wilder than any other I've come across, chased me.

As I fled, I dropped my mother's necklace.

I dare not go back there myself.

You seem able to hold your own against these beasts. If you could help me find the necklace, my appreciation would have no bounds.

Replies.Content: Worry not, I'll retrieve your necklace!
That oryctus sounds terrifying, no way!

Dialogs.Content: Thank you! Thank you so much! I was terrified I'd lost it forever.
Ah... I was truly hoping to see that necklace again one day...
Be comfortable! Be comfortable! Be careful not to get bitten by the goats!

Long live the Somberseason!

The lonely page is said to mourn his lover across the river during these dark months.

How did that visiting troubadour's song go?

Da la la di! His tears join the rain! Da la la da!

Long live the Somberseason!

Badouk Brank, you say? You don't forget a man like that.

He arrived alone, but he spoke at length with a man in bad shape who appeared to be waiting for him. They left together after sharing a few large ales. I don't know where they went afterwards. Certainly, his companion couldn't have made it far in his condition.

I think he had family at a lodge a little further north of here. He may be there.

Residents.Greets: Watch out for the kids! The baby goats, I mean, not the children... they shouldn't bite.

Name: Kortombe Portal
Description: The portal of Kortombe is in good condition. It is clear that renovation and structural preservation work has been completed in recent years.

Dialogs.Content:
Which means that you will be able to start building a network of portals to move around Myriaden.

We, the Mistwalkers, are using this network to prepare for the great upcoming upheaval.

Explore the area around Kortombe a bit more and then come back to see me at the Throne of the Troll. We will talk about the rest then.
This is a big step forward.

Name: Cybelfly Nest
Description:
[D]A mound of earth pierced with thousands of holes let's you know that you're approaching the nest of the cybelflies. By day the place is completely silent.

[N]At night, thousands of cybelflies circle around the nest. Will you really dare to approach?

Name: Passage of the Lithydrios
Description: A cable-car traverses the river using huge mechanisms and a complex series of gears and pulleys. The system is powered by mechanical humanoids.

Name: Bobo's Crypt
Description: A foul smell comes from the crypt.

Name: Looters' Camp
Description: Tents have been erected in a small forest clearing. A handful of men with hard, unshaven faces are gathered around a small bonfire.

Name: Hipporiel Woodland
Description: In this small wooded area of colourful trees, a tiny herd of winged horses land to rest and feed. Little reddish birds often come to rest on them, where they feast on their bounty of fleas.

Name: Burial chamber
Description: This burial chamber is guarded by an otherworldly apparition.

Name: Aranbourg Plaza
Description: Every day, countless employees can be seen busily cleaning the streets, repairing street furniture, and catching stray animals. Despite all these efforts, Aranbourg Plaza remains rather drab and sad.

Dialogs.Content: *You approach the bulletin board. It looks like it could collapse at any moment...
The Healing Fairy, coming directly from the Fairy Forest, prepares the best potions of Wellnear! Meet me directly at the hostel.
Travellers are frightened at night when they pass near the Woodlands of the Dryads. The screams that echo through the leaves sound supernatural.

Every day, one struggling Wellnear family has the right to ask for an item of clothing that could see them through difficult times. 

We hope that a noble artisan will choose to spend his day making the people of Wellnear happy today.
Workers are needed to harvest in the fields of Aranbourg.
The populace of Aranbourg seeks help in getting rid of a nest of vicious snakes from the park.
Professor Ouab is missing. He was last seen on the road to the Donpa Woodlands. Inform Leovia if you find him.
Aeryn Dool at the Inn of Tales is researching new substances for his decorations.
A Wellnear family cannot afford the services of Carl Sifer at the Scarlet Warehouse. They offer a lucky dip for new clothes. Who will fortune smile upon this day?
For reasons that are not your business, the owner of the Plindor Farm is looking to acquire a bundle of spears.
My job ain't fun, and it certainly ain't well paid. Still, better than staying at home looking after my elderly father, eh? I almost envy Sofya, always on the road driving her stage coaches.

Replies.Content: Life seems difficult in Aranbourg. Am I wrong?

Dialogs.Content:
Baaah, I dunno what they're called. But you know, those northerners, you follow me?

*Obviously not in his element, Anvar picks up a rock and examines each of the gashes in it, probably hoping you drop the interrogation.

Baaaaah! I can't say, I've never lived anywhere else. Sofya told me about the riches of Gantras, but unlike us, it's a duchy. At least here we don't have too many of those weirdos with their horns and long tails.

Name: Tower of Dreams
Description: On the top of a small rocky plateau stands a high tower of black stone. Peculiarly, there seems to be no entrance, yet flickering lights can be seen through one of the loopholes about 20 metres up.

Dialogs.Content: [dev] The tower is ultimately one of the buildings of the order of the hippogriff, so you have to have a good reputation to unlock its secrets.

Name: Motionless Star
Description: A clearing has been created surrounding a gigantic translucent globe. The composition of the globe is difficult to determine. Strange little lizards that look like tiny wyverns fly around inside.

Name: Scarlet Warehouse
Description: On the ground floor of the textile shop there is a counter and a small exhibition room. A staircase leads to the basement. The decoration of the main room was done by someone who was visibly attentive and had a special affection for red.

Dialogs.Content:
It's always good to meet someone with an appreciation for fineries and fabrics. Personally, I love working with doussoie. Clothing made from it is ideal for swamp expeditions and for hunting.

We have, in Wellnear, a few of the plants that can be turned into it. If you are able to pick some for me, I would grant you one of my creations in return.

Tis a question of necessity and entrepreneurialism. For even the poor must clothe themselves and their wee children.

And we are no mere simple store. In the basement, there is a large workshop for altering fabrics and sewing clothes. 

Travellers often rent part of my facilities in order to wash or repair their apparel.

And when I see particularly dirty adventurers, I also offer to give them a quick wash. For a small fee, of course.

*Carl grins. 

Interested?

What's wrong? I'm furious!

This numbskull of a lord has decided to take away my title of Official Outfitter of Wellnear.

Who does he think he is? My family has owned the title for generations. Worse yet, I have not even been granted the right to participate in the contest to name the next outfitter.

Listen, you're quickly becoming a celebrity in the lordship. Could you use your influence to restore these rights to me?

In exchange, I offer to share with you the right to create and wear the official clothes of the city.
If you're looking for fabric, clothing, or a job, you've come to the right place. If you're here for any other reason, please leave the premises.

Replies.Content: Your shop seems to be doing better than most businesses in Aranbourg.

Name: Cave of Knowledge
Description:
Behind the falls is a gigantic library accompanied by a high quality laboratory. You're immediately hit by the powerful smell of sulphur. 

A dozen people are lost in thought as they carefully scrutinise ancient texts.

Dialogs.Content:
It's a rumour started by those xenophobic idiots, the Tulsenvor.

According to them, Tulsen was enveloped in the Mists. And hidden amidst the Mist is an army eternally stood guard to prevent us from ever finding and returning to this native homeland.

It's a hypothesis invented to reassure imbeciles. Everyone knows that Tulsen was undoubtedly destroyed by a volcanic eruption or a hurricane shortly before our ancestors left it. Parts of its landmass still appear and disappear every century.

The ignorant see magic as evil. Although in reality we are more Arcanists than philosophers, we prefer to present ourselves in a way that would not unnecessarily scare the populace.

In short, the term Thinker suits us well and makes us more acceptable to people, though we're not that acceptable anyway. We have a certain lack of social skills. I'm always having to remind Nicola to bathe before meeting nobles and dignitaries.

Replies.Content: Are we in a research centre?

Dialogs.Content: Welcome to the great laboratory of the Thinkers! May you have all your questions answered by its resplendent knowledge.

Replies.Content: The Lithidrios is out of order...
What can you tell me about the region?
I have with me a list of equipment needed for an important ritual. Would you be able to lend us those articles?
I kept my end of the bargain.

Dialogs.Content:
They are the followers of the Cult of Nephyria. I'm not sure if they worship this demon or if Nephyria represents some other malicious entity.

As I said, for the past two years or so, many people have been claiming that there is a being trapped in the Mists who could return at any time. A creature that is directly linked to the Century of Catastrophes.

* Zarou seems to hesitate, then decides he has nothing to lose by saying more. Obviously, the rant does him good.

What is interesting is that the majority of people who bring up this legendary creature, a kind of giant of the north, have all at one time or another been considered missing. No one, even them, knows where they were during their disappearances. Creepy? Yes. Inexplicable? No. 

* Zarou pretends to drink an imaginary bottle of wine.

* Zarou gives a long sigh

Obviously, whenever I talk about the Mists, adventurers get excited. No, it is not dangerous. Hell itself is not lurking beyond the Mists. It is not the path to Tulsen. And we won't wake any sleeping demons. Got all that?

Replies.Content: What do you know about a sleeping demon?

Dialogs.Content:
You mean Crazy Ralouf? Is that old bugger still alive? I'm quite surprised.

I'd love to do him that favor, but first he'd have to give us back the equipment he borrowed from us ages ago. I imagine that after all this time, and especially the way he maintains his belongings, it would be better if you brought me some new ones.

While you are getting the different items, this will give me time to prepare Ralouf's order. I will be able to let you go with the order once the new items are returned.

It would be good to remind Ralouf that we borrow items and not donate them...

Replies.Content: I will get back to you as soon as possible with the articles.

Dialogs.Content: You assume well.

Replies.Content: Will you teach me some techniques?
Why do you use the term Thinkers and not Arcanists?

Dialogs.Content:
Again?! Yolasula still hasn't performed the correct measures to disrupt the operators. I'd be better off hiring a dozen peasants from Brumedor instead of these damn machines. At least the machines can't quit and don't expect a tip. 

Could you reset them for me? The best way is to deactivate them with an elemental spell.

Replies.Content: I've seen enough golems for this week.
Turning it off and on again? Sure I can do that.

Dialogs.Content: We believe in the sharing of knowledge, though we reserve lessons of technique for those that we trust.

We're rather isolated, so we're not the best informed on matters of the region.

Still, I know on an island to the east is a shrine to the Circle of the Great Tree. While their methods are occasionally unscientific, I can't help but respect their love for knowledge and the little I know of their research into the essence of life.

I also believe that there are a few rare tree species in the forest near here, but it is populated by wormhogs that are particularly hostile to humans.
Indeed it is! Except after hatching season when there are too many dragonflies around. The damned bugs tend to "crash" the system.
*Zarou seized the end of the handkerchief with his fingertips and read its contents, displaying a repulsed air.
Thanks! I never thought I would get these things back, especially in such good condition. The order is ready. This time, it's a two-month loan, not 20 years. Please pass this information to Ralouf.

Replies.Content: Thank you. I'll pass the message on to him.

Dialogs.Content:
We study many phenomena here, and we are developing techniques that can be used by more adventurous Thinkers.

For example, Velcron over there is learning how to use magic to stick objects together. Whereas Lykra is finding ways to use magical energy to help stretch any material. Ferrius here, is trying to cross the Mists.

Replies.Content: Cross the Mists? That sounds dangerous to me.

Dialogs.Content:
* Zarou heaves another long sigh. This one of an almost comedically long duration.

Of course it would be the mention of demons that interests you. I personally have little interest in tales designed to terrify toddlers. 

More and more people are buying into this bizarre idea. And I'm not just talking about those crazy Nephyrites, but peasants, nobles... even academics!

Yes of course!

Alchemy is all-but-essential when working with materials. Most of us have a background in alchemy.

In addition, the higher levels of Arcanists' evocation magic requires tablets of power that bridge the gap between the ether and the physical world. These tablets are much more powerful than grimoires.

Would you like to know more?

Yes, Yes! Well... in hindsight, I think it's mostly just to show off what we can do. However... we suspect that ultimately we could create a hydroboard network between the different research centres of the realm. Can you imagine the potential?!

It is our hydroboard. Many Arcanists need materials and components for their research. They send their requests to the scientists of the hydraulics department who compile their request in a format that the hydroboard can comprehend. 

Then, members can consult the hydroboard to see who in the guild needs what! Clever, eh?
I see, too bad for you, I had some nice variants of elemental spells for you.
Oh...
Molouno Goldan Need Plant Luminomanger Experiment 434.
Search.Crest.Collector.Exchange.Information.
Pass of Spirits Experiment. Heavy load vehicle required. Delivery expected at experiment start. Attention: fragile. Attention: explosive. Attention: cutting.
Gildiro Resonardo Need Gem. Resonance Experiment A345 Version 4 Post Regulation.
Gildiro Resonardo Need Gem. Resonance Experiment A346 Version 5 Post Regulation.
Randul Cybellus Egg Experimentation. Three Group Five So Fifteen And Three For Five So One. Error. Error.
*You approach the blue glowing bulletin board... which greets you with a strange sound.
Gildiro Resonardo Need Gem. Resonance Experience A348 Version 7 Post Regulation.
Gildiro Resonardo Need Gem Resonance Experience A354 Version 9.4 Post Regulation.
Detection Problem Golem Reset or Destroy. Danger. Danger.

Name: Sylvan Court
Description: Dozens of trees are bent to form a dome. A few animals, bears, vargrs and deer come in and out of what looks like a courtroom. A raised platform created from stumps and climbing plants is installed in the middle of this natural palace. A menacing-looking tree stands in the centre of the small stage.

Dialogs.Content: Yes.
I am Eli'Carde, the ruler of all trees. And you are inside my palace!
All the plants of the continent follow my edicts! I don't need a vulgar, fragile bipedal for a servant!

* The tree seems to follow your every move.

Bow before the sacred court of trees.

Name: House of the Gargoyles
Description: Built from stone and compacted straw, this little house is well-hidden in its small forest clearing. Four sculptures representing Ogvanian gargoyles have been placed at the corners of the roof. A pungent stench of sulphur rises from the windows.

Dialogs.Content: Ooh, visitors.

On a practical level, the toolset is completely disparate. 

For alchemists, measurements must be extremely precise. That's why all alchemists require the highest quality scales. And even more important still... stills!

My science, you mean! For I am an alchemist.

My goal is the transformation of one matter into another without an over-reliance on external magical energy.

You can find a bit of everything in the matter that surrounds us. For everything is just energy at its core. And if we can transform those energies, then we can create that which is new... that which is more than the sum of the original components.

Do you see?

I work in collaboration with Korllights and with the Arcanists. Though some of my experiments have gone wrong in the past... which is why you find me here, in my exile's laboratory. At least here, I have peace.

Ha! Were you expecting a green-skinned witch or a horde of demonic creatures?

Believe it or not, I live out here in the middle of nowhere in order to protect the population. My experiments can be somewhat dangerous. 

*Goldoran smiles innocently.

Replies.Content: Nice gargoyles. Tell me about your art.

Dialogs.Content:
Ahh, this classic once again. To compare a herbalist to an alchemist is insulting.

Herbalists pick pretty flowers and mix them together to produce a result. We alchemists change the very properties of elements themselves!

Name: Berthier's House
Description:
A house clearly built more for pragmatism than aesthetics, the exterior of the building leaves a lot to be desired. 

It appears to have been built to withstand strong hurricanes. Although you suspect even it would be unlikely to survive a falling tree should the strong winds pull one down.

Dialogs.Content: I don't like the company of people, much less strangers.

Replies.Content: That's not much of a welcome!

Dialogs.Content:
Well, not many people know this, but I was an adventurer when I was young.

But an adventurer meets far too many people for a solitary soul like me. So, I became a lumberjack.

Want me to show you my old tricks?
* Before continuing your journey, Berthier and you chat for a few minutes while drinking a couple of crisp and refreshing pints.
Oh! I didn't recognize you! Well in that case, a warmer welcome is in order! Care for a pint of ale?

Name: Fortress of Isifort
Description: A small fortress has been built on a hill overlooking the Mound of Thievery. Around fifty soldiers are stationed there, alternating roles between guard duty and patrol duty along the Giltan Road.

Dialogs.Content: You seem to know how to fight. I would have a job for you.
Meet me at World's End Relay, at the very end of the Bran-Wojtek way, and I'll explain.

Replies.Content: This region is too difficult for me.

Dialogs.Content: Too bad... Come back if you change your mind.

That's welcome news. I've lost too many scouts in recent months. It's long overdue that we accept external aid. 

You'll need to be an expert explorer, proficient in the ways of the mountain. I will mark a location on your map, your responsibility is to patrol it. 

Can you handle it?

I'm aware. I had you tailed by another scout to ensure you weren't cheating us. Just a precaution, you understand.

Having earned my trust, you may now view the Scout Bulletin Board. I've marked the places we require to be scouted. Once the work is complete, we can assign patrols where they're needed most.
Make haste.

Replies.Content: There are a lot of cylmos in the passage!

Dialogs.Content: Then don't waste my time! I've seen too many good men die.
An outpost in the Arwell Mountains allows scouts to see all the way to the Kartazon Plateau. Be wary, the last scouts sent to investigate have not returned.
A group of scouts is needed for the central parts of the Shield of Astrid. Watch out for hostile creatures in the area.
The scouts request aid in their fight against the creatures of the mountains. Do you have what it takes to help them this day?
Strange movements have been reported in Karkantas Forest. A group of scouts must go to the clifftops of Snake Hill and watch the forest.
*You approach the bulletin board, which displays the current locations where patrolling scouts are most desperately needed...
The authorities are looking for a transporter to deliver materials that will be used for research at the Ruins of Malasette.
Gantras authorities are looking for a guide to take inventory of all the woodlands of Hunthief. The ultimate goal is to find all the nuertesilicio groves.

Name: Bonarmalar Relay
Description:
The relay is a simple but practical shelter allowing travellers to rest reasonably safely from the perils of the wilds. 

It's built near a small stream and has a large stone circle ready for campfire building.

Dialogs.Content: The Bonarmalar Relay welcomes all kinds of travellers. Most of them are passing through to the town of Aranbourg, in Wellnear.

Will your path take you to Aranbourg?

If so, I have an urgent letter which must go to Leovia at Aranbourg Market.

You seem to have the physical prowess to get to the city safely.

*Marian looks you up and down, then winks.

Replies.Content: Alright, I'll take care of delivering the letter.

Dialogs.Content:
Fantastic! Though I must warn you, I do not fight before noon and after sunset. Oh and my snoring is louder than the screams of a howler-bear.  

Seriously though, I'd love to accompany you. Though I need to be sure that you meet my requirements before setting off.

Stop right there! You shall not pass! 

Haha! I'm kidding, of course. Were I to risk my life in combat, I'd prefer to do it for a more noble cause than the protection of a bridge.

However, if you were looking for someone to accompany you on your adventures, please know that I have already outlived my six older brothers.

Replies.Content:
Aside from swiftness with a blade, a good sense of humour is an all but essential trait in a companion-in-arms. 

You are welcome to join us, Bolnis.

Name: Bloranossa House
Description:
Hidden deep within the forest, in a place where sunlight never quite reaches, there stands a most sinister house. The house itself is covered in hundreds of terrifying runes, and its thick layers of moss glow in an eerie blue light.

Even standing in its presence leaves you feeling deeply uncomfortable.

Name: Altar of Reflections
Description: An altar faces a pool of black water. Feeding the pool from the far side, a waterfall splits in two where it hits a black reflective monolith. You see your reflection within the monolith's dark stone with all the clarity of a mirror's image. The monolith is said to be a nexus with the Den of Darkness.

Name: Valekar Egrom
Description:
A luscious two-meter high hedge of climbing plants surrounds a small village of wooden houses. 

Wafting over the hedge come the smells of fresh berry jam, hot tea, and incense. The combination of scents is most inviting after your strenuous travels. 

On sunny days, the sounds of children playing also carry over the verdant palisades.

Residents.Name: Vedish Hisste

Dialogs.Content: It can be found somewhere in the Fairy Forest, but you won't find it unless you too are a chosen one.

If you're here to mock our traditions, I would ask you to leave, promptly. 

On the other hand, if you are looking to reconnect with the ancient lords of Myriaden, you are most welcome to stay.

Replies.Content: I'm looking for someone named Palenne.

Dialogs.Content:
We are among the chosen elect who hear the voices of the fairies.

To ensure that their return is a smooth one, we have decided to respect the scriptures contained in the Valekar grimoire.

We must therefore every three days offer gold or jewellery to emissaries of the fairies. Every morning we have to leave them cheese, wine and a live pig. Once a week, one of our women has to go, naked, to dance at the Circle of the Lunar Caterpillar.

Replies.Content: The Circle of the Lunar Caterpillar?

Dialogs.Content:
Well, well, as the old fairies used to say...

*You don't waste your time listening to the rest.
And you shall have your answers, wingless one, once we can be sure of your commitment to the cause of the ancient fairies.

Ha, wow, uh, good. You really saw all those things?!

*Vedish's confused and frightened look surprises you.

Well, we did encounter this Palenne you're asking about. He also researched fairies, but above all he tried to make us believe that offerings weren't necessary.

Well, he wasn't really looking for fairies, but ruins. So we sent him to Kildos. There aren't any fairies there anyway.

Ah... I see you are just another one of the brainwashed masses who cannot see the truth before their very eyes!

Millennia ago, before humans left Tulsen, Myriaden was populated by divine creatures. These beings looked like the fairies of our tales. In fact, we believe they inspired the stories our grandparents told us.
