Besides, don't you find it strange that more and more people have visions and dreams about an era that would never have existed according to the great sages of our time? It's a sign of the return of the fairies!

Don't believe me? Do some research, you'll see that I am right.
I've told you that I won't answer your questions because you're an outsider, and you don't even believe in fairies!

Replies.Content: But I do know the fairies!

Residents.Greets: May the morning fairy smile upon you!

Name: Notroll Camp
Description: The central building in Camp Notroll has been carved out of a gigantic tree stump. The loggers and hunters who reside there later constructed log buildings and a few stalls.

Dialogs.Content:
I'm starting to wonder if all those lunatics were right with their stories of forest spirits...

One of my groups of workers never returned from their expedition to the centre of the forest.

Would you care to go check if they've encountered any problems?

Brigands, vargs and undoubtedly a few other hungry creatures. 

Though if you wanted to believe the morons living in the middle of the forest, there are also dragons, unicorns, and trolls...
Mainly Elvinos. There are other species, but they're less interesting.
You can rest here, but please don't disturb the workers.

Replies.Content: Are you a Verdant? Does that mean you're related to Sir Tarul Verdant?
What trees grow in this region?
How are your team of workers doing now?
The golems, they do come from Darkblade.

Dialogs.Content:
They'll survive. Though according to their stories, these creatures were truly awful, as black as nuertesilicio! However...

... there is no such type of tree growing in our forest. Someone must have brought these creatures into the area.

It's said that there is a large forest of black barked nuertesilicio trees to the east of Rimouskan...

... Darkblade Marsh.

Replies.Content: I'll try to find more information.

Dialogs.Content:
Interesting, and will they keep attacking my teams?

*You explain to Alissia that you don't yet know what the reason for their presence is, but that it must be related to what's happening in the village.

Then I shall resolve to arm my teams. Do you know a good arms supplier?

Life is difficult in Wellnear. Its residents are always looking for new ways to improve their lot or escape their realities. 

These particular idiots decided to form some kind of cult dedicated to ancient creatures, and to donate the little wealth they had hoping to get some sort of supernatural reward.

If you wanted to rip them off, I wouldn't stop you.
I think he's a cousin, but I've never met him.
(reuse 3)

Name: Enchanfruits Estate
Description: Enchanfruits is one of the largest apple exporters west of Ordval. Few people know, however, that the estate also produces plums, pears, haskap and lemontarsus.

Dialogs.Content:
I'm looking for someone who is authorized to enter Gantras. I have a shipment of fruit to be delivered to The Monster of Gargagoth.

What? Why are you looking at me like that?
Looking for Enchanfruits? You've found it!

Name: Island of the Eternal Sister
Description:
A small luxurious house built of wood and stone, has been erected in the centre of the island.

According to legend, the sister of a former lord of Wellnear did not age. To hide the truth from the people, the lord exiled her to this place.

Dialogs.Content: When the night approaches, a mist appears on the surface of the swamps. It gives the entire place a strange, mournful feeling. I like it.

That's a well-constructed cart that you have there.

I need new furniture for the house, reckon you can make some deliveries for me?

Great work! And I managed to sculpt the rune!

The door should open now.

Good luck!

Looks like we arrived on time.

*Rhavina inspects what remains of the fresco.

Hmm... I don't have the full story, but what I do understand is that two sisters, Arriel and Ela, took an oath to ally themselves in death. They did this to take revenge on something or someone named "Laemonie" who pitted them against each other during their lifetimes.

I can't find any clue as to the significance of the baby at the bottom of the fresco. Though I imagine it's related to their conflict.

It is fascinating though, this fresco. And you're in luck! Following the fight, I came across an interesting item that will serve as payment for my services.

Come back to me if you find any more details on all this. You can consider me intrigued!
I don't often have the opportunity to see visitors on my island.

Replies.Content: I'm ready to go rune hunting.
How do you feel about the Somberseason?
Were you talking about a delivery?
I found some runes that I don't understand.

Dialogs.Content: Rhavina holds small auctions where she trades runes with visitors. For you, it's a good way to improve the runic enchantments of your companions.

That's music to my ears. 

Our destination is Manynotes Forest, to the west of here. It's quite a distance, so I hope you enjoy hiking.

Our target will be a creature they call the Great Protector. I will need its magical essence to craft the desired rune. That means you're going to need to fight it. 

And win.

You're not the only one, believe me.

Usually I charge per rune. So you bring me to the place, and I'll quote you according to the complexity of the deciphering.

I would say, about a thousand crowns per rune. Are you still interested?

Replies.Content: No way. The runes can wait.
Yes, if that's what it takes.

Dialogs.Content:
Mainly swampsharks, marsh lizards and large moccasins. Nothing super dangerous.

Though that said, I do believe there is another even more dangerous predator lurking in the waters. I've seen the corpses of mauled hunters which certainly had not been slaughtered by the usual suspects.

[dev] a small quest could introduce the presence of the Devouring Mound boss
As you wish. Though I hope you don't hold it against me that I charge fairly for my expertise.

Let me think for a few seconds...

Eureka!

I think I understand what you need. We must recreate a rune identical to the missing one. I'd normally need to go there and study the lock in person, but I don't believe that will be necessary this time.

It's possible for me to create a rune which should open many such locks. For this, I'll have to extract a rather special essence. The process of obtaining the essence is a little delicate, however, and I don't believe you have the required skill. So, I'll take care of that.

However, I will need your help in getting it back.

Ha! Ha! Ha!

* Rhavina's face lights up like that of a young girl who had just been told an incredibly funny story.

No! Eternal youth? I wish! Though believe me when I tell you it's not the first time someone has asked me that.

I do have links with the reigning Wellnear family, but you are in one of their secondary houses after all. The current lord is a distant cousin of mine, and he no longer has the means to maintain the place. 

He lets me live here under the condition that I keep it well looked after. Above all, I have to protect it from swamp monsters... and humidity.
Yes, in fact I am. I've received two separate invitations to deliver runic seminars. I'm not sure yet which one to accept, I'm not very experienced at travelling through these regions.

Replies.Content: Here, let me take a look at that map.

Name: Hidden Entrance to Mount Siho
Description: Well hidden by brambles and bracken, there is a cave entrance.

Dialogs.Content: Seriously, Badouk was right earlier, the colour of the creatures is unnatural. Something caused this mutation.
We're going to need Badouk if we find the Lord of Wellnear. You should go get him.

There seems to be an evil protective barrier over the door. I'll be able to disable it temporarily so our group can get in.

I'll concentrate, let me know when you and Badouk are ready.
I'll try, but saving him is probably a miracle beyond my ability.
Everything seems to indicate that we are in the right place.

Name: Camp of the Dreamer
Description: What was once a humble lumberjack camp has been transformed into a veritable stronghold. Its residents diverted the river to the north to irrigate the surrounding land. At least a dozen men and women, each armed to the teeth, patrol the vicinity.

Dialogs.Content:
Very well.

Enough pleasantries! We've got royal chimeras to slaughter!

I've wanted to add these creatures to my trophy cabinet for a long time, and scouts have just located some in the area.

Royal chimeras are rare. So rare that no one knows where they normally hide. I shall not miss this opportunity.
How is Reginold?
Ah yes, a present for my... how to say... good services in the past.
I'm here!

I didn't have much time to talk.

I mean, there were rituals and the Dreamer seems to have appreciated our inspirations. But I haven't been able to find out who her enemy is.

But one thing is certain, she knows there is trouble in the Mists. I don't understand all your discussions with Leonidas... but know that you are not the only ones looking for what is hidden between the worlds.
I don't think so, the Dreamer seems to be expecting an army of infernal creatures, not a band of adventurers with funny lanterns...

I... uh... for no reason.

*Finn, who stood on the sidelines every time you came here, takes a deep breath and steps out of the shadows. He approaches Sidonie with a step that was meant to be determined... but which lacked conviction, according to you.

Hi, Sidonie, it's been a long time.
You want to know more?

I have known you for a long time Sidonie, if you are here, I can easily imagine who the Dreamer is.

Do you think she would meet me? Our group might have very important information for her.

No.

* Sidonie looks at you with obvious and undisguised disgust.

We are, above all, warriors trained to face the apocalypse. As the enemy has many faces, the Dreamer prepares us for all their traps.

Replies.Content: Apocalypse? Enemy? Traps? I don't understand!

Dialogs.Content:
Yes. Though since you're forbidden from entering the compound, you must deal with me. I shall be the intermediary to your trade.

We also offer combat training to prepare people...

... for the events announced by the Dreamer.
You have set foot upon the lands of the Dreamer. You can rest and trade with the people here, but you must never draw your weapon.

Replies.Content: So can I buy and sell goods here?

Dialogs.Content: I'm not surprised. Perhaps one day the Dreamer will visit you in your dreams, and you too will experience enlightenment.
Our spiritual guide and military leader. You don't need to know more than that. Unless she summons you.

Replies.Content: Spiritual guide? Are you some kind of sect or cult?

Dialogs.Content:
Finn! You little...

*Finn takes off his helmet and smiles his best smile, finally according to you, at Sidonie.

Well, that's an old story. I must not let the past distract me.

*Sidonie looks at you with her fierce gaze and quotes aloud what seems to be a commandment from their code.

"In front of the Dreamer, the bearer of inspiration will have to bring four proposals."

Are you ready to comply with the code?

*Finn and Sidonie turn to you.

Stores.Name: Lessons from the End of Time

Name: Matteus's Woodcutters Hut
Description:
[D]The only thing that connects the imposing fortified house with a hut is the name. Matteus's home is a personal fortress built of rounded wood. Perceptive visitors will spot the platforms in the trees surrounding the clearing, designed to accommodate archers that could quickly put down unwanted guests. 

[N]A palisade has been erected around a veritable stronghold built of round wood. Lights were strategically placed in the yard to improve the visibility of the occupants and to scare away any overly curious passersby. Vicious watch dogs patrol freely.

Dialogs.Content: Don't be so jealous! You know I prefer men who breathe and bathe at least once a month.
Fine, fine. But the bread will be best when it's warm and if you're too long, there'll be nothing but crumbs left.
Alright, fine. But hurry up. You wouldn't want to miss the time when Matteus and I get shredded by hordes of flesh-hungry zombies, right?

Perfect! For my part, I found some bread for breakfast. Shall we exchange?

Once we have full bellies, it'll probably be the ideal time to deal with our undead problem. What do you say?

Replies.Content: I have to take care of one or two tasks first, but I will come back shortly.

Dialogs.Content:
Oh yeah, of course, hundreds of them! How about you? 

In seriousness, however, I believe I do have a helpful lead on the matter. A few months ago, at the market, I met Eugenie Filouderien who lives in Caledorn Forest. She and her family live a little like us, on the fringes of Kortombourger society.

Eugenie and her husband make rare objects sought after by unsavoury individuals. If you notice the symbol engraved under the censer, it looks like that of the Filouderien. 

Questioning them has to be our best bet.

Replies.Content: I need to take care of a few tasks quickly before continuing with this investigation.
Okay. I'll take care of it.

Dialogs.Content: Atora Kordan, now Atora Grandmoon. I was formerly a bounty hunter, albeit not a very successful one, and now I'm the doting wife of Matteus. Ah the domestic life!

* Atora coughs to interrupt her husband.

I defend myself very well on my own, my dear.
Hmm... Fauconneer? I've heard that name somewhere. I think your grandfather may have killed a member of his family in a duel.
You forgot alcoholic...
I know a few craftsmen, maybe I could help.
And a wonderful husband!
Didn't one of your ancestors kill a Fauconneer during a duel?
Do not hesitate to make yourself comfortable, but keep your clothes on, please.

Replies.Content: To whom do I have the honour of speaking?
Do you know an artisan specializing in occult censers?
I found the solution to your problem.

Dialogs.Content: Let us pray that this night is truly the last.
Make haste! You don't want to miss all the fun!
Those sound like the words of a person about to flee. Though I will not hold it against you. Courage is not distributed equitably in every family.
Just once a month? I guess I'm reassured.

Replies.Content: I don't have time to go to there right now.
Don't worry, I'll take care of it.

Dialogs.Content: That name doesn't mean anything to me.
I understand, but please don't delay too long.

I agree. I suspect there is someone behind all of this.

According to my limited knowledge of occultism, it would take an extremely powerful necromancer to cause such attacks. It is more likely that the perpetrator just waited for the ideal time to intervene. Either way, someone with this kind of knowledge has surely not gone unnoticed in Kortombourg.

Replies.Content: I can't take care of it right now, but I'll be back.

Dialogs.Content: Thank you. If you're ready, join us for a cup of lamden and cookies. We may as well be comfortable and well-fed while we wait for the encroaching hordes.

Replies.Content: I have a few preparations left to finish.

Dialogs.Content: Are you saying that we're the victims of some sort of intergenerational revenge plot? That seems a little implausible.

Replies.Content: I can see why you would find that farfetched. Perhaps there is an alternate motivation, though it would be necessary to travel to Maliken to find out.

Dialogs.Content: Did Rhys Pair send you? Well whatever. Everything is not going too great here, no. We get visits from the living dead most nights. Though I am capable of ensuring our protection, do not worry about that!

The more I think about it, the more plausible it seems. Do you think you could get there for me? I don't think I'd feel comfortable leaving Atora alone with these undead perverts running around half-naked.
Please, hurry. I have a bad feeling that there will be another attack tonight.

Replies.Content: Well, it may be the last attack if they do. I think our man may be Gustavo Fauconneer - he left the seigneury just a few days ago.

Dialogs.Content: That's possible, yes. Unfortunately, I don't really have many contacts in the censer community.

That's what I meant, sweetie - we are capable of defending ourselves. Though, we could do with some help finding the origin of the attacks. I cannot defend our domain and investigate at the same time. Sorry darling, I mean we cannot defend our domain...

I've read through the books of my ancestor, Sorcha. There were some indications on how to stop the dead from rising. We tried them but it barely lasted a week before we were attacked again.

We refuse to burn corpses. Therefore the best solution would be to discover what or indeed who is causing this ghoulish phenomenon. I'm no scientist, so I wouldn't know where to start that research.

Can you help us?

Replies.Content: I was mentally preparing myself to battle the living dead, so I might need some time to think.
I am here to help you.

Dialogs.Content: I love you too, honey!
Alright, then I guess we shall search elsewhere.

Replies.Content: However, I've found another trail to investigate, that of a nobleman named Gustavo Fauconneer.

Dialogs.Content: My wife and I welcome you. You are requested to respect my property and my tranquillity.

Replies.Content: Is everything going well here? Can I make myself useful?
I do not believe that the attacks were mere chance.
I have new information for you.
Night has fallen. Are you ready for one last battle?
Do you think this crypt is related to your situation?
I went to the crypt and found some clues. I suspect that the origin of your problems lies earlier than your adventures in this place.
My team and I are at your disposal. We will defend you.
Identifying who used the censer will surely allow us to find out who is responsible for the attacks.

Dialogs.Content: Fantastic! Chat with Atora for the next steps.
We Grandmoons will always be ready to defend our lives and livelihoods. Will you take up arms and fight alongside us?

Replies.Content: I have a few final preparations, but I shall be back momentarily.

Dialogs.Content: In any case, thank you. I have one last favour to ask of you. Supper with us, and wait until night falls. If we are the victim of a final attack, your help will prove invaluable.
An awakened warrior is worth two asleep. Come back quickly, the sun is already set.

Replies.Content: I'm ready, and I will gladly take your cookies.

Dialogs.Content: That name doesn't mean anything to me...
... Hey!
In my younger years, I was an adventurer and a treasure hunter, but now I'm a freelance forester and a woodworker.
My grandfather killed a lot of people in duels! But still, you really must be an... unhealthy individual... to blame an entire family for what is a very acceptable way of solving disputes!

Replies.Content: So I imagine we'll wait for the final attack of the living dead.

Dialogs.Content: I understand, do what you must though please do not tarry. Who knows what evils could come for us tonight.

Name: Captain Blroulsoso's Hideout
Description: The camp seems far too small for the number of pirates you have encountered on the island. The only logical conclusion? There must be a classic, secret pirate cave around.

Dialogs.Content: Quick! They'll be back!
As you approach Sahranna, a bell rings underground and pirates flood out of one of the encampment's tents. Are you really ready for this fight?

Name: The People's Armoury
Description: A small training hall and armoury has been constructed by the river that passes through Giltanbourg. The interior is modest yet practical. There are weapon racks lining an open room containing wooden mannequins, leather armour, and a few men practicing their combat skills.

Dialogs.Content:
Are you ignorant to the existence of the most chivalric order in Pireiria?

* Arnaud seems truly indignant at your question. He then heaves a sigh of resignation.

Forgive my demeanour, but I cannot help my irritation when so often commoners are unaware of all the Protectors do for them. 

The Protectors of the Rose were founded long before the Century of Catastrophes to protect the domain of a venal lord of what is now Maliken. When the earthquakes started, the order opposed the unjust and selfish commandments of their founder and then ventured out to help common people all over the country.

They are knights in the service of the population and not of the nobility. This doesn't mean that they never help the blue-blooded, they too are a part of the fabric of Pireiria. But the Protectors are not controlled by private interests, coin, nor crown.

* Arnaud grimaces.

We're in Gantras. There are laws. If you don't act like a civilized person, you will be arrested. If you're looking for problems, I advise you to go to Thorval. Sounds like they don't have a problem with barbarians there.

Replies.Content: There must be some ill-intentioned people who come here.

Dialogs.Content: Everyone may train here in peace and harmony. We don't have teachers, but we believe in the idea of mutual assistance. We therefore invite you to share your knowledge and pay attention to that of others.

Replies.Content: So no instructors and we're all free to do what we want?
What can you tell me about Gantras?
Would you be interested in teaching me sword combat?

Dialogs.Content:
The Duchy of Gantras is the richest and most powerful on the continent. Some will tell you it's Maliken, but a town of pot-bellied crooks and criminals cannot compare to our great land! Duke Branic will be appointed as the king's chief advisor, so at least he can bring them some civilisation soon. 

You doubt my words? Even the Protectors of the Rose, who were founded in the nation's capital, saw the light and came to set up their headquarters near Giltanbourg.

*Arnaud asks you a few questions about the handling of the sword then gives you a smile.

You will soon be ready for training, yes. It will be a great pleasure to duel with you.
Perhaps. Though I'm here often and when I'm not, Conrad, my assistant is. We both make sure that practices are respectful and civilised.

Name: Wellnear Castle Court
Description: You are in the room leading to the castle vault.

Name: Howler's Mount
Description:
No one knows for certain the true origin of the mountain's name. 

Some believe it to be a cry of distress uttered by explorer Cardomir Poveynar. Others say it is an allusion to a wizard who lived in the area whose traces can still be found in the ruins of their mountain tower.

Name: Throne of the Troll
Description: This green hill has seemingly been carved into a throne fit for a huge being. A small, natural cave is nestled between the legs of the great chair.

Residents.Name: Leonidas of Valsonge

Dialogs.Content:
Aha! Forgive yourself, young one. It's normal to be confused at this stage. You have a great journey of discovery ahead of you. 

For now, just know that you have unwittingly crossed the Mists that separate Valsonge from the rest of the world. You will notice that the people here have evolved differently to the Valsongeois. 

But I have no doubt that you will learn this all for yourself. Though if you enjoy a problem-free life, it is probably best not to mention your origins.

Yes, he is fat! Why do you think I sent you to learn how to make carts and shelters !?

* Leonidas really seems more irritable than during your first discussions, something is bothering him. *

I forgot, the pillar is not eternal, when it has used up its energy it will disappear. So you need to place it in a location that will be profitable for you.

Yes, and I said I would tell you about it later.

Take the time to improve your workshops and get to know the people of Kortombourg better.

Then I will tell you about the pillars of mist.
I'm listening...

Replies.Content: What is the purpose of making a vortex?

Dialogs.Content:
I can help you fix it, but you'll have to bring me some glass. I believe that if you go to the forest near here, you will be able to find vials abandoned by adventurers passing by.

I know, I know. Such waste is incomprehensible for a Valsongeois, but it must be understood that the resources here are much more numerous and the territory more vast.

There are many portals, though few are easy to access. Many are hidden and some were never discovered at all. Worse yet, there are some guarded by hostile forces, monsters, or even exiled Walkers.

You will need your Lantern to unlock them.

Replies.Content: What can I do after unlocking a portal?
Can my Lantern do anything else?

Dialogs.Content: Yes, in the northwest of Kortombourg, in the hills of Kortombe. Just before the forest, you will find another portal. You will likely need to unlock it before you can use it, but after doing so you will be able to travel much faster.
Awesome! I had no doubt that you would find the package quickly, but now we know that you have retained some of your faculties.
*Leonidas makes no attempt to hide his offence at your answer. He sits down in the Throne of the Troll and opens up a book.

Really? It seems a bit early to me. Exploiting your first vortex will mark a significant change in your status as a mistwalker.

From the moment you set up buildings at the Myriaden, you can attract trouble from the locals and even from Valsonge.

Replies.Content: I will wait and explore the continent a bit.

Dialogs.Content:
Portals allow you to return to your home, which is located in the Mists surrounding Valsonge.

You can also use them to walk in the Mists and quickly make the distance between two gates. This is a great advantage, especially for someone of my age, ha ha ha!

Your Lantern's glass is polarized to contain the energy of the Orb. However, there is a diffraction effect that can be exploited to see variations in the misty spectrum in the distance and thus triangulate the position of a rift or a vortex. Got it?

*Leonidas looks at you with a smile then adds:

Basically, you hold your Lantern in front of you, look into the distance, and try to see stuff that shines.

I would be happy to answer any questions you might have. Though if you are the type of headstrong person who prefers actions over words, then I have a mission you would be well suited to.

It would be a question of delivering a parcel to my good friend, Mylena Imratti, in Kortombourg. I know, I know, it's an easy job. But it will give you a great excuse to go to the delightful main village of the seigneury.

Replies.Content: I would prefer to explore the area a little more.

Dialogs.Content:
Indeed there is. Yet be patient, you are not yet ready to construct such buildings in your domain.

When you have strong tools and a few craftsmen to aid you, you will be able to build workshops facilitating machines and mills.

I have no doubt that one day you will be building even more specialized workshops such as forges, tailor shops, or fashion houses.

I see you don't have foggy eyes.

*It's unclear if this is another of Leonidas's jokes or whether you have narrowly missed out on an unpleasant-sounding medical condition.

I don't recommend going to this rift today, but if you climb Ridiculous Mountain, look towards Kortombe. There is another rift dangerously close to town.

Yes, as always I will go there by example.

You must have a cart to transport the pillar. Join me at the Troll portal and I'll provide you with a pillar that you can install in one of the nearby forests.

Replies.Content: I haven't built my cart yet.

Dialogs.Content:
That it is. I must depart for a vital matter demands my attention. Though thank you, friend, for placing your trust in me at the beginning of this great adventure of yours.

I've told you where the Mistwalkers manage their operations in Myriaden.

Strengthen your domain and your adventurers' talents a little more, then and come visit us. Together, we can unravel the story of the Vanishing Mists.

Know that as a matter of protection, only a Walker can cross the fort.

Goodbye.

*Leonidas wrinkled brow furrows in confusion at your comment.

Hurmm, it's kind of true actually, though I've never seen it that way. Mistwalkers like you will have a big part to play in the events to come.

Right now we need to concentrate on halting the flow of these creatures. But in the long term, we will need to find out whether to close the rifts or whether to open them and clear the Mist.

I can't be certain as to how or why, but the Mist damages the carts. You need a good shelter in your domain in which to store them.

Fortunately, the shelter also serves as a warehouse where you can store many more objects discovered in your adventures. They should be safe there, in your domain.

The vortex is a portal that only allows you to enter the mists but not to get out. Because of this particularity, we build installations around the vortex to exploit the resources of the surroundings.

We can then recover the resources directly in our domain without having to worry about the transport of goods.
As you wish, but I'm not sure it will be very interesting. It is always best to walk before you attempt to run.

Aha! Yes young one, you shall indeed be building more than one!

You currently have just an outdoor workshop, though some trades are not fit for the harsh weather. They will need to be practiced indoors. 

You should visit Ulrick at the Tower Construction Site. He will be happy to see you, and few have more expertise in workshops than Ulrick.

Replies.Content: Outside?! Is there no proper workshop?

Dialogs.Content:
Your Mist Lantern can do a great many things...

The most important, for now, is that it will transport you to your home if you are on the verge of death or if you are unable to continue your adventure.

Why or how this happens is a mystery, though one I am thankful for.

Though don't forget that you cannot travel like that with items that have never been in the Mists. Only a portal will allow that.

Nice cart.

So here is the pillar in question. You can install it in any forest in Kortombe. I'll let you analyse the best place yourself.

* Leonidas then explains how to activate the pillar with your Mist Orb. *

I will have to leave the region, I have a problem to resolve with ...

* Leonidas looks you straight in the eye *

You and Scisanas must be working in secret at the moment. The people of Valsonge are not ready for the changes that are coming ...

... and the people of Myriaden even less.

I'll get back to you when I can tell you more.

* Leonidas hands you two scrolls explaining the construction of pillars and leaves without another word through the Troll portal. *

Hourglass? Why it's a Mistglass!

It just so happens that creating these mystical objects is one of my specialties. They are powerful artefacts from the world of the Mists. 

I won't confuse you with all the details right now, but know that a Mistglass allows you to erase an item's history, which has the effect of...

... fixing it.

I am not sure of the exact origin of the Mistglass. I can create them at a high cost, but sometimes Walkers also find them in places affected by the Mists.
Hmm... yes, I'd recognize that disoriented air anywhere. You are neither from Kortombe nor this country, are you? Do not fear, my child, I was a Mistwalker too.
As you wish. However, it is of great importance for you to understand how to use the portal properly.

Impressive...

* Leonidas seems lost in thought

With all you've learned, it will only take a little willpower to become a powerful Walker.

I'll give you time to improve your domain. Then I shall have to talk to you about something else.

That's right. Though it can only be seen from the top of the mountain. The angle of polarization is too vertical or something... I think... I'm not a geometrist.

Anyway, what you need to know is that a fearsome creature named Zhyxhu is attracted to this rift. Repelling Zhyxhu is a vital task that must be performed often. That is why the Mistwalkers are being asked to contain it.

Replies.Content: I think I'll try my luck!

Dialogs.Content: I'm listening...

In Valsonge, we use teleportation to move around. Here, we use simpler means of transportation.

Though whether it's a simple cart or a flying boat, the concept remains the same: a vehicle should always be crafted to withstand the stress of its intended environment.

Were you searching a swamp for resources, you might want to start with a cart that has large wheels made from pan.

Yes yes, we can talk about it. I believe Choubard has already shown you how to make poles.

The first real type of vortex you need to learn is the pillar.
Come here and get comfortable in the Throne of the Troll. Then, look south.

Good yes! The pillar looks like a totem pole, it uses the properties of the constituting materials to become entangled with the surrounding materials, transporting them into the Mists.

Finally, I believe the Mist Creatures Collective gets the job done, because the Pillar commands them, and since the Pillar is tied to the Misthouse in your home, the resources are there.

Replies.Content: There are going to be pillars everywhere!

Dialogs.Content:
It will be even worse. If multiple faults open at the same time in Valsonge, it will be the end of our capital.

I tried to warn them, but Valsonge's council is trapped in its political game.

Some of the representatives believe that it is necessary to encourage the opening of the rifts in order to ultimately liberate the city. The other tries to plug them in secret without even thinking of looking for a proper solution.

Now I have to show you an old trick of the trade, in case you haven't discovered it yourself.

Your Lantern allows you to see spectra of Mists, which will give you clues about the position of both vortices and rifts.

First, you need to build a base camp. It is easy to build and will allow you to harvest basic resources. Later you can build specialized buildings.

We do not build in Myriaden as in the mist, you have to create a building capable of withstanding bad weather. I advise you to visit the inhabitants of Kortombe and to study their constructions.

My best advice for this moment is to stay within the vicinity of Kortombe. Get to know the people and assist them in whatever ways you can. 

Return to me once you have built a better reputation amongst the people of Kortombourg.
This should do the trick. Soon though, you will have to consider making a better Lantern for your Orb.

I've already completed my little investigation in town, and it seems you're already quite the popular one. You fit in well with the civilization of the outside world.

That means it's time to focus on your team. 

Here's what I recommend...

Replies.Content: Wait, I forgot to do something important.

Dialogs.Content: Yes, the mists are inhabited by entities, creatures or spirits. And we, as a walker, are able to influence them.

Ah yes, of course. I guess you haven't heard much from here, because Walkers usually do not return home unless they are being held incommunicado. Everything should change in the next few years, I suppose, since there seems to have been a phenomenon that has disturbed a great deal of the Mist Orbs.

My apologies, I've strayed from your question. That is a habit of old age. You are in the seigneury of Kortombe, in the province of Ordval. I will not go into details, since some answers are best discovered by one's self. 

Though I would warn you that the people here do not have the same accent or the same customs as those of Valsonge.

No...

I may not look like it, but I'm a busy man. I will have to leave soon, though I have one last test for you. After that you will have to manage on your own for a while.

It is essential that you build your network of portals, that is the way to make the most of Myriaden.

Have your curiosity taken over and you want to explore the world beyond the mists?

Vortexes will only allow you to go to from Myriaden to your domain, not the other way around.

The closest vortex is on the Sorcerer's Mound. When you are ready, I will help you set up your first station there.

*sigh*

The weather may be less meaningful for a walker, but I'm getting old all the same.

I can help you fix it, but you'll have to bring me some glass. I believe that if you go to the forest near here, you will be able to find vials abandoned by adventurers passing by.

I know, I know. Such waste is incomprehensible for a Valsongeois, but it must be understood that here, the resources are much more numerous and the territory more vast.

Seriously?

A giant pillar filled with strange inscriptions and carried by an adventurer team is perfectly suited to get you banished from a lordship because they thought you were trying to bring down a curse on the territory ...

Well, that's my opinion, you do what you want with it.

Yes, now that your Lantern has been repaired, you can. You're welcome!

That said, unless standard training has been greatly improved since my day, then you probably haven't learned how to unlock a portal. 

Return to your arrival point, and I shall explain how to activate it.

Replies.Content: I don't have time right now.

Dialogs.Content:
You look strong, but I don't like your chances of carrying a Palvable monolith on your shoulders. 

Didn't you see how Ulrick was planning his expeditions? You're going to need a vehicle.

It is inevitable, a Walker who wants to progress will have to surround himself with a team.

The first step is to have a place where they can live. So you have to build a shelter in your home. Preferably something resembling that which exists outside of the Mists.

Then visit the region and find workers who are willing to settle in your domain. It is far from simple because settling in the Mists is not a lifestyle for everyone.

But you'll often run into people who are... special.
It's wise, I think. Come back when you are ready.
Start by learning what Choubard has to show you. Then I'll tell you about another power of your Lantern.

No, once the pillar is activated it passes through the mists like the posts. So the inhabitants of Myriaden will see nothing. But other walkers could sense his presence.

Ah yes, the people of Myriaden might see you transporting the pillar to its destination though. And they are unlikely to like it.

Unfortunately, yes. And it's no joke!

The haze between the worlds is weakening and no one knows exactly what will happen in the long run.

But in the short term, I can assure you that it's going to be hellish.

Trapped in the Mists, there are many legendary monsters. They begin to borrow the rifts and are able to exit into the real world, although they cannot move away from the rift. Still, I fear it is only a matter of time.

Replies.Content: So am I a bit like these creatures?

Dialogs.Content:
Ah, you hear it too! I'm sure it's from Trolgobeth Cave. Sounds a lot like a vargr distress call to me.

You should check it out.
Warm greetings to you, Walker friend.

Replies.Content: Nothing here is familiar. Where am I?
I have a problem with my Lantern.
I have a problem with my Lantern.
Can I reactivate the portal I came in through?
Are there other portals in the world?
Could you offer me some advice?
Did you have something else important to say?
You said you can see a rift from the Ridiculous Mountains?

Residents.Greets: You! Yes, you! Come closer! I can aid you.

Name: Bloody Bush Plateau
Description: An eye-catching bush with crimson leaves has, against all odds, grown from this small rocky plateau. A few steps away from the thicket, there are some stones that must have been stacked on top of one another until recently. No doubt it was intended as a sign post for travellers.

Name: Rabouf Estate
Description: Similar in structure to the small farms of the region, the Rabouf Estate is only distinguished by the bright red of its buildings. Twenty sheep graze in the fields watched by a huge sheepdog. A teenage boy sits on a log, whistling as he repairs clothes. Two little girls playfully chase a tame oryctus.

Dialogs.Content: *Gerald tells you that the mule is for sale.

Replies.Content: I would like to buy your mule.
What do I need to own a mule?

Dialogs.Content: *To purchase the animal, you must have an appropriate place in your domain to house it.

Hahaha! Ready, are you? We'll see about that when you're knee-deep in manure. But it's a very interesting trade. Some animals are more finicky than others, you will have to learn how to build facilities fit for each of the animals you wish to breed.
I am always happy to receive visitors. Unless they're here to claim my money, of course.

Replies.Content: Need some help on the estate?

Dialogs.Content: No, actually, but thank you. If you're bored, you can always return to see Mylena Imratti in Kortombourg Square. I reckon she'll have a little job for you.

I heard about you at The Queen's Fianc. They say you offer your help immediately to all those who need it. I'm honoured to join that esteemed group.

Do you know anything about construction and transportation? I have to renovate my shelter and my little cart before visiting the next Larcen Festival.

Oh not much. They're easy animals, especially this gentle old fella. A simple pasture with a drinking trough should do the trick. Once you have a pasture, take a closer look at it and you'll find you'll be able to tinker with it.

Replies.Content: I'm ready to begin housing and breeding animals.

Name: Lighthouse of the Long Night
Description: Day and night, the lighthouse projects its multicoloured beams over the region of Enorwen and the waters of Lake Corsitan. Many tents and temporary huts have been set up around the building designed in variegated stones.

Dialogs.Content:
Impressive! With a name like that, it's got to work!

Do you want me to show you what we've managed so far?
The lighthouse uses the transparency and colouring of crystals and powders to produce its starry lighting effects. Lighthouse operators are always looking for new colours.
No... I'm pulling your pipe, of course it is.

Soon we're going to have another party. I'm working with Kolda on a new colour diffuser, but we're a little stuck with our build. 

We'd have to direct the flow of light in a linear fashion, but we're just not getting there.

Replies.Content: An object from my country might help!

Dialogs.Content:
A little. I know there are heavy concentrations of the Claw Assembly in the Thorval area, but I wouldn't advise you go there.

I also heard that the headquarters of the Order of the Hippogriff are in the area of Larcen. Though I'd stay away from them if I were you.

Hmm... what else? The Protectors of the Rose hold a stronghold in the Duchy of Gantras. Them, I like, even if they're a little stuck up.

Do you really have your own country? 

Haha! An old Caravaneer dad joke... it's not really funny, I know.

Could you tell me more?

Whoooooaaaaaa!!

Did you see that lance of light?!!!

I think we might have to forget about using the effect to add some sparkle to my parents' birthday party. But do you think we could use our device to defend the lighthouse, maybe the whole of Enorwen, from pirates?

Hoooo, my parents are going to like the idea so much... or maybe not... hmm... should we keep it secret?

Bleeehhh!

That damn feast of the Great Tree! Every year my uncles wake me up super early to go and watch the sun rise over Zarata.

It would be a much better festival if we could have candy!
Welcome to the Lighthouse of the Long Night!

Replies.Content: You seem very young to be taking care of a lighthouse.
Do you have any interesting information for me?

Dialogs.Content: Yep! Well, in fact, Andreas's rank is higher than mine, but he doesn't like talking to visitors too much. Don't worry, I don't take care of educating our members, but I do direct them to people who can!

And you seem to be very poorly dressed to be judging someone by their appearance.

* Tristan laughs out loud.

Don't make that face, old-timer! You're right, I'm not in charge of the lighthouse on a permanent basis. It's my parents who do that. But as Andreas and Karel have gone on an adventure again, I'm their makeshift replacement! In fact, I also act as a representative of the Lunar Caravaneers.

Replies.Content: Are you the Caravaneers' representative in Enorwen?
Is the lighthouse a meeting point for Caravaneers?
Do you have information on other factions like the Lunar Caravaneers?

Dialogs.Content: Sure! I have some juicy secrets! But I'll only share them with our members. After all, I wouldn't want to offend someone who isn't family.

Name: Enchantress Park
Description:
The Enchantress Park was developed by one of the first generations of the Kortombe family. 

In a small central pond, many rare species of fish and amphibians make their home. A statue of Cornea has been erected near a small concert stage.

Hunting is permitted in the park, but reserved for nobles and guests of the Kortombe family. There are also deer, oryctus, and pheasants.

Name: Gris Domain
Description: A dozen growers and assistants carry out regular work to allow the gigantic agricultural business of the Gris family to function properly.

Dialogs.Content: He! He! My comrade of the night! I hope you don't have nightmares when you think back to it! He! He!
I understand. Thank you all the same for your interest in us.
I'd take the time to explain everything to you, my sister, but it would be far less funny.

Uhh...okay fine. A few weeks ago, one of our cows, Charlotte, gave birth to a two-headed calf. It's rare, but it happens; it happened once in my grandfather's time. So we thought little of it other than that it was a rare event.

Since that time, many phenomena of the same kind have been seen. Oryctus who now eat nothing more than chocolate, goats with bleeding eyes but no other symptoms, and even mice who no longer try to escape from cats. 

It makes no sense. It's like the animal world is turning upside down. I don't know if you can help us.

Replies.Content: I am ready to help you.
I don't have time to take care of this right now.

Dialogs.Content:
Like most farms in Ordval, we grow many traditional vegetables and cereal plants: wheat, oats, corn, carrots, turnips, potatoes, etc.

We also produce some watermelons, vasanets and radishes.

We also breed cows and goats for leather and dairy production and sheep for meat and wool. We have a team that specialises in processing who turns them into cheese, cured meats and jam.

Oh dear! Is it really so obvious? I have really had trouble sleeping lately. Mauve told me that it's because my bed is too hard and told me about a master craftsman in Larcen who makes wonderfully comfortable beds.

But I can't leave Kortombe and it would take a cart to bring the bed back here. I don't know what else I can do.

Replies.Content: I happen to have a cart!
Could you try the Golden Gin?

Dialogs.Content: *Despite her good humour, darker thoughts seem to torment Blanche.
Oh! Yes! Everything is going wonderfully well!

Welcome! We are one of the largest employers in Kortombe, and certainly the largest agricultural area in this part of Pireiria. Dad takes care of the business management while my sister and I manage the work on the land.

Replies.Content: Is everything going well in the domain?
Was your night everything that you could have hoped for?

Dialogs.Content: Hey! That's not nice!

*Blanche gives you an angry look

I will solve my problems without alcohol thank you very much!

The vasanet is a typical vegetable from the province of Ordval. It is a kind of turnip with a more bitter taste and very red flesh.

We have three different cheeses, two soft and one hard. Grirouille is our best seller.
Or with our homemade cherry nectar. Delicious!
I thought so, thank you for listening to me anyway.
*Mauve looks horrified at her sister.
Hey! Ho! A visitor! Welcome newcomer!

Replies.Content: What's your role at Gris Domain?

Dialogs.Content:
You can notice?

*Mauve sighs a deep sigh.

My girlfriend is meant to meet a future client in the next few hours, but the location of her meeting does not inspire me with confidence.

Replies.Content: I can watch her back if you want.

Dialogs.Content:
You're right. Sorry sis. 

I am the prettiest, but she is the least mean.
Really, nothing could be better!

I take care of the production of textile fibres and manage our small sewing and dyeing workshop.

Incidentally, I'm also the less pretty, but friendlier sister of Blanche.
Personally, I prefer Drucmuche. A much more pronounced taste. Excellent with a chicken salad... cooked in our workshop  from local Gris ingredients of course.

Name: Mecablip Dump
Description: There is a veritable mountain of ancient machinery here. Broken parts, old cogs, and loose springs are piled as high as houses. Finding something of interest here will be a challenge.

Name: Minokiller Outpost
Description: A watchtower encircled by a low wall protects the passage between the plains and the territory of Kortombe.

Dialogs.Content: Creatures in Manynotes Forest are causing trouble for travellers. The militia requests that a scout discovers more.

An important message must be relayed to Gantras, literally. The militia requires a volunteer to complete the first stage of the journey, from here to Marquise Valley. Another messenger will take over the delivery from there.
Take a letter to Bentro Cemetery and make the caretaker understand that its contents MUST be respected.
A platform in a tree resembling an observation post is visible across Sorcerer's River. It is necessary to ensure that its builders are not using it to spy on the seigneury.
Strange fires have been seen on the precipices of the Ridiculous Mountains. Inspection is required. The militia requires hardy scouts up to the task.
The militia needs a volunteer to temporarily replace Renine who guards the Statue of Kortomis.
Ruins, possibly related to Kortomis, have been discovered on Hammer Hill. A capable volunteer disciplined in academics is requested for an inspection of the ruin.
*You approach the bulletin board. Most of the tasks have been stamped with the seal of the Kortombourg Militia though a few are signed by the Order of Kortomis...

Legends say that an ancient fortress stood here long ago, built to protect the territory from minotaur hordes living in the hills.

Today, though, we just think the name sounds super impressive.
If you're here, you're likely lost or you've lost your mind. There are few reasons to intentionally visit the Leviathan Plains.
One of my patrols fell to a gang of trogulnus scouts who attacked them without mercy. We're preparing an expedition to push them back from the guard post and avenge our fallen comrades.

The plains themselves are not especially dangerous, but you have to keep an eye on the hills. Dangerous creatures reside there and the terrain is most rugged.

If you're looking to explore the area, take the easy path following the cliff to the west, then head up north following the lake.

If you're not a real adventurer, it's probably best to turn around and take the road back to Kortombe.

Name: [D] To Delete estie
Description: A stone slab path leads you to a ghastly monster guarding a chest.

Name: Inn in the Wall
Description: Sharing its thick stone walls with the palisade surrounding the city of Thorbourg, the Inn in the Wall appears rather welcoming at first glance. The clientele are largely comprised of travellers, farmers and hunters.

Dialogs.Content:
It's only been a few months since Eyerik went missing and his father seems to have given up. Well, frankly even that's too generous. As far as I can tell, he didn't make any effort to find him.

Some believe that the son simply ran away. Others believe he's dead and the earl already knows it.

None of these theories satisfy me, but hey, I'm just a simple innkeeper. If I've managed to pique your interest, ask around the port. Be careful though, some people might not like the line of questioning.

Ha! That basta...

... ahem... thank you. At least I'm not about to be buried alive, eh? I'll find a way to get him arrested. Though he is a militiaman, it won't be easy...

Baaah! I reckon you're more likely to stumble upon a trunk left behind by a drunken sailor or a package that sank with a ship than a buried treasure. Although...

... the most interesting rumour concerning a hidden treasure remains that of the brigand, Lorankis. According to the stories, there are secret plans to reproduce his famous Hallissarde axe. You might find out more about all that a little further into the mountains, but I couldn't help you much more than that.

Thanks to the hop house and the nearby hop fields, we have a wide selection of beers and ales, such as our world-famous OPCT. We also sell several hop-based meals. My personal recommendation is the oryctus  la Dirontol. Though you should also try the flipped-bowl supreme with Thorval sauce.

Interesting, yes... as long as the wall isn't falling on our heads.

I'm not even joking. Lately, an exceptional amount of debris from the wall has fallen onto our roof. I'm starting to wonder if we're not on the brink of a terrible accident.

Enjoy your ale!

Replies.Content: I have some experience in these matters. I'll take care of it.
Shame, I don't have time to help you.

Dialogs.Content: That it is! Well then, let us drink until the sky falls on our heads!
Welcome to my inn! I hope you'll take the time to taste some of our local specialties, like OPCT!

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the county?
The architecture of your inn is interesting.
Did you just hear those thudding noises?

Dialogs.Content:
Yeah, thanks...

*You get the distinct impression that she hoped you would go and deal with it.

Damn it! He's been doing it all over again...

I'm going to have to make a formal complaint to Jon Thorval, but I don't have much hope that will change the situation.

I dare not ask someone to go and make him listen to reason, that could cause even more trouble.

Replies.Content: You're quite right. Best leave him to it.

Dialogs.Content:
This is an important port, but you probably already knew that. Like any port, there's a lot of commercial activity and almost as much criminal activity.

As I imagine is also often the case in port towns, there are plenty of tales of buried treasure and fearsome pirate captains. Though what I've found most strange of late is the disappearance of Jon Thorval's son. And no less peculiar than the son's disappearance is the reaction of his father.

Replies.Content: The disappearance of Jon Thorval's son?

Name: The Filouderiens' Shack
Description: Once clearly a place built for luxury, this log home has fallen into disrepair. The old palisade has collapsed almost entirely, and some of the secondary buildings are little more than ruins. The smell of spoiled meat hangs in the air. At least, you hope that's what it is.

Dialogs.Content:
*Eyes reddened by tears, Eugenie greets you with a little wave of her hand. A cry of pain erupts from her decrepit old house, visibly startling her. She gives you a forced smile.

All is well, I assure you.

Replies.Content: Are you sure everything is okay?
What can I do for you?
What can you tell me about Yamal Filouderien?

Dialogs.Content:
For days, vargr packs have been circling our house. My husband saw them right in our yard last night. I'm terrified that they're coming for my children.

Get rid of any nearby vargrs, and I'll help you end the spell that haunts the Grandmoons. You may think me heartless to exploit their situation so, but I am merely a desperate mother doing what she must.

Replies.Content: I'll have to keep you waiting a little longer, I have urgent quests I must see to first.

Dialogs.Content:
My children's lives aren't urgent enough? Fine. 
Though I hope you are prepared to carry the burden of their deaths on your shoulders should the worst occur.

Yamal? He was one of my husband's forefathers, I believe he was a painter. Or was it a poet? I think he worked for Reinfort Kortombe what must have been three centuries ago. I can ask my husband if he knows more, once he gets home that is.

I'm very sorry. This is not much of a welcome, is it? The truth is, grave misfortune has befallen us in recent weeks. I was raised not to ask for charity, but we need help. 

*Eugenie calmly pulls herself together.

Charles was injured while hunting. That was over a week ago, and we have nothing more for the kids to eat. We have four children to feed and I can't go to Kortombourg and leave Charles with them in his state. There wouldn't be a house to come back to. 

If you help us, I'd be so grateful that I'd introduce you to my sister, or my brother, I don't judge.

Replies.Content: I will help you as best as I can.
I can't help you at the moment.

Dialogs.Content:
*Eugenie does not manage to hold back a sob, but hurries to wipe her eyes with a big dirty handkerchief.

I understand... you have more important things to do than take care of poor people like us. We will survive. Somehow.

Name: Banks of the Arcane River
Description: The aquatic plants that grow in this section of the Arcane River differ from those living upstream and downstream. A keen fisherman's eye will also notice that the fish swimming in the area are nothing like the other species seen in the waters of the realm.

Name: The big red mushroom
Description: A huge red bolete mushroom stands in the centre of a forest clearing. Purple butterflies, violet birds, and blue oryctus have taken up residence near the fungus.

Residents.Name: Professor Ouab

Dialogs.Content:
Good question, young one. The stench of a fungal potion protected me. To the spiders, I appear as just one more pustule on the surface of this magnificent mushroom.

It's an old herbalist's trick. Though to be fair, I didn't expect to become a prisoner of this clearing, trapped eating bolete for two whole days. Good job it's tasty, eh? 

*Ouab takes another bite of mushroom.
Great, here's a list of materials to use. The result won't always be spectacular, but it will at least give you an idea of what makes a good tool.

Replies.Content: I'll come back as soon as it's done!

Dialogs.Content:
It's been a long time since I taught and I'm not sure I still have the energy for it.

And yet, you just saved my life.

We're going to make a deal. These spiders put me behind in my studies. Help me complete my rounds of gathering, and I will begin instructing you in herbalism.

Indeed. Herbalism is science and art combined.

I can see from your billhook that you already know how to forage for plants and herbs - an important preliminary step before true herbalism.

People don't always understand it, but you can't just stuff all the plants you come across in the forest in a bag and assume a herbalist can use them.

But I digress, herbalism is the job that transforms plants and substances into potions and serum.

Replies.Content: What if I wanted to learn?

Dialogs.Content: Damn. I liked that idea. Come back to me when you have a good cart that's good enough.

Actually, we'll start by destroying one! 

I happen to have an old herbarium in the Dantrin Woodlands. I no longer use it, but I would like to recover some of the materials.

Replies.Content: I think I've got what it takes.
I don't think my cart could handle that.

Dialogs.Content: Oh dear! Oh dear! Looks like you'll have to make some new ones for your future herbarium.

Of course. We can't sit in the corner of an inn and make potions!

Practicing herbalism requires a suitable place for mixing plants. The herbarium will become your aromatic and telluric sanctuary and many other words of the kind that academicians like to use to sound smart.

Replies.Content: Do I have to build one?

Dialogs.Content:
Ah yes, the basic tools of the herbalist. You have to look for materials of high purity so as not to cause contamination of the plants.

I'll start your training by getting you to create a few tools yourself. If the result is satisfactory, we can continue the tutelage.

Replies.Content: I have the workshops to do that.

Dialogs.Content: Ho ho! Yes, I believe they probably will. Can you do anything about that?

Replies.Content: Don't move. These arachnids can taste my steel!

Dialogs.Content: This red bolete is delicious!

Replies.Content: These spiders are surely going to end up eating you.
Why didn't the spiders attack you?

Dialogs.Content: Ohhhh yes! I'll take care of the more difficult plants with my blueroc billhook and leave the easier ones to you.

Residents.Greets: Would you care to discuss herbal medicine?

Name: Klotoss Tribe
Description:
A few dome-shaped huts covered in compacted mud are well concealed at the bottom of the valley.

There are signs of recent activity, and yet no smoke to indicate the presence of the tribe. Perhaps you'll have to get closer.

Dialogs.Content:
*You notice other Klotoss scampering away as if you were a dragon. Nik, however, just takes a few steps back.

Nasty!
*The Klotoss looks at you without moving.

Me Nik. You want?

*You understand that Nik is on the verge of fleeing.
*The Klotoss takes a bucket and wets her head. Then she points forlornly towards the swamp.

Name: Harmony Camp
Description: A small guard post has been built here to accommodate people arriving in the most populated area of Larcen. Travellers can also stop here for a bite to eat and a chat with local guards.

Dialogs.Content: Those dirty rats will pay!

Replies.Content: What else did you learn about the scabonzis?
Did you discover anything important about the scabonzis during your mission?
The Scabonzis are rapidly expanding in Grandfall Forest, threatening the life of my friend who lives there. Do you have a solution to repel them?

Dialogs.Content:
Each Scabonzi warband conquering new territory is led by a warlord. If this one is killed, they fight among themselves to have the command of the troops and generally abandon the invasion in progress.

However, it can be very difficult to locate the leader. He hides among his troops and keeps a low profile so as not to derail their mission. I'm willing to help you find it, but you're going to have to lend me a hand. This task is very dangerous.

Replies.Content: I will assist you to the best of my knowledge. Thank you for risking your life to help me save my friend.

Dialogs.Content: I understand. Come back to me when you're ready to make the final assault.

My espionage mission allowed me to observe scabonzi scouts in the plains constantly returning to the neighbouring woods.

I discovered that shaman and warrior scabonzis were hiding out in there.

I say we take the fight to them! Let's mount an offensive and hit them head-on in those woods!

Ah! Thank you.

I like to wander around the Knight sector before doing my patrols during this season. It's a special time.

Now that we have greatly weakened their forces, we are ready to launch the final assault.

Go there and deliver the killing blow!

Replies.Content: It sounds too dangerous to me.

Dialogs.Content:
When I was captured, I was returning with vital information.

From the top of the plain, I managed to see a tribal castle located in a small forest.

Let me point out the location on your map.

Oh? You've never heard of them? They're a kind of goblinoid, common in the north of Ordval. Technically, we're further west, but some scabonzis venture down here and cause all kinds of mischief.

They look like, uh, how to put this, like huge rats on two legs that can wield weapons and wear armour. You should never mistake them for shandoris. That could be the last mistake you ever make.

Replies.Content: Could I really confuse them with the shandoris?

Dialogs.Content:
Matis, one of our best spies, has been gone for too long. He should have reported back by now.

He had gone to seek information on the position of a rumoured scabonzi fort in the plains.

Go find him, I'm afraid something has happened to him.

* Theosos doesn't seem to understand the meaning of your question, then he bursts into a warm laugh.

Ah! No... uh, actually, but the name of camp is related to the river and not to, uh, a sentiment.
I ensure that travellers going to the capital understand that we will not tolerate troublemakers. I'm also here to warn the troops if any scabonzis get too close to the bridge.
Welcome to Harmony Camp!

Replies.Content: So I guess everything is running perfectly smoothly here?
Can I do something for you?

Dialogs.Content:
Good work! We have our hands full with these creatures.

As you have some experience, I may have something for you...

Well, you know, many of us have difficulty accepting the bestial appearance of the people of Jawana. My brother married a shandori, so I understand, uh, the difference...

The scabonzis, on the other hand, are monsters... no doubt about it.
What a relief! I'm very happy to see you back with us, Matis!

Name: Lyrmouges Stables
Description:
Long before travellers can see Lyrmouges Stables, they can hear the creaking of its unoiled hinges and the whistling of the wind running through its slats. 

When it finally comes into view, they're met with ruined structures, whose once rich decorations are now all but faded and destroyed. The grounds are littered with the corpses of animals. The presence of damp straw beds and crude firepits suggest that vagrants rest in the ruins.

The buildings have been abandoned since the death of Renard Lyrmouges. Locals claim that they are haunted by a stable boy killed by a rabid horse. Passing travellers claim to have heard the whinnying of horses at night despite all the horses being thought long dead or stolen.

Name: The Camp of Last Chances
Description:
[D]Some men and women repair used tunics and torn pants. A few young children are laughing and playing with knights and brigands. A muscular teenager unsuccessfully tries to impress three young washerwomen.

[N]The camp is surprisingly silent at night. Armed, masked men appear to be patrolling between the tents. No children are visible outside.

Dialogs.Content: Hmm... I seem to have fallen into an ambush.

Replies.Content: I better stay away for now.

Dialogs.Content: *Petunia noticed your arrival near the camp. Although she doesn't know you, your presence seems to have reassured her.
Well, friend, it looks like you've strayed from the good path! Ha! Ha! Ha!

Who am I? Let's say that I am the president of an association whose aim is to better distribute wealth between the rich and the poor. 

And you have just stumbled into the centre of the poorest camp in Kortombe! Ha! Ha! Ha!

Name: Danfeust Mine
Description:
[D]The mine appears to have been abandoned decades ago. A few rusty picks are lying on the ground near the old cart rails. And yet, peculiarly, the interior of one of the caverns seems to be maintained daily.

[N]A few suspicious-looking people enter and exit the normally disused mine. Light, music, and voices echo from further inside one of the caverns.

Founded a few years before the Treaty of Maliken, the Danfeust Mine was in operation for almost 80 years. Today, the place is abandoned, but some independent and amateur geologists continue to explore it in the hope of discovering a new deposit.

Those who know the secrets of the realm know that the mine now serves as one of the most important black markets of the seigneuries. At night, numerous merchants, brigands and smugglers meet here to sell illicit goods and products that are otherwise closely monitored by the authorities.

Dialogs.Content: The baroness pays me to prevent curious adventurers from injuring themselves while exploring the disused mine. You may not believe me, but I have had easier jobs.

Replies.Content: Do you want to get out of this cave a bit?

Dialogs.Content: And why not!? Do you have an adventure for me? One condition though, I want a more comfortable place to live than here.

Name: Plateauvores Camp
Description: A small camp has been erected at the bottom of a large cliff. Men and women prepare their equipment to climb an imposingly sheer escarpment.

Dialogs.Content: Hail stranger! I hope you're enjoying the view. Are you here for climbing or training?

Replies.Content: I'm just visiting. What are you doing here?

Dialogs.Content:
We are training to climb a dangerous cliff face, of course!

Some do it for fun, others out of necessity. Many adventurers return to me to thank me and to tell me how precious my climbing lessons have been to their adventures.

The men you see before you are highly experienced; this cliff is far too dangerous for beginners.

If you feel your climbing progress has stagnated, I could show you a thing or two. Though I give all my future apprentices the same challenge. First, climb the Ridiculous Mountains, then return to me for your next lesson.

Replies.Content: I have already reached the summit!
I believe I can learn what I need to alone.

Dialogs.Content: Let's just hope those aren't famous last words! We'll be here when you break your leg or change your mind.

Arrrrgh! I'm having a bad day!

A few nave adventurers came to see me for rock-climbing training. But the geniuses concluded that the snap hooks we use for the ropes were objects that they could simply throw away after use.

In reality, the things are worth a bleedin' fortune!

If you find any on the mountain, pick them up. I'll give you a reward for any you return to me!

Name: Ridge Path
Description: A tiny path follows one of the mountain's precipitous ridges.

Name: TestQuestElder
Description: [d] There you go!

Name: Wreck of the River-Rat
Description:
The River-Rat was a small boat designed specifically for navigating the waters of the Chiona. It mainly carried equipment for miners and mountain explorers. 

Scorch marks and broken shafts indicate that its sinking occurred due to an assault by flaming arrows from the far side of the river. The corpses of its sailors are still fresh, suggesting that the attack only took place very recently.

Dialogs.Content:
It's a military camp that's been installed nearby for a few months now. I'm not sure what they're looking for. Rumour has it that the main officer is a famous heroine from the capital.

* Kryhn shrugs his shoulders indicating that he's not normally one to trust rumours.

Huh. Interesting. It looks like a list. I recognize the names of Anya Sternakovic and Podrick Rask. Rask was the captain of the River-Rat and Anya is a trader in Thorbourg. The other name here vaguely rings a bell too...

Anyway, the piece of paper appears to have been torn from someone's hand. I guess whoever was holding it, maybe Rask, snatched it out of a pocket... either that or he had it in his hands and someone snatched it from him.  It looks like the original list probably had more names on it.

*Kryhn clears his throat.

My father-in-law and I sometimes come here to have a few beers and get away from the family. A few days ago, we witnessed the bandits' brutal assault on the River-Rat, so naturally we dropped our rods and beers and ran! Most of our beers, at least.

*Kryhn looks visibly uncomfortable. He sighs.

I know we should have gone to Thorval Vigilance Camp. There are, apparently, extremely well-trained soldiers there who might have been able to intervene. Although I doubt it would have made a difference.

So anyway, I wanted... umm... to make sure I wasn't dreaming.

I did, yes. Though I found nothing of note...

* Kryhn's face darkens. He shudders.

... apart from charred bodies.

If you want to rummage through the place, we can look at what you find, together.

[the quest leads to the list of names which will start the intro)

Replies.Content: I found some bits and pieces of little value. Though I also found a body clutching this torn piece of paper in its hands. Here...

Dialogs.Content: The one of Kortombe? We surely have a distant ancestor, but I assure you that I have no more royal blood in my veins than I do wine. In fact, I surely have more alcohol in my body than nobility.
I've no intention of stopping you if you're planning to steal from the cargo. I'm not here for that.

Replies.Content: Verdant? Any connection to the knight of the same name?
Have you searched the wreckage? (will lead to a quest / task)

Name: Pirate Dump
Description: The pirates on the island seem to use the place to dump their useless items. Especially empty rum barrels.

Name: Diadem Manor
Description:
Servants and labourers work day and night to carry out the maintenance work necessary for the proper functioning of the luxurious Diadem manor. They must feed the animals, oil the doors, polish the glasses, and make sure the windows are spotless. Not to mention keeping the beds ready to welcome visitors at all times.

Historically, the main function of the Diadem manor was to receive noble visitors from the Kortombe, but over time it became a second home for the Valero and their friends. It is no longer administered by the ruling family of the barony.

Name: Manticore Cemetery
Description: Dozens of manticore skeletons of all sizes sit at the summit of the mountain. Huge scavengers revolve around the most recent corpses, picking the flesh from their carcasses.

Name: Fortress Prison
Description: A thick layer of unbreakable stone lines this small airtight cell. Smells of mould and decay hang in the air. Three wooden beds are attached to the walls. The only light source is the small window in the heavy wooden door to the cell.

Dialogs.Content:
Well, I was skipping through the forest leaving a trail of breadcrumbs when a wolf dressed as my grandma tried to eat me. While escaping, I made it to a house inhabited by a family of tortolions. Then, while eating some of their oatmeal, which was rather too cold might I add, they came home and kicked my ass!

In seriousness, I was an arrogant fool and came here unprepared... you can guess the rest.

How about we get out of here first and I'll tell you my life story later, yeah?

Thank you!

Then let us reconvene at the Mountainfoot Relay. My thirst for ale grows stronger by the minute... and we'll be much more comfortable there than in this abominable place.

Replies.Content: I hope you're fit enough to follow me.

Dialogs.Content:
If I say "no", will you be leaving me to rot in this cell? At least bring me bread and wine... or beer... lots of beer.

My name is Badouk. I assume twas Leonidas that sent you?

Ah! That old wreck thought I was going to need help!

*Badouk looks at you then looks to the ground, massaging his wrists.

Seems he was right.

* Badouk appears hurt and extremely tired

I really hope you're here to rescue me?

Replies.Content: Okay. Come with me. We'll find a safer place for you to continue your story.

Name: Argistant Outpost
Description: A fortification protects the lands of Gantras from creatures coming from the mountains.

Name: Dematis Mine
Description: A decade ago, a rush of independent miners flocked to Dematis Mine to recover the precious minerals found in the natural caverns. After the surface minerals were extracted, its tunnels became neglected, lacking the investment required for further excavation.

Name: Top of the Trail of Falls
House of the Old Man
Description: Located near the peak of a mountain, this solid stone house was constructed directly into the rock face. A few gigantic horned birds circle the house and an odour most foul lingers in the alpine air.

Residents.Name: Ingrid Vodyanoi

Dialogs.Content: I never said that.
I'm not important, it's my husband who has all the secrets for you. Leave me alone!

Replies.Content: You insist a lot on waiting for your husband...

Dialogs.Content:
*A pout appears on Ingrid's energetic but aging face.

I never said I had secrets for you. I have knowledge that few people have, but I only give it to those who know how to be worthy of it.

* Ingrid heaves a long sigh.

Okay, okay, my husband never even existed! Adventurers generally prefer speaking to an old man than to an old woman, so they don't bother me for long.
And do you want me to insist with my fist in your face?

Replies.Content: Calm down, please. I just found it strange that you wanted to tell me all about him when I never asked you anything about him.

Residents.Greets: My husband isn't here, come back later.

Name: Port of Aranbourg
Description: Barely big enough to accommodate half a dozen fishing boats, the port of Aranbourg appears relatively well maintained. A few abandoned kiosks have been optimistically constructed around the main neighbourhood building.

Dialogs.Content: A group of prospectors is camped out in Finorgan Woodlands from where they explore the mountains. They need materials to solidify their camp.
The construction of the new Wellnear Hangar requires particular materials.
One of the craftsmen on the site needs a highly specialised tool for his work.
Coming directly from Maliken, a package is to be delivered to Calista Tantillon at her woodland estate. Do not open it, as it may be cursed.
A strange box has arrived to be delivered to Rhavina in Raven Marsh.
Imported directly from the savannas of Jakodisnol, this totem must be delivered in tip-top condition to one Cletus Delabouette. He lives in the depths of the Rimouskan Lands.
Deliver fish to Tranilda Soucta in the Gontruk Quarry. The workers need their protein.
*You approach the delivery board... the smell of fish is overwhelming...

Replies.Content: A Special Request for the Warehouse
A Specialized Tool for the Warehouse

Dialogs.Content:
The plans for my dream warehouse! A fantastic new Aranbourg Hanger that could transform our town's fortune. 

Here, take a look at this drawing. Giant gurdismo beams! Precision assembled diorite foundations!

We start the work today! And we'll need a lot of materials. As well as paying for their delivery, we'll offer a guided tour of the warehouse and even the construction plan to those who have collaborated on the project.

Do you want to become an official supplier?
Well well, if it ain't the most colourful delivery team in the kingdom. Coming to visit little old me in Aranbourg.

Replies.Content: Is the militia always like that?
Can I make deliveries for you?
You look busy! What are all those papers?

Dialogs.Content: A town can never have enough fresh fish. And any help in providing them is most welcome. You'll find plenty along the beach nearby.

Careful. Those thugs will remember you...

I'm Forewoman Stoe, and that's my liquor. Pass it here so I can get my crew off.

It's always the same thing... at the start of the winter period, I receive hundreds of packages from the high nobility of Maliken.

In an act of generosity, they send random gifts to the provinces. You pretentious people!

Anyway, it's not my job to judge nobility. My job is to deliver packages and letters.

But I must admit that this additional workload bothers me. Do you have a delivery team ready to help me?

Replies.Content: It will be my pleasure to continue this tradition.
No, I gave up delivery work a long time ago.

Dialogs.Content:
I should probably do the same... but no, I really like giving orders to my delivery people.

*Stoe turns to the first worker who passes.*

Robin, go put these crates in the 3rd basement of the warehouse!!! Hurry up!
