Did Mylena send you? I can't forget to thank her when I return to Kortombourg.

Name: The desert watchman
Description: Woven from wonta, a very rare fibre from the great swamps, this sculpture of a watchman scans the desert with an inquisitive air. Legends say that it is thanks to his eternal vigil that the deserts have not invaded the lands of Ordval.

Name: Dev.Distro.Enorwen
Description: Stuff a distribuer dans ce territoire

Name: Land of Grubeer
Description: Several holes have been dug in the ground adjacent to the riverbank. Inside one of these pits, there is a skeleton dressed as a carnival pirate. Next to that pit, there is a sign on which you can make out the words: "Turn around! He has a..."

Name: Forest Marquee
Description:
Constructed from leather and wood, this huge tent is used as a place of rest and training by the foresters of Larcen. 

A few men and women are busy smoking fish and forest meats to bring back to their homes or to the market in Quara.

Dialogs.Content: Isn't it pretty here? Still, I would love to see new forests.

Replies.Content: I have a job for you outside of Larcen. Would that interest you?

Dialogs.Content: Oh absolutely! Nothing would make me happier than the chance to travel the world. Do you have a place to host me?

We have beautiful forests and woodlands around Quara. Some are more dangerous than others though. I'd avoid the Forest of Whispers unless you fancy yourself as a skilled survivalist.

The exanese and the olf are our two typical trees of the region. If you are a good hunter, you should be able to catch some Larcen hares too. Their leather is quite something to behold.

Surely you have already heard the talking point bewitching the tongues of all the villagers? The wedding of the count's daughter! Though I guess it doesn't count as a rumour as it will be happening very soon.

I've also heard that Simenon, keeper at the Hydra Inn, was an assassin paid by the Duke of Gantras. Though, I don't really believe it.

Hmm what else? Ah yes! Many hunters have told me that the animals are increasingly aggressive. That's pretty odd, especially as there have been no famines or disasters to explain this change in behaviour. Perhaps Thinsac at the Camp of the Wild Boar could tell you more.

Replies.Content: Where is the Camp of the Wild Boar?

Dialogs.Content: Welcome to the marquee! You can rest here, train, or simply swap tales with the hunters and forest rangers.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the county forests?

Dialogs.Content: It's in the Larcen Woodland, to the southwest of here.

Name: Finn's Trail
Description: A cave goes deep into the cliff between Dunedan River and Ridand'hok Hills.

Dialogs.Content:
... yes, yes.

I'm chasing Hilla Shadowbringer. Have you ever heard of her?

I guess not. She's a former druid of the Great Circle. Until an adventure led her to stumble upon an object that by all rights should not exist...

We had a lead that she was hiding in Viperin, so I went to search the area. But, it was a trap! The forests on the edge of the Great Maelstorm are now corrupted to the point that anyone who sets foot there is attacked by vegetation.

Replies.Content: How can we be sure she's here?

Dialogs.Content:
Hey! Oi! That's not fair! You found my present before I could give it to you.

I hope you weren't rummaging through my stuff for underw... w... wait a minute! 

You don't trust me, do you!?

Listen, I really need you, Shadowbringer has... succeeded in bewitching me. I feel something is changing deep inside me. You know how I hate tales of the undead, and, well, I feel like I'm becoming one. I must take back from her what she stole from me.

*Sorka turns to Finn.

And you, big boy, I apologize for my past behaviour. I hope this gift can at least convince you that I'm making an effort.

Now put on that cape so that I can admire you in all your glory!

Where is she?!

*Sorka's head darts around, panicked, like an oryctus that's just heard a predator in the long grass.
Here we are!

Do you think you're funny?! The witch will probably be controlling my mind in a few days and...

... bah! If it's to be laughed at, I'll manage on my own!

I... I feel Shadowbringer's presence.

I thought we would have to find her, but I think she's coming for us! We have to prepare for battle!

Replies.Content: Draw your weapons! Fear not, we shall see this day through!

Dialogs.Content:
Shadowbringer leaves traces on the flora of the places she inhabits. We must go hunting for any animated vegetation in the region, then I'll check to see if I can find traces of her presence.

I believe that lily cobras come out at night and flytraps during the day.
Much better!

It's good, like in the good old days then. Let's find that witch!

*You get the feeling that something changed in Finn's gaze as soon as he put on his father's cape.

*Finn takes you aside, out of the group's earshot.

Behind her beautiful smile, Sorka hides a manipulative spirit. I've... let's say... hurt myself in the past out of a willingness to get involved in her business.

We'll have to discover what she's really up to. I see no reason for her to be seeking an ancient fallen druid.

And who is she referring to when she says something has been stolen from "them"? Sorka is not the type to align her interests with a collective.

I'll do my little investigation, but you'll have to keep her busy.

* You approach Finn who seems disturbed by his findings.

She relocated my father's cape... the same one she stole from me all that time ago and sold on the black market after our notorious night at the inn!
I'm worried...

Name: Fishing cabin
Description: A small cabin for fishermen. From here, you can take a barge to World's end relay.

Name: Entrance to the Cave of the Ancients
Tower of Tarawest
Description: An observation tower stands atop an undulating hillock. At its top, you can see the silhouettes of guards vigilantly watching the swamp.

Dialogs.Content:
That's right, the swamp in front of us. Take a look, that place is hellish. They say giant crabs can swallow you up in one bite!

But... they don't come out of the swamp.
I'd assumed monitoring the Tarasquan would be more thrilling...

Replies.Content: You've never fancied visiting the swamp?

Dialogs.Content: No, for I must stand guard over this tower. However, I really would have loved to have seen one of these "carpothingies".

Replies.Content: I can bring you one or two!

Dialogs.Content:
And you would be too if you'd experienced what I've not long ago experienced. 

Yesterday, I was doing my rounds when I heard an infernal cry coming from the Golden Plateau. Twas a cry from beyond the grave, I'm sure of it!

Replies.Content: Spooky, but I have other things to do.
I think I know where it could be coming from.

Dialogs.Content:
Yes, yes. The tower guards keep watch over the swamp as we always have. And should we see attacking hordes of creatures, we are to blow on our horn of warning.

Yet I have been here for years, and not one creature have I seen.
I really wonder what I'm doing here.
Oh nice! That's right, just let the world be torn to pieces by the rotting fists of the living dead fresh from beyond the grave. Charming!

Name: Epir Bridge
Description: Despite its splendour, the Epir Bridge is very difficult to cross due to the strong winds that shake it in its foundations. The clothing and tents of overly gung ho adventurers can be seen torn and ripped on the rocky banks of the Chiona River below.

Name: Caravanserai of the Great Eclipse
Description:
Old wagons belonging to caravans of all cultures and generations have been painstakingly carried to the summit and then transformed into homes. A selection of tree species, foreign to Kortombe, have been planted chaotically at the top. 

A few elderly people, their wrinkled faces red with windburn, live there permanently. Smells of stew, mulled wine, and lavender float in the mountain air.

Residents.Name: Charles Eouwettu

Dialogs.Content: By arriving here, you showed the soul and aptitude to become a part of our big family. That's a great start...

We are a big open family, but we cannot simply let just anyone call themselves a Lunar Caravaneer. Still, I won't hide from you that Sorka has already told us about you. So I know you can be trusted.

I have a few tasks that I could give you, and if we like working together, I believe that you could officially become a member of our family.

Are you ready to see the country?
Take the time to rest and have a glass or two of mulled wine. We'll talk once you're comfortable.

Replies.Content: Can you teach me any special skills?
What if I wanted to become a Caravaneer?
It's quite the trek to visit you up here!

Dialogs.Content:
I guess it would be nave to think none at all, but we're a pretty neutral organisation and we don't seek to interfere in the lives of the powerful.

However, we have struggled to live with some groups, including members of the Claw Assembly who see our pacifist vision as a weakness. I wouldn't say they really pose a threat to our members, but it would be wiser to avoid them.

They call me Charles. Though I imagine you want a more elaborate answer than just my name.

I am Master of the Lunar Caravan. At least, for the Ordval chapter, and you have arrived at our main meeting place west of Maliken.

The Lunar Caravan is a large family of freethinkers, adventurers, explorers and troubadours.

*Charles makes a circular gesture with his left arm to encourage you to look at the diverse carriages and ageing community of travellers.

Over the decades, we've built homes up here to allow elderly Caravaneers to come and end their days amidst peace and beauty.

Young members of our group bring food, clothing and tributes to the elders. The elders, in return, ensure that the place is ready for our large gatherings. They also pass down ancestral knowledge to our brothers and sisters.

Replies.Content: Can I become a Lunar Caravaneer?

Dialogs.Content: We can show you how to best use your alertness to overcome obstacles and defeat your enemies.

In a nutshell, they are the descendants of barbaric tribes that existed in these lands before the founding of Ordval. I know little on the matter other than that they have a meeting point in Thorval County.

Hahaha!

So it is intended, for the protection of our elders.

But...

... a good group of adventurers should be able to discern that people settled in a place like this must have a secret path in case of trouble.

I'll say no more...

Residents.Greets: A few more steps and you will have arrived, friend.

Dialogs.Content: Caravaneers need brave travellers to deliver cargo to the guild's secret dock in Ridand'hok.
Friends and guild members are asked to provide materials for building upgrades. Residents will reward you with items of their creation.
Friends and guild members are asked to provide building maintenance materials. Residents will reward you with items of their creation.
*You approach the quest board to discover the usual pinned tasks have been nailed in to prevent them being whipped off by alpine winds...
The Golmosa family is offering a reward to anyone who can bring back a strange plant they found in Tarinna Swamp. It does not adapt to the mountain climate.

Grandpa Blonose, the old storyteller bard, wants headbands in all colours. He says every story deserves a headband and every headband has its story. Grandpa will take possession of the headbands during his visit to The Queen's Fianc.
Caravanners are proud of their caravans. Even here, at the top of Ridicule, people like to add a touch of prestige to their constructions.
Friends and guild members are being asked to contribute materials for the creation of a new Hall of Stories, where adventurers from all over the world can come and recount their exploits.

Name: Base of the Trail of Falls
Epirpon Relay
Description: From this point onwards, the path becomes steeper. Only experienced travellers dare venture further. Some carts leave from the relay to transport food, resources and visitors to Thorbourg, capital of the County of Thorval.

Dialogs.Content:
You don't say? Everyone who comes here goes to Thorval, it's crazy!

The relay is used by merchants who transfer their goods into specialised carts adapted to Epirpon's narrow paths.

In addition, travellers on the bridge are often attacked by creatures coming from the mountains. So, they hire mercenaries to protect more valuable cargo.

Hmm. You're not part of the usual mountain team.

So unfortunately I can't take care of you unless you have a valid reason for being here.
Well done on doing the hard part then! The road should be a lot smoother from here.
Hiloldo reporting!
I'm here to help you with all your bills.

Replies.Content: What can you tell me about the area?

Dialogs.Content:
* Charane sighs for a long time.

Both. Oh! I guess you're looking for a quick way to make money. That's always what people like you do...

Replies.Content: And I guess people like you always have a solution?

Dialogs.Content:
Oh? You're not here to supply the mountain teams. I would've bet you were, based on your odour.

* Charane's face betrays no sign of humour nor nastiness.

I work for a captain from Thorbourg, helping mountain workers with the various costs of expeditions... often the least profitable ones. I won't go into details with you, so don't ask me any more questions about it.

Replies.Content: I still have one more. Are you lending money or are you suggesting other methods of increasing income?

Dialogs.Content:
Frankly, it's not the kind of place I'd be spending my time if it weren't for my job. But that said, the mountain camp workers are generally a nice bunch, and I get paid well.

There are several places hidden around that might reward the curious. At least, the curious who are skilled in mountaineering. These are generally abandoned sites as companies don't like the arrival of armed outsiders on their territory.

Sadly, you'll find that archaeologists, miners, and scientists rarely clean up before leaving a site. I pity those who have to live with these people.

And as you probably know, rumours of buried treasure abound all over Thorval, so it's a safe guess that there's some in the mountains too.

Of course, but...

* Charane watches you attentively.

... but you'll have to work honestly... I don't know if you can do it.

In short, there are a few abandoned sites in the mountains that you can visit if you're not afraid of packing on some muscle.

Name: Path of the Water Snakes
Description: You are on a platform leading to a chest. But tied to the chest is a creature the likes of which you have never seen before.

Residents.Name: Sorka the adventurer

Dialogs.Content: I know this kind of monster, this isn't normal. The owner of the chest has tied it here as some sort of monstrous guard dog, knowing that if it's attacked it will let out a cry of distress. If it does, hundreds of its kin could come to its aid.

Replies.Content: Let's leave the chest there and get some glass.

Dialogs.Content:
I know. Let's put your roguish looks to good use. We'll have the creature fall in love with you!

*Sorka winks at you.

Seriously, the water snake will stay quiet if it believes a potential mate is around. Not wanting to look weak, it'll play the "strong and silent type".

Their vision outside the water is poor. That means we only need to sort out the smell.

I'm serious! Where's your sense of adventure?

We need eggshells from a water snake nest. With this, we'll be able to imitate the creatures' scent.

A sage at Korllights informed me that water snakes nest on ledges overlooking waterfalls. Look up there, that's where we need to go!

Follow me, gorgeous!

Replies.Content: I've got a bad feeling about this.

Dialogs.Content:
Woah there! This is my quest.

I'm willing to help you with yours, but you're going to have to help me too.
We need a plan, it's surely not alone.

Ohhh! It's gonna be fun! Hee!Hee!Hee!

*Sorka tries to regain her seriousness.

We have everything we need! Let's go back to the monster to get ready.
Only if you're looking to alert every other snake in the cave. I'd prefer not to become snake chow. Why don't you let me decide what to do? I have much more experience than you, after all.

You look magnificent. And you smell magnificently terrible.

So here's my plan: I'll attack the creature while you concentrate on smelling as awful as possible so that it doesn't attract the other snakes.

Ha! Ha! Ha! No one is going to believe this tale when I recount it in the tavern!

Residents.Greets: It's a trap, that's for sure.

Name: Nadaya Cave
Description: Hidden behind the falls is a small cave. Inside, someone has installed a bed, a desk, and even a makeshift kitchen fireplace with its smoke diverted to merge with the spray of the falls. A thin layer of photoluminescent dust covers part of the rockface.

Name: The observer
Description: A little wooden hut has been built adjacent to a small tower. At the top of the tower's turret is a rather comfortable looking seat. Two trained vargrs protect the staircase leading up.

Residents.Name: Papatus Beautylook

Dialogs.Content: * Although the man has been alerted to your presence by the vargrs, he seems completed uninterested in you.
* The man shifts in his chair as if to swat away an invisible insect that irritates him.

Replies.Content: Do I have to bring down the tower to get your attention?

Dialogs.Content:
Them!

* He points vaguely towards the ground in the direction of the wooded area.

* The man sighs then addresses you in a loud albeit exhausted voice.

Leave! Now! I must not miss a moment!

Residents.Greets: Silence! I cannot miss a thing!

Name: Trolgobeth exit
Description: Once you have passed through a small tunnel, you come out into a cavity behind the Waterfall of the Troll. Sunlight passes through the tumbling water to create an enchanting light.

Dialogs.Content:
Ha! Ha! The adventurer's life is a state of mind. I like to separate each event into what I call a quest, it allows me to organize my schedule.

You'll get used to it. And don't worry, not everyone in Ordval talks like me.
Here we are.
Yes, the place is bigger than I thought. I don't like enclosed places...
Before we leave, we should check that we've recovered all the loot from the cave. We don't want other monsters settling in while we're not looking.

Well our two quests, of course. Is this your first time adventuring or something?

I'll help you in any fights but I'll let you decide where we go in the dungeon. For my part, I'm looking for an old mask. It's probably in a chest. You know how it is... rare items are always in chests.

As for you, we'll find your pieces of glass. They'll probably be on the ground... I'm not sure anyone would bother putting them in a chest.

Replies.Content: It's peculiar, these notions of "quests" and "dungeons".

Name: The Great Dyery of Enorwen
Description: A colourful sign indicates that the dark foundry-like building in front of you is the dyery. Atop its high roofs are many lines of smokestacks as well as a larger central chimney from which pestilent clouds and a foul stench rise. Factors that surely explain its presence far from the houses of Enorwen.

Dialogs.Content: Here is the plant of the day.
Here is the sap of the day.
Here's the substance of the day.
*You approach the brightly coloured bulletin board. It appears to be some sort of game...
Here is the powder of the day.

Your face is indeed familiar to me. 

Perhaps you have time for something a bit more personal. I need a range of pestles and mortars for my employees. Are you a skilled crafter?

Replies.Content: Yes, I'm equipped and ready to begin.

Dialogs.Content:
Yes and no. Some of our dyes are available to the public, though through a barter system that we use to avoid certain... taxes.

However, some colours we treat as sacred. Namely the unique colours of the powerful factions. We charge them a fee for their colours to be reserved, and only official representatives can purchase them.

Colouring, you see, is more than a matter of style, but a matter of politics also.
The Great Dyery of Enorwen is the largest colouring centre in Ordval. Vibrant or subtle, radiant or dull, we sell our colours everywhere!
Are you looking for some colour in your life?

Replies.Content: I've already acquired a few tickets.

Dialogs.Content:
Do you like it? 

*Miloue gives you a big smile that quickly fades.

It's the result of a test product that we tried a few years back. But the product had certain side effects... I'll leave it at that for now.

Name: Grandflood Shipyard
Description: Workers are busy fixing the final planks to the skeleton of a gigantic caravel. A little deeper into the site, men and women are repairing some fishing boats.

Name: Great House of Kortombe
Description:
[D]Many ordinary citizens enter and leave the Great House of Kortombe. They come there to pay accounts, settle conflicts between neighbours, or to lobby for changes to regulations. The burgomaster and her team are trying to resolve the problems as quickly as possible.

[N]After dark, only a few zealous guards and officials enter and leave the Great House. Sometimes, to deal with complex cases, Celeste Kortombe stays until the early hours of the morning.

Built of wood and stone, the Great House of Kortombe once housed multiple families. With the development of the barony, those families were given land and houses while the structure was transformed into a building fit for administrative purposes.

Dialogs.Content:
The nightmares continue, though I am still not affected. I hope you have no problem sleeping either for you will need your strength. The knight, Tarul Verdant, sent letters concerning this strange epidemic, and we got an answer from Maliken. It seems that the village is the victim of a misfortune. 

If you are interested in continuing your investigations, I will tell you more.

Replies.Content: I apologise but I don't have time at the moment.
I've been waiting for the opportunity to help you again.

Dialogs.Content: The situation is pressing, but I cannot force you.

No, and let's hope they don't come back. We have not found the originator of the curse. It is entirely possible that they are a disgruntled trader, a merchant's rival, or just a practical joker with a twisted sense of humour. I am glad it is over though. 

* Celeste breathes a sigh of relief and smiles at you sincerely.

Thank you, once more, for your help.
Pity. When you can, come back to me.

*Cleste pouts, but doesn't overreact.

As you wish, I can't force your hand.

Your question surprises me. Then again, I guess not everyone had the same education. It is a famous treaty between Pireiria, Jawana and Ogvania, which created the first continental government 198 years ago.

There are undoubtedly many citizens who need help and who will not take heed of your reputation before offering you work. Why not go to The Queen's Fianc or the market and ask if they have jobs for you.
The Kortombourgers are hospitable and generous. I see that you have already started to meet some of the members of the community. I am glad to see you involved.

Yes. There is a rumour circulating inside the Great House that several peasants are selling spoiled food. However, the harvest has been good this year. That leaves me concerned.

If you could investigate, starting with the farmers, citizens, and traders, you would do the town a great service. Besides, they will probably be more honest with you than with me.

Replies.Content: I'm sorry, but this isn't the right job for me.

Dialogs.Content: While you were in the laboratory, one of Cedric's men found the source of the contamination. Someone had put small barrels in the river near the Kortomia Fortress. You will have to go there, clean up the river, and then pour in the antidote.

A royal vargr? Do not apologize. I'm very impressed that he chose you as... a servant.

*You glance at Ovie and wonder if she's right.*

Seriously, I think you should visit Cdric Duverger to tell him about your meeting with Ovie, there's a good chance that troubles with the Trolgobeth pack will have an impact on his work.

Replies.Content: I'm going there as soon as possible.

Dialogs.Content: In the documents you brought to me, there was a list of ingredients needed to make the antidote. We are able to get almost all of them. We only lack the wings of gremfyrs. I could ask Sir Verdant to send men to hunt them, but I'm afraid he doesn't have the manpower to act quickly.

Replies.Content: I have obligations for now, but I will come back.

Dialogs.Content: Too bad, but it's your right to refuse.

Oh, it's you.

Yes, I have a diplomatic meeting in a few hours. I know you travel a lot in the province. Would you like to give me your opinion on certain subjects?
Yes, as in all the seigneuries, I suppose. You understand, I will not confide in a stranger of whom I know nothing.
I understand, but come back to see me quickly.

Unfortunately, yes. Many citizens have noticed dead fish floating on the surface of the Thaumaturge River. They have also found the bodies of small mammals that had come there to drink.

Samples have already been analysed by Korllights Academy researchers. They found a rare toxin in the blood of the animals. Scientists at the academy are looking for a solution, but I suspect they need some help.

Replies.Content: I have an emergency I need to attend to before I can help you.
I understand the urgency of the situation, Celeste. I will take care of it.

Dialogs.Content: Welcome to the barony of Kortombe! I am Celeste Kortombe, the burgomaster and daughter of the baroness. If you have any questions about the region, don't hesitate to ask me.

Replies.Content: I am sure I can be of aid to you, somehow.
Any news on the nightmare epidemic?
Do you have work for me?
Can I help you once more?
Can I help clean up the river?
Can I help people in the community?
Do other members of your noble family need my aid?
Are you preparing for a meeting?

Dialogs.Content:
I am worried about my fellow citizens. Several of them complain of frequent nightmares.

Normally, there would be nothing suspicious there, these things happen.
Someone tells a dream to his neighbour, who has the same bad dream the next day and after that it snowballs into mass paranoia. But frankly, that doesn't seem to be the case here. 

If you could investigate, it would relieve me of a growing concern.

Replies.Content: I don't really have time yet.
Sure. You'll be sleeping easy when I'm done.

Dialogs.Content:
It is the largest village of the barony, a town by some people's calculations. The majority of the inhabitants live here, apart from the farmers, hermits and brigands who prefer to live outside the community. Go and look around, you will certainly find some interesting activities to keep you occupied. 

I recommend that you visit the Multiforge and the inn, The Queen's Fianc.

It is the principle building of Kortombe. Here, look at these recent legal papers showing the oldest places in the town, there's Korllights Academy, my offices, the court, and a few of the other public buildings. Interesting, huh?

Officially, the barony of Kortombe was founded in 187 before the Treaty of Maliken, but it bore the name the Lordship of Kordan. It's almost thirty years since my ancestor Cebrian, became the first of the line to rule the territory.

My mother may need the help of an experienced adventurer, but she is distrustful of strangers. I told her about you, so she may be willing to give you a chance. Though I cannot be certain.

You will find her at the Kortombe Castle.

Name: Crestfallen Jumpers' Point
Description: Poetically, someone has installed a skeleton, held upright by a wooden cross, on the edge of the precipice. Did he want to give explorers a warning or just give a friend a great view for eternity? Still more questions that will remain unanswered.

Name: The Dancing Cybelfly
Description: Built from rare woods and encircled by a stone palisade, The Dancing Cybelfly seems surprisingly luxurious for an inn located in a remote hamlet. Inside, a few travellers are playing dice and exchanging jokes. Smells of vinegar, strong spices, and cooked tomatoes float in the air.

Dialogs.Content: Problem, Claudel? If these people are causing you issues, I'll kindly ask them to get the hell out.
The Cybelfly belongs to all the people of Enorwen. Strangers are never allowed to cause trouble.
On your way, stranger...

Well, the inn has some generous new residents who have booked out the entire floo...

*Claudel pauses and watches an armed group approach the bar.

Oh no, I shouldn't talk about it, that's right.
This is the village tavern, a whole community project. Me? I'm just here to take care of the customers and make sure the place is clean.
What can I get you?

Replies.Content: What's new at The Dancing Cybelfly?

Dialogs.Content:
There is no trouble, Durong, no trouble at all. This... this group wanted to rent the top rooms of the inn, I was just telling them that the place isn't currently available.

*Durong and his group leave the inn with a scowl but without another word. You notice that the other customers were watching the scene as if expecting a show.
No, nothing... you... what did you want again?

Oh, yes, no, well yes...

... I think his uncle's wife's brother's cousin used to live here before and he's now back on his family land. Or something like that.
How should I know? A few weeks ago, I didn't even know him!
My cousin? That guy isn't even from here!
I wouldn't abandon my mother's side for any old troglodyte unable to offer decent conditions to their workers...
Like my mother and her father before her, I'm a fervent worker and a lover of everything related to crafts. However, the time is nigh for me to fly the family nest to find my own calling.

Replies.Content: A knowledgeable craftsman could be of great help to me.

Name: Rocky escarpment
Description: You are trapped on a rocky outcrop between the fall and the cliff.

Dialogs.Content: This little game has gone on long enough, do you think I have to answer you, adventurers!?
Calm down Cragstein, these visitors are trying to break our alliance.

Replies.Content: Did you want to replace Cragstein as well?

Dialogs.Content:
Damn you Mistwalker, you don't know what you're getting into.

My cover is broken, it seems.  I won't do you the honour of giving you any more clues.

Goodbye!
What do you want?
Ha ha! Yes, dear Uncle Horald. We should go to the well to continue this discussion.
Cragstein, you're paid to protect me. I want your personal opinion on the possibility of using this well...
Badouk... indeed, yes. I am the lord of Wellnear, I meet so many people that it always takes me a little time to recognize them.

One moment... I know all the nobility of Myriaden, Sir Horald Coeurdor does not exist.

*Cragstein prepares to be attacked, he takes a step back to position himself near the door of the vault and draws his weapon.

That is! Your explanations better be good when you get back!

*Cragstein doesn't waste a second and comes out screaming.

Guards! Condemn the well and post men in front of the vault.
My mercenaries will be here shortly, but I don't need them to slay you!

Replies.Content: Protect the castle, I must follow him!

Dialogs.Content:
I know, do you think I've been waiting here for you doing nothing? My mercenaries have already found Baloin's body, apparently dead for a few months. His face erased.

The creature wanted to take my place, which makes sense, since I'm in a better military position than Baloin. I let my guard down for a moment, being sure the lord was a fool anyway.

He could have had me with all the creatures he had summoned. I therefore owe you one, and I will return it to you on the spot without accusing you of the murder of the lord.

I'm going to stay in Wellnear for a while longer with my mercenaries, but I have no interest in this town and the life of a lord. If such creatures infiltrate all the nobility of Ordval, I will have very profitable contracts in the next seasons.

I will announce the death of Baloin on my departure. If you do anything against me in the meanwhile, our deal will be off an you will have to face justice for the death of Baloin.

Farewell.
Sir, you pay me to keep order in your village rat hole. I have nothing to do with the inspection of your well...

What is this masquerade!

*Cragstein raises his hand to his sword. While Baloin seems completely stunned by your appearance.

Name: Burrow of the Wise Foxes
Description: Sculptures of different woodland fox species have been placed in a circle in the centre of a small clearing. Some censers are placed in a circle around a statue representing a bearded and winged animal of the vulpes family.

Dialogs.Content:
Indeed, few people know it, but a magical protection prevents people from venturing into the Leviathan plateau through the Pass of the Spirits.

I will show you how to disable protection.

Replies.Content: I can't wait to be there!

Dialogs.Content:
What do you mean?

*You explain what happened at the Diadem Mansion and at the riddle location.*

So Tarul was right again.

If it were that simple...

I will have some quests for you to prepare for my departure. Not that I'm a complex person, but I'd rather disappear cleanly to free Tarul from the weight of my existence.

The first step will be to empty the Diadem mansion of my assets. You visited my room, but what nobody knows is that Tarul booked me a suite where I installed my equipment.

At the same time, I would ask you to study my installations, I will need to install my equipment in your domain if I am to follow you.
I will be able to leave the Wise Fox burrow only when you have prepared a place for me and my things.
That's right, I want to explore the Leviathan Plateau and eventually Tarzakon. The creatures in this area are very dangerous so it is unthinkable for me to visit the place alone.
Oh, it's you.

Replies.Content: Are you talking about the plateau?

Dialogs.Content:
I am Korkane and I have a beautiful smile. Do you think that's enough?

*Leighanna tries to give you her best smile.

Well, some also call me the witch of Malarcane, maybe because I often meet my friends Obscura and Calista there. Or because I have been studying the forest for more than two years to find out who the Thaumaturge of the legends of Kortombe really was.

*Leighanna smiles at you.

You must understand a little better why my dear Tarul wanted me to leave the Barony...

And yes, I practice dark magic, which officially makes me a witch in the eyes of a good part of the population of Ordval.

Let's keep this little secret between us and everything will be fine. I will tell you about this magic in more detail when the time is right.

Yes, it is a very ancient place which is protected by powerful magic. Unfortunately, that's all.

I mean, the location cannot be found without the help of a riddle created by someone who has visited the location before.

But there's nothing here, so it's only a good place for secret encounters.

I know. My dear Tarul is trying to get me out of the barony because he's afraid I'll end up being burned at the stake like a Korkane witch... which I am?

Anyway, my mission here is coming to an end, the Wise Foxes' burrow was one of the last places of interest for me in Kortombe.

Replies.Content: Tarul told me you need help?

Dialogs.Content:
No... it's really a name chosen to scare. That's her real name?

*You admit that you have no idea. You explain that you have dealt with this powerful character a few times without knowing his exact motivations.

I don't think I do anything important enough to incur the wrath of such a person. However, Tarul is currently in a position where his allies could be hunted down.

I'm going to stay here for a while, there's no way I'm going back to Diadem Manor alone.
Did you happen to come across lots and lots and lots of worms?

Reginold didn't tell you? 

Aha, well I tested a new scent that was supposed to repel giant earthworms. Unfortunately, it's had the opposite effect. I'm a prisoner to worms until I can get rid of this damn smell! I need protection to cross Eligratine again. 

But beware, the scent attracts worms much, much larger than those normally found here. Hopefully it won't lure Whuzulm here!

Name: Tower Construction Site
Description:
[D]By day, half a dozen workers are busy building a small tower which would improve surveillance over this section of the barony of Kortombe. Some artisans have set up workshops near the site to provide various services to workers.

[N]The site foreman and most of his men return to Kortombourg when night falls. Only a man and a woman, both soldiers, remain on site to ensure the security of the premises.

Dialogs.Content: You've proven to be quite adept with the gloves. You should now be able to create new ones in your domain.

Ah, yes... about that...

Part of the tower collapsed on top of the workshop, it's safe to say it's going to put us even further behind schedule. I don't suppose we could make use of your facilities? Pretty please?

I have just received a message from a passing traveller informing me that one of my team's carts has been blocked by a small landslide. What worries me most is that I know there are some rather aggressive gremfyrs in that corner of the hills. 

Can you go there and see if my men are in need of help?
A team will be leaving for Crown Hills shortly to pick up branzos. They will need your help to prepare the shipment.

You've been helping us a lot lately so I'm ready to teach you how to build a good workshop. But...

We're going to have to build one here first to show you how. That means we're going to need some materials!

*Ulrick grins mockingly

Of course! You look like a person willing to do anything to make money... Sorry, that came out wrong. I mean you seem like you're ready to work hard for a living.

I'll start by giving you a little job, so that you can find out if you like working for us, and then I'll have a better idea of your qualities.
There you are!

Replies.Content: Do you still need my services?
Do you have another job for me?
You seem like something is troubling you.

Dialogs.Content: Oh, here's Milane! She manages our inventories, buys wood and prepares special orders. Since she's always very busy, she will undoubtedly have work for you.
The site is closed for the night.
Well... tough. He's sleeping and he doesn't appreciate being woken up. Come back tomorrow morning or wait around the fire with me if you have nowhere else to go.

Those are the vargrs, they roam the neighbouring regions looking for easy prey. They are dangerous and sometimes attack passers-by.

Kill five to make the area safer, and I'll give you this shield as a reward.

Replies.Content: It takes more than vargrs to scare me!

Dialogs.Content:
Again! Damned oryctus! You see, during the day on the plains there are lovely little rabbits that we can hunt.

But at night, it is the oryctus who rule these plains. They might not go hunting people down, but if you accidentally approach them they'll get real angry. Don't be fooled by their cuddly exteriors. Those fluffy critters can bite!

What's more, they steal our damned provisions! How would you like to scare them away for me?

Replies.Content: Why not? It'll pass the time.
Bah! It's too nice and cosy around the fire. They won't bother me, and I won't bother with them.

Dialogs.Content: So be it. Tomorrow I will ask Ulrick to find a hero worthy of the title.

Gotcha! You fell right into my trap! I knew I had some good bait.

We need hare leather to use as wrappings. There are small leporidae near here. Go hunt some for us.

You're correct! We need timber for the building site.

Go to the Crown Hills to the east and you can find some. Oh! And while you're there, think about picking up supon too. We're always running low on it.

We settled here so that we would be able to supply the tower with jot rope as quickly as possible. You understand, I'm sure, that there is a lot of utility for ropes on the construction site, and we're already running low on raw materials.

Could you walk the plain and bring us some jot?
Hello! Are you new to the site?

Why of course. It's an essential material on a construction site of this size. You can find kutel and branzos in Crown Hills.

You bring it back to us and we'll turn it into tools.
Do you have a present for me?

Replies.Content: What a beautiful bow! I bet that my next task will have something to do with it!
I understand you need the services of a lumberjack?

Dialogs.Content: Ulrick Bonbras practices hashpick throwing near the cliff in his spare time. As he inevitably loses them in the river, he would like a new one delivered. Can you help him?
Ulrick would like to provide basic weaponry for members of his expeditions. Nothing fancy.
*You approach the bulletin board. It's jampacked with requests from the busy construction workers...
On the construction site, Milane always needs a little something. Can you meet her needs today?
Rofuran Delsun, the night watchman, wishes there were fewer wild creatures around. It would help him in his work. Do you think you can help him?
Ulrick needs some tools for his new recruits.
